text: The first gen app was better. I am always having trouble connecting with Siri or with the new Geofencing.
This needs to be fixed I can't use my $200 lights now.

I have three lights that I've been using for a long time; they haven't been working at all with these past few updates. I make sure I keep everything up to date and the lights are still unresponsive. Aside from that, I loved them when they worked.

Can't use home app if the hue app is not updated. Got home from a trip and none of my lights turned on, neither could they be turned on through the hue app without first updating the lights. How the heck do you expect me to update if I can't even see where to place my stuff inside my home once I arrive from my trip. Mildly annoying but the more I think about it, the more annoying it is. My Sonos speakers can still work, even with an update pending. Why can't my lights?? I've spent so much money on these stupid lights, let me use them when I f***ing need it, DUH
I've never done this before. I've never written a review, but I'm doing for you Philips. This is terrible. Someone should probably be fired for releasing this app.

The first gen app was much better. It gave better control for not individual and grouped lights. So disappointed on this "new" version which makes many things much more complicated and time consuming _
Why remove functionality that obviously drew people to the system? This app is inferior to the 1st gen app.
Ever since I had to update the app it no longer connects regularly. I have to delete and reinstall it.  Don't update. It's garbage

The first gen app made it easy and fun to create new scenes and stored everything in a logical place. The new app requires you to meander through the entire non intuitive interface to accomplish anything, and yet it still seems to fall flat of the functionality of its predecessor. I sincerely hope they address these issues, because it seems clear that the other app will soon no longer be supported.

I had many problems. Cannot login and frequent sync error. All my settings keep getting erased randomly. Massive drain on the battery. Very slow to switch the lights on and off. It was good before but it is terrible for the first gen hue now. Updates are getting worse. People dont keep updating hardware for lights every year. Philips need to provide quality support fora reasonable period of time.

Wow Philips. What a spectacular way to destroy a fantastic system. Seriously, who did your UAT and did they realise what they had to do. This screams of being tested by someone who does not use or understand your product. Terrible user interface and leaving out proven and popular functionality. Switch to supporting the first App which I have happily used for 20 months now and will go back to. I am available for UAT if you need someone who knows what they are doing. All I ask is that you don't let the same people lose on the hardware or you will ruin that too.

I deinstalled after 3 days. Went back to the previous version. Geofencing don't know if its working or not. With the previous version you receive a notification when arriving and leaving. Couldn't find a way to group the lights with my custom scene. I tried to add all the lights under home and then they weren't available individually anymore... very confusing. Wouldn't upgrade to this version. Needs further work.

This app is NOTHING compared to the first generation. I loved that app, it was simple, the setting were easier to use, I could set each light in a Photo Scene to the exact light recipe I needed/wanted... now everything I loved and enjoyed about Philips Hue & Friends is gone. Only reason why I still use this is because I have invested to much money not to. Thanks a lot Phillips for taking my money and leaving me with nothing but regret. I've have these lights since the day they hit the shelfs so I have. Wen there with you for every update and not once have I complained until you took away my first gen app.

Awful app. Takes a life to send any command to the lights, crashs all the time. The lights are a totally waste os money. Philips used to be a reliable company, right now is no better than any cheap Chinese electronic.

Ever since I upgrade to the new app, nothing works right. I have to reset my color scheme every night because it resets all by itself to plain white light.  Also not very user friendly navigation within. Spent a lot of money on these lights, and the app needs to work for them to work properly. Fix your app.

Massively better than the first iteration. If I had one complaint it would be that the sensor schedule only allows for day/night so 6:30 in the morning on Monday behaves the same as Saturday... for a night light that's a wee bit annoying.

I loved the first app, why did you guys downgrade! I went on your website on how to create scenes and it is no where to be found! Someone help! Look at all these negative reviews! Get on it Philips or I'm not recommending you to anyone!

Like the app. Easy to manipulate lighting . Very frustrating that my phone does not recognize the bridge from time to time . I e deleted and re downloaded the app multiple times , even powered off my bridge and still nothing! The developers need to fix this asap!
Doesn't work half the time and it wants to update before I use it, so I have to just manually turn lights off 50% of the time.

The first Hue app was... ok. It did the job but the interface was so bad that third party apps came to the party. This one is way better so far. You can easily group lights into rooms and the interface to change lights is much smoother. I dock it one star because as I've had the new app for about fifteen minutes, I've had to run through the bridge update process three times which takes about two minutes each time. Hopefully this will get fixed soon. Alexa integration still works so I'm happy with that!

Veel betaald voor de Hue Lampen en dan zo'n waardeloze app! Hoe durven jullie Phillips! Jullie moeten je schamen! Hoe stel ik snel kleur en lichtsterkte in per lamp voor automatisch aangaan? Dit was eenvoudig te doen in de oude app. Waar is de alarm knop uit de oude app? Gebruiken de ontwikkelaars zelf ook Hue lampen?
Hello Hue DevelopersMy iPad battery is being drained by this app since some days. IOs is reporting a 50% of consumption and the app is always closed.
As soon as i updated the app, nothing ever works properly. Come on philips, wtf. It worked fine for 3 years until this update. Pissing me off.

Terrible app. It might add a couple of useful things, but it strips too much functionality from the old app. What's worse, I have scheduled events created in the old app that can't be edited in the new one, and the old app won't run anymore. I'm sure Philips will tell me to default the bridge and set up all 20+ lights again. I regret ever buying into their ecosystem.
Almost nothing is working. - You can't login to your account. - You can't add new discovered light to a room which means you can't control it!!

It took ages to support the 2nd generation app on the iPad and this is completely unreliable. According to the iPad stats it consumed 41% of my battery in the last seven days despite being on the screen for a few minutes. Plus the widget continuously freezes and you have to delete it and make a new one. Useful features like timers disappeared from the 1st generation. Philips, you can do better than this!

Seems that the remote access feature is broken via the app. If I log into the Hue webpage and try to control my lights it works. Additionally, if I go into Apple's Home app I can happily control my lights while away from home, however, in the Hue app I just get the "No Hue connection". _

I can't have a scene that controls lights across multiple rooms ? The whole system is unresponsive now. I was happy with what we had. This upgrade has caused a complete mess. Routines is useless. Who goes to bed, wakes up, gets home at exactly the same time everyday? Scenes are so hard to get to now. So bad. Please update soon!
Not sure why all the negative reviews for the app. Works just fine for me. There are other good apps too but I use this one everyday. Never any problems. Running IOS 10.2.1
Please make this app user friendly, really is not an easy app to setup. Lights are great but app is by far the worst app on my iPhone.  Does anyone at Philips now what is going???

In the suggested apps it is nearly impossible to close the window with the app displayed to return back to the menu. Consider how many people have hue lights I am shocked how terrible the app is. The way you could color pick all your lights to an image is nearly impossible. It does it by room.
You can't share your settings with someone else in your house

I hung on to the first version for as long as I could and earlier this week it stopped opening on my phone so I was forced to move to the "upgrade" - all of the intuitive functionality is gone and the app has reduced the functionality of the lights. Looking into purchasing a third party bridge so I can get my lights to work the way I want them to work!

Philips makes great electronics but any sort of app support doesn't seem to exist. Yes, the new interface is worlds better than the old app but the fact that syncing it with my Hue account doesn't download the dozen or so custom scenes I've saved seems ridiculous. Do I have to re-assign dimmers and buttons to these new scenes?Re-installed almost year after my previous review (above) and holy moly. Are you kidding me? Who is the developer team on this project? Can I please come work there for a year or so and project manage this mess?Every other Hue app can find my bridge, but this one can't and I have to manually enter the IP address. Strike one.Creating scenes. Well, it's INSANE that the scenes from the previous app aren't supported here. Insane. But, ok. Let's give this one a try. Create a scene. Let's use a photo like in old app. Wait. You can't set individual lights to specific colors? You can only dim the lights and deal with whatever color the app RANDOMLY assigns to the bulb? YOU.  HAVE. TO. BE. KIDDING ME. Strike two. Sweet Jesus. Philips. Get. It. Together.

This application is a huge disappointment. No support for sunset/sunrise times and the requirement of a Hue account to use Homekit is abusrd. The fact of the matter is I suggest to users to use Hue Pro on an Android device. This app is a joke. I usually never award just one star but this is one case the application deserves it. We're not talking about an indie developer here, rather a commerical entity who can't be bothered to produce decent software to compliment their hardware.
Why would you remove the Timer feature? It makes no sense to do so. Please add it back!If you're forcing us to move to the new app because you won't support Gen 1, then please add useful features.

Incredibly poor decision for the product team to have replaced the old app and essentially restrict users from using it. This 2.0 version seems to be written without any understanding of how the typical user would use it.  Setting timers and scenes and creating any real automation just not considered well here.  Investment would have been better focused on making the old app more usable and adding features rather than redesigning UX and calling that innovation.  Highly encourage the product team to reconsider.

Moving to this version was a nightmare from the perfectly working previous version. Nothing transfers and new app set up is far from user friendly. Let's hope whoever design and whoever sign off this 'downgrade' doesn't get to go anywhere near the next version. Complete cluster f*ck _

Bought a couple more Hue bulbs, to switch my bedroom from white to color.  Had to download new app to add them. Ugh!  Now no more real (animated scenes).  Had to purchase rainstorm and now that scene that I paid for has LESS OPTIONS?!?   Put my original two white bulbs. Had to delete and re- DL app to have the old lights recognized.  Now WHERE'S the storm scene I just paid for????So much trouble using this app.   Makes me feel like a disconnected idiot.  YUCK!  Fix this quick, or bring back the old app. I deleted my old app... going to go see if its still available to me.  Very frustrating!
This app is terrible. The only good thing about this app is the fact that the released it as a new app instead of an update so you can still use the old one.
Seriously... give an option to decline an update or push it out!!! Now I have to wait 10 minutes to turn my lights off.
Pros:* Looks nice* when things are set up then it is goodCons:*Not intuitive at firstSuggestions* have favorite tasks page for operations that we do often

I hope all of the problems I'm having getting this app to function with Amazon Echo is because we are between versions.  When it functions it is great fun.  When it does not function it is very frustrating.
Not even the basic stuff works properly. Every time I open the app it says "out of home connection", even though I'm connected to my house's wi-fi! And Philips calls this an upgrade. Unbelievable.
This update that was forced on all users is the shittiest thing ever. How the hell do I create new scenes now? What's wrong with philips?

This may literally be the worst update I have ever received for an app. If I had not already invested so much money in the bulbs I would completely abandon the platform. It is non-intuitive and difficult to navigate. To any one considering buying these bulbs, I would reconsider if I were you.
Wow.  Didn't think it could get worse than the original app but Philips sure has proven me wrong!
Not experienced any issues. App appears to work and fiction well. Used with both Hue bulbs and light switches

The 1st gen app is much better, the gen 2 app is missing a lot of the original features. 1 I feel the best bit about the 1st gen app needs to be added to this version which is the random setting for lights to randomly come on either side of a specific time. (Also being able to switch off a light from widgets. Was better on 1st gen hence why I haven't deleted the app. Philips have gone backwards on improving its app). (Thanks for sorting Philips, that's a step up). :)
Come on Hue.  Bulbs are great, your apps far from it.  They have all really stunk.

The decision to discontinue support for the gen 1 app over the train wreck app that is gen 2 is beyond disappointing. With each "improvement" the app has gotten worse And worse. Congrats Phillips. I was contemplating replacing my gen 1 bulbs with gen 3. But after this announcement, I will be throwing them away and researching alternatives. Look at the rating and reviews for this app. Clearly it has issues and your development team should be fired. LISTEN TO YOUR CUSTOMERS
The first app was clumsy but fulfilled most people's use case. Now it's gone. This version only allows you to set scenes per room, which makes zero sense unless you're living in a studio apartment.

The previous app, for me, was much much better... now it no longer works after the LAST update.  It will not launch!  So it appears I am stuck with this version.  Unless I erase 7 scenes I have created.

I've been using this app with Hue color bulbs for over a year now. The bulbs themselves and the colors they can produce are wonderful. I always forced to update the app whenever a new app is available the after the update is released. This means that when I we are ready to go to bed and dim the lights, I'm forced to wait until the update completes before I'm able to control them. It is a great inconvenience when trying to get to sleep. Meanwhile I lay in bed with the lights on full brightness. This has remained unchanged since app release. As far as I know this is an issue for iOS. I'm not sure if Android users have experienced this. As soon as this is fixed I will upgrade my rating to four stars and write a proper review.

The latest update has screwed up everything. No rooms work no scenes work bulbs are going on and off randomly.  There was no option not to update it comes up and forces you to update.  This was not tested and has made a mess of all the setups I have done.  I have ten rooms and 54 lights.  It is really unprofessional to force this on people and break people's setups and features.

This second gen app is such a disappointment. I finally received notice that the first app no longer was going to be supported. So I switched over all my alarms to the new "routines". Well, low and behold, I just woke up and my lights were NOT on despite my wake up being set to turn on >30min ago. I checked my network and it's working, I checked Fing and it sees my Hue Bridge. I checked my app and I was able to manually turn on my lights. So what gives? Having the light turn on is critical to my routine. On top of all this, it doesn't even remember my last theme setting on my lights and keeps reverting to "relax" mode if I turn one on and off. I may have to go back to the unsupported app. Why make a new app and break every feature that made the old one great? And WHY is there even a second app? Why couldn't the first one just be updated or at least give the second a working import setting for the alarms. This is such BS! Make this thing work!!!

Hue intentionally crashed their original app to try to get users over to this one.This app is actually horrible, and since it's now obvious that we can't trust the Hue iOS developers not to abandon their user base, our lighting systems are now at the behest of their shifting industry.Wasn't the promise of LED light to have lights that lasted longer and were better at being controlled?This forced update just broke that promise for Hue.

I'm afraid this app is just not reliable enough. After a day or two it will lose the bridge and there is literally no way of reconnecting. I was skeptical of other reviews describing this problem but I'm afraid it's true. If you're only just looking to buy the light bulbs, maybe don't. There is also no sort of customer care.
Can't sign in to use the location services. Fails every time even though it says I entered the info in correctly.

The new app does not have a way to simply set lights to turn on at a certain time (w/o half an hour fade in) and turn off at a set time (w/o 15 minute fade out). You can set one "routine" to turn the lights on, and a second routine to turn them off. But if you turn the lights off before the second routine's time, that routine will turn your lights on at its set time. It's effing ridiculous that they couldn't sort this out, especially since the earlier app worked well, and given all the negative reviews they've gotten.

I just spent $1,000 on hue lighting and was so disappointed to find how hard it was to group all lights in my apartment and create scenes. It only allows me to "group" lights by room, and you can only control 4 rooms at a time. I downloaded the Gen 1 app. So simple. So many more features. The Gen 1 app does everything I expected these lights to do, and this new app does nothing but complicate the few simple tasks it can do. Go back to the Gen 1 design please.
When this app can do all the things the Gen1 app can do. Then I'll consider using this version. Too many missing features.
Philips now warns that the old app will no longer be updated, however the new one still barely works. May need to seek alternative.

I've never seen such an "update" become such a flop. I feel like 80% of the features I used from the first app are now gone in the second version of the app. Why are timers which start immediately no longer allowed WITHOUT setting an exact time for the "routine" to begin. I used to just hit one button for a 10-minute timer to fade the lights out as I go to sleep. Now I have to sift through a ton of screens, pick the fade out option, and then literally set a time (which is always now) to fade the lights out. I would think the time would not be required.  It's kind of self-explanatory - if I want to go to bed, I don't want to have to input what time I'm going to want the lights to fade out. I want them to start fading NOW!  Extremely disappointed with this "update" as are most of the other reviewers of this app. Here's an idea, Philips, when creating a new app, ask the people what they want. Do some research... :(

This version of the Hue app is terrible. First, the connectivity to my Hue Bridge is hit and miss. I can connect to the Bridge 9 of 10 times with the old app, but only about 4 of 10 with this app.Second, it is much harder to customize your lights in this app, for some reason they figured you didn't want to be Adele to control individual lights in this version? What ever. I keep the old version on my tablet and phone so I can at least reliably turn the light off when it's time for bed.DO NOT DELETE THE OLD APP!

My bridge was working up until a few weeks ago. Now its lost connection. Tried a different/new bridge / new ethernet cable too. Still cant get it paired. Hope they come up with some new fix cuz im on the latest ios 10.2.1 and firmware update for Hue.

I have over 15 hue bulbs throughout the house & have had them when they first came out years ago. The new app doesn't give you the freedom to customize the colors the way you would be able to with the old app. I'm pretty bummed out that I'm forced to use the new app :/ just my opinion
The app works now. The manufacturer needs to create some kind of tutorial on how to work it because it isn't intuitive.
Used to be a decent app. This one constantly disconnects and is a complete pain to setup scenes. I have a lot of hue lights and hubs between my home and office. Very disappointed with this app.

nice visual design, and i'm fine with the rooms & routines convention. but, without the ability to customize the color of my lights for any routine - eg. wake up, this app is unusable. if i could at least define my own scenes like in the old version, it would be usable.

Wished I'd looked at the app first before I spent so much on kit, the app is extremely poor in functionality.Very basis control with ads for other more functionally rich apps, at a premium price, which then has further in app purchases.Feel conned very disappointed.
Anyone beta test this? Can't connect to bridge. Non-starter.

The app represents a puzzling (infuriating!) downgrade from the original Hue application. The "room" framework remains incomplete and confusing -- my kitchen is adjacent to the family room, and when it's time to watch movies, I synchronize them both to a different palette; why make me pick different scenes? -- and the new interface is still a step back in terms of touch target size and how easy it is to perform repetitive tasks.Come on. Please.

This new version, which is supposed to replace the old one, required that I press the button on the bridge. That's fine. It asked me to name the room _ that's fine. It lost every one of my presets. That's not fine. So I have gone back to using the old app. Even the old one now is partly more responsive, and partly far less responsive. Hue, what got into you?I have never seen such a disconnect between the power of the hardware and its creative possibilities contrasted with such thoughtless programming of applications; not just this one. Each of the Hue apps I have tried uses a completely different strange paradigm to create groups and rooms and animations that require so much work on the part of the user.Hue needs a new product management team that runs testing labs with people who have never seen Hue before and try to set up useful scenes and animations from scratch. Watch them as they struggle with such poorly thought-out elements of the enabling technology, and the applications and the settings and the local bridge, and the My Hue online interface to the bridge. The error messages are cryptic and bizarre.

It's great that Hue allows you to create an online account, but to use the app across multiple devices or users is impossible. If there was a way to do this, the interface is so bad that no one can figure it out. An entire family should be able to easily login and change the colors using their own devices
I can't connect to the bridge anymore all of the sudden.  I press the button when it tells me and nothing happens.
Worse than the old app, & that was dreadful.  If I'd known how bad the app was, I'd have thought again about buying the lights.
The easy simplicity and much functionality has been removed from this "upgraded" hue app. If you still have the original don't delete it!

Interface is incredibly unintuitive. Stops working at random intervals; have to delete the app, reinstall and start again. Have found a better, cheaper option; when the bulbs finally die (and I expect they will in short order, given the cost) I'll delete this for the last time and not look back.Expected better from Philips.

This app is fine and dandy, but it lacks the "all off" switch on open that the old app had.  Also, my hue hub is right at the edge of its range, and the original app can reach it for some reason when this app and third party apps cannot.  The loss of this feature makes the process of going to bed very annoying as I have to go pull the hub as far as the cable will reach every week or so.  It really robs the system of any magic it once had for me.  Can you please un-break the old app or figure out why the old app can reach when the new app can't?

Works well, when it works. Had few issues with my wifi and ended up having to erase and install the app multiple times because it wouldn't find the hub...Update March 17:That's the 5th time I have to reinstall this app. Please. Fix. Your. App.

New app. Worse interface. All prior scenes that took awhile to setup were erased. Can't combine lights into groupings within scenes now to make it easy to adjust color in groups. Or move them on a picture. If there was another good led light manufacturer I would stop buying these lights just because of how bad this app is.

I have Hue installed in 5 rooms and using the first generation app. That worked great. The new app totally destroyed my light scheme and time settings.  My entire Hue installation is now a $400 pile of useless junk! On one device using Hue Original I still can control my house. I can't get the new app configured to work. I need to recover the best lighting scheme I had on my updated apps but still can't.  We have been depending Hue 1 for the past few years; now it's gone!!!!  BRING BACK the original app.  Fire those developers who ever unleashed this app- stupid people, have ruined a good Phillips LED light source.  This is just unbelievably BAD.    :(
I'm not going to jump through hoops to import scenes from the old app. Developers need to consider the user upgrade experience. Fix it.
Does not recognise hub. Old app works perfectly. Waste of time.
It's really worst app. Every 2nd day's restart my wifi-router only for adequate work my home lamps! It's shame!!

I hate this new gen 2 hue app. I like the gen1 app and now philips is no longer supporting that and forcing us to "move on"??I have 25 hue bulbs and this crappy app makes it difficult to do what I want with them
Literally one of the worst apps I've ever used on iOS.  Confusing, nonintuitive, seemingly designed by apes.

This version of the Hue app is worse than the first version of the Hue app, and that is saying a lot. The first one had its quirks, but I was always able to connect my lights, set random on and off times, and actually control what I wanted. This new version makes me rely more on a manual switch than what Hue is designed for. It appears Phillips could not care more than two cents on reliability and adequate user interface with this new version. I would recommend finding a different company for Wi-Fi lighting such as Flux, Cree, or GE. Avoid this poor interface and reliability of a company.

I like the 1st version where one can choose a picture, add all your lights and set it. This new app got rid of that and treats each light as it's own scene, why would anyone want to do that? The app forces you to add the same picture to each light and does not let you choose a picture to set your scene from a picture screen. If you do have a scene you can't save it for all your lights anymore. If you set up Siri, none of the custom pics are available, only the app defaults. Really horrible horrible.... horrible UI. What were you guys thinking?!
Why do people go backwards when developing a good interface?
I've been trying to set up a new scene and I'm fumbling around. There is no rhyme or reason to the interface. If you can, stick with the old version.

Why on earth would you update the app and implement less features? The old app was perfect. This version is symbolic of a bad trend: taking something great and over simplifying it for idiots. Glad I never deleted the old version.
The new app appears to recognize my six hue lights, but is unable to control one of them, which the old app can still do.

Great job Phillips, the latest update on the old app does not allow it to launch anymore. I downloaded the new app and it will not connect to my Bridge. So now the whole reason I purchased this system for controlling with my phone is useless. Yay me!!

You can't make scenes that encompass lights from more than one "room." In the old app I had scenes that were room dependent and scenes that weren't; here, you can only group lights in one rigid way. Plus, if you've made a bunch of scenes in your v1 app, you can't import them. The new app is sleek in appearance but I'm very disappointed I can no longer use v1 because this one is a huge downgrade and total disappointment

Hue forced my phone to "update" to this new app, leaving the old app useless. Previous app allows one to mix lights, creat scenes, use more color. New app fails to provide such a freedom. This app needs mayor improvement and give us more freedom to do whatever we want with our lights. Give us your recommendation but do not limited the creation of scenes to only four rooms. In this case newer does not mean better. No stars for this app. I am force to rate, and therefore force to at lease give one start; but it deserves non. One star, just because I can not give it non.

The old app was intuitive and flexible. It allowed you to set your lights according to your needs. This app is just bad. There is absolutely no flexibility and Philips has decided that I may not have more than 5 rooms in my house and certainly no more than a certain number of lights in each room. Geo fencing used to work - it doesn't any longer. When it does work it is kind of random which lights are turned on and which aren't. I can't decide to have certain lights turn on any longer to guide me into the house - I have to turn on the whole house at some random color and lux - or rather some of the house cause I cannot add more than a limited number of rooms which then has to turn on all lights - but some rooms need to stay dark - or I just have to combine rooms which kind of removes the whole idea of this Hue system. It's just bad bad bad - and bloody annoying caused it used to be both smart and easy to use.

I had the previous version of this app which worked well and now I am forced to switch to the GEN2 app because the GEN1 app is not supported any more. Now I cannot use my previous scenes that took me a long time to fine tune. The app is not the least bit intuitive and I cannot even create scenes the same way as before!!Wish I never bought HUE lights!!

So Philips is really pushing people towards this new app but it still lacks a few important features from the first gen app: the ability to group lights by colour and adjust them as a group (without putting them in a room!) and timers. The new app supports alarms but not the ability to set a timed event (such as "fade the lights to off over 15 minutes, for example).

We just upgraded our hue lightbulbs and I love the ease of use of the new software.  I love the scenes, and changing colors and saturation is absolutely intuitive.  I have to work on the computer all day and don't want to come home and have to be a tech geek in order to turn on the lights. But I do love the new added feature where I can see exactly the percentage of light that I have on, so if I have a light at 10%, I know to put it at 10% tomorrow if I want that. The scenes are great and it's easy to change them. Love it! Thank you!
This ''upgrade" is so poor it makes me regret adopting the Hue system.

The new app is awful. Very disappointed with the Philips Hue team who created something that is not intuitive, doesn't allow for the transfer of customized light scenes or timer information and generally causes frustration to the point where I am considering returning to the old school method of flipping the light switches manually. There was nothing wrong with the previous app.

I declined to update to this as it was panned for not retaining the ability to change by scene.  10 months later and they haven't remedied this flaw.  the ability to switch scenes at a tap was marketed to customers.  removing this is tantamount to a rip off.  This is corporate incompetence and greed.  I will not spend another dime on this product.  FB page keeps acting like this is a work in progress. BULL.

You basicly ruin the f*ckn app with this new one, how the hell do I navigate this sh*t?!  Did the tec-guy eat some mushrooms before uploading this new thing you call an app? if you wanna have them on different volymes of light you have to have all the light sources one by one. You can't easliy  turn them on with the widget function when it's like this, i'll go back the old version untill you fix this shitti app...
It's ok but they could make it better
I really don't think that the people that wrote this app actually use it. The short comings are too many to list.

This new app is awful. I have multiple hue light set-ups with alarms and routines. What was so easy in the original app now must be done through 3rd party apps. I. The first app it was all there in one place. Cut the crap, Philips and go back to the ease of your 1st app.
The latest update just broke the app. It will not open

I had a much longer review submitted in the past for this app - but just let me say this instead: This app is Horrible and was forced upon users of their first BETTER app (can u believe this?). The reason is they don't seem to understand 'why' people buy these lights. We buy them in order to set an overall scene. Not to go room-by-room. Why don't I just use physical wall switches while I'm at it? They act as if rooms are completely independent from other rooms and from your home. Philips needs to get it through their thick heads. Forget the 'room by room' stupidity. Homekit is not called 'roomkit' for a reason. Good bulbs, but this is a horrible horrible backwards app that ignores all users and the endless string of bad reviews telling them: Fix it.

The 2nd generation app tried too hard for looks and said good bye function. If hue lights went to school, the new app I am reviewing wouldn't have any friends, definitely have no girlfriends.  Friends don't friends download this. Stop the abuse that is happening to homes world wide. Only you can make the difference. Just say no to the new Hue App.

I can only assume that Phillips do not use their own products in a real life setting, the reduction in functionality from the original app is shocking, the intuitive interface is completely gone what is left is a nightmare in the face of confusion. I can only assume you went for a minimalistic interface, you only succeeded in minimising the overall functionality of the app.
Makes me very disappointed in Hue.

This morning, I downloaded, and worked with, the latest app. I've was able to pre-set my individual lights (I have 4 of them) to their preexisting settings. However, when I setup my 'Routine' - when I want my lights to turn ON / OFF and to a particular time, color and intensity settings - I find my new Routine time turns my lights on to FULL BRIGHT; I CANNOT get the latest app to select my light color and intensity to their pre-selected settings. What A Watse Of Time. Hey Philips, here's some advice; when you update and dispurse a new app, the objective is to ADD features, not take away features. Mijn vrouw is Nederlandse en het is genent om te zeggen dat je een Nederlands bedrijf.
This one isn't user friendly at all. The older app is the way to go. Download that one if you can.

The Gen 1 App was so much better and you updated that app today so that it no longer works, so now I can not control my hub. I have to completely start from scratch. This makes no sense and is incredibly frustrating!

The new update for the app is horrible. Poorly designed in all aspects. It is literally easier to buy a raspberry pi and set it up to control my lights then try and set up this app. This company should be ashamed of itself for charging this much and offering poor app support, which is essential to the lights. I now find it easier to just turn my lights on/off manually with plain boring white light than use the apps to get the colors we all want out of these lights. DONT BUY HUE LIGHTS!!!!

We used to be able to create a new scenes with pictures. Why can't we do that? You should integrate your emotion tensor with HomeKit so we can create other automations with non-Hue devices (like garage doors and other non-competitors). If you don't integrate your motion sensor with HomeKit, consumers will be forced to buy Motion Sensors from other vendors that do integrate with HomeKit and IFTTT.
You destroyed you product with this recent update!! Awful!!! Whoever designed this new update should be fired!!

My wife and I have been using the hue system for some time now and have had no problems at all.There's a small learning curve but very small.We use it when we're away to turn lights on or off to deter any would be theives who might be lurking about. I love the ability to change the color of light to suit my needs, whether I'm reading at night or during the day or if I want to turn it down to a nightlight position. We have three of our rooms already using the Hue lighting system and will extend it to additional rooms soon.

Having installed and reinstalled the software and played with it for two days, I still cannot change the lighting hue. In fact, the options to change the colours just remained frozen. Also, when trying to turn the light off remotely, it did not work. Terrible trouble shooting on the website and still waiting for Philips to reply to my email in a last ditch effort to make the Iris do more than just switch on and off. I admit defeat and am returning the product as it is not fit for purpose. Sorry Philips, it's unreliable, buggy software that does not do what it says on the can. Let me know when you have a product that works.
Prompted me to log in 6 times to my hue account to set up a routine. Please stop playing games and let me make my life easier with my lights like you're supposed to

This app has limited functionality. As a result I have gone searching for 3rd party apps ( to do what I think this app should do ). Getting third party apps is actually suggested by Philips as if it were reasonable. Third party apps are either free and also too limited or add cost to an already expensive system of lights. It seems like it would be pretty easy for Philips to provide a properly functional and customizable app for this system. The fact they don't must be about making money of course. The lights sit there mocking me while somewhere out there is code that would tell the lights to do what I want. Buying smart lightbulbs has made me feel pretty dumb.

The prices of the lights are unbelievable to begin with. I have managed to buy 18 plain white color over a year. Of course I like that I control them from my phone but this App needs to be updated. When they sell lights from $15 to $60 and we fools buy them, Philips should had gone out of their way to give us an App equivalent to their lights. Why should we have to buy other Apps?

The new app is awful. I love the hue lights but not the new app.  I can use the old app and connect to the lights fine. New app you can only set accessories to a very small number of lighting options.  Use a 3rd party app cause Philips can't seem to make a good app.

This could easily have much better UI and flexibility of programming.   Also suspect its a battery drainer as it is top of the list for usage despite only have a few minutes of screen time.  For such an expensive system it should have a top notch app.

Update ~Still Stinks. I guess the app is an orphan. I bought some 3rd party Hue apps and they're better, but still have horrible sense of flow. There's no way.....none.....that a person with knowledge of human interface flow and design created this mess of an app. I'll live with the hue bulbs and switches I currently own, but no way in hell will I buy one more hue device. Too many other options to put up with this mess. ~~~~What a stupid update. I had the first app and it was fine. I wasn't doing anything too fancy but I had different scenes and liked changing the colors using Siri. So maybe there's a way to do this but I haven't figured it out yet. Not intuitive in the least. Why Philips assumes I want to spend hours or even one hour learning a stupid app is beyond me. Hire an interface engineer for cripe's sake. Yeah, maybe I'm not worthy of this app but I'm stuck with me! Thank heavens I use my Amazon echo 99.9% of the time so it's fine. It can't change colors yet though. Just an idiotic update. And no.....I'm not going to use IFTTT or some other George Orwell app that wants permission to access contacts, email, twitter, facebook and on and on. Get out if here with that insanity!

The official app of the hue lights is so simple, it doesn't let your lights change with music, or movies, and is BASIC. Phillips doesn't want you using their app, they want you download 3rd party apps for the selling points on their website, which feels misleading.  Why wouldn't they include these options in the official app that is HomeKit enabled and secure?  Very disappointing for the price of the kit and lights, I'd think they could afford to make a quality app to power their hardware. Instead I'm supposed to trust a 3rd party app from people I've never heard of to do all the cool things they sell you on their website.  (Want to Sync lights with music/ movies/ games? not with this app!)
Widget stopped work with this version.. please fix this!!
Controls your Hue devices nicely.

The app is fine, just two things:1. Options are limited with accessories (such as motion sensor, when it doesn't detect movement it has only two options: turn off and do anything for example). 2. The synchronization between Home app and Hue is still not perfect. It need to be improved.

Just wondering if anyone else is also having to reinstall the app in order to reconnect every time it looses connection. Problem persists on both iPhone and iPad, and has been an issue ever since the introduction of this particular hue app.
Added new bulbs wasn't working properly so reset everything now I can't import scenes to HomeKit app!

To call this app amateurish would be an insult to amateurs. Copying scenes over from the Gen 1 app (which works just fine) is a complete pain, and the Gen 2 app seems to misremember scenes more commonly than not. Setting up new Scenes is counterintutitive at best. I don't get why Philips continues with this horrible app when so many users have clearly complained about it. Do they even care? Seeing as how you can't even get the Gen 1 app anymore, I'd hesitate to recommend Hue at all to new buyers.

Fancy little app that doesn't do much and is over complicated. I asked developers for a simple on/off timer and that seems to be too difficult for them. A basic software program isn't possible....come on!

This app is a lot better than other people are giving it credit for. Yes, it is very simple and basic; but I think that's the point. The third-party developers have made some amazing aps, But this one does what you need to get up and running. It's well designed and has worked flawlessly for me. If it included fading or pulsing sequences I would have given it another star.
Very confusing to use, too many settings, overlapping, please make it simpler
Does not work
This version of the app is draining an insane percentage of my iPad Pro 9.7" battery. Deleting app until it's updated.

I just bought the ambient starter pack and went through the setup. Totally cool!! Perfect operation is my experience, although it takes some time to understand how to set it up the way you like it to operate. Understanding how to setup HomeKit with customer scenes took me a while but now I'm able to simply say to Siri 'time to get busy' and my bedroom turns into a sexpot palace of colors I defined _

All my lights are non functional and the bridge does not connect. Do you people even do testing on apps before you release an update. An update like this turns 250 dollars worth of lighting equipment into non functioning obsolescence. If this isn't fixed soon I'm taking further action and escalating the issue

Love that scenes work with Alexa. But there are two seriously frustrating problems:1) you can't delete the default scenes and the "include default scenes" check box when creating a room does not work (it includes the scene regardless).  This makes it impossible to trigger scenes in Alexa because she will get confused with multiple rooms having the same named scenes. 2) you cannot control individual lights if they are not included in rooms
The application development team needs to go back to 1997 and fix this application and bring it up to modern standards. Give me a break. The hardware has tremendous capability, and the app does not.

The app used to be great a couple years ago, then they changed it to this user unfriendly version that doesn't work half the time. Since the latest update I can no longer change the individual bulb colors only the whole room changes to the same color. The option to view my individual lights and scenes is gone. I open the app and there is "living room" I tap it and the color screen comes up and all the lights change to the color I pick. As expensive as the bulbs are I think I should be able to change each bulb to my liking as I used to but not anymore. Fix this!!!
Philips Hue is the best out there for smart lighting that looks great and is easy to use.
Whatever update took place basically ruined any connection to Siri and google home (via IFTTT).

The hue bridge has all three lights on and all the options to find it don't work. This app simply never works well and when It did I couldn't even turn my lights on when I wasn't home. Don't sell a product if you can't design the software for it!
It is almost like hue team sabotaged themselves. They went out if their way to purposefully gut this app to force people away from Hue as a solution. _
Since the last update, today widget is often unusable until I restart my phone.

App does not work for me. I have had to delete and reinstall the app several times trying to get it to connect to the Hue 2.0 bridge. Once I get connected to the bridge it will not allow me to do what I'm trying to do. I then have to delete the app and reinstall the app and re-pair to the bridge to get to a point where I can do what I want to do and even then I am unable to get it to pair with my old bridge or lights.  Terrible design that does not allow for you to go back to the previous screen to set up the bridge and or migrate data from another Hue bridge. Terribly frustrated! Wish I had never bought Hue 2 in the first place. Gen 1 worked fine for me.

For the past few months after this app came out my iPad battery used to get really warm and would drain like crazy, I tried everything to fix it. I took my iPad up to the Apple Store yesterday, they saw that this Hue app for iPad was using 62% of my battery over a course of 7 days and was ONLY 1.5 minutes on screen time! Obviously this app was somehow killing my battery without me even using the app. So I deleted the app and the iPad IMMEDIATELY started to cool off and haven't had any battery draining issues since. I won't be using this app anymore unless they come out with an update to fix the issue. The iPhone app though works great and I love it.

You would think this was a start up venture, given how terrible the software is. Reliability is null, which you will certainly notice when you're troubleshooting at 1am because you would like to turn your lights off before bed.

I always want to set scenes for my entire home never just 1 room.This feature was removed from the app when they made this gen2 app and therefore I can't use it.Fix this please!!! Just add a scenes tab instead of settings or explore (hide those features elsewhere since We don't need them every day)In the scenes tab let us define what every light in our home should do!!!Seriously if you don't fix this in 30 days I will make my own app.
You still can't share lamps between rooms and no grouping.That you can change the color of all lamps in a room is a great improvement.
I was able to set up everything I wanted but the ability to perform the "location aware" functions. From other reviews this is an issue for everyone.
I have no problems with the app or the light bulbs, app is just a little hard to navigate.
The software takes a little to completely figure out but other than needing to handle multiple rooms better, as others suggest, the app and hue hardware are pretty sweet!
Please make this app user friendly, really is not an easy app to setup. Lights are great but app stinks.
I can't believe this app only got 2 stars? Really? It's the best app ever. If you are to stupid to use it it's your fault. Works Perfect for me.

This app has the potential to be great but is so disappointing, clunky, ugly and unreliable. It's not a patch on the iOS Home app (but unfortunately I need this app to run automation tasks). It's surprising how Philips could make such a good product and then let down so badly on the app.
Installed new Hue app. Lost all my settings: devices, scenes, the whole shebang.Do you actually hire programmers at Philips to write your code ?
Horrible! I cannot find a better word for this application. Nothing works, or works randomly!

I am very found of my Hue lights and have invested in 25 lights.  Unfortunately, this current light app is the worst update I have dealt with.  My lights and switches are no longer working or reachable when I need them. The unreliability of this app is devastating, frustrating and above irresponsible of the developers for not vetting.  Especially, when I think of all of the other loyal customers like myself and the amount revenue they have made.  Let's hope they regrouped and get our systems back online.

It already happened many times, when I opened the App and tried to turn on my lights at night, a bridge software upgrade page popped up and no way to get around it.I don't understand why I have to wait in the dark room until the software update finished before I can turn on my lights.

They recently fixed a few things so I bumped it up one star. However it keeps putting up errors indicating the room name is invalid and Siri is not working. However everything works fine. So apparently this application is still bug ridden. It is an overly complex application. It tries to do far too much and exposes too much that the average user does not need. The UX people for this app should be fired and application rebuilt from ground up.
An expensive toy that often breaks down. Not cool!
Does anyone know if this app is compatible with Bose SoundTouch playing music via airplay?
Today's update removed all of my scenes and knocked out any Siri/HomeKit capabilities. What is this garbage?
A masterclass in bad design. Truly terrible UI. Simple things made stupidly complicated.

Old App works well - this app does not show if Nest timer is on or off.It can't be relied on to show accurately what is on or off when we are away - (I have phoned to check) old app is 100% correct.No geofencing notifications.Looks great but a disappointing step backwards.

I'm giving it three stars because it doesn't MOST of what it claims. But since this update, I can't turn my lights on when I'm away, before I get home?? It was working before but it doesn't anymore, and it's so annoying. Please fix!!

There are a couple nice new features. Overall this app is more difficult to use and you take more time to do simple things, such as select a scene, more scrolling and tapping compared to single taps before. The old app was way better!

I'm not a developer. Having gotten that out of the way, I will now bravely state I actually like the Philips Hue app. I'm new to the product, only just having installed within the last week. I run a modest 14 different bulbs (5 3rd gen white and color ambiance A19s, 3 3rd gen white ambiance A19s, and 6 2nd gen white and color par 16 spots), and haven't had any trouble getting the app to do what I want when I want it done. It was pretty easy to figure out, to pair my bulbs with my bridge, and to set up scenes which interface with Apple HomeKit and iOS widgets etc. for my devices. I particularly appreciate the Apple Watch app, which is handy for when I'm entertaining and want to make a change without calling too much attention to what I'm doing. I'm guessing people reviewing the app negatively might have been through several iterations of this app, and as I don't have that same perspective this may be affecting my overall impression of it, but I've had zero difficulty. Though the app is fairly basic, it's out of the box a good and (for me) fully functional tool to dip my toes into the smart lighting sea change. I look forward to future updates.

Like many others here I have invested a substantial sum of money into my hue lights and this app is terrible. You don't have near the options to customize rooms like the old app. The bridge doesn't consistently talk to the app...I'm just so displeased with the whole setup. I have been playing with it for days and still cannot set up the individually colored bulb scenes that were so easy in the previous app. I sincerely hope someone from Phillips is paying attention because it feels like they have ruined an amazing product.

Hey guys, your app is broken. Since day 1 of owning the new bridge and downloading the new app, I haven't been able to sign into the "My Hue" feature. Therefore I haven't been able to use any of the location-based features that you advertise. If you have a little more effort, I might open and use your app more frequently. As it is now, I avoid it at all costs and try to stick to the Apple Home app which ironically has a far better integration with your product.

I love the lights and app but when you update the app can you provide a help page. Or how to? I can't find out how to change colour of individual lights, just the room as a whole. Can I add new recipes for whole room? What's the difference between recipes and scenes?

I found the setup to be incredibly simple (took about a minute). The lights work great. If you don't want color it's ability to run on a timer, dim, and be controlled from anywhere is worth the price. I'm very happy with the purchase.
I hardly ever use my hue lights bc I have to reset the bridge every time I want to turn them on. Not sure why it can't be found on the network. Highly disappointing.

Whilest I do agree with the general consensus of the reviews I somehow got used to the new app. HOWEVER: a key function missing is the ability to set random times for routines. A simple, but very useful feature. Please bring this back!!
This is the biggest waste of money you will ever spend I bought a whole set of hue lights and none of them work because the bridge will not connect to the wifi
All I get is local light control. But get to something more interesting like home and away routines, forget it. It requires login to myhue account which never works.

I really don't understand the reason behind creating this new app. The old one worked better and was more flexible to create scenes.One thing I really don't understand is why you cannot combine lights in rooms that already are assigned to other rooms to create a specific scene or activity. For example, I have my dining and living room lights close together and I want to manage them both separately and also together for different regular activities. Why the app cannot handle scene-based activities like the old app is beyond me. In the old app, you could manage activities and scenes with the fully customizable picture buttons.

Can no longer assign a single light to a single button on the Hue Tap. I used to be able to do this with the old app and switch on and off 3 different lights with the Tap.Please implement! You've reduced core functionality with this supposed update!
When are you going to create a "fixture" mode/setting? This is ridiculous'!!!

It's overall a good app when you are home. I think you should be able to access the app and use its features when you have HomeKit available like the August lock. I would also like to set the temperature of the light (daylight) for my wake-up light as opposed to a soft white. I want to be able to get out of bed in the morning, not linger. It's a shame that the lights are not as bright as Cree. I wish Wink would be HomeKit accessible. _

This app does all the fundamental stuff to get your expanding set of Hue lights going, including controlling them away from home. Obviously the sky is the limit with the potential for third party apps to control your lights in any way you want. I have had no problems at all with adding new lights and grouping them.When you link your app to your "meethue" web account, you can control and schedule your lights away from home.
please, please bring the random function (30 min random timer) back!

The app is consistently saying lights unreachable. When I turn some light off they will pop back on every time. Ex: I have 3 bulbs in the kitchen and 2 of them shut down and the 3rd one will pop back on every time. The sync with home app is always having issues... don't know if that home apps problem or hue's.Other than that the bulbs themselves are amazing to dim and I do the the colors... just want them to work the right way.

We have about $2800 invested in Hue lights and the app just gets worse and worse! And with the last update, the tap accessory is useless, lights drop off the recognized list, wrong colors come on.  The list goes on and on of things bad about this app

Only 3 stars because I ran into the following problem:; I had 12 Dimmers and Motion Sensors. But in my house I need 15 of them. Adding the 13th was not possible, after research in Google I found out about a limit of maximum 12 Dimmers and Motion Sensors. Why this, I bought all 15 and can now only use 12 and have not the comfort you tell about in home automatization. Will this change, I and surely others with a lot of Hue lights as I surely need to have more than 12 Dimmers and Motion Sensors. Please help, you like to sell it, right?
The recent version 02/17 has broken the automatic light automation of turning off and on when I leave and return home. Disappointing that Philips continues to struggle with this app year after year.

It sure would be nice if three put some instructions in the box as to how to set it up! There were none in there and can't find anything helpful online, frustrating product that will be returned asap, and app deleted! Don't buy these things unless you want more frustration in your life!

The location aware routines no longer work. Given that I don't want to spend $$ on a light switch it's frustrating having to pull out my phone every time I get home. It used to work flawlessly but suddenly broke. Please fix this!

If I open this app, I almost certainly want to do something other than wait 15 minutes for a system update so why is there no option to postpone the updates? Like everything else in the Hue ecosystem this app has serious usability flaws. If you own Hue bulbs, make sure you have a way to control them that doesn't come from Philips.

Missing so many essential features that the previous app had, like: being able to set custom timers for *any* theme, not just "wake up" and "go to sleep"; being able to activate custom scenes from the home screen (widgets); lacking a full color swathe for picking colors when making custom scenes; and more. Huge downgrade compared to previous version.
Making lights useless since I can't turn them on. No idea why lights become unreachable. Killing app, turning wifi off and on doesn't seem to help in reestablishing connection. Disappointing!
Wonky app that turns on lights u want off or brighten lights that are dim when the app is opened.
The out of home connection doesn't work!The turn on lights when I arrive at home doesn't work!

Simply one of the worst apps I've ever used! The updated current version is not an improvement, the functionality is actually much worse. Did anyone bother to test it?? One would think philips could invest in what should be simple and easy to use software for their expensive hardware.  Huge disappointment! Don't waste your time.
I can't sign in on the app using my information. It just keeps sending me to their page where you sign in or create an account.

If you have the first generation app KEEP IT.  This app totally ruined what was once good.  You cannot control your lights other than turn them off and on while away.  You can no longer randomize on/off times or set alarms.  If you are going on holiday you cannot set and forget to make your home appear as if someone is there.
I paid $200 for a device that doesn't work. I'm a software engineer and I can't get the device to connect.

Considering how expensive these bulbs are and how rich Philips is as a company, and these lights being such a good idea, I cannot fathom how this is the accepted interface for them. It's disgusting. Just got everything setup and works a treat. Really happy with everything (lights and app) so far...

Is it too much to ask for a simple on / off timer facility? At the moment I have lights set to come on with a "routine" but can only find a way to switch them off by setting a "Go to Sleep" timer which does not have an instant off and requires a minimum fade out of 15 minutes. The Philips Hue system is brilliant but the app needs more work to realise the potential of these lights.

This app works as advertised. And it's integration with HomeKit makes controlling my lights a breeze. I never knew I needed this in my life until I installed the starter pack. Since then I've added lights to 2 other rooms in my apartment. The lights turn on when I come home and turn off when I leave. It's amazing and can't wait to see what else they can do!

Alway's seem to be connecting ? Very buggy. For a company as big as Phillip's you'd think they would get this right. Not the case..You pay all the money for your equipment, please spend some of those profits and get this right !! Your customers deserve better than this...

I'm genuinely curious who the iOS engineering manager for the Philips app team is. I moved to a new internet. All my other IOT devices, simple reset and reconfigure. Hue hub does not let you delete old one as it requires it to be connected.. but I'm no longer in that network!! Why is that a requirement. Factory reset did nothing that helped. I end up reinstalling the app, then it finds a new device! O wait now it tells me to press the main button and that does nothing. I've tried factory reset again. Powering off... everything I can think of. Do I need to fly back to my old network 3000miles way?? Terrible user experience. Even the need of a hub seems totally un necessary. Especially since you pay $60 a bulb and a smart IOT chip with wifi costs $1.80...

Why is it not possible to control a single bulb with the dimmer switch? Furthermore you really should add new features like dynamic light scenes, music Synchronisation, a real wake up light scene with the sun rising up. Better routines... if I want to go to bed, I just want to press a button and the light turns down maybe 15min later. The Apple Watch app is a shame. Why is it not possible to select a colour on the Watch? Instead you just can select predefined scenes. That's weak..

Waste of my time. Lights don't come on as the setting shows. I have 3 bulbs grouped together and only 2 come on. Then 3 different room settings fail to go off when they should. Deleted and going back to the old version.

I live in a place that every device has its public ip and this app simply does not allow me to input a domain name. Nor it could perform a network scan and find the right address in its corresponding range. Plus, the interface is not user friendly; requires a lot of practice before user can master it.

I just got my brand new, expensive lights, and the app does not work!!!! It's so hard to install. And it keeps telling me to update it but it crashes midway through. I can't believe I slept all this money and one for nothing. I'm going to send this back ASAP
This app always has issues connecting to the Hue bridge. On my iPhone it will work more or less, but for the Apple Watch it's a disaster.
The old app used to provide light status notifications when leaving or arriving home. New app doesn't do this!
Scenes need to traverse rooms, or rooms must be able to overlap. Without this everyone is stuck using v1.

This app is awful. The widget never works.  Never.  The old app, which is on my iPad works instantly. I cannot turn lights on or off. I've gone back to just using switches. I have never hated an app with such passion. Please get your _ together.

Glad that the settings are now easily accessible from the bottom of the app at all times, and love the visual improvements. Would love to see a manual sleep timer for lights/scenes that you can activate for different time periods (15min, 30min, 1hr, manual time period) rather than having to choose a recurring time each day, as not everyone sleeps at the same time each day. Keep up the awesome work!
App heavy ! Make a simple version learn from tp-link kasa or wemi!

But... still very unintuitive to use, scene creation is a pain, and *still* no way to control all lights/rooms at once. I expect the manufacturer's app to be rock solid, we pay a premium for these lights, and we have to rely on third party apps to fully unleash their potential. Disappointing.

Great app with lots of nice features yet only a single person can fully control Philips Hue.  I can come home with the light on automatically.  But what about my wife? I like the app for controlling my lights but I find it limiting. I purchased these lights so that I could set up automated schedules for on and off times for when I am away ( so that it appears someone is home). This is possible, but not well designed. You must create a unique routine for every time that you want to switch a light (or grouping of lights) on or off. Other apps allow you to set on and off times in the same routine. I've even used one that let you add intervals. So you could have your downstairs lights turn on at 5:00pm then off at 7:00 pm then on again at 8:30pm and off again at 11:20pm. I like that I was able to control both on and off as well as doing multiple on/offs in a single routine. The other feature that I really liked on other apps is the ability to add a random amount of time to my scheduled in/off times set in my routine. So I might have my off time set for 11:00 but I also have the "randomize" feature set on with a value of 30 minutes. This would add a random amount of time (between 0 and 30 minutes) to my scheduled 'off' time. So on the first day it might add 12 minutes and turn the lights off at 11:12pm. Then the next day it would add 25 minutes and turn the lights off at 11:25pm. This allows you to set up less sets of routines by making them variable. So even though I may only have one routine for weekends, the lights would go on and off at different times (relative to the specific times that I had set). It's a small thing, but I feel it is important. The last item that I would address is that periodically the app won't recognize that I'm home and connected to my home wifi signal. In these cases it still connects me, but assumes I'm accessing the system remotely. The app still works to turn lights on and off, but there is a delay. I'm not sure why this happens. So far it seems random as I haven't been able to isolate a pattern. All that being said, that app does control my lights. I just wish it had these listed capabilities then I could give it a higher rating.

Not all of my scheduled tasks work. I have a task that turns on my lights in the morning and then turns them off a couple hours later. I come home and my lights are still on. What gives?  And the geofencing feature in the new app doesn't work either!

Firstly let me be clear that the Philips Hue product is excellent, high quality and very responsive to the app.The problem is the limitations built into the App and therefore the dimmer/remote too!As I'm rating the App as the main controller for the Hue lighting system, I've rated it 2 stars, because it does work, and the little it does, it does well.The downside is the limitations in terms of the setup of your various Hue Lights. If you have one set of Hue lights in a room, then fantastic, it will work well for you, but I have 4 Hue GU10 spotlights in the lounge ceiling and 2 E27 bulbs in the lamps either side of the lounge. These are set up as two rooms (lamps & lounge), because otherwise they cannot be controlled individually as 2 groups and the 'scenes' will be applied to all of the bulbs and spotlights. Of an evening when I'm relaxing I don't want the ceiling spotlights on, just the lamps. To do this you have to set them up as different rooms!!!!This is a problem, because the dimmer switch will only control one room (although it has 5 settings, these settings will only apply 5 scenes to 1 room!!!!). The reason I have given two stars is because of this limitation and because Philips tell me that the App programs the dimmer!!! The other reason I have given 2 stars is that Philips are proud that they have opened up the App to third parties to develop their own Apps which will allow functions that are not available through the official Philips App. Some may see this as a positive, but essentially this means that you are likely going to have to pay a third party for an App, that gives you more control. Fair enough as Apps cost money to develop, but Philips, poor show really, instead of taking ownership of a poor control App for the Hue, they are passing the buck to third parties. Of course this then means that when you call Philips Hue Customer Services, they will simply say, sorry we do not provide support for issues with third party Apps!!!Cynical, maybe. What could be an amazing lighting system is significantly let down by the poor support from Philips and the poor App.

STILL can only control all or none of the lights in a "room", and the "rooms" are mutually exclusive. Huge fail, time to get out of this stupid and overpriced ecosystem. Which is a shame, because I love non-Hue Philips LED bulbs.
Now that I've finally managed to set everything up properly the app works great. So many great features!

Philips makes great hardware, but the mobile app is really bad. It's not that it's unreliable or buggy, the interface is just bad. It doesn't look very flat (too many gradients) and pleasing, and you can't adjust multiple lights at once, like the gen 1 app. It would be better if they made the interface flat and simple and markers were brought back (scenes and adjusting colors from gen 1). I love my Hue bulbs though.

I expected a lot from a large high tech company like Phillips, it turns out they have too many small fingers into making this pie. The hardware can work well, but lacks some A.I. that less costly simpler products have for example Hue has no mechanism for lights to know times of sunset and sunrise at your location, so as days get longer or shorter you have to edit the times if you want lights to come on/off at times that may make sense for you. Try to work the Hue app for two locations, two homes or work and home - the software can't deal with it. I set up Hue at one home, traveled 1000 miles to another and set up hue there on a Sunday (Hue support was closed). There was NO DOCUMENTATION (nothing even on chat groups) to explain this - I wasted way too much time trying to figure it out - and messed up settings for the first home (Hue would not let me remotely restore it, and their 'customer support' was pretty useless and limited - they cannot even access the user accounts to help!). I could go on and on. Phillips management should be embarassed by this. Sorry, this is not ready for prime time. Martin

Everything about Philips Hue was a horrible, frustrating experience. Pre-purchse research on the Philips Hue website left us thoroughly confused about what to order, so I drove to Best Buy where I fiound an in-store display even more confusing than Hue website. I found an exceptionally sharp and knowledgeable Best Buy sales associate, but he admitted to being just as confused as I was regarding which Hue lights and accessories are Generation 2 vs Generation 3, the differences between some of the lights and how any of that related to HomeKit compatibility. I concluded that the only way to understand the product line was to buy a small selection of the bulbs and system components and do some trial and error. That meant leaving Best But with a fraction of the Hue lights I'd hoped to deploy... but it STILL added up to more than $300.Setup JUST DOESN'T WORK. The Hue iOS app "sees" the bridge, but pressing the bridge's button when instructed does abosolutely nothing at all; I never got past that so I've never had any opportunity to do the (supposedly) required setup. However HomeKit "sees" the Hue Brige and 2 of my 5 Hue bulbs... so WHY do I need the Hue software? And what is the ryhme or reason of some bulbs showing up in HomeKit and some not? And for the bulds that I CAN control with HomeKit why can I only get on/off and dimmer? What happened to colour temperature? Is it even a feature of the bulds I bought? Seems to be, but the packaging isn't clear and it's difficult to determine which of the bulbs I ended up with match specs on the Hue website.Two unpleasant hours later I've thrown the whole lot in a bag and will return everything to Best Buy. $320 is a bloody high price to pay to for 5 lightbulbs and a couple switches. Even if there IS some way to get this junk working (which I doubt--I suspect it's just a bad, bug-ridden product) I'm NOT interested in paying this much for a product that makes me look and feel stupid. I'm actually quite confident that I'm NOT particularly stupid... but I suspect the product managers and designers of this product line (or at least the Hue app) probably ARE. How else could they fail to notice how rotten the entire Hue experience is?

Hate it. This is a disaster. Who keeps their job after putting out a POS like this software? Constantly losing the bridge. I have 25 bulbs and I want to make a group called "All" so I can shut them all off on departure but this is not possible because apparently each bulb can only belong to one group, such as Kitchen. So now you have to turn off each room individually? Setting up was tedious because the software kept crashing or trying to update the bridge for the 10th time even though it was already updated. I know there are plenty of great apps out there that do a FAR better job of managing rooms, devices and scenes... so will stick with them. but cannot seem to find one that will allow offsite control so I can turn lights on or off from work.How about a little QA??

It works great as a means of turning lights on or off, but that's it.Next routines, does grey for each day mean it or not? If it is on, then is the app working or not or is it the routine off? The lack of clarity in this design creates a very frustrating system. Despite testing it, I've not been able to determine the answer. Maybe it's off or maybe there is a bug.The Geofence on lights apps like this always covers around a hundred houses in my rural area which contains how many people wanting to see in my room? Perhaps two hundred people, one or two could be a thief and Philips lets them get a good look while I'm around the corner. In a city, it could far more people. So many times, I come home wondering how long the lights have been on for. Routines should activate either only when I approve via a notifcation or only when I'm connected to the same wifi network, never when I'm a mile away.I also wish the app would notifify me routines activate so that I can turn off lights remotely if they shouldn't  be on, although I think remote activation also doesn't work.

I generally don't need much hand holding when it comes to tech. Ok, I would have given this 5 stars if the instructions were just a bit more detailed. Took a few try's but then great success. Connected two different rooms, 2 bulbs in each room and running off 4 different devices. Then connected it to our Echo. That was the more difficult task. Once that worked we used the Echo remote from upstairs to turn all lights on off and brightness. FYI - In your Hue settings name the lights, (Bills light or desk lamp) then make sure you have Echo discover each device and when you talk to Alexa make sure you tell her exactly which light you are talking about. Disregard all those terrible reviews. We love the convenience of these lights.
