First Hue system. It's easy to set up. No problems so far. When creating "scenes" for specified rooms, it would be great to have access to the full color spectrum instead of limited to the already created ones... I think it's odd to access the users camera roll to generate the color palette for a scene.

OK, it's taken a while but Philips is finally getting this app in shape. The new UI is FAR more elegant than the original, and now has enough editing/tweaking functions to existing scenes to be useful.HomeKit support looks to be greatly improved, including the option of killing old orphaned scenes that were stuck in the hub that prevented me from reusing the names for new scenes.iPad support is very welcome, but I'm dismayed they didn't make use of the expanded real estate to show more than a couple scenes at a time. I was looking forward to seeing a much larger set of scenes without having to scroll so much. Very poor use of the iPad area.One quibble: the patch notes say you can add 'multiple scenes' to a HomeKit scene, but there seems to be no way to do this in either Home or the Hue app. Did they mean multiple rooms? Confusing.I still miss the timers function from the v1 app, but the UI for accessing it was terrible so it's not a great loss.
The app is so horrible that I now just use the lights as normal on/off. What a waste of money!

As the manufacturer of these lights you'd think they would be interested in having the best app to control them - not so.  That leaves us having to mess around with multiple apps to achieve even a simple thing like turning on lights at sunset. Then, with multiple apps, you have to figure out which apps work with HomeKit (if you're using that), along with trying to keep your Hue bridge cleaned up after these other apps load their own scenes and whatnot onto the bridge. Dear Phillips; in case you haven't noticed the new standard for home lighting is being chosen by consumers right now. And history should tell you that consumers are not necessarily going to push the market to the best technology.  Consumers want a complete solution without having to piecemeal together a bunch of different hardware and apps to accomplish different tasks. What can you do with the Phillips Hue App1. Schedule light(s) to turn on and offWhat can't you do1. Turn on and off lights based on changing criteria like sunrise or sunset2. Create lighting effects to continuously change,fade,brighten individual or groups of lights3. Create groups of lights - at least not in the latest app4. Sync the lights to music5. And so forth......Come on Phillips, if you really want to make some money with this product do two simple things:1.  Make your application the go to app for anything and everything you could possibly accomplish with these lights 2.  Create an addressable adapter for regular non-Hue bulbs.  Let consumers at least control on,off and dimming of other lights and I'll guarantee you they will buy more Hue lights when they want to add color control as well.

Either I'm dumb (my wife and kids would agree to that) and I don't understand simple instructions or Philips need to work on their app a bit more.

I used to live my hue system and the old app. It wasn't perfect but it worked. This version makes me want to dump all my lights which is a decent amount of bulbs, strips, and switches. No light groupingNo scene of a room that can exclude certain lights (all or nothing)Super glitchy color selection. If you want your house setup, you have to go thru and turn on each room separately and select each scene. I do not recommend to anyone that they but hue lights anymore. I actually still use the old app that isn't supported anymore to control most of the system but they are slowly removing comparability for that. Eventually apple will update the OS and the old app will stop working.

Garbage. Garbage. Garbage. I love the idea of this system, and it did work well for some time, but it has gone from fairly reliable system, to an enormous waste of power, that turns lights on randomly, and none of my location based rules work with any consistency, so I constantly come home to an empty house with all the lights left on, even though they should have turned off when I left automatically. If I could get my money back and go with another brand, I would gladly scrap the Hue platform altogether, as is is completely unreliable. The concept was great and it used to work well, but between one of the worst UIs I have ever seen, and how incredibly unreliable this system is, I would never recommend it to another person. After HOURS of attempting to implement a simple two light system, I have decided to pack up the Philips HUE lights and bridge and return them to the retail store. Apple - ban this company - this product is not only worthless, it is unsafe and should not be allowed to be sold.

Love the hardware, although it is a bit expensive!Massive holes in the app, eg:- I want to be able to assign an icon photo to each scene (not a photo that's used to pick colours but a photo that helps me recognise the scene I want to turn on)- I want to be able to create a 'mood' by selecting a number of lights in a room and setting them all to the same colour and brightness (I seem to have to do this individually and end up with each bulb being slightly different)- I want more than 2 time slots for the motion sensors, eg. At night I want to turn on a bedroom nightlight when motion is detected, during the day (if light levels are below the set limit) I want the lights to be bright, in the evening I want them to be relaxing.- At the weekend I want my motion sensors working on a different schedule to weekdays.- I want the motion sensors to be very sensitive during the day but at night they should be less sensitive - I don't want the lights to come on if I roll over in bed but I do want them to come on if I get up.It would seem that all of the above could be achieved so easily - just put it in an 'Advanced' menu if you think it will confuse the 'average' user.

i've been using a wemo wall outlet up to this point and decided to plunge into the world of philips hue with the gen 2 bridge and 2 white light starter kit. first, it's way more complicated just to even rename the lights. second, even though the bridge is connected and i can control my lights at this very moment through the app, when i try to set up the connection to siri, the app says it can't find the bridge? huh? third, how many companies does it take to automatically turn on the porch light at dusk and off at dawn? apparently, the answer is three or more. involving philips is obvious, but i have to also involve ifttt and the weather channel as well. wemo does the same with just the one wemo app. and to top it all off, i created an account on the site so that i could at least use it away from home without having to use siri, and the app says there's no connection.this thing needs a lot of work.i notice that there is a scene option where you can switch on a light on arriving at home. location based automation...fantastic. it also has the additional option of switching on said light "only after sunset". but the sunset option can only be used with the arriving at home scene.if sunset can be determined, then sunrise shouldn't be hard. and along with that, programming the porch light to turn off/on at sunrise/sunset independent of my arriving/leaving my house should be possible. and yet...it needs a third party to do this (ifttt).COME ON, PHILIPS, GET IT TOGETHER ALREADY.

Overall, the 2nd gen Hue app seems to work. The biggest, and most obvious mistake the developers made was to eliminate the ability to create scenes that can control lights in multiple rooms or in the entire home. When I first bought the Hue system a friend told me that the new Hue app couldn't control lights in multiple rooms at the same time. I looked quizzically at him and said, "Naw, I don't believe it.  That capability is so basic that no-one would eliminate that."  Dang if it isn't true though!For those using this 2nd gen Hue app who want to create scenes with lights in multiple rooms (or the entire house), I suggest using Apple's stock Home (HomeKit) app to create the scenes. It works fine... and the scenes will work with Siri!This is not to say the 2nd gen Hue app doesn't need to be improved. We can "get by" this way, but most of the criticisms in the app reviews are valid. That said, for me, not even the 1st gen Hue app can do what I want to do with my lights. Not only do I want to create static scenes of a certain brightness and color, but I want scenes that can fade in and out, and that can change color and brightness gradually. The most obvious use for this is for a movie scene where the lights slowly dim. Also, I want the ability to create my own "animations" for my lights. For this I am forced to look to 3rd party apps. After testing over 21 different Hue apps, the best one I've found so far that can do all this is called Hue Lights. It has a great widget and Apple Watch support too. The only thing it can't do is create scenes that can be used with Siri, but I hear that capability will be in the app early next year. Once that's there it will probably be the primary app I use with Hue. Lastly, I have a feature request for Hue's motion sensor... is it possible to add a "tripwire" function where the lights do one thing when motion is detected the first time, and the second time motion is detected the lights do something else? One of the problems I'm having is the lights turning off while I am reading. I read for hours at a stretch and really don't move much while reading, so a timer doesn't work. Also using a motion sensor in the bedroom is impossible. It detects motion when you toss and turn in sleep and turns on the lights every time! By placing the motion sensor so that it has a narrow field of view, and with a tripwire function, we could use a motion detector in the bedroom to turn on the lights when we walk in and turn off the lights when we walk out. This would save energy too. Another motion sensor feature i would like is the ability to utilize its light level and temperature sensors to control my lights. The sensors are there, why not use them? Oh, and HomeKit compatibility would be nice too and would make the motion sensor much more useful. That's about it. Hue is a great product and getting better every year. I hope some of this review was helpful.

Philips Hue is an excellent product. It's pretty straightforward to set up and has some nice basic features with this app. If your looking for more advanced features - get a hub like smart things or home assistant.

Hi, I'm new to the Phillips hue system so I'm not biased from use of the old application. I actually don't mind this app but, there are many reviews here with many great improvement suggestions. I really love the motion sensors however, I'd like to set more than just two times a day "daytime" and "nighttime." Actually, it would be awesome if I could add as many time sections as I needed. For example: daytime, nighttime, nightlight, early morning, etc. Thank you for making a great product and I look forward to future updates.

Over the years I've avoided The Phillips brand because, well; they are a long, sad history in producing "affordable" crap. The hue lights and Hub were a gift, so I tried them, and true to their legacy; Phillips managed to live right down to my expectations. I won't get into the chincy hardware since I'm on the App Store and will need to restrict my review to their app, which is like anything with their name attached to it: crap. How hard is it to create a straightforward user experience, or as we shorthand in the industry; the UX. You'd think, a light control app would be simple: on, off, maybe change colors, segregate by room. Done. Right?Nope!  Not the Phillips approach.  Instead they try too hard to be cute & clever and managed to screw up the very simplest of navigation and UX. You will get lost in "scenes" and "lights" and "which light am I controlling?" And "why can I not dim them at same time....oh, there it is, a hidden feature". Nothing about this app's controls is intuitive or obvious....just frustrating. This app takes the simplest act of on/off and makes it a ridiculous & confusing experience.  Phillips, however, is an easy name to remember because it continues to be synonymous with Phail!

I'll admit it, the version 2.0 of this app left a lot to be desired compared with v1.0. With that said, I'm giving this app 5 stars due to the good release cycles. This app gets updated usually once a month and they seem to be listening to the community needs/wants. Keep it Philips Hue team, this app will soon be excellent through iterative updates!

I had originally written a review with the hopes that they'd improve the app. So far, very little has been done.It remains completely unintuitive. It now has widget and Apple Watch support so that's nice, I guess. Except that the Gen 1 app widget and Apple Watch both support using scenes that change every light while this app limits you to four "rooms." Setting these up is completely unintuitive: create a new one, then tap to select rooms, then tap back to set what the rooms do.Once they're set up they work, but if you have more than four rooms, forget about having an "all lights off" widget. Of course, HomeKit can do this instead. In fact, HomeKit can fill in a lot of the spaces this app fails to fill. But saying "go use the new Home app in iOS 10 instead" isn't exactly a ringing endorsement.

I use iOS language as English, but my Siri is Turkish since I may use Siri Turkish for speech to text. Philips Hue app fetch my iOS language as English and choose app language as English.This is where the problem starts.  Since app language is English, all predefined scene names are English and it is not possible to use those scenes/room names/lamb names with Siri since Siri tries to convert my English voice to Turkish which is funny and meaningless. There should be an option to set application language so that scene names/lamb names/room names will be corrected to Turkish in order to use it with Siri. I have tried to manually convert all English scene names but editing icon for scene names on user interface does not present for all the scenes. I  was only be able to convert first 5 scene names. There should be definitely an option for users to change application language so everything will work fine.

Seriously, what is it with huge companies like Philips, Samsung, Panasonic etc? All their apps are nothing short of rubbish. I'm sure they've got the money/talent, as companies, to create or commission a well made app to go with their smart products, but time and time again, I am so let down. The design of this app is poor. It is not user friendly. It's trying to be fun, and it's not. And it's useless to boot.I won't ever bother listing the problems, as nearly every other review has done a great job of that. Just take heed of one thing:SIMPLE DESIGN! S I M P L E !Lose the gimmicks and start from the ground up. You could have something immensely functional here if you design cleverly and then test your work before releasing it to the world.

So go sleep allow turning off light but light could not start from current state color, lamp change from current color to WHITE then fade out to off. If you use "my routine" option to program change light start from current color then change to programmed color (exep light off). So fixing this simple thing could be a big improvement! Ether adding a simple function to fade to off for a preset delay could be a very simple improvement: We all know when we want to wake pu and never know went we go to sleep !

11-29-2016 Update: The app was actually working well for a time - responsive, and connected to the hub. Until the latest update. Now it's back to dropped connections again. One step forward, two back...Update: The app has taken to either not connecting to the hub (second gen) at all, or taking 30 seconds to connect every time the app opens.  Sometimes Siri will work and the app and widgets won't, other times it's the other way around. It's getting close to unusable. They'd better step up their game before competitors overtake them. The bar keeps getting lower...Original:The new app fails in several ways. The biggest failing is the inability to assign bulbs to more than one "room". The quotes are important, since you might want to define a room as the whole house, or several physical rooms. Since a bulb can only be in one "room" in the app, you're out of luck if you want scenes that apply to a single room *and* scenes that are for larger areas in the house (like, say, a scene for a living room night light and a scene for watching TV that affects lights in the living room and nearby dining room). Technically you could define a single room for all the bulbs and then create a ton of scenes, but it's awkward and you'll still run into a problem if you want to turn on lights in two separate physical rooms independently.The other issue is that there's no good way to import scenes and settings from the old app. You have to activate a scene in the old app, then use the add scene button. You need to do this for each scene, and again you're out of luck if you want to copy a scene spanning rooms.I also noticed the app had a hard time connecting to certain lights. They'd become unresponsive for a while, sometimes requiring restarting the app.All in all, this app is an attempt to streamline the interface, but in doing so makes the app less usable. Hopefully this gets addressed in future updates.For now I'd recommend staying on the gen 1 app until lights are allowed to span rooms and the connectivity to the lights gets a little more stable.

Do NOT download this app onto your iPad if you already have it running on your iPhone.I installed it and happily saw all my scenes had copied over from the Bridge. I started to create a new widget on the iPad and after setting up the 2nd item suddenly the same scene had been duplicated several times. Then a different scene appeared to be duplicated.The screwed up settings propagated back to my iPhone and probably they are totally wrecked on the Bridge as well. UPDATE: after mucking about it seems at least 4 scenes were corrupted and all assigned one name and a different image/color scheme. Deleting one crashed the app but seems to have cleared them from Bridge.Also the dashboard widget used to show two lines of items (8), now it only shows 4 with the next row revealing only the tops of the icons. Clicking Show More on the widget does nothing.This app update is a DISASTER. Everything I do in it screws up more of my scenes. Seriously how did this get released?

Right now I can't control my lights at all because the app won't let me do anything until I install an update. Why lock me out of my own system just because you want to install an update. I only have two bulbs so far and now I plan never to buy another one.

App. I stopped using it because it keeps deleting rooms, lights and there is no easy access to basic stuff like turning all lights off or easily controlling each light. Other 3rd party Apps like OnSeutch do a much better job of managing rooms, widgets and scenes.

They keep releasing updates, but don't address ANY of the user complaints.Among other things, you can't even set a simple on/off timer for the lights anymore. And so many updates filled with so many bugs.The way Philips has degraded this app has soured my experience with the hue lights. I doubt I'll buy more of the Hue products.

I am a long-term user of Philips Hue Lights and I seriously hope they have better plans for this NEW app. In its current state, it's confusing and has lost a tonne of functionality.- Unable to create LIGHT GROUPS. The only group option is "rooms" which means individual lights cannot be added to multiple rooms and therefore, it's not possible to create multi-room scenes.- Unable to control individual lights, or combinations of lights from NOTIFICATION WIDGET. Only allows you to select whole rooms or whole home.- Unable to create ROUTINES with individual lights, or combinations of lights. Only allows you to select whole rooms or whole home.- WAKEUP uses warm light instead of bright white light which is preferred for those of us  wanting a natural wake-up rhythm or those with Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD) - No ability to configure geofencing zone size.  Notification for leaving or entering geolocation zone has been removed as well.- No ability to randomise on and off alarm schedules.- Can't create light scene with standard colour pallet, forces you to use a photo. - Unable to automatically calculate light schedule for "sunrise" and "sunset"- Fade time is limited to 5 minutes intervals up to 30.  Longer or shorter durations are not available.Now I know that there are a lot of other applications out there that work with these lights, but Phillips need to demonstrate basic and advanced functionality to help grow the platform. The brilliance of these configurable lights is that they are highly customisable. I just hope this doesn't signal the demise of these products because there has been no indication from Philips whether missing (or new) features are going to be return to the app. I'm going to keep this review up-to-date with all the problems I find as I continue to use the app in the coming weeks.
Just bad. I'm so embarrassed...

Update 29.11.16: Nach dem aktuellen Update scheint Philips 3 meiner kritisierten Punkte in Angriff genommen zu haben. 1. iPAD SUPPORT: da fragt man sich, warum das so lange gedauert hat?! Dies h_tte gleich nach dem groen Update auf die neue Gen.2 App passieren mssen. Soweit funktioniert alles, jedoch l_sst die Grafik an einigen Stellen zu wnschen brig. Die original Symbole von Philips (z.B gedimmt oder Nachtlicht) sehen sehr verpixelt aus, hier wurden die Symbole in geringer Aufl_sung der iPhone App genommen. Aber naja, damit kann man leben.2. 3D TOUCH FUNKTION: wurde endlich eingefgt, jedoch ohne die M_glichkeit, hier eine spezielle Reihenfolge festzulegen - unabh_ngig von den Widgets. Bei den Widgets werden mir 10 Symbole angezeigt, bei 3D Touch nur die ersten 5. Klar, es es weniger Platz vorhanden, dennoch w_re es wnschenswert, die 3D Touch Shortcuts unabh_ngig von den Widgets festzulegen.So h_tte man mehr M_glichkeiten die Szenen ohne App zu _ndern. Schade - hier wurde nur halbherzig eine l_ngst berf_llige Funktion nachgereicht. 3. INDIVIDUELLE SZENEN BEARBEITEN: endlich, die wohl wichtigste neue Funktion. Jetzt kann man direkt eigene Szenen bearbeiten, ohne jedes Mal eine neue anzulegen um danach Widgets, Schalter usw. manuell zu aktualisieren. Dennoch sollte Philips weiter an der Verbesserung des Systems arbeiten. Es gibt noch viele Sachen, die einfach zu benutzerunfreundlich sind oder nicht richtig funktionieren. Statt 1 Stern gibt es nun 3. Auerdem w_re ein gewisser Radius wnschenswert, wie in der alten App. WAS ICH NICHT VERSTEHE: Warum kann die App, trotz der HomeKit Integration nicht mit weiteren Bewohnern umgehen? I have been involved with computing for over thirty years, and I must say that this is one of the worst user interfaces I have seen in ages. Everything seems to send you around in circles, and every simple adjustment you might want to make seems to require that you close the screen you are on, rather than having you simply click a button/link that will seamlessly take you to the page you need to be on.These light bulbs are beautiful, but controlling them is one major PITA. I have considered getting additional TP-Link Smart Plugs just so that I can use those to turn the Phillips lights on and off. (And don't get me started on the Hue Motion Detector and how "well" that integrates into the mix.)I don't regret the purchase of my three lights, but this app needs to go.

But lemme pile on.I appreciate that they attempted to give the interface a sleeker look, but you can't strip out core functionality and slap on a new coat of paint and expect users to be happy about it.For example: timers that you can trigger manually. I have two timers that I use daily. One of them fades in all my lights over 10 minutes, and one that fades them out. I use the former to ease into the day in the morning, and the other to wind down before bed at night. I can set an alarm to do these things, but I don't go to bed at *exactly* the same time each night, and I don't always get up at the same time. This alone has me using the old app instead of the new one.There's more - but it seems like Philips isn't listening anyway. If they do anything that disables the old app before they provide parity in the new one - and fix some of the many, many usability issues, we're going to have a problem.

Update 29 Nov 2016:"...now you can also edit your custom scenes both with and without a picture."Liars! If I try to add a new scene, it still asks me to "Select an image". There is *still* no way to create a scene from scratch. And still no way to add lamps from different rooms to a scene. This app is still a worthless piece of crap.---Why do you release an app that's *worse* than the old one? Where you have *removed* functions you have to go back to the old app to find?Why on God's green Earth can I no longer create a scene using all lamps? Only for a single room? What were you thinking?Why in heaven's name can't I create a scene from scratch, but *only* from a picture? Creating a scene from a picture should only be some additional "cool" function - fun for a while, slightly nerdy, but basically useless. It should *not* be, not only the main way to create scenes, but, even worse, the *only* way! That's only for playing around, for God's sake! What were you thinking?!Give us back a way to create exact scenes from scratch, precisely the way we want, using any lamps we want!

For those having problemsgetting scenes to work on the Amazon Echo, you need to go back to the Alexa app after setting up your scenes in the Hue app and have it Discover Devices again (even if you have done this in the past). Whatever you do, if you still have V1 of the Hue app, DO NOT REMOVE IT, and continue to use that version. Unfortunately Philips has decided to remove many of the functionality and features that were available in V1, not sure why. Features like multiple room scenes, grouping as many light bulbs as you want, modifying scenes, setting individual light bulbs to a specific colour on a picture, and more. Aside from removing functionality, it now takes more clicks than ever to actually enable a scene, especially across an entire system. What once took me one click, now takes 20 clicks to change the scene in every room,  the notification centre widget is the only way to avoid this  not sure why you can't do it in the actual app; Someone needs to fire their UX developer. Remote access no longer works reliably, I log in to my online account via the app and it says it's connected, but the second I close the app, it disconnects my app from my online account, and I can no longer control my lights unless I'm on WiFi. The app is also riddled with bugs. Routines show one scene but actually launch another, any attempt to modify or rename a scene also cause it to duplicate and delete random scenes. I tried so hard to use this app, but as you can tell by all the negative reviews, it's a huge step backwards for any Hue system. Sad really...

Without a doubt, Hue Lights is the best Hue Lights app out there. Even those who like another app better overall agree that Hue Lights is by far the best animation editor. Not only can it change the color of the lights, but it can change their brightness, flash the bulbs, fade in and out, and control each light independently, simultaneously, or in groups. If you want the control to create animations like YOU want them to be, this is the only app that gives you that ability. Hue Lights has a lot of options and a lot of functions. It can be a little overwhelming at first, and it's layout is not the prettiest, but it makes all that up with functionality. For example, it's scenes have far more options than scenes in any other app, including the ability to fade in and out and even have individual lights change color. In addition, every option and feature can be easily seen. There are no hidden functions that you have to accidentally stumble upon to discover and use.  If there was one thing I'd like to add to the app, it would be the ability to add sequences and animations to the widget and Apple Watch. Otherwise, I couldn't be happier with Hue Lights. I highly recommend it.

Falling foul of the Phillips Hue YouTube sales pitch, 12 months ago I replaced the lights in the house with 63 LED's & 3 rope lights, not forgetting a stack of remote controls to make it all come together without having to use an app on the apple devises. For six months During a room by room upgrade from conventional lights to Hue LEDs I used one bridge. As time progressed I have now a need to add the second. Using iConnectHue as my preferred app, I took good advise from Stefan Goehler and started the process of adding lights to the Hue bridges via the Hue app, rather than start from iConnectHue. Things went well for a while. The Phillips app connected to both bridges. I was able to search for the lights; Adding ground floor & first floor lights to each bridge, controllers and all. I was quite impressed. My frustration came about when two lights in separate rooms were not responding. I tried in vein to add the serial numbers, I even stood on a set of steps offering the bridge to the LED, multiple times, but with no success. In the ongoing process of trying to discover 2 out of 63 LEDs, this app has prevented me from switching between bridges, meaning I have rooms created on both bridges, lights need to be assigned, however the app will not allow me to go backwards to select another option, or cancel the present action. I wish I hadn't bothered with the LEDs, there's just no alignment of hardware to software in the quality stakes. My advise, keep the quantity of lights to a niche few to impress your friends, but do not migrate your entire home to Phillips Hue.

Whoever is responsible for ruining what was a functional, though flawed app with this piece of garbage needs to find a new line of work. This is the most counter-intuitive and terribly designed piece of crap I've ever encountered. They've removed functionality, and the few functions they've retained are never where you expect them to be. A good example of the terrible programming in this app is that after daylight savings time started, all my routines are off by an hour. The lights that are supposed to come on at 4:00, now turn on an hour late!  How to you screw up something so basic as that?!  Shame on Phillips for not fixing this pathetic attempt at app design. I am done with Hue and will never waste my money on their useless products again.

Je mag bij een tweede generatie app toch iets meer verwachten, dan bij de app van de eerste generatie.Het enige pluspunt, dat ik kan ontdekken, is, dat je je lampen per kamer wat gebruiksvriendelijke kan groeperen. En dat je de routine thuis & weg hebt. Echter daarvan gebruik voorlopig niet de weg van huis functie, want dat zou inhouden, dat alles uitgaat, als ik van huis ben, terwijl mijn dochter dan nog thuis is. Thuiskomen (alleen na zonsondergang) gebruikt ik voorlopig alleen voor de hal en woonkamer. Dat is wel makkelijk, want dan gaan de lichten aan.Echter de pluspunten wegen niet op tegen de tegenvallers. Want je kan geen scene meer aanmaken, en moet het dus maar doen met een scene, die je voorgeschoteld krijgt. Dus je komt thuis, de lichten gaan weliswaar aan, maar die ga je allemaal __n voor __n weer aanpassen.Philips lijkt voor je te denken. Dus ook hebben ze de routines aangepast. Men denkt blijkbaar, dat het wel af kunt met het eerdere genoemde thuis en weg, ontwaken en gaan slapen. Net of het handig is om iedere dag te moeten instellen, hoe laat je naar bed toe wilt, en hoe laat je weer wakker wilt worden. Lekker dan.En de timer-functie. Dus lampen aanzetten tijdens afwezigheid, bijvoorbeeld vakantie. Die is helemaal verdwenen. Hier zal ik dus noodgedwongen ontwaken en gaan slapen voor moeten gebruiken.Al met al zeer teleurstellend, omdat ik ook speciaal hiervoor de tweede versie van de bridge heb aangeschaft, terwijl dit eigenlijk helemaal niet nodig was, omdat ik de pluspunten niet tegen de minpunten vind opwegen.Ik heb een hoge pet van de mensen bij Philips op, maar dit valt me zeer tegen. Vandaar slechts 1 ster. Ik verwacht, dat er gauw een goede update komt, waar een ieder mee geholpen is.

I have been a big fan of Hue lights since they came out. I have resisted using Hue2 App because I like to develop scenes for different moods in the same room. First the good. I own a Apple 2 watch and having Siri be able to control the lights from my wrist is rather cool. The less liked is that I gave up multiple scenes for the same room.  Example: I have the whole front of my house lit with Hue lights. When it is Christmas I change the lights to red green. Halloween to deep purple. St Patrick's day green. Fourth of July red white and blue. And fall in orange green and red. Before I just picked my scene but now I can't find an easy way to do that other than manually changing them as the seasons change. Siri really made the lights complete. I hope the programmers find a work around to add what I liked and this will be 5 stars.

In this, the second (failed) attempt to create a hue companion app, Philips has outdone themselves, proving that second shots aren't always comebacks, but, in this instance,  an outstanding and complete failure. PLEASE COMPLETELY OVERHAUL THIS USELESS, FAILURE OF AN APP

When I walk back in the room my light is off but my wife's is on 100%. I don't believe my house is haunted but weirder things have happened. I hope Phillips can correct these issues and also extend the range so the lights don't always read unreachable.

First let begin by saying I think these lights are the next best thing since sliced bread.  But sadly the HUE app isn't!!  It took some getting accustomed to and that was to be expected.  But now there must have been a bad update or some kind of bug!!  The lights just seem to do whatever they want.  There is nothing selected for my arriving home and yet a set off lights still turn on!  At the same time two other groups of light that never had geo fencing activated turn off when come home.  They turn on using routines only, and they turn off when come home?  I have also noticed scenes changing in the routines with out my input.  The routine and geo fencing is VERY cumbersome to use and navigate in general, and I've been through the settings a dozen times and I do not see why this is happening. Hopefully Phillips is reading all the bad reviews and making changes, because it appears NO ONE is happy.

A pity you cant give -5. Bunch of amateurs these app developers. Philips shouldnt have sold their light division. Just like their tv's... starting to become crap products the minute they sold that entity. Each update is completely useless!Start listening and add the 1st gen app's functions!!!WE NEED THE SCENES with individual light control and the ease of use!I fitted my entire house with hue bulbs and you manage to screw up the app and leave those functions out?!?! WTF! The software is THE most important aspect of the lights.And in addition you take functions out of the 1st gen app??!?Guys come on! Listen to your users and people who use your lights daily!! Although the feature 'rooms' is great, where are the other features from the first gen app: a list of the lights and their individual light controls? Which is way faster to flick on 1 light.Where are the scene's?? I need to be able to create custom scenes and the optionto add individual lights to different scenes! Adding a scene to set the mood inside a few rooms at once or use only a few lights in the room is something that is used for parties/setting cosy lighting etc.Whats the use of being able to select 'Dim' when i have NO control over the amount and which lights it applies to??Again: you are killing a good product. I have invested in no less then 14 of these lights, and i cant tell you how angry i am! Get your act together and invest time and resources to get this app back on track!I still find myself using the first gen app and onlychecking this second gen app after an update to see if it has those features or improved... and then i close it. As long as it doesn't have those 1st gen features: i am using the 1st gen app.

There are so many things that you could learn from third party apps, as well as predecessors like WeMo. I have two things in particular that I'd like to see. 1. On demand fade. I imagine that most people aren't lucky enough to go to bed at the same time every night. It would be nice to be able to start a fade on demand. 2. WeMo offered a feature to schedule the lights to turn off/on based on sunrise or sunset. I'd LOVE to schedule a light to turn on 15 minutes before sunset, and then just forget about it. I can use IFTTT to turn them on at sunset, but there's no flexibility. Please look at HOW people use third parties to control your product and build some of those features in. Please.

App does everything I need it to and works as it's supposed to but I would welcome a redesign to improve the user experience.

I don't normally write reviews, but I do read them. So here it goes.  I have my whole house set up on hue lights. We use them for security, for lighting watching a movie, and for other daily activities.  The last app (gen1) was better.  You can't create scenes like before. My app won't recognize that I'm connected to my home wifi so the geo effects are useless. You can't create other timers. Like I want only my bedroom light to come on at 6am but the kitchen lights to then come on at 7 and have the outside lights go on after dark every day and have specific lights turn off when I leave unless it's after dark (no sense in going out to dinner and have the outside lights go off). The room controls. I appreciate the idea of putting them in a group. But the response is so slow I hit it like 4 more times before I realize I did hit it. It's just not responding fast enough. The whole app is tough to use. In gen1 I could see where I was in the app and in this one it's like I have one page to navigate. I'm going to look for another app and or go back to gen1. Delete this one. Too frustrating to use, has made me want to throw my phone.  I'll say the app works so well that I'm getting more exercise, if you can call it that; I get up to turn the lights on and off now. It may be free. But the best things in life are NOT free!  You will be frustrated- don't bother.

I very rare write a review but this time I just feel like I need to do it and let the other people to not update this app.  The interface it is ugly, restrictive and non functional.  I upgraded just because I bought the new motion sensors from hue, what a mistake!, (I thought it will be better then using smarthings sensor, which work fine by the way), soon as I set them up to work during the night time I begin to have trouble with my lights during the day time, the lights which are linked with the sensors turn off them self if you turn them ON outside the set it window time.   Some of other devices connected with the hue hub could not be seen anymore unless you define them in the room but that could lead to duplicate names and confusing the EVE and IFTTT apps.  Very disappointed with this upgrate.

please bring back the old app and everything with it. i have more than 20 bulbs and strips and other hue products. the new hub didn't recognize them so i had to enter all of them manually - this is horrible. then your app lost all of my scenes. online this works but not through the app nor the Tap switch, no more scenes that I set up. the interface insists me on separating things in rooms and won't later let me do groupings if i wanted to turn on say both the kitchen and living room, the lights are reserved for one group only. the hell. you had a great product, please return it to us. at least as an alternative app.

Unnecessary restriction to a specific amount of lights/rooms for actions. No scenes including all lights any more. No changing of existing scenes. Horrible! Not happy with the workflow and app at all!

1. No Ipad app2. The potential of this app is great. I love all these new features with the rooms3. 1 star for annoying bugs, which are unacceptable in programming industry. I will give 5 stars once the bugs are fixed.

I wish I could say something positive about this app and Phillips in general. They show a lot of promise but fail in execution. To be specific: Nearly every time I open the app I am asked to update the software. I'm all for regular updates but sometimes I'll update then be asked to update again. I just want to turn on a light! The app routinely looses connection with the lamps. I turn a light on, notice the light is on, close my phone, the light goes off or resets to previous settings. I have an AirPort Extreme and an airport express extender on a small property, yet the system can't stay synced. My Craftsman garage door opener stays more reliably synced than their lamps even though the garage is another 10 feet past the farthest lamp.

Die Einrichtung ist nicht besonders intuitiv. Fr ein doch recht teures System erwarte ich eine ausgereifte Usability. Das ist hier nicht gegeben. Zudem habe ich nach der Einrichtung 72 E-Mails mit dem Betreff "sch_n sie zu sehen" von Philips erhalten. Wahrscheinlich wurde hier bei der Anpassung auf deutsch falsch bersetzt. Unglaublich. It's too bad I need this to setup the lights. The Apple HomeKit app works much better than this ugly, glitchy mess of an app. Philips needs to hire on a couple professionals to overhaul the functionality and make it more user friendly.

This app is one of the worst Homekit apps.  First, you cant use this app to attach any of the Philips Hue devices to Homekit.  I needed to use the iDevices app to do that.  Next, the app use its own version of houses and rooms than the Homekit version, even though you give it access to the Homekit home.    It also uses its own version of scenes and schedules than the Homekit version. Even when using  their version of scenes, you can only apply a scene to a room and not to an individual light.  I really dont know how that makes any sense.  The app looks like it was written in 1980 rather than for this century.  Small companies, like iDevices and Elgato, can write clean, well-written apps, but a huge company like Philips, with much more resources, cant write a similar app. This app is really bad.

Widgets in today view are too big for iPhone SE. lazy programming? one size fits all which it never does. Where's the anti burglary setting? ieIn version 1 app we could set a + - time to the timer light coming on. This made it look like someone was home rather than the lights being on a set timer everyday.  This was a huge selling point for me. Infact the only reason I bought the lights as I live alone so need to make it appear I am home. Would like some randomness please. Example. I set front room to come on 8pm everyday. I want it to not come on 8pm but around that time varied each day. Same with other rooms I set. I set this according to sunset but an auto set to come on round sunset would be a good option so I don't have to change the timer when the clocks go forward or back. As most people switch lights on around sunset why isn't it a standard feature? Why no "going away/holiday button?"Also leaving location, I would like some added function. Not to just switch lights off when I leave. That's OK in daytime. But to switch certain lights off and others on when I leave at night. I want to be hands off. I leave my front room light switches to a set scene. My hallway goes into a timer which goes off after 3 minutes. My kitchen goes off. That sort of thing. Thanks.
What a joke. How can philips release this junk. A lot of work is needed to make it usable.

Precisely why I never update my apps, they always get worse. The app is far more difficult to personalize. The rationale was let's simplify it, and by doing so, they limited functionality. Now you have to create rooms and only the rooms can be made into scenes. There is no central screen with your scenes, you have to click on the "room" that you made in order to get to the scenes for that room. I'll be using the old version as long as I can. Anyone with a positive review must work for Hue because this is horrendous! I'll use the first app, this one is useless!

How is it possible to create such amazing hardware while at the same time being completely incapable of making software to control it? Everything this app does, no one wants; everything everyone wants, this app doesn't do.  Bravo!  Just use third party apps to control this amazing lighting system. This app is awful.

Since this update, custom light scenes can't be assigned to Widget buttons and, what is worse, can't be assigned to Philips own wall tap switch buttons. New app no longer uses it's own cloud service so it's no longer possible to control the lights from away (for example during holidays for security). Now, if you want to remotely control your lights, you must buy a gen 4 Apple TV and throw your "older" Apple TV to the trash. This was all possible in version 1 of the app without any problems or equipment replacement. Not a happy customer right now after spending 400 in light bulbs. Spent three hours cleaning up all settings, reinstalling version 1 again, just to end up where I was the day before. Very, very bad job with this new version of the app, Philips. Fix this, or I'll sell all my hue equipment on eBay for a dollar and move to a different brand.

This newer generation of app did take a little getting used to but once I did I like some of the features. Managing the lights and grouping them by rooms is pretty nice. Hue...what have you done? I had all my light settings ready for the season than I was forced to upgrade and I'm dealing with a nightmare. My taps no longer work even though I have reset them multiple times. There's a delay when I turn the lights on and sometimes I have to close the app and reopen it for the lights to come on. I have a couple rooms that have matching pendants or lamps and I can no longer get those to be the same color. I'm forced to use the pre-set designs which are nice but don't necessarily fit my personal style. The option to set a routine to wake-up with the lights fading in is a complete flop! Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesnt! The worst part is, only one bright light comes on. In the original version my nice dim lights would come on so I could wake up peacefully, not with a bright light in my face. I appreciate that you are trying to improve but so many wonderful features from previous programs have been eliminated. Don't force an upgrade if you don't have the wrinkles ironed out. I preferred the previous version and if I don't see an update in the near future I will go back to my traditional lightbulbs and IKEA dimmers that are guaranteed to suit my personal desire on demand! On a positive note...I love the new sensor switch! Let's hope that continues being a great product. Please fix this app! Daylight savings is almost here and I want my awesome light system working! Hue is a GREAT product but not without a great, user-friendly app that always works on demand...not when it feels like it!

I never had this problem with the old app. I tried to reconnect the dimmers, but most of the time the app can't find them. There is no way to make custom scenes or control individual lights. Create a scene with only four 'rooms' doesn't help. I guess they tried to make the app easier to use and navigate, but took away the features that I bought hue for and now I have to go to third party apps to control, customize, and enjoy my lights.

After now spending $300 on these lights, I'd still expect more from a multi-billion dollar company. I'm sure a student at my college in the computer science department could design a more intuitive app and would do it for free! Features still needed: 1) Add groups so that I can make multiple lights the exact same color. 2) Allow for scenes to be synced across rooms.3) Allow for better control of my lights when I'm not connected to Wi-Fi.

Why can I not control my lights when I'm not connected to my home network? This was a basic feature in the old app. If I accidentally leave my lights on and leave the house, I can't shut them off remotely.

The old app was nicer. This new version hangs when you try and log in, makes you group your lights into rooms. Just isn't easy to use. Unfortunate for such a cool product. Seems like you should be able to figure it out quickly. I anticipate the next update.
No custom scenes - terrible. How can you just have a few lights set to certain colours as a saved scene??
Poor UI. Wake up routine refuses to work.

Dass fr eine solch groe und tolle Produktpalette keine iPad-App existiert bzw. nur eine veraltete ist wirklich schwach.Auerdem lassen sich zwar OSRAM-Schaltsteckdosen als "Lampe" integrieren, jedoch nicht in eine Szene einbauen. Schwach!

This functionality of this app gets worse every time it gets updated. The most recent update has made it so slow that it can take up to 25 to 30 seconds for my lights to respond to a command. Previously response was less than 5 seconds. The app also seems to lose contact with the bridge frequently. Finally the new way of grouping the lights is very inconvenient but I'm not sure what the thought process was behind it. I really wish I didn't have to update this app I could go back three or four generations

The new app is horrible and unintuitive. It broke what was an almost functional controller and made it clunky and terrible. How can some other third party apps do this better than the manufacturer themselves. Get your act together!!!

This new app forces you to assign your lights to groups (disguised as "rooms"). At first this doesn't sound so bad, but the Scenes can now only be created for these groups, and you can not specify which lights you want in your scene, it's just all the lights in that group.The problem with this is that you can not assign lights to multiple groups, which means you can't make scenes that span multiple areas of lights, which is highly ridiculous, and makes this app seem like child's play in comparison to the old app. In the old app you could make Scenes that included or excluded any light you wanted, giving you full control. Please remove the light groupings.

Whilst there has been an obvious investment to improve the design - the user experience is still poor. Basic functions require too much thought and fiddling. Please think about how your customers use these lights.

1. You can't use photos from your own albums as a scene -- only the "camera roll".2. You can't edit the lights individually in a scene - it chooses for you.3. If you create a routine, it will mess up all of your custom scenes (wrong image, delete all of them, etc.).4. You can't choose any scenes if you set up a routine for your "home".5. You can't make any light recipes of your own.6. You can't make any "fancy" light effects.--About the only good thing this app does is load fast, allow you to make rooms, and turn off all your lights quickly. Other than that, this app is far inferior to the first generation app. Get a third-party app to actually USE your lights.

Die erste Version der App war um Welten besser!Auf Grund des Motion Sensor bin ich nun gezwungen Version 2 zu nutzen. Leider sind die M_glichkeiten der Einstellungen sehr schlecht!Ich kann dem Senor keine Lampe zu ordnen sondern nur einen Raum.Aus diesem Raum muss dann eine Szene gew_hlt werden.In der Konfiguration der Szene kann ich nicht festlegen welche Lampe aus diesem Raum berhaupt geschaltet werden soll! Auch die Helligkeit der Szene kann nicht gespeichert werden!Bedeutet das ich das einfache Szenario "ich gehe Nachts zum Badezimmer" nicht ausreichend einstellen kann!Es soll nur eine Lampe aus dem Wohnzimmer in sehr geringer Helligkeit angehen und nicht alle Lampen in mittlerer Helligkeit!Auch das immer noch keine IPad Version der App verfgbar ist kann ich nicht verstehen!Die Lampen sind super aber es kann doch nicht sein das ihr nicht auf die Reihe bekommt eine vernnftige App zu bauen! Oder integriert in die Alte den Motion Sensor!Bitte Philips _ndert was!

I agree with most of the negative reviews.Compared to the original app (Philips Hue gen 1) this version is very poor in functionality, design and support for iPad.Somehow it can't import the settings from the previous app or import them from the bridge.I also use my Hue lights when I'm not home and in the previous app I could set the switch-off times to be random. This for me crucial feature is now missing. Also in the iOS home app this is not to be found.The lack of support for iPad is just staggering.All in all a watered down version of something that DID work. I will continue to use the GEN 1 version even though it is no longer supported. I hope the guys and girls actually read these (this) review as Hue is too much of premium product that requires proper apps.

Usually when a company comes out with a new were version of the app, it's adding more features and functionality Not in this case!There's some features of the previous app that are missing, like being able to save the dimness setting of a particular scene so when launched in app or widget or Apple Watch, it would remember that saved dim level.  There is also way too much click-thru to get to the scene settings.They should also add 3D Touch... that came out last year and still no adaptation?

The app erased all of my settings with the latest update.  With no warning.  I would have to reprogram everything before I can get back to using what I had before.  I'm not sure if I'll bother.This was after the famous statement from Philips telling customers that they're wrong for wanting a light that won't turn on at full brightness if there is a power failure in the middle of the night.  I will never buy another Hue light after my starter pack.  Maybe it would be good for me if writing this review were my last interaction with this awful product.

As a user of 35 hue bulbs and 5 taps, the old version app was sufficient, able to adjust all bulb colors and brightness individually, as well as customize lights with the use of  custom scenes derived from digital pictures etc. this was a great concept. However, with the new app, I had to reconfigure all the bulbs, color, rooms, brightness, and no more custom scenes! Also, to my surprise, the hue bridge seems to be 3-4 times slower to change all the bulbs in different rooms, often changing color one by one in half second intervals. The old app programmed the bridge and all bulbs will change settings at once! What happened? The new app totally feels and acts like it was developed by totally different companies. I am totally put off by the new app and will continue to beautify and make my home functional with the older app, until Philips gets their act together with their next release. Philips, your bread and butter and history is in lighting, please don't let your loyal customers down!

Pros:App runs extremely well. Individualized settings are flawless. Splitting room capabilities as well. Kind of odd that you don't have those physical controls unless you find a third party app. Why can't we control single colors for all routines and when we arrive?

Update: The app has taken to either not connecting to the hub (second gen) at all, or taking 30 seconds to connect every time the app opens.  Sometimes Siri will work and the app and widgets won't, other times it's the other way around. It's getting close to unusable. They'd better step up their game before competitors overtake them. The bar keeps getting lower...Original:The new app fails in several ways. The biggest failing is the inability to assign bulbs to more than one "room". The quotes are important, since you might want to define a room as the whole house, or several physical rooms. Since a bulb can only be in one "room" in the app, you're out of luck if you want scenes that apply to a single room *and* scenes that are for larger areas in the house (like, say, a scene for a living room night light and a scene for watching TV that affects lights in the living room and nearby dining room). Technically you could define a single room for all the bulbs and then create a ton of scenes, but it's awkward and you'll still run into a problem if you want to turn on lights in two separate physical rooms independently.The other issue is that there's no good way to import scenes and settings from the old app. You have to activate a scene in the old app, then use the add scene button. You need to do this for each scene, and again you're out of luck if you want to copy a scene spanning rooms.I also noticed the app had a hard time connecting to certain lights. They'd become unresponsive for a while, sometimes requiring restarting the app.All in all, this app is an attempt to streamline the interface, but in doing so makes the app less usable. Hopefully this gets addressed in future updates.For now I'd recommend staying on the gen 1 app until lights are allowed to span rooms and the connectivity to the lights gets a little more stable.

App SUCKS!Takes forever trying to log in .... and after a few hundred retrying .... it .... SUCKS!UPDATE: After 2 years I know what's going on.You install the app and configure everthing. Things work 100% (in my case!). Then, Philips decides to release a firmware. You get it and installs fine. Things continue to work 100% (in my case!). Then, you decide you want to factory reset your iPhone so you install a clean version of iOS 9 / 10 / etc. Hell goes lose! Meaning, you can configure the App to see lamps and etc but no way you can log in from within App anymore. Don't break anything (I did!). Just factory reset Philips Hue and reconfigure EVERYTHING. Things should continue to work fine 100% (in my case!) until the next firmware and next iOS you want to install clean!

Upgrading my Gen 1 bridge to Gen 2 for HomeKit functionality. I knew it wouldn't be as simple as it should be. And it wasn't. After a few fiascos I got the bridge paired to app. But app won't find the lights. Manually entered 3 serial numbers. It found one of them. I'm on iOS 10 and on both my iPad Pro and iPhone 7 the battery indicator shows that Hue is consuming 80% of the battery over the past 4 days even though it was only open for two minutes.

While the old app had its limitations, at least the UI was somewhat simplified. Everything had easily found labels and it was obvious how to navigate and set scenes/lights/colors/timers/ect without having to google how-to videos just to find your way around. It took me three months to actually delve in to figure this app out and I only did it because they stopped properly supporting the old app on the apple watch (which was half the reason I got the apple watch, mind you). There are, of course, pros and cons to this new app once you get past the ridiculous learning curve.Pros:-When you set a scene with one light on and one light off it actually turns the light off instead of just not having it react. This was an issue I found with the other app that I was glad they addressed.-There is seemingly no limit on how many widgets you can have. Or at least, it's got a higher limit. I don't know if this is because of ios10 or because Philips stopped limiting it but I'm up to 13 scene widget (the limit on the other was 10) and it's still letting me add.-If you have an apple watch, the watch not only has as complication for Hue but the app actually loads up faster now on the watch. No more 30-60 second lag (most of the time) waiting for the thing to load up.Cons:-Setting up routines is annoyingly complicated. If I want to set the light up so that my elderly father (who still works) can come out to the living room with the lights on and then have them turn off after 30 minutes I have to first set up a routine to turn them on then a routine to turn them on. The old app let me set my own parameters with just one save. This seemed like an unnecessary complication.-I tend to use color picker rather than picking colors from a picture but the fact that you cannot actually self-select a picture color is frustrating when you try to do it. This could've been done much more skillfully than it was-I cannot for the life of me figure out how to edit a scene once I've created it. Maybe I've just not found the method yet, maybe it's not there. If it's not there than fixing that would be excellent so you don't have to create a whole new scene just to tweak it. If it is possible then for godsake make it obvious.

Firstly the UI looks a lot better than before except now it's less functional, I can't make my own scenes (by colour) or just pick the colour of the room, these were basics which were already in the original app, why can't I make a scene using colour sliders like before? The off widget doesn't even work, I was expecting more feature to be integrated such as lights changing to music or visuals like other 3rd party apps offer, this should all be included in the price of hue bulbs they are very expensive and I must say the lights are amazing but the app needs work if you want people to adopt this technology for the price of the bulbs the app offers insufficient functionality even when compared to the last generation app also I assume your aware and are working on the next generation of hue lights but the blues, greens and yellows aren't very vibrant and need to be stronger next time. Thank you for reading and I hope you put my customer feedback to good use!

UPDATE: The latest update limits functionality even further. App update combined with update to the NEW hub breaks connection to 3rd party bulbs (e.g GE bulbs), something Philips specifically said they wouldn't do after complaints. Really bad move by Philips that demonstrates a lack of prioritizing customers. This update severely limits functionality. Philips reduced the number of alarms/routines that can be used or simply designed. They even updated the Gen 1 app so that it is impossible to revert to the proffered older functionality. The app updates the bridge to "max out" even though that was never an issue before. Philips, please revert to the old system or expand the number of routines that can be designed. I'm not sure what they're trying to accomplish by limiting usage. This update actively harms the hue lighting system.

OMG, Philips! It is amazing that in this day and age, this is the best you can do. It went from one horrible app to a new version of just a slightly less horrible app! Can't you hire some smart people to write a program that is actually useful and works?Here are some suggestions. Creating a room is a vast improvement from before. Now you need to improve your scene capability in each room:1) create a scene2) allow to select which specific lights would be assigned to each scene3) allow an option to select each lamp color and dimming level individually AND as a group4) create presets for color temperature AND provide a color wheel for more white and or RGN options5) allow to saveHaving pictures is a nice touch for someone but I would rather have an app that I can use than a useless picture selection app. What good does it do if I spent over 1k on these lamps and the app makes them pretty much useless?

The bulbs are only $15 at Best Buy, which is still a lot of money but somewhat comparable to long life LEDs. If they last it's a pretty good bargain. That said, I don't see th point of using them everywhere, so I don't use them in reading lamps or overhead fixtures.  The parts of the app that work work really well. I enjoy the white/color bulb in my bedside lamp. I even find that tweaking the color and brightness has led to better sleep.  I can also use voice commands through Siri on my iPhone.  I like the "scenes" option to control both lights in the bedroom so I'm not dealing with glaring lights first thing in the morning. However, I have not been able to make the "routines" work. If you already use the previous Hue app, do not bother with this one. If I want to create a scene in one room where two lights are on and a third off, I have to either manually turn two on independently, or turn all three on with a scene and then turn off the one I don't want, there seems to be no provision for creating a scene to do this automatically. Nor does it import existing scenes from the original app.So again, if you use the original app and have custom scenes and settings, this new app is a massive step backwards, do not bother with it.

I tried timeline this app...as much as I missed many off the features from the original hue app, I diligently recreated scenes (as closely as I could with the less precise photo function) and was somewhat back to normal. But after upgrading my bridge to the HomeKit compatible model for Siri support and especially after learning to use iOS 10's HomeKit app, I'm done with this one. The homekit app gives us back pre-light control of color and brightness and scene creation that makes sense (with the ability to combine on/off functions in multiple rooms)I'll keep this app on my phone as a backup to HomeKit but Apple has given me plenty of reasons to never open this one again.

In many ways this app is a huge leap forward over the original app.  Having rooms now is probably the biggest improvement. And overall it's much more responsive. But in the process they ruined creating scenes from photos. Before, you selected a photo and assigned each light to a color you liked in the photo.  Now, you select a photo and the only option is to randomly change what each light is doing until it looks ok.First, that's not as fun. Second, it's just blind luck if you finally get something that you're happy with. They really need to fix that as it's the largest complaint about the new app.

I awoke briefly at 4am. I forgot to turn off a light at the far side of the house. I open the app so I can turn the light off. YOUR APP WON'T LET ME...until I update it. I want to go back to sleep, not wait for an update during which "your system may become unresponsive for a while". I have spent thousands of dollars on these lights. I expect to be able to turn them off when I need to. Do not force updates on your users. Let us dismiss them so we can get to them when it's convenient for us. The update took in excess of 2 minutes during which I went from "sleepy" to "exhausted, frustrated and awake". Sure, I could walk over there and turn it off, but the more you move when you're just briefly awake, the less easy it is to fall back to sleep. I expect my super expensive light system to work when I need or want it to.

I downloaded the hue app. Created a home and then logged into hue so i could manage the lights when we were away from the house via the out of home connection. Everything worked well.I was the primary one that logged into the bridge and paired it, assigned all the scenes, and then synced it up. I would then send an invite out to our the other family members so they could controls the lights via siri on their devices. This all worked fine up until we upgraded to iOS10. issues we are seeing with the hue app under iOS 10 is:Original person that paired the bridge and logged into the hue account can use siri to control lightsFamily members who were invited via :Share Home: are no longer able to control the lights via siri, HOWEVER they can still control the lights with the gui app.since iOS10 i have just been using the light switches to just turn on and off the lights which is not really home automation anymore. Hoping Hue can fix the issue with the siri not working for everyhing. Prior to iOS 10: Would have given in 4 stars out of 5Post iOS10: 1.5 stars

It works but it's like it's only designed for the 3 bulbs you get in a starter pack. Too hard to select color pallet for lights. Scenes are too hard to select and control. Needs different functionality. Old app was better!Update: 9/2015 ... STILL TERRIBLE.

Im confused.  I get the added features for creating rooms and stuff.  But the whole purpose of these light is so you can easily customize the colors and brightness for each individual light.  The new version us horrible for this.  I've wasted time with it.  Time to fire the idiot or idiots that directed the development if this app.  Is it a 60 year old exec that cant use a smart phone

It's great they are trying to improve and the interface itself is better. However, a couple of big fails here I am sure they anticipated people complaining about. #1: room based control. So now a scene can only control lights assigned to a specific room. See point #2. #2: No easy way to port over my gen 1 scenes. Even if I did as they recommend, use gen 1 to activate scene and they save current set up in gen 2, most of my scenes won't fully work because of point #1. My living room is connected to my dining room, hallway and loft. #3: Selecting lights based off a picture and being able to move the points around and group them is gone. That was the best feature gen 1 had. It was the one cool that I showed everyone as a brand enthusiast. It was so intuitive, easy and fast. Now, it's random and clunky to adjust if you want to change individual lights after starting with a picture. It doesn't even make sense in gen 2. Yes, I can still use gen 1, as long as it's there and supported. But we always want to use the shiny new thing.The best thing about gen 2 is multiple bridge support.

I don't normally write reviews, however the limitations of this app incensed me (maybe a slight exaggeration).Through this app you are restricted to controlling lights by room or individually. I can't create my own scene to control certain sets of lights within that room or groups of lights within my house. Looking at other reviews this feature was available in previous versions of the app. Why remove this, you have limited your products potential though your own app? You need the ability the have quick link buttons to the routines or scenes(if they were not so limiting) on the homepage so I didn't have to go through a couple of screens to enable them. Create a widget so they are accessible from the locked screen of your phone. Essentially the usability is very poor.Fade, can I choose my own colours to fade in and out of? No of course not. Your website says turn on your imagination, perhaps I want to wake up to my lights fading from green to red, why are you limiting me! What's the point in having all these colours and the fade facility and not combine the two.Of course all these things are available through 3rd party apps, most of them at a cost. It would appear you have decided to let other developers do the work for you.

Ik heb net de starters kit aangeschaft maar ben erg teleurgesteld over de bijbehorende app. Het is erg omslachtig te bedienen, en er zijn ook geen lichtanimaties zoals bijvoorbeeld kaarslicht. Zelfs basiszaken zoals alle lampen makkelijk dezelfde kleur laten zijn kan niet. Ik hoop dat Philips hier snel eens wat aan gaat doen.

I used to love my Philips Hue lights and recommend them to everybody. After the new app release, I strongly recommend against buying this line of Philips products, and tell people to look elsewhere. It's simple, the room setup is pretty great, and you can still fine tune the lights if you want to. Seems very intuitive and the end results are much easier to achieve. Preset scenes are for individual rooms only - and 2-3 screens to activate them. The "dial" interface for adjusting brightness is gimmicky and inconvenient... The 'bubbles' as buttons for scenes are wonky and difficult to organize/use... I just can't understand how, after all this time, this company still hasn't figured out how to design for their own product.

My first app review from 6 years use of iphone and it tells enough how bad this app is. This is the only control source of the hue system and yet it disabled one of my bulbs and now the bulb is not reacting. In every way, this app does not deliver what it's supposed to.

Another reviewer said it best by calling v2 of the hue app "one step forward, two steps back." The breakdown of rooms is great because it allows you to easily categorize lights into different groups. That's great. The awful and frustrating part of the app is the Siri integration. I want to be able to rename scenes, which the app lets you do only if you select two scenes with the same name. The app will ask you to rename the second, duplicate scene. So then I had to create a fake room in order to create fake duplicate scenes in order to be able to rename some Siri scene commands. Well, this triggered a bug because now my fake room can't be referenced as "living room" for Siri because that's what the original room was called, even though I deleted the original room. I reset Siri settings and it still didn't let me rename my fake room to "living room." Now I might have to reset the entire app, which I spent a really long time setting up, so that I can work around this bug,

The "New Hue App" is awful. There is significant and basic functionality missing that existed in the prior app. Let's hope Apple's new Home app due next week gives us more control over scenes (particularly editing scenes) and uniform Siri control with all HomeKit apps.

Latest review 09-0916Been playing with your app all night and you are so close, love all the new schemes & Shuffles, all that is missing is a collaboration between rooms & let's call it sets.The Siri HomeKit stuff is perfect, although what if I want to turn off one of my room lights or set just a few???I can't do this with scenes as I could do before as it affects all lights, I could do this with App light commands or I would have to give Siri loads of commands...So how about a collaboration between rooms, around say something like as above commands, where the end user can set rooms into commands & then submit them using your cool new Shuffles?At the moment I have found that to effectively use your new app I have to set all my lights into different rooms even if they are in the same room, then give Siri separate commands to turn then all on or off individually.Whereas if the room commands were grouped then... Well say no more.If you need any consultancy let me know, it's me Shane, I used to work on the same estate as you guys in North Wembley (for Rank Video) & now I am an Apple Developer and would be happy to advise. Especially considering my whole house is covered in Hues and they are growing every day. Call me :)You can find me easily on Twitter by my Apple nickname.Latest review 01-09-16The new Siri HomeKit updates are awesome, all scenes are still called the same although if you try to add another room, you get a prompt for a rename, sweet...**********************Edit*still need to make lights available for multiple scenes*********************Rating updated to 4 stars keep it up. Hat's off to the devsPrevious review...Hey Philips nearly there, like the concept of rooms, although not being able to use a light again once it is added to a room kinda spoils things, it would be great to be able to split rooms or join rooms, for example I have two uplighters, a bloom behind my TV and a main bulb in my front room, when watching a film the main bulb becomes redundant so it would be great to just have a room mode with some of the lights, like just the uplighters and the bloom, but I cannot as they are already added to my living room. Also all default scenes are recreated for each room you add, so the bridge gets full up with duplicate scenes, all named the same but all attached to different rooms, on the plus side, really like the shuffle feature, a bit more work and this will be a great app, look forward to your next update.
