Now three updates later, the app still does not address any of the problems that have been brought up in the reviews. Strangely enough there still isn't an iPad or universal option. And we're left with no import function so if you want to use only this app, get ready to manually recreate all your previous setting/scenes. There are a few improvements, like the addition of rooms, but the benefits are outweighed by the lost functionality. Case in point, everything only functions by room instead of allowing the option to use certain bulbs from different rooms (like turning off the lights in one room and simultaneously turning the lights on in another or turning on the lights in more than one location.)  The emphasis on photo-based scenes still does not have the ability to choose specific bulb color and grouping is still not possible (so we are left with random colors.) Plus, in case you want to have multiple bulbs in one room with the same color, good luck getting all of them to match correctly.  We've had the new app for some time, and Philips has failed to explain the purpose of using it instead of improving the original one (all we get is a Twitter handle saying they'll pass along info to their development team.) Still a case of the company demonstrating a knack for excellent hardware and absolutely terrible (and clueless) software, even in their updates.

For the life of me I can't figure out why Philips would develop a great line of smart bulbs and then be unwilling or incapable of providing a decent user interface. Here's hoping their total disregard for the customer comes back to haunt them someday soon...

This newer version of the Hue app is just unusable. It is unintuitive. It is clunky. It crashes often. Simple tasks are difficult to accomplish or even impossible to figure out. The widget does not seem to work correctly. This was a step in the wrong direction.

Why would you break what's working?  Randomizing the time lights turn on and off so it's not so obviously an automated routine is one of the KEY features that had me buy the entire setup in the first place.  Now you remove it for no reason in your new and improved app?  Here's a hint: Don't break / remove what nobody is complaining about.

I have spent some time trying to get used to this new version. It lacks an intuitive interface and they wrecked the Siri interface. Very frustrating and makes me wish I'd gone with another company. Very disappointing that I will need to buy third party software to use hue when the earlier software worked better. I am very bitter.

Good luck trying to create a regular routine with this app, which was clearly designed by the drug-addled. Setting a new routine offers a beginning but no end ("fade" means nothing if it's not clear if it's "in" or "out".) menus are obscure and hard to find. Some routines force you to have a fade in or fade out, you can't have it just switch on or off instantly on a timer. Why not? Not cool enough? Ridiculous. The old app was excellent. The new one is clearly in alpha. Whether the developers know it or not. Shame as the lights themselves are brilliant.

Latest review 01-09-16The new Siri HomeKit updates are awesome, all scenes are still called the same although if you try to add another room, you get a prompt for a rename, sweet...**********************Edit*still need to make lights available for multiple scenes*********************Rating updated to 4 stars keep it up. Hat's off to the devsPrevious review...Hey Philips nearly there, like the concept of rooms, although not being able to use a light again once it is added to a room kinda spoils things, it would be great to be able to split rooms or join rooms, for example I have two uplighters, a bloom behind my TV and a main bulb in my front room, when watching a film the main bulb becomes redundant so it would be great to just have a room mode with some of the lights, like just the uplighters and the bloom, but I cannot as they are already added to my living room. Also all default scenes are recreated for each room you add, so the bridge gets full up with duplicate scenes, all named the same but all attached to different rooms, on the plus side, really like the shuffle feature, a bit more work and this will be a great app, look forward to your next update.

Strzt h_ufig ab, ist unbersichtlich, endlos verschachtelt und berdesigned. Das machen einige Fremdanbieter besser.Und wieso kann ich nicht R_ume gruppieren? Ich wrde gerne in mehreren R_umen gleichzeitig Licht schalten - geht nicht. Lampen aus verschiedenen R_umen gleichzeitig schalten - geht nicht! Beta-Schrott!!!
I don't know how you can make what should be a simple app extremely confusing. Not user friendly at all. Plus lights are expensive, not worth it

Update: Still horrible. Configuring a Philips dimmer switch or tap switch to control just one light is impossible now. You can't even assign scenes to tap buttons. What were they thinking?As others have already said. This app is one step forward and two steps back.1. Scenes have been dumbed down to the point that they are utterly useless. It's almost laughable. There is no way to actually customize or edit any scene short from hitting a randomize button. I was hoping that Philips would actually try and fix the scene editing interface rathen than just decapitating it.2. While room grouping is a welcome change, there is still no concept of grouping lights together as one logical unit (zone?). So if you have any rooms with multiple light fixtures that have multiple lights, good luck to you. You can turn a room on and off, but if you want a scene where some light fixtures are on and some are off or at different levels of itensity with different color, no go.3. Also, there is no way to create a scene that sets lights for multiple rooms. So if you have a relatively open floor plan and you want to configure your lights to dim down an adjacent room to watch a movie in the living area, no go.4. It is unclear if the Home & Away feature actually works with multiple users.This app might work well for customers that have bought a starter kit to play with the lights but it doesn't serve anyone that actually made a considerable investment in installing hue lights in an entire house.

There are a lot of things I really appreciate about the new app once I started understanding the new setup. However, the biggest thing making this a two star review and not 3 1/2 or 4 is I can't make custom scenes for Hue Tap. I have to go back into the Gen1 app, and it's infuriating needing to know the two systems.Either this is a bug or really bad design. I really appreciated being able to build scene by room now, but the fact I can't set that custom scene as a Tap option makes the tap irrelevant.I've been telling people to buy a Tap with Hue, and now I just feel bad.
Ottima applicazione molto intuitiva e funzionale con Siri si riesce a impostare ogni scena vocalmente

This is an insult to Apple users. The 1st time I opened the 2nd gen app on my retina iPad mini, everything is just stretched out, pixelated, and zoomed-in - so it was a huge shortcut they took to not differentiate the mobile and tablet version. If you want it to be clear, you click the "1x" button at the bottom, and it zooms out leaving 2" black borders on your iPad screen! This is the cheapest/stingiest rollout I've seen. As for the app on both my iPhone and iPad, it takes a good 15 seconds to find my bridge every time. Sometimes it takes longer, so instead of waiting in the dark to wait for it to connect, I find it easier to just manually turn on my lamp. I live in a tiny 600 soft apartment so connection to my router isn't the issue.

I'll be honest in this review. I am a first-gen Hue user. I bought my first bridge set and lights when they first came out and have used them since. I've now got 9 color lights, two Lux white lights, two sets of Light Strips, one Iris and a Bloom. I picked up a bridge yesterday to integrate into HomeKit and it was AWFUL. It took hours to set up because I was unable to integrate the existing lights to the bridge. I had to do everything manually, one at a time. Then, I had to log in to My Hue online in order to get the bridge to connect to the app. It was very very frustrating and annoying. Took me about four hours to get it all back to normal. Now that everything is set up, it works fine. I actually like the HomeKit screen better and Siri integration is awesome. So, after the clunky startup, it's fine.

This may be the worst app for home automation ever. When it first came out it was easy to use with every update it has become more complicated and confusing to use. Many of the complaints below seem to touch on the un-intuitive nature of the app and then a host of networking issues that may or may not be app related. I experienced none of these. Connected to the bridge on the first time (and on multiple devices), scanned for and detected all lights save one (had to follow the in-app directions and put in the bulb's serial number - a very minor setback), and we've had loads of fun playing with "Scenes". While the general complaints about the app being mildly un-intuitive, sitting on the couch drinking a beer gave me the patience to "discover" all of its capabilities. It's deep - and that's not easy. The one complaint I share (and therefore the reason I knocked off a star) was that you cannot apply Scenes to more than one room. Seems like an overlooked feature, but no big deal really. Also, the "Go to sleep" routine is kind of a mess - if you have a scene applied, the app slowly puts the lights into general mode (i.e., bright!) and then starts the "Go to sleep" routine. That's not how I would have programmed it, but this is very minor to me. The "Wake up" routines were far more important and work as expected (though again, if a Scene is applied to the room/lights, the routine ignores that - this is probably good for waking up). One reviewer suggested a login, and I agree with that. But, overall, this is everything I expected and while it takes a modicum of brain power to figure out, for me, that was half the fun. "Look hon! Jellyfish purple! Whoot! And, I can dim it!" You'd think early adopters would have more patience and a sense of adventure. But, maybe it's just old curmudgeons who can actually afford these things.
Simpler layout from the first version. Easier to understand now, even my wife can use it finally! Current wish would be for color of the lights customization in routines.

yes such a beautiful lighting system needs a great app. looks better, works worse. Philips please listen: we want to control all our lights as one room. Also through Siri. Let us assign lights to any and as many rooms as we like. Please dont send us through the pictures to create scenes. The pictures are a cool idea but usually not that cool of a result. We want to choose by colors mostly. Let us create scenes based on what the lights are currently on. And again control one room or All Rooms! Please add back to timer. I go to bed in 20 minutes not the same time every night. please get the functionality of the old app with the elegance of this one, so we can go back to enjoying life instead of staring at our phones while our partners fall asleep.

The new app has now been around for a while, but there is no indication of where Philips wants to take it. The only problems the old app had were cosmetic and could've been easily fixed. The new app on the other hand has serious conceptual issues, as it abandons the multi-room scene concept in exchange for a simpler, but unfortunately simplistic room model. Philips move to keep the old app around was a good decision. It might now be the time for the company to take a second good decision and abandon the newer app and further improve on the original app. There are many other room-centred apps. No need to replicate these.

I've been in rooms where people make horribly dumb software decisions (it's always the most vocal person). The new version of the app is just that. Someone with a "vision" made this, clearly ... Made a lot of assumptions about how people use the app, and was dead wrong on all of them and shouldn't have their job. You forced this piece of crap version of the app on users and they all hate it.- My lights turn on in the middle of the night and makes me think someone is screwing with me.- The app is always disconnected until you close it and open it back up.- The way of choosing the hue is absolutely not intuitive.- I lost all my old scenes without warning (things I personally created and curated) because some jerk over there doesn't care about users.- HomeKit is continually reset and has to be setup from scratch.- Now you choose colors from photos for me? Nice going. You took all the joy out of creating new scenes.Seriously, get rid of the person who did this. It's a bad job. It says screw you to your customer base for no added value. It does not improve quality of life. You're saying screw all the people who really bought in and invested in these lights. Very hated.

After spending $50+ a shot for each and every light bulb to fill the entire house, I expected more from the Philips app. Philips needs to hire some new guys to design an application! There is no question the first application was amateur and missing some major capabilities for the Philips Hue bulbs. However, it was much better then the new version! Since the update, every single one of my lights are no longer connected and do not function. I continue to get errors that they are not connected and so on. Yes, I tried deleting each and everyone and tried researching. After much troubleshooting and failing, I eventually unscrewed each and every bulb around the house and gave them power literally inches away from the bridge. I used the computer application to search and finally was able to connect. Installed them back in the original locations around the house and a day later, half of them are nonfuctioning once again. A person should not have any problems what so ever with these lights after paying the premium price for them. Philips Hues are a genius idea, but with a terrible app makes these bulbs useless. The main application for these bulbs should have endless options and functions while being completley being user-friendly. There should be no issues when it comes to connection issues. Hopefully Philips can figure out their application needs work.

Even this next update is complete useless!Start listening and add the 1st gen app's functions!!!WE NEED THE SCENES and ease of use!I fitted my entire house with hue bulbs and you manage to screw up the app and leave those functions out?!?! WTF! Guys come on! Listen to your users and people who use your lights daily!! Although the feature 'rooms' is great, where are the other features from the first gen app: a list of the lights and their individual light controls. Which is way faster to flick on 1 light.Where are the scene's?? Adding a scene to set the mood inside a few rooms at once is something that is used for parties/setting cosy moods etc.I still find myself using the first gen app and onlychecking this second gen app after an update to see if it has those features... and then i close it. As long as it doesn't have those 1st gen features: i am using the 1st gen app.

Would be nice to see in app feedback. Instead I'm leaving it on a review...What's nice about previous app is when you have multiple lights you could find a color you like and link that rest so you can have the same color linked. This new app you cannot, your guessing between your lights if they are the same as there's no way to group it.Also..It's a real pain setting up a scene for every room of the house when all I want to do is to have the exact same scene on a widget. This new app makes you set up a scene for each room in order to set up a wider to turn them all on at the same time never mind the same color. Would be nice to be able to see a scene already created from another room to cut the guessing if you managed to find the exact same color. Please change it around to make this more user friendly like how the previous app was.I'm sure I'll have more to say about features as I finally just started to use the new app. Would have also been nice to have a way to import previous settings into the new app rather than having to reset up the whole thing to how it use to be set up.

The Philips Hue hardware is mostly ok, albeit highly limited (it doesn't support native integration with anything but their own light bulbs). Even much-needed controls like motion sensors were teased a while back, then not released. Hopefully development picks up and they eventually include Zigbee HA support (so other devices can be controlled using the Hue bridge).This app, on the other hand, is just abysmal. Don't even bother. Look elsewhere.Apparently scenes can no longer span multiple rooms, making a combo living/dining room or kitchen/breakfast room scene impossible. Why?! It was working fine before this updated app!Scheduled transitions, such as dimming lights at night, don't appear to work correctly, leaving the lights alone until the very end of the selected fade period then just turning them off quickly.The old palette system of setting multiple light colours was silly, but at least it to didn't bury the lights behind multiple navigational points (it's several taps just to access brightness, more if you want to adjust individual colours!).There are far better apps (one in particular) that give much more control over the system, including full customization of the wireless dimming switches. Absolutely brilliant! It's what Philips should have released years ago. Certainly not this.

After using the original app for years, I was excited for the next generation of the app. I did not have to go far to see that this "update" was not fully thought out and published prematurely: it is not a universal app (i.e. small interface for iPad or poor resolution if you select the "x2" button to fill the screen), you cannot transfer scenes from the old app (you are led to believe you can, but it is not a TRUE transfer, it's more of a "partial kind of but not really transfer" that does not bring over the picture associated with a scene; and if you invested a lot of time on the original app that's very frustrating), no landscape mode for iPad (again, not a universal app). Since Philips stopped support and updates of the original app, I certainly hope this new app has a big next update that incorporates some of the above listed (and what I believe to be) core functionality that should have been included in the original issuance of the new app in my opinion.
Doesn't make sense to release a brand new app that does less and makes it harder to use the hardware. Sticking to the old app. Love using photos to color the lights.

Great product but the app is garbage. Where is the automation based on sunset/sunrise? Why won't my lights fade the way the app says? Wish they'd fix this so I didn't have to use 3 apps to make what I want happen. Seriously disappointed.

The new version is a fraction of the capabilities of the 1st version with no communication or clarifty what customers are supposed to do. Keep both apps? Lose the functinality of the 1st app? Where are Philips' prioritiies for development? Siri success rate is poor - 1st request to turn on lights, she says "you're ready" - no lights are on. 2nd request - lights go on successfully, Siri says "Hmm some may not have responded". This is where quality improvements are needed. Otherwise homekit is useless advatange over other systems. What are you doing Philips? Where are you going with your app strategy? Some of us have invested a lot in great lights but our patience for what you are doing is not unlimited.

It's prettier - but that's about it.Less functionality, fewer features and a more confusing interface make this "upgrade" more of a downgrade.The Hue hardware is awesome (if still somewhat limited in selection) but the software leaves a LOT to be desired.Phillips needs to bring in someone who actually USES the lights, not just app programmers and/or engineers. The Gen1 software was going in the right direction and just needed some improvement and development. This new app is a virtually unusable, unfriendly train wreck in a pretty package.
This app very rarely connects to my hue hub.  Tried changing zigbee channels but was never able to complete a channel change.  Lights are fairly useless without this app reliably connecting.

The new app lost the ability to see and control all of the hue lights in one list. You can only see the lights in a particular room by selecting that room. They just need to add the ability to see a list of all lights in the home by selecting home.

Main reason I got hue bulbs was to get a vacation timer, but this new app doesn't have it. No manual timer, just something called Routines.  They let you set a start time, but no end time??  So I had to make TWO routines: one for turning lights on at 6pm, and another to turn if off. I must be missing something, or Philips made a huge oversight.Problem #2 -- Can't manually tune the color of my room, which has 3 bulbs.  The app only allows you to choose a "scene", and tune that, but a scene is pretty limited.Problem #3 -- You pick a picture as a starting point for a scene, and you can pinch to zoom into the picture. The zoom level is destructive in the sense that once you zoom in and save, you can no longer zoom out of that picture later on. So you just end up seeing humongous pixels at the end.  This must be a bug.

I've had the app and lights for 3 yrs or so, running 3 floodlights.  App works ok (colors are ok, not impressed) but God forbid when there is an upgrade or other connectivity issue.  I've found the restart process extremely frustrating.  I'm running multiple wi-fi devices in my home and BY FAR this Hue thing tests my patience time and time again.  In fact, I've had better luck with a competitor product.

Why do app makers take functionality away?  This version is actually much harder to use and has removed two very important features. 1.) Why can't I select which lights to turn off when I'm away?  You can only select ROOMS to turn off when you leave.  I want to leave one light on for my dog at night when I'm gone.  Just dumb.  What if I want to leave certain lights on to make it look like I'm home?  You can select a theme that includes only specific lights when you come home. Why not in reverse??2.) Why can't I group lights and move them all simultaneously along the spectrum? Now you have to do it one light at a time, which takes forever and prevents you from achieving exactly the same light in all your bulbs. With the new emphasis on "rooms," one should be able to move entire rooms around the spectrum at least.I'm thinking going back to 1.0, but I deleted it and would have to reinstall and setup all my recipes again.  Very frustrating.

The new design is truly fancy. I like the idea of the rooms, it was something that I was missing in the previous app.In the scenes I would like to be able to modify the scene once saved and not go to lights change and save another scene.Something I liked from the previous app was to pick the colour from the image and not the automatic shuffle of colours. Also, when u make a new scene from an image you should be able to decide which of the light in the room to enlighten; I might understand that this can complicate things but at the same time it will make it more complete.
Ficou muito pior que o antigo App! Muitas falhas, perda de conexo o tempo inteiro e comandos MUITO lentos!

Over het algemeen zeer tevreden met het Hue systeem, echter de nieuwe app is een forse achteruitgang ten opzichte van de eerste. Misschien mis ik iets, maar de volgende functies die ik vaak gebruik in de vorige app mis ik in deze: Je kunt bij het aanmaken van een scene niet de standaard helderheid van die scene zelf bepalen. Die is afhankelijk van de helderheid van de kleur. Dus wil je de scene donkerder hebben dan moet je een donkerdere kleur kiezen. In de vorige app kon je gewoon kiezen voor de helderheid! Tevens kan je niet zelf bepalen welke lampen precies welke kleur hebben. In de vorige app kon je de kleur van elke lamp afzonderlijk kiezen (of ze groeperen, ook erg fijn als je precies dezelfde kleur wilt gebruiken) maar nu kiest de app zelf welke lamp welke kleur krijgt. Door middel van "shuffle" kun je proberen de juiste kleuren te krijgen maar het blijft een gok. Ik begrijp dit ook niet, dit is toch juist de potentile kracht van een dergelijk systeem? Om toch met een positieve noot te eindigen: de interface en layout vind ik wel verbeterd. Ook de manier waarop het gebruik van kamers is toegevoegd en de mogelijkheid om widgets aan te maken zijn sterke pluspunten. Daarom ook 2 sterren in plaats van 1...

Aggiungo una stella alla singola di prima. Piccoli miglioramenti ma ancora oggi ti fa fare meno cose di prima e in modo pi macchinoso! Ad esempio: - scene multi stanza non     permesse! - impossibile posizionare    manualmente le luci su una foto    per creare una scena ma pare    (almeno a me) che consenta solo    l'automatico (quindi perch_ un    bottone di scelta?)!- impossibile dettare il livello di    intensit luminosa in una scena e    salvarla cos!L'app rimane estremamente macchinosa, troppi passaggi e, quelle cose che ancora sono fattibili, non le si riesce a trovare per la pessima complicazione del progetto. In ultimo NON salva la posizione gi attiva! Ho provato a impostare 10 volte "in casa" e "fuori casa" per far attivare e spegnere le luci nelle stanza al mio arrivo o alla mia uscita e... Nulla! Appena chiuso l'app si disabilit da solo lo switch per la localizzazione.Ancora molto molto molto lontani dalla semplice sufficienza!

Buona la grafica  l'interfaccia,  ho perso un po' di tempo per configurare le stanze ma capito il funzionamento di fondo risulta abbastanza semplice. Peccato che in questa seconda versione manchi il supporto per selezionare un'immagine dagli album invece che da rullino fotografico. Altra cosa mancante la possibilit di selezionare manualmente un colore dalla dalla fotografia ed assegnarlo alla luce voluta. Altra enorme mancanza  il completo supporto al cloud: se prima potevo sincronizzare le mie scene, ora definite come widget, tra i vari dispositivi ora le trovo solo on line o nella vecchia app, peccato perch_ i preset sempre sincronizzati erano utili, ora ad esclusione della possibilit di accendere le luci via web l'utilit dell'account  praticamente nulla! Spero vivamente in un aggiornamento di tali  funzioni.

Read a handful of any reviews and you'll understand the extent of problems this app faces. No need for me to rehash them all. I will like to address one issue that's important to me: poor Routine execution. The app gives the ability for users to setup automatic Routines that trigger at specified times. The problem: there is aways a number of Philip Hue lights that are not triggered by the Routine. These lights are programmed to be triggered, plus they are not out of range from the Hue Bridge and they are powered on during the triggered Routine, but due to bugs random lights are not following the Routine and the color stays unchanged or changes to a default white, which is not part of the Routine. This bug voids the ingenuity of having automotive Routines. I have to manually select the scene to get the remaining lights to change color. Pathetic excuse for a native app from Philips. Same could be said for the first gen app they gave up on. Why did I invest in these lavishly priced lights when clearly Philips has invested so little? Their buggy app should give potential consumers plenty of reasons to consider taking their money elsewhere. Although I love what connected lighting can do, I absolutely do not recommend purchasing Philips Hue products. I own 7 Blooms, 4 color RB30 spotlights, 7 color A19s, 2 Hue Tabs, and a Siri equipped Bridge, which I have amassed slowly over a couple years. Huge investment. Years later I am still unsatisfied with what seems like a permanent  bata experience. Please Philips, give us a world-class product.
No. No. No, no, no.  If/when the original app stops working the Hue bulbs will go in the trash, and I will buy the competitor's bulbs.  This new app is worse than useless!

With the latest updates, I lost control of sevearl lights in the home, and cannot "search" for it back, even with the serial number method. This was all working just fine some releases ago, but recent updates really Foxtrotted it up.

Two updates later, the app still does not address any of the problems that have been brought up in the reviews. Strangely enough there still isn't an iPad or universal option. And we're left with no import function so if you want to use only this app, get ready to manually recreate all your previous setting/scenes. There are a few improvements, like the addition of rooms, but the benefits are outweighed by the lost functionality. Case in point, everything only functions by room instead of allowing the option to use certain bulbs from different rooms (like turning off the lights in one room and simultaneously turning the lights on in another or turning on the lights in more than one location.)  The emphasis on photo-based scenes still does not have the ability to choose specific bulb color and grouping is still not possible (so we are left with random colors.) Plus, in case you want to have multiple bulbs in one room with the same color, good luck getting all of them to match correctly.  We've had the new app for some time, and Philips has failed to explain the purpose of using it instead of improving the original one (all we get is a Twitter handle saying they'll pass along info to their development team.) I like the new app, but it did take me about 15 minutes to figure out how to assign specific colors to individual lights. I noticed a few reviews saying it couldn't be done.  It can, it's just not intuitive. Just go to Home, select your room, select the Scenes icon, select the scene you want to edit, then click the Light icon at the bottom of the screen, then click in the middle of the individual light icon to edit the color of the individual light in the scene.  Not easy, and I keep forgetting how to do it, but it does work quite well and the Hue lights are pretty awesome.

Effectively it makes that entire mechanism pretty much pointless for any real use.Even more significantly, the loss of iPad support is practically a deal-killer. This kind of utility app needs to be accessible from all of your devices. At least they got around to adding Apple Watch support back in.

This is one of the least user-friendly apps out there. How come Phillips managed to make so difficult something so simple (other apps do it better on their own system). I have 14 Hue devices (mix of bulbs and light strips) and several Philips wireless wall switches, and I much prefer this new application. You can finally manage different rooms, creating new schemes is much improved, and finally for the hue color bulbs, you can finally also pick white temperature (although I wish it was providing numeric values, like 3000K or 4505 K and so on). Configuring wall switches through the app is also very nice.  I use the app every day, and so far it works pretty much without any issues. Of course this app can be improved, like having iPad version, or being able to *easily* set up timers for turing the light off (like delayed turn off in 5 minutes) without playing with schedules. It takes time to learn how to use this app, which can be frustrating for beginners but once you know how everything works, it's actually OK. However, I miss the ability to set up colors for multiple bulbs the way it was done with the old app. Honesly, I'm happy with this app but of course I hope there will be future updates with even more features. I would rate 5 stars if there was iPad version. I don't have iWatch so I can't comment that part.

Apart from new web like face, the app lacks the capabilities of the previous app, which by all means is the best. The most annoying drawbacks are:1) NO geofencing capability.2) NO connection without the home wifi. That means you cannot control your lights when absent from home via internet, while with the previous app you most certainly can.3) Serious bugs that need to be fixed. Scenes are sticked to "no can do" state and I had to reinstall the app all over again and to re-synchronize with my Hue bridge. 4) NO scenes available outside Siri. And unfortunately Siri says it DOES NOT UNDERSTAND ME when I pronounce the name of the scene, e.g. "Set all my lights to Savannah sunset".The latest update did NOT any positive effect whatsoever to the above mentioned problems.Philips should give a little more attention when writing an app like this, which is supposed to IMPROVE things and not make them worse...

1. No more manual control of light color and brightness when creating scenes. Just a pre-determined setting with a shuffle button. I've pressed it HUNDREDS of times trying to get my room the way I want.2. Can't control multiple rooms with one Siri command anymore. For instance, a "bedtime" scene in which all lights in other rooms turn off and bedroom lamp turns on. Only work around is to make a widget. To integrate all HomeKit devices so that one Siri command changes lights in multiple rooms (like above), turns down AC (with Ecobee), and locks the doors (with Schlage) cannot be done. Only lights in one room can be changed.3. No iPad support.4.  Added rooms but took away groupings of lights (as in for fixtures with multiple bulbs).5. Takes multiple taps to accomplish what used to take one.6. Stock scenes are far more limited and good luck getting them back if you delete any then change your mind later.Edit: adding another complaint. I just added a white ambiance bulb and moved a color one. The colors picked randomly for my scenes are crap and there's no way to edit. You have to make new then delete old. But then Siri says there's already a scene by that name. Only option is to completely reset. Entirely frustrating to know this will happen every time I add a bulb.
I feel like this is a failure, since I have reverted to using the old (much better!) app.

Wirklich gut ist, neben der Sortierung in R_ume, dass man mit dem Dimmer Switch nun durch Drcken der Einschalttaste mehrere Szenen durchwechseln kann. Zwar ist die neue Hue gen 2 App vom Design her schick, leider fehlt die Funktionalit_t: Die H_lfte der Szenen, die ab Werk da sind funktionieren gar nicht erst.Der fehlende Timer, das Fehlen von zuf_lligen ein/ausschalten der Lampen (+/- 30 min der eingestellten Zeit), die miserable Umsetzung der Szenen (keine eigenen Fotos mehr, Lampen und deren Farbe aus 16 mio verschiedenen Farben  einzeln einstellen in der Szene nicht m_glich ), die fehlende bertragung der mhsam erstellten gen-1 Szenen uvm. machen die Nutzung leider zu einer deprimierenden Erfahrung. Die Symbole, die man bei den Widgets fr Szenen festlegt sind auch nicht in der Mitteilungszentrale zu sehen (Wozu dann definieren frag ich mich?)Ich kann mir einfach nicht vorstellen, dass Phillips darin so wahnsinnig viel Zeit und Arbeit investiert hat. What idiot at Philips thought this was an acceptable replacement for the previous app?You are no longer able to store a brightness setting in a scene, so all scenes are full bright and have to be adjusted after switching, even though their built-in scenes do store brightness...Scenes are created only from pictures now, you can't just set colors for the lights manually, making it much more limited. I don't write reviews. This new app has so fundamentally broken how I use my Hue lights that I'm working a review in hopes that Phillips are reading these. Overall, the new app has better visual design, good feature improvements, and some smart ideas. However, I can no longer achieve my very simple scenario of setting certain lighting conditions while watching a movie. This has to do with a combination of the Rooms concept, how you create/apply a Scene, and limitations with Routines.My kitchen, dinning room, and living room are all separate Rooms, but in the physical world light from one influences lighting in another. In the old app, I had a scene that turned off light in all rooms except for a gentle blue light strip near my TV. In the new app, I need to set scenes on a room by room basis, meaning I now need to do 9 taps to achieve what I could previously do in 1. The new app does have Routines, which modify scenes across multiple rooms at once. This sounds perfect for what I want to do, but it has a critical failingyou can only make time-based routines. I don't watch a movie the same time or day of the week, I need to trigger the routine manually without it randomly running at some time I'm forced to set.Having manually-triggered routines that have no element of time would make this a 4 star app for me. Building an import wizard for stuff from the old app would make it 5 star, but I'm willing to start fresh with the new app as long as I can keep using my lights how I have been for years.

Look - the original app was pretty bad. This one is infinitely worse. It simply doesn't have the functionality you need, unless you have a limited number of lights and zero desire for nuanced, creative, or useful scenes. This is not an app for smart lighting / smart homes - it's for barely useful gimmicks. They need to go back to the drawing board - this app is an unsalvageable failure.

Any advancements this app may have offered are tainted by its lack of basic user features. Scenes are horrible, you can't group lights to change colors on the fly, My Hue login is tricky at best. Basically all the features that made this product great are turned to crap with their app. I didn't believe it at first. Being an engineer I thought that the reviewers just didn't have the patience to learn the app, but after months of learning and calling support, I can honestly say this version of the app is garbage. The version 1 UI may have been a little long in the tooth, but this is more confusing. And where is the Apple Watch app? Yes, I actually used that! Frequently. Siri is great and all but tonight I raised my watch to change our lights to realize the app is gone. Lame.

I love my Hue lights but their new app has errors in it.Starting off it would not allow me to control my individual bulbs, only turn on or off a "room". Sometimes the bulbs in a room will list but not always it seems. A couple times they flashed and disappeared when I flipped to that screen. The ability to take a picture to create a scene will only allow shuffle and moving/zooming around on a picture to adjust colors shown to formulate from and not individual picking of which lights are which colors. There used to be little pins you could move around on the picture that were numbered based on which bulb they were. Now it seems to formulate its own mix based on the picture and what parts of the picture you center on. Shuffle does not change much at all most times. Maybe change with bulb has its already formulated color choices? Guessing but that's what it seemed like. Unsure if I like this change. Would be cool if it allowed the ability to do both ways depending on mood choice. It also does not allow you to import scenes you've already created in their old app which I find disappointing. Luckily I did not create too many yet. Granted this can be remedied by selecting the scene in the old app and then just going to the bulbs section in the new one and simply save the current settings in a new scene (hit + and name it). It will take time but it's doable. You just won't have the picture with it if it was created with one originally. Another bug is that not all created scenes are syncing with HomeKit even after trying to do the "resync home" option it offers. I have not tried any geofencing that many are saying is buggy or any of the timers to see if they work. On the plus side the layout of the new app is cool once you figure it all out. It is appealing to use. Took me a few minutes to figure where to press and go to do what. I think the scene creation process of by pictures and by chosen colors (currently done by individually tinkering with each bulb and then saving settings) should be in the same place instead of different places but that's my opinion. It does have a new widget setting that's a bit different and updated that I also like. It allows the choice of up to 4 rooms and scenes/color settings for those rooms upon activation of said widget. I hope to play with that more once I get more bulbs.

I rarely put in the effort to write a review but this new hue app is just garbage. It's like they took the best aspects of the gen. 1 app and tossed them out in favour of all the bad elements and to top it off threw in some more nonsensical add-ons to make it more confusing.I just re-downloaded the gen. 1 app as it is more preferable to use that app than this one.

I had the previous app, so the layout of the new app was a little confusing at first, but the new app has all the functionality of the previous app and more. Seriously. I prefer to set my scenes up with solid colours, not photos, so the most confusing thing about the new app was how to do that. Just tap on the room name (I have Hue bulbs in my living room and bedroom), then tap on "lights", not scenes (photos). Tap on each light and set their temp and brightness, THEN tap + and name the scene you just created. If you want to bring over your pre-made scenes from the original Hue app, just activate the scene with the ORIGINAL app (which still works at the time of this review), then switch to the NEW app and save the scene by hitting the + from the same location as my previous comment. As far as not being able to tap the scene 2 times in the widget to shut the lights off, just create a scene called "off" for each room. Easy.I like the ability to change the scene icons, and if you want, you can use emoji to name each scene too.

L'app  il successore della "prima generazione" che si trova ancora nello store.PRO:Ha un'interfaccia utente oggettivamente molto pi pulita e di facile configurazione per il bridge e le luci da installare.Ti aiuta a dormire e a svegliarti meglio, cosa molto importante per una persona. Il supporto a HomeKit  eccezionale, ti porta veramente a comunicare con la luce! CONTRO:Bisogna includere la luce in una stanza per poterla gestire completamente, invece con Siri non si hanno restrizioni. Sarebbe meglio, oltre di gestire tutta la stanza, farlo anche per le singole luci di tutta l'abitazione senza doverle associare per forza in una stanza.Non  disponibile una lista di esempi circa l'utilizzo di Siri per gestire le luci, ma solo due righe generiche.La gestione degli scenari non  intuitiva e n_ del tutto personalizzabile. Perlopi non  possibile assegnare uno stesso scenario a pi di una stanza (?).Ha pochi effetti. Per esempio, manca l'effetto loop di tutti le luci o un effetto "respiro". Manca il supporto all' _ Watch. Sebbene si possa comandare vocalmente con l'ausilio di Siri, sarebbe pi utile in alcuni contesti farlo dal proprio polso premendo un pulsante e regolare con la corona digitale.Manca il supporto a iPad. Veramente?!CONCLUSIONI:Tutto sommato, l'app funziona e fa quello che deve fare. Purtroppo  stata cos snellita dalla precedente generazione che  diventata povera.

Perte notamment d'une fonction qui m'_tait essentielle le minuteur avant extinction pour g_rer le couch_.Il y a bien une fonction "se coucher" mais elle oblige une transition de 15min minimum et de programmer son coucher  une heure pr_cise... Franchement qui fait a?

I really don't have time to write a review right now, but this app is so terrible I feel obligated to do so. Philips needs to fire the entire development team and start fresh. No one should be receiving a paycheck for such laughable work.

It's nice to sea new layout and options. But, this new app can be explained in one phrase. If it ain't broke, don't fix it. I can't connect to my lights when I'm away. And, the geomapping hasn't been working at all. I'm downloading the old app, and setting it up when I get home.
what with the tablet format? no landscape mode!

Siri control doesn't work, interface is horrible, scenes don't setup properly... The old app was much better. Using huemote to control everything now and can't impress my friends with the voice control.

Let's start with the obvious already mentioned countless time in other reviews: the "upgrade" from the previous version and the introduction of rooms could have been managed much better! Allo, Philips: Change management? Please do better next time.But this major issue aside, this second generation app and API that came along is a great improvement! The fully theme-based approach of the first gen app was fun for some but rendered the app totally awkward for most and required purchase of many other apps to do all the basics expected from Hue. You needed "switch" apps, wake-up apps, etc.So, giving high star rating to recognize that the API is maturing in the right direction and that the Hue apps can now be The app one can use to do all the basic things one expects from Hue without paying many other apps.Removed one star for the poor change management from gen 1. Only one star deducted because although I was swearing at first like many others, in fact it gave me the opportunity to rethink my whole setup at once (as it had grown organically).Anyway, overall a painful transition, but a better result at the end.
This new app is horrible!  Please just update the previous version, it worked much better.
What a pile of rubbish. If you're going to update try and make it user friendly. Whilst I agree gen 1 needs improvement, this is not the answer

I held off from upgrading to gen2 because of the poor reviews, but it turns out that gen2 is actually a lot better for me.You can sort each bulb into separate rooms, which means you can finally set scenes for each room without any fuss. Notification Centre widgets are very easy to configure.Definitely give this app a try and see if it's right for you firsthand.

Some of the new additions are good and the app looks awesome,  but it's RIDICULOUSLY buggy.  On a few occasions ALL my custom themes change to a single color meaning you have to remake them all, which I gave up on even making themes until they fix that nonsense it makes themes un usable.  Twice ALL my rooms except 1 disappear off the list and I have to remake them and add each light back.  Many other problems too.  Hopefully they are actually working on this stuff because this app would be great if it worked properly.  The layout and stuff is much easier to use than the old one.  So buggy and broken though. App is terrible right now

The old app was way better, all the timed presets or geo location settings work 40% of the time. This morning I woke up to all the lights set to red, which is not there pre set... Please fix it, the old app was way better

This new app isn't horrible but it does need some improvements.The most annoying problem I currently am experiencing is that the off widget is not working. I have to open the app and turn the lights off that way.Please address this.

I got the notification of the new software. I downloaded it and started playing. I like that you can create zones, but where the hell is the rest of the app? I have like 40 scenes that I meticulously put together that I have no way of using with this new app. **AND PLEASE, DO NOT TELL ME TO LOG INTO MYHUE** I already tried that to no avail. How do you migrate your scenes. ATTN:  PLEASE DO NOT TELL ME TO LOG INTO MYHUE AND THAT WILL DO THE TRICK.Phillips Hue:  If this is the app you want to people to go to, to use your product, prepare for a lot of store returns. This app is GARBAGE! And a slap in the face to veteran users.Anyone who reads this:  If you are considering making a purchase, if you are considering investing in a Hue lighting system for the first time, please do not let this app deter you. There are PLENTY of other apps that will allow you to do the exact same things and. You just have to find one that works well for you.PS:  THE HUE GEN 1 APP STILL WORKS PERFECTLY WITH HUE GEN 2 HARDWARE

I never write reviews but this app is so bad I feel compelled to write something about it. I have had for Hue lights for about four years and with each Update of this app it's usability has become increasingly more absurd. If I could give it no stars I would, are you guys on crack?

I've been trying this Version 2 of the Philips Hue app for several weeks now and it is simply awful. I've decided to sell by Hue bulbs on eBay and switch to something else because this app shows that Philips is totally lost in understanding their own product. This app is Philips' second attempt to integrate Hue into HomeKit. It fails. It loses all previously defined scenes from the first version of the app, because it can't import scenes -- either from Hue gen 1 or from HomeKit. Existing scenes are not modifiable, and you can't edit a scene once created.A problem that is definitely the app's fault is the Today screen widget. In the old app you could set existing scenes to be available in the widget. In the new version you have to individually create scenes just for the widget, even if they already exist. It's pointless extra work.These are just a few of the many frustrations. I am giving up on Hue.

As others have said, this app deletes all your old scenes without allowing you to import or even giving you a warning. They should be imported automatically. Philips continues their incompetence in software development with this app. None of the issues with light connectivity are fixed in this new app, either.

Philips is really a unique company in making quite decent quality appliances and destroying them by firmware, written by people they've found in the next pub. This app is not an exclusion - it continues the line of Philips ""Smart"" TVs and you risk smashing your phone over the ground. I guess, that want be a covered by a warranty )
L'ancienne application et bien meilleurs.

Wow, this app is horrible. It connects to my bridge about 10% of the time. The other 90% it just says "connecting" and never actually does. Luckily I still have the old app that connects and works EVERY time. These lights are too expensive to have such a horrible quality app. I keep trying it again and again just to see if it gets fixed and nothing.

For the price you pay for the bulbs you would think Phillips would have a nice app to go along with. But no. The UI is finally nice and clean. But they deleted several needed features. Need to be able to change the color of all lights in a room at once.Oh and the app has reset on me about 6 times. Causing me to lose all the scenes and rooms I set up previously. Extremely annoying and time wasting. I guess Phillips really is just a light bulb company. Not an app dev company. Whoever they hired to build this app should be quickly replaced.

I am not really sure who was on the committee that redesigned your app.  The old app worked really well it was very intuitive, easy to follow.  My young daughter and non-tech wife used it. Now half my lights can't be reached because they turn them on and off manually because they can't figure out the new app.  I am forced to give one star, I would give it a zero. IF IT AINT'T BROKE DON'T FIX IT!Where is the iPad app?  No one uses iPads in portrait mode.  At least give us a landscape mode for iPad.
Doe er wat aan en maak hem gelijk als gen 1 en niet minder omdat het uiterlijk van de app er mooi moet uitzien.

Previous app was average at best, after version update it got worse. Com'on guys! Get your act together! I have a $600 kit in my house but due to the software lackluster, it really isn't worth anywhere close to that to me
Takes minutes to save changes and often fails. Lights randomly come on, waking me up at night. Prompts me to update firmware every five minutes then doesn't do anything.

I have been a long time lover of these lights but this app made recreate all my scenes and timers.... and widgets. I was a huge fan of the widget shortcut, i loved i just had to pull down on my screen to turn off my lights but ever since the new app the widgets are either extremely slow or just don't work. The first app was the real OG, i miss it.

This app is a major step backwards in functionality. You can't set a scene covering multiple rooms. Triggering geofences is unreliable for both leaving and arriving. You can't pick specific colors for your lights when you create a scene. No iPad or Apple Watch support. I don't know what Phillips was thinking. The old app still functions (for now), but it nags you multiple times while using the app (not just when you launch the app). This app is a joke, and the joke is on us, the users.
Totally not intuitive, lost features of gen 1 app. A scene can only control lights in one room. Save yourself the aggravation and search for "hue gen 1" and get an app that is useful.

So, after making our lives easier, Philips decided to make it difficult for us! Difficult to use and manoeuvre, and close to impossible to configure scenes exactly how you want them - not interested is using pictures!!Please sort this out!!!!

Having lived with this app for a few weeks, I have to say I am very disappointed.It is buggy. Linking third party services using the app simply does not work. Trying to figure out which third party apps are connected to your bridge seems to be impossible. Lights turning on and off at random? Good luck figuring out which third party app is causing it. Want to change the settings for a third party app? Doesn't seem possible.

It's so bad, it's almost funny. Whoever was the lead design for this version of the app really screwed up and does not know the audience.So, I can't use my original scenes I've created/import. The iPad resolution is stuck with the iPhone resolution, makes the app look cheap. Creating a scene is no longer intuitive. Love the lights, the app is terrible. Why is the first gen app so much better than the second? If it's the Siri, just add it to the first gen app, no one likes this new version. You're going to lose customer base.
En dat is knap. Veel features missen of werken niet meer naar behoren. Belachelijk voor zo'n duur product.

Ik heb wat opmerkingen omtrent de nieuwe hue app Ten eerste is de nieuwe hue app veel makkelijker om lampen in ruimtes aan/uit te zetten.Aangezien ik onregelmatige diensten loop vind ik het toch prettig dat er licht brand indien we niet aanwezig bent, alle hue lampen zijn ook geprogrammeerd, met als groot voordeel dat ik iedere lamp mijn eigen specifieke kleur kan geven (door speltje ergens op een kleur te zetten)Ook vind ik het mooi dat ik niet alle lampen van bijv. woonkamer niet allemaal tegelijk in/uit hoeft te schakelen. en sommige lampen op "willekeurig" kan laten schakelen. ook de fade functie per minuut kunnen kiezen vind ik een mooie optie.dit zijn toch dingen die ik mis in de nieuwe hue app. nu weet ik wel dat de oude app nog gewoon te gebruiken is, maar deze wordt niet meer ge-update, wat voor mij inhoud dat deze app in de toekomst niet meer goed te gebruiken is of zelfs zal verdwijnen.Ondanks dat ik de verbeteringen zie in de nieuwe app mis ik de "programmeur vrijheid" van mijn lampen zoals in de oude app.alsof ik mijn mooie farrari heb laten ombouwen tot 45KM autootje.
Ik gebruik de iPad. App is daar totaal niet voor ingericht. Waarom?

The old app was not great, but, the new one is even worse. Apps are supposed to make life easier this is the most confusing and horrible thing I have ever come across. I think it is best to avoid all Hue lights period.

Just don't upgrade when it prompts you to.

Just as I was getting ready to buy the new hub and add several more lights to the Hue-o-sphere, Philips drops this new app.  And drop it, they did, just like they dropped the ball. The app has fewer capabilities, it doesn't inherit existing settings, and they didn't even bother making an iPad version. This is a good way to make people who were going to spend a few hundred dollars on your products stop and reconsider. Being so different from the previous version they should have thought about walk throughs or wizards when you launch it the first time. The user is left completely alone. I will wait for to the Apple Home app to replace this thing. -10

remote controle when not home doesn't work anymore. the new "intuitive" interface saves a few clicks, but misses out many of the earlier features. also it deletes all previously composed scenes. also there is no iPad app anymore??

I can't get the widget to work; it tells me "configure in the app," when I already did. I can't actually control individual lights because it bugs out and bumps me back to the room selection view. I can't select individual colors for any light because it's buggy, and I don't know how to set each light to the same temperature like before. Sorry, Phillips. I love the lights but this app is not working and I'm going back to "Gen 1" while this gets fixed.
The developers of this app should be embarrassed about the Siri integration. No one wants to turn light bulbs off and on one at a time. Alexa voice integration was significantly better...

The older version of the app had many more features. Also, I really don't want to have to re-enter all my scenes and timers. I'm sticking with the older app.
It looks nicer. Better interface by far. But why must I create scenes separate for every room? Repetitive waste of time. Otherwise, so far so good. I really wanted to hate it, badly. It's not.

I would give zero stars if I could. Forcing all users to move to a completely new app and redo ALL our customizations and scenes. How did they think this was a good idea. Completely absurd design and user experience. Not only is it a complete nuisance to reset all my scenes, but the new app itself brings absolutely NOTHING NEW. If that's the case , why force everyone to a new app. Completely unacceptable. I'll be looking at other products at this point.
Hoop snel op gen3

I love the addition of controlling rooms but that also add some complexities and deficiencies like when you'd want to do a scene to adjust multiple rooms.  I think there should be another selection in the main page for something such as "house" or global something Iike that which was similar to how the old app functioned in which the light listing and scene creating would list every single light you have connected.  My second and biggest complaint with the new app is the scene creation.  First of all...there is no import function from the old app??? Seriously Philips???????  I could only imagine how people feel that have tons of lights and custom scenes created already.  I only have 7 lights and like 3 pages of scenes and I'm ticked off.  The suggestion I got was to set the scene from the old app and then open the new one and create a scene with those bulb color settings.  It does work but then you end up losing the same type of icon you had in the previous app for a generic icon.  And my other gripe about the scene creation is how to create brand new scenes within the app.  I have no idea how to set specific colors for bulbs, it seems like you can either use one of their presets or when using a picture it seems like you can only randomize the colors??  How do I use a color pin to select a specific color for a specific bulb?  What happened to the color matrix chart where you could select from all of the millions of colors and color temp range without having to use a picture??These need to be improved before I can say I am satisfied with this app.  FIX the scene creation and bulb color selection, add an import function and lastly add an option to setup and control lights/scenes on a global house level much like how the old app functioned...or an easy workaround, what about allowing lights to be added to more than one room so you could add a "house" room that had all of the lights inside!!
I just updated to the new app. It said I had a new software upgrade for the hub. I installed it, it said it failed, now I don't have access to the hub.
Easy to set up and easy to use!
This 'new' app is a downgrade. I have re-installed the 'old' app for more functionality, iPad compatibility and a more modern look and feel.
I push the button on bridge but is not connecting ...

Die idee mit den zimmern finde ich super, jedoch w_re es n_tig, auch szenen zu generieren, bei denen alle lampen verwendet werden, oder das man die lampen fr mehrere r_ume zuordnen k_nnte dann br_uchte man die szenen nicht mehr. Die szene einrichten mit dem foto war bei der alten app viel besser, man konnte die einzelnen lampen auf dem bild verschieben, hier geht es nur zuf_llig. Ich hoffe phillips wir die app verbessern, momentan bleibe ich bei gen 1.

Als Interface Designer muss ich sagen das dieses User Interface eines der schlechtesten ist die ich kenne. Man kommt einfach nicht zurecht, die vorg_nger Version war wesentlich klarer strukturiert hier herscht totales chaos. szenen zu erstellen, man bedenke das hauptfeature! gestaltet sich ungeimlich schwierig. da hat man geld an der falsches stelle ausgegen. sehr schlechte user experience. da schaffen third party apps ein wesentlich gelungeneres interface. bitte lasst da profis dran und nicht eure werbeagentur oder den print designer...

Phillips, I wanted so bad for this app to be good! But, it's a terrible mess! It is really confusing to use! I can't even figure out what scene my lights are turning on to when I come home. There seems to be no order to its UI! This clearly was a rushed release. Just make the tabs at the bottom be 'Rooms' and 'Scenes', then highlight the current Room or Scene that is on and let the user modify that by taping on it. Leave everything else to the new HomeKit flow in iOS 10 for Routines, Location Aware and Alarms. This should turn out to be a fine tunes, maintenance and set-up app, only, once HomeKit is more integrated and advanced in the fall.

This new app is a complete waste. The app it replaces is far more functional and let's you see what you are doing rather then showing you one little piece. I will not be switching to the new app no matter how many times the old one asks me if I want to.

Very hard to use. Trying to turn a light on at a given intensity is now impossible. This means, for example, that now if you wake up in the middle of the night, you'll have to turn the light at full intensity before being able to regulate it.
The coming and leaving home doesn't work, they released version 2 but it's 3 steps back, aren't they supposed yo improve the app, not all the way around? Keep using the gen 1 app as long as you can.

This is one of the worst apps I've ever seen coded. I would be embarrassed to be a developer on this team of incompetence. Terrible UI.  Lack of flexibility of controlling lights in an intuitive way. For example, if a bulb is part of a "room", it can't be controlled independently by a widget as was possible in the first version of the Hue app. Nearly everything to set up requires more taps than was necessary in the original app - and the original app was a terrible UI too - this is just worse. Thank goodness there is an API so I can use third party apps and controls.

I agree that the old app needed a facelift and this one looks pretty good. But why would they remove so many features? It's just frustrating to use. There is no way to get to scenes quickly. I am a pretty lazy guy, in fact....I hate doin stuff, but come on? I can't understand all these crazy negative reviews. First of all I love the bulbs and system itself, very reliable and well built system. Have 3 color bulbs, 1 ambiance, 5 gen one white, 1 gen two white and a light strip, and the new HomeKit hub. I have had the system for about 2 years now. The app really needed an over haul, and I love it! I guess everyone who uses it and gives it one star is scared of change or too lazy to sit on their butt and poke around the new app for a bit. Are people afraid that playing with the app might cause one of the bulbs to kill their first born? Start WW3? I don't know, but the unified slider to control a whole room is great, you can still create scenes, use a picture to get colors....etc. Really friends, if you are shaking in your boots, download this app and use it in tandem with the old till you get comfortable with the new app. Just make sure you don't set your lights to 29%, whatever you do, don't do it.....trust me, I set mine there and my cat exploded!

Everything was working perfectly until the Philips geniuses decided to switch to Hue App 2. A true step back. Looks like they managed to get only the worse out of any feature. The new App is working very bad. Connection from outside the network where the bridge is connected works 1 out of 10 times. Navigation is really not simple and certainly not intuitive. All the time you open the App you need basically to study it from scratch. Widgets are now unreliable and so hard to set up right as scenes now are inconceivably hard to work on. Geo tagging is never ever working. I am surprised I still manage to turn on the lights. No more Apple Watch support. No more iPad support, if not using the terrible iPhone version. If I did not invest already in this system I would certainly not buy it. You had been warned. And you, Philips geniuses, get back on the design table and do something worth buying as you are not cheap.I still can't believe that from an almost perfect App, version 1, they managed to create this incredible masterpiece of monstrosities.Ohhh, and the Twitter support is another joke. Not possible to direct tweet. Why would I want to share all my problems with all the Twitter's world? As they do not know how to design and create a working App, no wonder they have no clue how to use social media. Maybe you should learn from your Dutch friends from KLM how to run a perfect helpdesk via Twitter.

I originally gave this a 2, but I changed it to 3 when I figured out how to set the routines to start with one color and then fade to a different color. The hard part was figuring out how to save different color settings for the same light. I also figured out how to transfer my saved colors from the old app to the new one. The routines are fairly easy to set up. (I don't use the Wake Up routine. Unlike the generic routine, Wake Up doesn't let you choose the scene/color. Weird.)So, I can finally start using the new app. It could still benefit from an experienced UX designer. Some Help or FAQs would be nice, too.

I was skeptical about installing this version after reading the reviews, but I think it is a great improvement overall. The app has much more finesse in its design and functionality, and the rooms are much less confusing than the scenes. If I could change anything, I would allow the app to handle more lights via Siri, and I would loosen up other limitations that keep one from really being able to use all of this app's great functionality in larger measure. I also hope that HomeKit integration overall gets a lot less buggy and complicated with improvements from Apple.

1. No more manual control of light color and brightness when creating scenes. Just a pre-determined setting with a shuffle button. I've pressed it HUNDREDS of times trying to get my room the way I want.2. Can't control multiple rooms with one Siri command anymore. For instance, a "bedtime" scene in which all lights in other rooms turn off and bedroom lamp turns on. Only work around is to make a widget. To integrate all HomeKit devices so that one Siri command changes lights in multiple rooms (like above), turns down AC (with Ecobee), and locks the doors (with Schlage) cannot be done. Only lights in one room can be changed.3. No iPad or Apple Watch support.4.  Added rooms but took away groupings of lights (as in for fixtures with multiple bulbs).5. Takes multiple taps to accomplish what used to take one.6. Stock scenes are far more limited and good luck getting them back if you delete any then change your mind later.Edit: adding another complaint. I just added a white ambiance bulb and moved a color one. The colors picked randomly for my scenes are crap and there's no way to edit. You have to make new then delete old. But then Siri says there's already a scene by that name. Only option is to completely reset. Entirely frustrating to know this will happen every time I add a bulb.

The "old" app was a modern iPad style app that worked pretty app. However, its apparently no longer supported.In its place is the crude old-fashioned iPhone app (you can 2x the screen to view on an iPad) that barely works at all.I cannot believe the giant step backwards this represents. Is anyone overseeing the software developers? Is marketing asleep?

Should have improved upon the old app rather than creating something that solves very few problems but instead introduces 100s more. Fire the person that approved this idea because they have no understanding of innovation, customer satisfaction or product usability.

I thought the first app was bad, but they've managed to make it worse. Not only do your old scenes not get moved over properly, but creating new scenes or editing existing ones is abysmal. I feel they've purposely tried to make it worse.
Szenen mit Familienmitgliedern teilen geht immer noch nicht. Selbst erstellte Szenen k_nnen nicht mehr ge_ndert werden.

The problem is not that I can't use my phone, I use it for everything! This app is by far the most complicated and least intuitive ever. Philips must be able to afford people doing this right. And people checking on it and preventing something like this to actually go on the market. Wtf is going wrong there?

1. Too complex, too many screens coming one from another.2. Looks outdated, these ugly dark gradient backgrounds and huge but so primitive icons...3. I don't want to have my GPS always active for the sake of turning on/off the lights. Is it a problem for the app to recognize when I'm in my wifi network's coverage?Philips, you make amazing products, but please, allocate bigger budgets for the apps, it's totally worth it.
Where is the iPad version? Where did all my scenes go? Horrible.

No timer and cannot create multi-room scenes. I had no problem with the old app, but I wish you could assign lights to multiple rooms.  I want to be able to set a timer for fading lights on or off.  Right now I have to set a routine at the time and remember to delete it later.

Was just told of the new app today and that the old app was not going to be supported anymore. Why couldn't they just have updated the first app? Anyways: Pros:- the new design is "pretty", but that is where it ends.Cons:- Had to re-pair my bridge at initial setup instead of bringing settings over from my Hue account.- Most of the feature in the older app are gone.- Can't set the color of my lights manually (Really?).- Can't edit and save changes to a default scenes.- extremely restrictive scene setup.- Forced to "choose a photo" to make a scene. I can't set a scene color manually...- Had to reset HomeKit settings to get Hue to talk correctly with Siri.Conclusion: This app NEEDS WORK. Update with more feature ASAP please!

I have 15 Hue lights and used to love them all but this app is slow and unresponsive and limited. The older App continues to work, DONT DELETE IT!!If I started with this App I would have thrown away the bulbs.

Hey Philips nearly there, like the concept of rooms, although not being able to use a light again once it is added to a room kinda spoils things, it would be great to be able to split rooms or join rooms, for example I have two uplighters, a bloom behind my TV and a main bulb in my front room, when watching a film the main bulb becomes redundant so it would be great to just have a room mode with some of the lights, like just the uplighters and the bloom, but I cannot as they are already added to my living room. Also all default scenes are recreated for each room you add, so the bridge gets full up with duplicate scenes, all named the same but all attached to different rooms, on the plus side, really like the shuffle feature, a bit more work and this will be a great app, look forward to your next update.

Nouvelle application alors qu'une existe d_j. J'ai le premier modle de pont Hue et il m'est impossible d'utiliser mes ampoules. More difficult to use than the 1st gen app, and the ability to link lamps up like we had in the first gen hue app has gone. The color picker is better and the ability to define rooms is nice, but overall it's not an improvement over gen 1. Fortunately gen 1 still works; unfortunately philips screwed its users by showing the same message that there is a new app every single time the app is activated.  I got that the first time alright (even downloaded it). What a perfect way to completely annoy and alienate loyal users.
Did the update and now I need to setup the bridge all over again. Great, considering I just want to turn off the lights :(

The new Hue 2.0 app is not very good. Especially when compared to the 1.0 app. I like using scenes... That's my favorite thing about hue. And Hue 2.0 makes that a lot more difficult. Please make this app better. I want fast access to scenes. That's the only thing that I really ask.

What a mess, everything from assigning lights to rooms, to creating scenes is a nightmare.First off, you need to assign bulbs to rooms, and only one room per bulb. This leads to having to hit multiple buttons to adjust more than room. Annoying, but even worst, choosing a scene randomly assigns bulbs a color from that photo, there is no way to adjust lights individually in a scene.Not sure what they were thinking with this app, stick to the gen 1 version or a third party app.

Heb de app al enkele keren geprobeerd maar dit wordt niets ...Ofwel zie ik dingen over het hoofd ofwel missen hier gewoon bepaalde zaken. Vorige app is veel handiger in te stellen. I loooove my hue's but not this app :-(

Die erste Generation war schon schlecht, aber das man es noch komplizierter und unflexibler hinbekommt, zeigt diese App. Die Einteilung in R_ume, ist bei Verwendung vieler Leuchtmittel angenehm. Total versagt wurde hier, bei der Erstellung eigener Szenen mit eigenen Bildern. Das dort nicht manuell nachjustiert werden kann, macht die Anwendung aus meiner Sicht unbrauchbar (shuffle?). Die Szenenauswahl fr das Widget, kompliziert und unn_tig. Ich finde keine M_glichkeit Szenen nachtr_glich zu bearbeiten, ohne diese neu zu erstellen und anschlieend die alte zu l_schen. Fazit: fr die Bedienung meiner hochpreisigen Lampen, bekomme ich aus dem Hause Philips, wieder einmal eine grotesk schlechte Bedienung.

I gave the new app a serious chance. I like the new UI and some of the new UX. But, the app is buggy as heck. It's lost my config multiple times in just the last week. This needs to go back to QA, now.
Why upgrade an app with less capability. I'm so glad I kept the original app.

The new app is seriously user unfriendly. All of the rules I set up previously don't carry forward to the new app. It also feels a lot like a marketing vehicle for other apps/products rather than being something in its own right. I'm assuming there were serious security flaws or the like in the previous one or why totally change things.Every time I got to it I get hit by a wave of "what were they thinking".

At first I thought that some users were exaggerating, why would a company like Phillips would come out with a crappy version of their app, well they did, after I reset everything in the new app, transfer all my scene (there is an easy way to do it), and manually re-entered all my timers(now called routine), I found out that I could not use the same scene name from one room to another, Siri was not responding as expected when calling for a scene in a particular room, and it didn't like the mixing of hue color and white in the same room, so I split them and tried again, but still no luck. So, to summarize, the idea of splitting lights by rooms seemed great, but it's not working the way we (customers ) want. It seems that the app was evaluated by kids; unfortunately at the price my 30 odd bulbs cost me, I am in no mood to play. The interface looks nice, the rooms option would be great, but make it work the way we need. Next time, have a real team to evaluate your product. In the mean time, I return to the old app.

I was hopeful that the announcement of the 2nd generation app would bring some increased functionality. It did provide a better user interface in controlling room lighting; however, it missed the mark on giving the user control of individual lights. This was a 1st generation app feature and enabled the user to turn on one light rather an entire room. An example being setting up a single hallway light to turn on in the morning instead of turning multiple lights on. It seems that the developers didn't beta test this with any consumers who use the app on a daily basis.
Used to love to be able to control my lights with my watch like the other app but it doesn't happen with this. Please add this!

This is a major step backward from the 1st gen. app. It doesn't even have an iPad version. It's like it's 2010 all over again. Navigation is terrible. All of my scenes and timers/alarms apparently lost. The only nice thing I can say about it is that at least they didn't take down the 1st gen. app, which I will be continuing to use.
Not an improvement from the previous app.

Please don't take away the older version Hue software because it connects to my network very easily. This new software, 10 out of 10 times it just would not connect to my network so that I can control lights. The older software is much better connecting to my home network !!!
I'm returning this product after this update. This ruins the whole product. And we're forced to update to this?
Wie kann es angehen, dass die alte Version abgekndigt wird, wenn die neue noch nicht einmal kompatibel zum iPad ist?Das soll ein Fortschritt bzw. eine Erneuerung sein?
Immer noch keine richtige Home Kit Untersttzung. Eingerichtete Szenen sowie R_ume und Zuordnungen werden nicht geladen. In der App muss alles wieder neu konfiguriert werden. So v_llig unbrauchbar.

...weil kein Support fr iPad oder Apple Watch. Ansonsten ist die App nicht schlecht gemacht. This new hue app needs much help. I have experienced multiple bugs that won't allow me to select which light I would like to change. I think it has potential, but right now, without an ipad app, I will not use the new app.
What a huge oversight not to import from the old app. Not switching yet.
