Zeg niet dat ik er aan moet wennen, aan de nieuwe app! De oude was veel prettiger en overzichtelijker in gebruik. Heb bovendien vaak last dat Hue met wifi niet reageert in het buitenland. Zit vaak in hotels, dit moet gewoon goed werken!

De app is mooier geworden, maar eenvoedige functionaliteit zoals het aanpassen van een scene (individueel instellen van de lampen) onbreekt volledig. Ik zie graag een aanpassing waarbij ik de app weer kan gebruiken. Nu maar op zoek naar een alternatief...
Sinds de laatste update heeft de app veel moeite om verbinding te maken. Het kost mij soms vijf minuten om het licht aan te doen. Dit werkt natuurlijk niet!

Waarschijnlijk 2x op het "i" drukken of swypen, maar dan heb je snel "verwijderen". Bij meer dan 4 lampen in de lijst verdwijnt de "i" achter de + knop. Scrollen gaat niet want je hebt maar 1 pagina.

Not perfect, but still a tremendous improvement over the gen 1 app. All the functions are there, but not straight forward to find in a couple of cases. I've not tried Siri yet as I found that to be more bother than it was worth anyway. Thanks Philips - you're definitely getting there with this product.
Clunky UI, scenes with Siri aren't recognised. Confusing menus.

I used to be a software tester for 10 years (yes lead of a bunch of UAT) testers. People do the strangest things yes plans/cases you wouldn't think possible. I'm sure everything will be fixed with the feedback but if you don't take risk and break everything things don't make you a pioneer (I think FB said something similar). Good luck. Your hardware is great AND you still left me able to use the original app instead of forcing an update. If you've never worked in software development. Don't comment. Claro que sirve es hasta mejor que la anterior para m todava estoy configurando el geofencing y los hbitos pero se ve y es muy buena
Delete this app from the Apple Store and just leave the old one, is 100 times better.

Was ich noch vermisse, dass der Sonnenuntergang auf Tastendruck aktiviert werden kann und zwar wenn man im Bett ist. Wer geht schon jeden Tage zur absolut gleichen Zeit ins Bett. Der Rest ist sehr brauchbar. Sonnenuntergang und Aufgang sollte aber noch realistischer werden.

Gef_llt mir die App. Besonders die Trennung der R_ume. Dass man allerdings keinen Timer zum ausschalten manuell aktivieren kann, finde ich sehr schade. Aber bitte behebt die Fehler und krzt die App nicht um vorher vorhandene Funktionen.Ich werde bis dahin die alte App nutzen.
Don't understand all the hate. Great looking UI and easy to use. Refreshing update from older version
Worst most unintuitive app I've ever used. Completely abandoned everything about the original app that made it work.
I refuse to use this.

The new app is yet another step backward in control of the lights.  I have been a Hue owner for many years now with lights and switches all over the house.  Removing the ability to shift the colors by group on demand was removed with the latest app.  All of my previous scene configuration, not forward compatible with the new scene setup.  With 6 switch and 4 different actions per switch, that's a 24 new scenes to configure.  Philips - please incorporate this legacy functionality into the new app before you fully deprecate.  Do not recommend purchasing Hue bulbs until they get the control experience sorted.  NOT worth the headache.

Every since we were forced to update I now want to package every Phillips hue products up and return them instantly. They will not connect to the wifi. States the bridge is not found. My husband is a pilot, I can build a computer from scratch... So no we aren't "special".... Whatever interfacing software they have changed to has made this a nightmare. Not satisfied.
Finally a well designed app from Philips for HUE!
Oude app veel overzichtelijker, handiger in te stellen.

Takes away ability to control all lights at home, only allows control by room individually one at a time! Can't use same name for a setting in more than one room, so have to rename and remember what each setting was renamed to then individually control each room (confirmed by Philips support)! Add to that complaint that geolocation doesn't work that often, Siri is unreliable, and Apple Watch support has been removed (despite being featured in Apple Watch adverts!), this app isn't just worse than the original app (which I'll just continue to use now) it's not even fit for purpose!

We have ~20 hue lux bulbs and were prepping to buy another 20 for the other floor of our home. This is a transition from the TCP connected bulbs which were great - just had a bad app. This app revision didn't import anything from the old, makes creating scenes a miserable experience. So many clicks, so poor integration for 'setting multi room scenes'. It's sad that I now have to have a dim dim1 dim2 dim3 scene.... All around absolutely horrible. I'm second guessing the move to the brand after dealing with this.
Really no good. It has potential but lacking basic things first gen app does? Come on and fix it Apple!

I can't believe that Philips released this app to consumers in this state. My custom Scenes are a mess because the app duplicates scenes, says Scene "xyz" already exists when I had already deleted that Scene, puts incorrect colors on Scenes, and etc. Whatever logic and database Philips used for Scenes is completely broken. The app has crashed several times and doesn't feel native. Come on Philips, if you make an iOS app (for $60 light bulbs), spend the money to make a native app and use the iOS interface guidelines.
still prefer the old interface but does what i need it to do...
nderungen an HomeKit durch andere Apps werden nicht bernommen. Alles muss manuell bernommen oder von der dafr nur bedingt geeigneten Hue-App ge_ndert werden. Daher nicht zu empfehlen.
ich hab jetzt lange versucht, eine zweite szene einzurichten, ich kriegs nicht hin. ich bleibe bei der alten version.

Bei mir und meiner Mutter die auch Hue hat werden dauern "Zimmer" mit eingeschalteten Lichtern dargestellt (egal ob Fern oder Wlan) die gar nicht an sind.Es scheint so als ob sie angeschaltet dargestellt werden wenn die Lichtschalter aus sind und die Bridge nicht mit Ihnen kommunizieren kann. Das ist einfach nervig und so ist eine Grundlegende Funktion nicht korrekt, somit die App Wertlos. Sonst gef_llt mir die neue App gut.Wrde mir in der App die Apple Watch Untersttzung wnschen.Cool w_re auch eine Partnerschaft mit Sonos und somit bei der Wiedergabe die korrekte Disco wiederzugeben. _

Awful update from Phillips and customer service since has been non existent.Since update my dimmer switches which previously worked no longer do so. I have 10 switches, and now in the latest app each switch takes 10 rules with no option to delete default scenes ... Meaning the 100 rule limit per bridge is reached and no work around.Contacted Phillips a month ago and no update.Extremely poor given the cost of these bulbs. When are they going to listen and respond to all this feedback??
This long awaited new app doesn't offer iPad support. Very disappointing.

Ever since this update my geo locations will not work when I'm off wifi. Everything was working fine before this update. Now I can't turn the lights on or off when not on wifi!! Fix this ASAP. Update oh wait there still isn't one!!!! How do I download the "old" perfectly working version!?!?!

Push button my a**, what's the point of an account if you have to push that stupid button...... Fail! Scene sharing is a joke, new device overwrites or duplicates existing scenes. Fire your app development team and start over! it's about time!
Strange that a big name like Phillips can't make a usable app with a basic feature set that is easy to use. Even the light discovery feature only works 25% of the time -- very frustrating app.

I have a room that has two sections. I like the ability to control the room as a whole or as separate rooms but that is not possible. I do like the easy on/off. I do miss the easy choice of the scenes.

The new app fixes all the issues I had with the gen 1 app. Siri voice commands work 100% now with the new hue HomeKit bridge. It rarely worked with the gen 1 app. Also the UI is much better. Works much more like Huemote which used to be my go to app.

App takes away all of the functionality of the old app. Now to make new "scenes" you pick a photo and that is it. No more picking the colors and saving it as a scene. Not a single scene we've created looks good or makes sense for our lighting. As far as HomeKit goes, every command given to Siri ends in "I sent the command to the lights but some of them aren't listening". At that point all but 2 or 3 of the lights in the room will change. I expected far better. Stop taking away functionality in the name of releasing something new. Fix what is broken so your product is usable.

The v2 app is terrible. No cloud management (i.e. you cannot control your lights while you're away), no settings migration from v1, and no light grouping (you can't adjust the colors of lights as a group). On the bright side, since they were too lazy to make this an upgrade from the old app, you can use both apps side-by-side.

App is a big pain. Better sliders to adjust brightness. That's it. Everything else is a big pain to setup or doesn't work. Scene are gone and Siri HomeKit does nothing. You can't even turn groups off in the widget.

In the old app there was an option to add timers with  a count down. I used to use a 10 mins timer to shut down all lights while am in bed. Scenes are now linked to rooms. What if I need a scene to cover several rooms!
I appreciate the simpler interface, but miss the Apple Watch support.

Was just told of the new app today and that the old app was not going to be supported anymore. Why couldn't they just have updated the first app? Anyways: Pros:- The new interface is cleaner and more forgiving for fatter fingers.Cons:- Had to repair my bridge at initial setup instead of brining settings over from my Hue account.- Most of the feature in the older app are gone.- Can't set the color of my lights manually.- Can't edit and save changes to a default scenes- extremely restrictive scene setup.- Forced to "choose a photo" to make a scene.- Had to reset HomeKit settings to get Hue to talk correctly with Siri.Conclusion: This app NEEDS WORK.

I didn't spend the hours (days?) it appeared it would take to install this and start over with Hue.  I couldn't even turn my lights out without going through a new set up process with all new jargon.   This app may be OK if you have Siri and a new Bridge, but it does away with "Scenes," so if you've taken the time to set up your Scenes with alarms (timers), this app loses them all.

A long list of problems, but here are a few. Lights appear briefly then disappear from room list. Having managed to set from another device, they appeared and worked.Siri regularly replies that a scene failed, yet it worked.Not sure you'd want to rely on this app/product other than as a fun item....

I have a fairly simple home broadband wifi setup and yet I cannot get this app and hardware to work as advertised. Whilst it dims and turns on and off the lights whilst I'm at home, I cannot log in consistently to the "my hue" section. It works maybe one day a month. Whether it's due to a hardware, software or backend problem I don't know, and neither does Philips. I'd avoid this product range for now.
Kein Apple Watch, kein iPad. Nur 4 Zimmer pro Routine. Szene k_nnen nicht aus der alteb App importiert werden. Szene einzustellen ist aufwendiger, Funktionalit_ten sind kompliziert strukturiert.

Habe bereits ALLE Alarmprogramme abgeschaltet oder bzw. gel_scht und werde dank einem SCHEISS BUG jeden Tag um 8h geweckt. Normalerweise f_llt es ja auch nicht auf, aber am Sonntag schon. BITTE BEHEBT DIESEN SCHEISS!!!
Very bad upgrade. Intensity setting was removed from preprogrammed setups

Con el uso te acostumbras,falta soporte para el Apple Watch e iPad y no me gusta que en una escena no puedas elegir apagar otras luces de la misma estancia y en los interruptores est_ obligado a configurar las 5 pulsaciones aunque no las uses. Siri es complicada(como toda mujer) y a veces no entiende, entran en conflicto los nombre de las luces y las estancias si son parecidos
App doesn't want to connect to the hub. The first gen app still works perfectly. It just got annoying with all the pop ups trying to force me to upgrade to gen 2. But gen two doesn't work.

I had been using Hue app for almost 3 years, it was easy to use and fun, never experienced any problems. But with this new app, it couldn't find the bridge! I have to login to my account from laptop to turn on and off lights:( Not much options of changing the colors of lighting. Very disappointed.
Where is Apple Watch app..? Seriously..?

I use the 1st app without any training/questions, it was intuitive and worked well. WHAT HAVE U DONE????? Terrible honest, looks better and that's about it.Give us back our simple scene tab that covers all lights. Allow me to set dim levels and build them into scenes - put pictures into the quick access .... I could go on and on. I don't want to even give it 1 star!
Can't create scenes Can't control by light anymore all assigned to a room so if you have main and side light both are on Can't turn off using widget. Get it sorted

Hey Phillips Hue, you use the word "routine" but I don't think it means what you think it means. Seems like your routine programs turns itself off automatically. I'm amazed how a product like this can be in use for years yet ends up worse than ever before.
Application bien meilleure en v2 qu'en V1. Ergonomie satisfaisante. Il manque l'application AppleWatch.
Cette nouvelle mouture est totalement contre intuitive ! Quel dommage

It would be nice to be able to make one light be part of multiple rooms. This would be a huge improvement, and from a programming and design perspective, wouldn't be hard at all for Phillips to do. Also, take advantage of Apple's new products and incorporate some 3D Touch! It would be great to be able to 3D Touch the icon to enable some quick actions like Turing on or off your favorite room.

But, I'm not sure how this is an improvement from the old app. I like the idea I can group all the lights in a room, but I have routines where I only want one light in certain areas to come on, a dim light in the hall, a dim light in the kitchen, enough light so I don't step on a dog toy or cat puke but no so much that I wake everyone up. I have a light strip that was apparently tuned to a yellow color when I switched from the old app; now when I want it bright it's colored canary yellow instead of white.This has some great ideas, but it's really not a better app.I need a simpler way to choose a color, like a color wheel with white on it.I need to group, not only by rooms, but also by individual lights.
The iPad version is missing. The scenes from old app are not transported. The count down timer is not there. Improve it and get more stars.
To complicated and not intuitive at all. Going back to gen 1 app.

Philips completely destroyed the Hue app with this horrific update. Make sure you keep the old app! Your scenes go away and they don't sync anymore. I can't figure out how to get them back. Why fix something that was not broken? What an absolute mess!

So nicht schlecht umgesetzt. Was etwas bl_d ist das importieren von den Szenen aus der alten App. Auerdem vermisse ich auch die Timer Funktion bei den Regeln. Und was mir auch fehlt ist das gruppieren von Lampen bei einer Szene. Daher nutze ich nach wie vor noch die alte App.
Hallo, was soll das ??Wirklich keine iPad ( und pro) Untersttzung.Habe sie gleich wieder gel_scht.Bitte nachbessern!
Wo ist die bisher Apple Watch App hin?! H_tte gerne auch hier ein Update!
Philips tries to think that they know more about what users really want, and this just ends up with a pretentious useless app.

I still use the old app and by any measures this is just horrible when it comes to (lack of) usability. What were you thinking when you created this "upgrade"? The navigation and steps to create scenes is so confusing I don't know where to begin. Phillips Hue is an eloquent solution, a beautiful product for the home environment and should be reflected by an equally professionally made app instead of this. Please, re-design this!
De app maakt heel moeilijk of helemaal geen verbinding met de bridge. De oude app die ik nog steeds heb die heeft hier geen problemen mee. Tot nu toe geen verbetering.

Mooie app maar te simpel. Ik wil graag zelf bepalen welke kleuren ik van een foto wil gebruiken zoals in gen1. En de sterkte bepalen per lamp. Maar voor de rest is hue perfect. Toe aan uitbreiding.

Like the design!!

Why launch a new app with no support for Apple Watch? It doesn't seem to connect when I'm outside my network. Not sure how this is an improvement. Not much different other than the UI which is pretty slick.

I own 44 bulbs and have so for about 3 years. All of apples homekit products start with defining rooms, and that is where this app excels. You can create in 10 minutes what it would take an hour to do on the old app. I did like a lot of the old functionality but from a practical and design perspective, this app rocks. Controlling individual lights is easier once you get used to the new setup, and generating new scenes, buttons, and widgets took me less than an hour starting from scratch. My roommates can finally use the iPad and know what they are controlling. Some functionality from the old app such as full control of all lights at once as opposed to just individual rooms was awesome. This is the first release of the new app, and I am much more excited about an app that people can use that aren't as tech savvy.

I have both the old and new app installed and widgets set up for both. The old app's widgets work immediately. The new app's widgets take *minutes* to turn the lights on or off. I have 4 lights, so it's certainly not some sort of overload. Rather I think the new app is connecting to the hub differently (much less efficiently).It's not acceptable to wait minutes for the lights to turn on.Other than that the new app has the same sorts of UI design issues the old one have (being unintuitive to use), but it is better thought out in terms of features. Feels less like a tech demo and more like something a multi room house could use to control the lights on a daily basis. Recreating all scenes is awful though. I sort of understand why it's necessary since scenes are now per room. Geofencing has been broken for me since a week after I got my lights and is still broken in this app.

Absolutely inexcusable!The app looks nice but works very inconsistently!I have two lights only, want them to turn on at certain times and off at night. Also, each one with a different color. Youd think this is simple enough...Lights rarely turn on at the scheduled time and when they do, they always give me yellow as opposed to the color I setup.God, was hoping I would eventually use more advanced features with IFTTT but if simple things like that dont work, I have no hope.

Why would I want to use this new app when it won't import all the scenes and timers I've already spent hours making!! Fix this aspect and I may come back. Also you can't control each individual light color for scenes! You can just hit shuffle? What a joke! The fact that they say they won't support the old app anymore enrages me. Just improve on the old app! You know like most companies in the world! Your users have spent hours setting up each room the way they want and now you're essentially deleting this work they've put into your product to show off to other possible customers. Please listen to your users. The majority of them are all saying the same thing about your new app. You might want to listen to them. Also, you have removed the ability to control lights in groups (for instance, a kitchen and a living room are both DOWNSTAIRS) and you want to be able to control the lights in both rooms but also you want to control ALL the downstairs lights together, by grouping living room and kitchen into a group! You can't! Once lights are assigned to one room, this broken app won't let you bunch those same lights into a  other group! You broke this app Hue.

dopo un paio di settimane di tentativi di adeguarmi alla logica della nuova app, sar costretta a rimettere in uso la vecchia :(( sperando vivamente che rimanga disponibile a lungo...la nuova app riporta la gestione dell'illuminazione a un concetto vecchio, stanza per stanza, ma poi perch_??? se qualcuno aveva bisogno di gestire tutte le luci della cucina bastava creare una scena "cucina"!! e a che mi serve adesso l'interruttore messo accanto al letto che accendeva luci soffuse lungo tutto il percorso dal letto al bagno? improvvisamente diventa inutile visto che con la nuova app posso gestire luci situate al massimo in 2stanze, non di pi.in genere la flessibilit che aveva reso speciale l'esperienza hue  stata tristemente spezzata da questa nuova app della quale ho comunque apprezzato un paio di cosucce, prima fra tutte la possibilit di assegnare funzioni diverse a un'ulteriore pressione dell'interruttore, ma niente che possa anche lontanamente sostituire il piacere della flessibilit e creativit delle scene.

Non solo gli aggiornamenti di questa app hanno la frequenza di un'altra era geologica, ma dopo tutta questa attesa arriva questo fiasco. Invece di correggere alcuni limiti e di portare avanti le funzionalit arrivano con un deciso passo indietro. Un concetto di stanza pi rigido dei muri di una casa, l'idea che le scene debbano essere legate a una stanza, la perdita di flessibilit nella creazione delle scene, peggioramenti nell'integrazione con Siri. Tutti errori incredibili. Sembra un'applicazione disegnata senza informazioni sull'utilizzo della versione precedente. Per il momento ho rimesso la vecchia app che per fortuna  ancora disponibile. Speriamo bene. Con lampade che vanno da 20 a pi di 100 ci si aspetterebbe maggiore attenzione da un marchio cos importante.
Gen 2 app is appalling. I'm now trying to reinstate gen 1 having deleted it yesterday only to find I can't control my lights remotely using gen 2. Would give this zero stars if I could.

June 12, 2016Every time we have a power failure, Siri stops working with Hue. Get a message that it cannot find what you are looking for. In the app, you have to reset Siri and then pair it again. This is simply a waste of time and annoying. Not going to pair it anymore and just use the app to turn everything on and off. May 22, 2016Had to drop the rating from 3 to 1. Siri was working fine yesterday after a lot of fiddiling with the app. Today, something happened to our uVerse router/modem. Had to reboot the router. Afterwards I went out for a walk and when I returned home, the lights were on (like they were supposed to be). However, I could not have Siri turn any of them off or all of them off. "Lights Off", "Turn Lights Off", "Front Door Off", "Turn Front Door Off". Nothing worked. Had to go into the app, reset Siri and then have Siri find the Hue Hub again. It seems there is a problem in the Hue as it should be able to find Siri even after being assigned a new DHCP IP address. I just went into the app and assigned a static IP to the Hue Hub, will see if this solves the problem with Siri. May 21, 2016Just loaded this after using the previous versions of Hue. Was using HESPERUS to contol my Phillips Hue lights with Siri. After setting up Siri in the Hue app, all I get is "sorry cannot find any devices this time". Did the resync and that did not help. Just figured it out. Had to go into Hue Bridges, select the i for information, Reset Siri voice control and then do Siri voice control setup again. This time it worked. Raised my rating from 1 to 3. iPhone 6S PlusiOS 9.3.2

I am going to weigh in and say I actually like the new app. I have a lot of light bulbs - like 20, and so I was really used to the old app. At the beginning I was confused by the "room centered design," but after using it for a few weeks I have gotten used to it and like it better than the old one.The app is much more responsive in general, and the integration with Home Kit works very well. Home Kit makes is easy to share themes between users without having to rely on the clunky web sync feature that the old app required.The only think missing is iPad and Apple Watch integration, which I miss. However, the Hue Facebook page says these are in the works.

Philips makes great electronics but any sort of app support doesn't seem to exist. Yes, the new interface is worlds better than the old app but the fact that syncing it with my Hue account doesn't download the dozen or so custom scenes I've saved seems ridiculous. Do I have to re-assign dimmers and buttons to these new scenes?Meh. Deleted.

This update has been more of a annoyance than anything.  It seems pretty buggy.  Like when I'm trying to turn a light off and the screen keeps refreshing over and over every couple seconds.  On the 5th try I got the light changed before it redrew the screen again.  Also, most of the configuration didn't carry over correctly from the old app.

I'm sticking with the old app. What's the point of having a room full of hue lights if I can't make fully tailored scenes? Instead of hitting "shuffle" a million times just trying to get something that looks good, why not just let me control (and save) the individual lights - like you could in the old app!?

I've read a lot of bad reviews about this new version, but I must say it that it is actually pretty good.First off, those of you scared of losing the previous version will be happy to learn that it is kept in that the new version is actually a new application. As far as the scenarios go, they are actually very powerful if you learn the interface. The new "rooms" feature is actually pretty good in that allows the simple way to manipulate your lights. There is a way to do pretty much what the other version did except that the way to do it is completely different. You have to be open to a new experience!That being said, the only drawback that I see is that the flexibility of the timers is not as good as before. You have a way to set up your wake ups and your bedtimes, but this concept is a bit restrictive. Creating your own timers can be done but it is not as flexible as before, from my short time working with it. So to sum up, this is actually a pretty good upgrade. You just have to be ready to learn a new app.

Wow. This app is now full useless. The geofencing function works never. It never turns off my lights when I leave and never turns them on when I'm home. I've made triple sure that I have the correct settings. The old app at least worked 70 percent of the time with geofencing. And I still use the old one to change light colours. This app is so horribly designed and arranged. I am now officially looking at other alternatives for smart led lights.

As other have mentioned the app is more aesthetically pleasing to look at than the original app but the design still fails to present the functionality in a simple, self-evident manner.Additionally it is really unreliable: geofencing is spotty and my lights are still running routines that I deleted...Lastly they took away the on-demand Timers leaving Routines that have to be schedules. For example I can't run a "fade-to-blue-in-30m" Routine at the touch of a button: I have to go in and schedule it to recur on specific days and times.Hire some UX people. Visually the app is great but the functionality is neither clear nor well designed.
This app really needs the group feature like the old app, and the ability to make presets off of more than just an image.

I'm at a loss as to why everyone is complaining. The old app was bloated and confusing, and designed poorly. This one simplified the whole thing, added the ability to group lights by room, and made everything more attractive and easier to use. It is totally beyond me why so many people are hating this app.

I have the new app installed in my iPhone and have been using it for about a month. I like it so much that I installed the app on my wife's phone. We think it is easy to use - it just takes a little patience to become accustomed to the changes.  The app is a huge improvement over its predecessor.  Access to scenes is easier,  and individual light control is right at our fingertips.  My wife and I use the app for all of our Hue lights.  We have a variety of types of lights and they are all easy to control using this app with our iPhones.  We have three zones set up in the house and that was also easy to do with the app.  We just added a Phillips Lamp and control it with the app. Give it a try and use it for a few weeks.  That's what we did and we like it a lot.

As others have said, Phillips should be embarrassed by this app. Everything about this app is more complicated than it needs to be without really giving the controls I wanted. Hire a usability team please! I'm switching back to the Gen 1 app.

These programmers and developers need fired.  What a horrible app.  I was expecting a better version of the first gen, but this is a step back.  There was obviously barely any thought put into this and no testing whatsoever.  They got rid of scenes, or at least made them difficult to find.  You also can only add a certain amount of lights to control by routine.  Even worse, the samelight cannot be part of multiple rooms such as "dining room" and "living room."  This app is so bad, I'm done buying these bulbs and plan to buy GE bulbs instead.
Issues connecting to bridge, setting scenes, controlling lights, navigating the app, you name it. Going back to the old one.

I happen to be in the business of software development in the web and mobile app space and I understand what it's like to receive a deluge of negative feedback upon the release of software that replaces an existing system. People don't like change, I get it. This is why it pains me to leave a one star review. But I'm left with no choice. I even had an internal battle to justify giving it two stars. The creators of the new app either did no user research or simply didn't understand the feedback provided by its users. It is very clear that none of the development team owns or uses Hue. Rather than adding functionality to the already mediocre but usable app, the team managed to remove most of the key features while failing to add even one new useful piece of functionality. They removed:The ability to choose colors from a custom picture scene. The ability to easily sync multiple lights to the same color. The ability to choose lights to add to a scene more than one time.  The ability to create an effectively customized wake up alarm. One of this app's biggest flaws is the inability to add a light to a "Room" more than once. This means that you cannot have a bedroom, living room, and an "All" room. Yes, you read that right. I can either choose to control all of my lights at once or segment them by room, not both. I figured that I HAD to be missing something, so I spent 15 minutes trying to figure it out. I am not missing something. Instead of spending time writing basic functionality, the development team added features such as the ability to Delete a light so that it can no longer be controlled. What use case necessitates that feature? You can't migrate your scenes from v1 of the app, but hey, now you can delete a light and lose control over it! The interface is clunky and unintuitive, it causes you to perform actions that you had no idea were going to happen, the bottom nav changes itself constantly, giving you no anchor back to the main pieces of the app leaving you lost and hitting back > back > back until you finally return back to where you came from so you can restart the process of finding what you were looking for all over again - and then have your bottom nav change again. I could continue. If the dev team is reading this, I am sorry. You probably had decisions made by high ups that forced your hand towards certain features and were inevitably dealing with no budget and a short vigorous timeline. I understand how these things work. That said, there is no excuse for the state of the app that made its way into production. This reminds me of something I would see in a development environment 20 weeks before launch. Something that is unusable, but someone somewhere on some team says something about it and comes up with ideas to make vast improvements to it. I can almost guarantee that this app was written by some business analyst or product owner who blindly passed it to a design team who blindly passed it to the dev team and then it went through one round of QA and some exec said that it has to go live with no additional timeline slippage. It's sad that this sort of thing happens with an app as big as this in a company as large as Philips. It actually makes me lose hope in my profession. Take this app, destroy the source code, and start over.

The rooms concept is something I've been waiting for! I have almost 40 hue lights in my house and the Gen 1 app is completely useless to me. I use OnSwitch exclusively because of this lacking feature. So, you can imagine my excitement when the Gen 2 app introduced rooms, and my disappointment when I can't add the same light to different rooms. Let me break down my use-case. I have lights in my living room, dining room, kitchen, and entry way, all in their own rooms; however, I want a "Downstairs" room so I can control them all together. And in the kitchen, I have light strips that I'd like to group as "Accent Lighting". Again, OnSwitch lets you do all this, and Philips should take a cue from them on how to design rooms.P.s. The ability to adjust colors for all lights in a room, like you can with an individual light, would be greatly appreciated.
Normaal worden apps beter, maar niet bij Hue. Absolute achteruitgang. Eerste app vele malen beter, kan veel meer.ZZZZZZZ

Warum bittesch_n werden nun Szenen, die man mit SIRI steuern kann, je Zimmer angelegt ??? Warum nicht allgemein wie vorher? Bei der alte App konnte mal jeder Szene die jeweiligen Leuchten zuordnen. Ein Szenenname (SIRI), und Fertig. Geht bei der neuen nun wohl nimmer. Nur als Beispiel, habe eine offene Kche zum Wohnzimmer. Die Leuchten in der Kche unter Zimmer Kche und die im Wohnzimmer unter Zimmer Wohnzimmer. Um nun berall die Leuchten auf ein bestimmtes Szene/Farbschema z.B. alle Lampen mit verschiedenen Blaut_ne zu schalten, muss man eine Farbszene im Bereich Kch und eins in Wohnzimmer anlegen. Ein Szenen-Name darf aber ja nur ein mal vergeben werden. Bei der alten App gab es eine Szene fr komplett namens OZEAN. Da man aber nun ja 2 Szenen anlegen muss, wiederum ein Szenenname nur einmal vergeben werden darf, muss ich 2 Szenennamen vergeben, d.h. "1 x hey Siri, aktiviere OZEAN1, danach 1 x hey Siri, aktivire Ozean2" sagen! Da kommt man sich doch vor wie ein Kasper ! Habe auch versucht ein ZIMMER anzulegen, das alle gewnschten Leuchten (Kche und Wohnzimmer) beinhaltet, das geht aber nicht, da eine Leuchte nur einem Zimmer zugewiesen werden kann, und will man die dem neuen ZIMMER zuweisen, wir sie aus dem alten Zimmer gel_scht ! Was fr ein Schwachsin mit der ZIMMER-Unterteilung. Die einzige M_glichkeit sehe ich darin, ALLE angelegten ZIMMER zu  LSCHEN, und dann EIN EINZIGES ZIMMER zu erstellen mit allen Leuchten der kompletten Wohnung. Dan funktioniert es theoretisch! THEORETISCH, aber dann der n_chste FEHLSCHLAG! Will man wie bei der ALten App ein eigenes Bild fr eine Szene definieren, geht dies zwar, aber die Positionierung der einzelnen Leuchten, auf eine Position geht nicht. Lediglich die "SHUFFLE-Funktion, welche wahllos fr jede Leuchte eine Farbposition festlegt. Selber festlegen, welche Leuchte auf einem dem Szenenbild welche Farbe bernehmen soll,....FEHLANZEIGE !!! Totale Fehlprogrammierung !! Faerbe selbst definieren oder zuf_llige Farbwahl, ging in der alten App einwandfrei. Und nun zum Schluss noch, dass via Internet "Mein Hue" die Szenen nicht mehr ansteuerbar sind, ebenso ein total fataler Rcksprung aus technischer seite!  Resume ....total umst_ndlich, techisch rckl_ufig, und daher uninteressant und unbrauchbar fr mich / meine vorstellung einer intelligenten und komfortablen Lichtsteuerung.  Dringend nachbessern !!

I have been a Phillips Hue customer for almost 3 years now. I have over 20 Phillips Hue lights and plan on buying more. A testament to how I really enjoy this product. I even moved from the 1st gen control bridge to the 2nd gen to turn on/off and change color/brightness by simply speaking. Amazing technology!Like most of the reviews for this 2.0 app, I regrettably agree that this app has taken a backseat to the previous version. The idea of recreating all the scenes and timers that I have already made in the original app was enough for me to remove this version from my iPad. The original Hue app took some time to learn however I pretty much mastered all of its tools. By no means do I want to take another couple hours to set up my scenes and timers again. Also, the lack of an iPad app is disappointing. The original app had both iPhone and iPad native apps and so should this version in my opinion.Lastly, I would like to encourage Phillips to read these comments and really take to heart that there is a great community of people that love this product. We want nothing more than an app to compliment this excellent light technology.

Why put the limit number of rooms. Wish I invested in a different company for my lights. Ugh.

Yes, the old app is a little awkward-looking, but it offers more customization options than this new minimal monstrosity. My primary metric is bedtime reading timers. This app fails at that. It didn't even show up on test day. Why can't this new app have pre-set timers? I looked in "routines" and I have to pick a specific time of day for any timed event. Nothing that's a button that you can simply tap any time you want to do a pre-set fade-in/out on a scene. I just want to be able to have some timers for reading for 30/45/60 minutes. I also want to have a widget button that activates, for example, a 45 minute fade-out of my bedroom Lux reading light. And a Siri voice command that does the same thing. This goal is how I judge the app because it's the main advantage I see smart (Lux) lights having one regular lights.Furthermore, I tried to set a reading scene and had to choose a photo but the old app let me ignore the photo and choose from a color/gradient palette or at least pick what spots on the photo to emulate. I may want an icon to represent a scene that doesn't necessarily dictate exactly how the scene looks but this new app appears to require me to drag a photo around so the pixels visible on screen somehow let the lights know how bright they should be? I just wanted to center the book in the icon . . . Why do all routines besides the wake up and sleep routines not let me fade beyond 30 minutes? (Again, it ruins my reading timer.)I have not tried the color scene creation yet because the app will always be one-star to me until a timer feature is added. I already deleted it. I'll check back after an update but I won't even open it unless timers have been added. Please keep the old app around. Don't discontinue it or stop fixing bugs.

I thought the update would improve upon the old version. But no! The old version is easier to use and way more intuitive. I do not like this version. I'm going to be searching out other apps to use for my hue lights.

I can honestly say that this is the worst app I have ever come across. Coming from a major company, and supporting a great product, Philips Hue lighting, it's inexplicable. Someone should be fired. The app is hard to navigate, nearly impossible to understand and has no instructions. Absolutely awful ! Don't even bother trying it.

The only part of the application that works right is turning on and off lights. The application is supposed to turn off lights when you leave and turn them on when you come home. This never works. Setting timers for when lights should shut off does not work.The first generation app worked much better.

It's amazing how far this app fell short of features that the previous app had and how well it worked. 1. I used location aware light scenes. Off when I leave and on when I arrive. It worked flawlessly with the old version and would notify me when those tasks were completed. This new app has never worked with the geofence location and has no notification system in place to confirm whether the lights have turned on or off. I have verified my location privacy settings and completely restored my phone and set it up as a new device, to no avail, it's the app. 2. When I am home it will intermittently state that I'm away. I'm literally in a studio apartment where I can see and knowingly connected to the router which in turn is connected to the Phillips Hue receiver. 3. Light combinations. I have three lights in my ceiling light that I want to be the same color. With the old app I could group the lights and with the new one I have to go through a tedious process to set each one individually and since there is no numerical value such as RGB values I can only try to match each individual light. 4. Scenes didn't transfer from previous app. I have spent a couple years making them and I really don't want to make the over again. 5. So I want to make a scene but not use a photo, well on the new app that's not a possibility. I'm switching back to regular led bulbs until Philips figures out what mess they have created. While the app is visually appealing, the lack of functions are astonishing.
The new design is okay, but it won't let me connect to my bridge if I'm not at home. This makes all the money I spent on this thing useless.

Pretty funny that after you shell out thousands of dollars on hue lights the company (a formerly high quality and innovative one btw) behind it just tells you to jump. Not only do they release a second version of the app while keeping the better one on the store, but they go in a totally different direction by using rooms. Why can't you just stop experimenting and prosaic an app that a) works all the time, and b) has a vision of what it should do and sticks to it. The HomeKit 'integration' should be an embarrassment to anyone working at Philips. Why have a limit of 50 lights accessible to the bridge when Siri can't access more than about 12 of them. Seriously, just use your brains and stop being so third-rate. It's not like your products are cheap. You can imagine the developers asking themselves - if our customers spent so much time creating scenes why wouldn't we allow them to import them into the new app? Nah! Forget it, who would want such an obvious efficient option. Let's go for maximum inefficiency! Make the customers start from scratch! We hate them after all.

Single light control is either gone or very hard to find. Overall this feels like someone tried to fix some experience issues with the first app, but fell short and shipped it anyway. I hope they don't disable the old app for a while because I won't be using this one...

Works to turn lights on and off while using the app, but the nicest feature is the widget...if it worked. It's completely useless. Keeps telling me the the widget "has no rooms"?! I assigned a room to each one, but it still won't work. Also, you have to create a separate on and off button...it won't toggle on/off in the widget, which is really stupid.

As many have already mentioned this version is a step backward.  It seems like the developers have no real world experience with Hue lights.  I certainly hope Philips wakes up and listens to its customers.

I like the new sleek interface but features taken away and new obnoxious bugs replace this new version of the app.Home & Away feature is broken to the point that my lights randomly turn off and on by themselves every day or in the middle of the f#$king night while sleeping. I triple checked the alarms and setup and NOPE, I'm not crazy ...the firmware/app is just clearly bugged. Even disabling geofencing still doesn't fix it and I live alone, so no one else is using it to fiddle with anything.Lost the ability to create custom scenes in exchange for an odd randomizer was a major loss.By the reviews I can see I'm not the only one having these issues. Hope that other reviewer didn't burn their house down over the grief of this under QA'd product.
Like so many others I updated the app and hope for the best. Like so many others I was let down and I'm so disappointed. My switch.

Like all the other reviewers here, this is a nice step forward, but a leap backwards. I won't bother to reiterate what everyone's already said except for this: This update removed the ability to change both lights at the same time! Adjusting the colors together was such an important feature, and I can't see any reason why they needed to remove that. The old color picker was so much easier and quicker to use. Please, please bring back the ability to join lights and change their color together!
Total horrible application. I just want to burn everything and forget about smart lights.

The interface has been improved. However, removing features is ridiculous. Timers have shifted to routines (which is fine), but fading time maxes out at 30min. It used to be 60min in "timers". You can no longer select individual colors in a picture to create a scene.Missing features are: I cannot group rooms into zones. Similarly, I cannot create a scene with lights that are in different rooms.Clean-up does nothing. It's supposed to reset the settings. Doesn't reset anything.

Whilst the original app may not have been particularly nice to look at, it was functional and allowed the user to be creative with their lights and how they use them around their home. This new app has removed the ability to create scenes (a very important function to easily control the mood of your lighting with one click and to prevent repetition when setting alarms/routines). It has also not imported any of my original settings and I would need to set everything up from scratch. This app is not fit for purpose and I will be deleted it as soon as I submit this review.
The update fails after multiple attempts. C'mon Philips.

Dopo tre anni in cui l'ecosistema Hue, inizialmente comperato come un gioco, era invece entrato a fare parte delle vere comodit quotidiane ed avevamo passato le 15 luci, possiamo solo sperare una cosa: che la vecchia app sopravviva. Quando non sar pi utilizzabile venderemo i bulbi su eBay.Senza la possibilit di controllare INDIVIDUALMENTE i bulbi dentro alle scene a prescindere dalle stanze, scegliendo colore e intensit di ciascun bulbo ("dal garage al letto senza svegliare la moglie che dorme", "una luce soffusa in ogni stanza per gli animali quando si  via da casa",  cos via), le hue sono solo una scomodit da buttare: di scegliere il colore del ... lampadario, il terzo giorno ti sei gi stancato. Tanto vale accenderlo con l'interruttore.  molto pi comodo e molto meno costoso.
Ma la versione per iPad???!!!

I only post reviews when I'm either very happy or very dissatisfied. I am very dissatisfied. This app is an incredibly clunky interface to what could be some very good hardware. I can no longer seem to set household themes, just room by room.  The selling point of Hue was that I could set the mood of my whole homes be customise it to how I see fit.  How could they get it so wrong?
For anyone who is struggling with the app, you can still use the first gen one and it works like a charm

Best ontwikkelteam wat een waardeloze app hebben jullie er van gemaakt. Het scherm heeft weer een 1x /2x knop om resolutie aan te passen. Mijn scenes komen niet na inloggen op mijn hue. Onnodig complex gemaakt in ruil voor wat grafische effecten. Slechte deal!. 0 sterren. Waneer kan ik nou eens een scene aan laten gaan sychroon met de zonop/zononder tijd.
Es una aplicacion desastrosa. Los widget van cuando les da la gana. Pierde conexion constante con el bridge. Poco intuitiva. He quitado esta cosa y vuelto a la anterior.

Aparte de las "no mejoras que ya han comentado otros usuarios, en esta nueva versin no es posible conectar a myhue, he porbado de todo y no hay manera. Si instalo la versin anterior conecta a la primera.Lanzar una nuevar versin con ests "mejoras" pues no lo veo claro y tener varias apps para hacer lo que debera hacer la original, pues tampoco.Decir que muy contento con el sistema de luces Hue, pero la app no est a la altura.
Was soll das, Philips. Die neue App ist Murks und in der brauchbaren alten App werde ich zuerst damit genervt, die neue App zu nutzen??? berdenkt das mal? Die neue App ist schlichtweg MLL_

Please don't the commission the original app, this version is so complicated I can't even get scenes to work properly. Very frustrating app so I removed it then went back to the original one.

Die neue App ist noch schlechter als die alte App. Keine iPad Untersttzung mehr. Szenenbernahme ist nicht m_glich. Soll ich meine 60 Szenen nun alle neu anlegen? Ihr spinnt doch bei Philips. So vergrault man Kunden der ersten Stunde.

Vous allez au lit tous les soirs  la mme heure de exactement ? Moi non ... Donc pourquoi la routine pour aller au lit  besoin de commencer  une certaine heure... On cliquerai sur le bouton pour l'enclencher au moment o on arrive dans le lit...Et les pices c'est bien mais si une ampoule se trouve entre deux pices ???
Manque le multi lampes par sc_nario et la compatibilit_ Apple Watch !!!

I simply want the ability to slide a Kelvin scale for the color temperature number I want. Over complicating it with pictures that you move around to get different spectrum points is ridiculous. Sometimes the simplest things in life are the most enjoyable.
Switching back to gen. 1.

I like the idea of rooms much better these once since I have only white lights. But why did I have to download a new app and rest set everything up. Now I will have to go to every iPad and phone and do it again. Also why no iPad app???

Being able to quickly turn a room on or off, or act as a dimmer for that room is very nice. That functionality is a signficant step over the old scene controls on the previous application.The old hue app had a fairly utilitarian interface when it came to alarms and could admittatly be a bit clunky at times.  The new application guts the functionality of fine tuned alarms.  This makes it awkward for "leave one kitchen light on as a night light."  Or my "turn on and off lights according to the rythym of the house" that I've determined over a bit of time. Whats more, there's no way to modify the existing alarms in the new application.Furthermore, there's no ipad application version for this. The 1x and 2x in the corner of an application is something that I've mostly forgotten on the iPad until this application showed up.So, as there are some nice points, the app gets a star above "I hate it".  But for the massive regressions in fuctionality regarding the alarms and lack of an ipad version - it isn't getting anything more.
Please let me know when the proof of concept is finished. I would like to provide feedback before the development of the real app starts. #worthless

This is just terrible. It barely works and always shows "connecting.."  It's way more complex than the first Gen app. I think Phillips hired high school students with a day of app DEV experience to create this. And the platform is still unnecessarily complex. You have to still physically go back to the hub to pair an app each time, reminiscent of 1995.

I have 2 wireless signals. 2.4 and 5 Ghz. It has never once connected while on the 5 G, and it only connects once out of every 5 tries on the 2.4 Ghz.  Do not get this app if you want working lights. It makes your lights just like any other lightbulb you can get for $1

This new app is a complete failure. Just the fact that I can't somehow import or transfer over the timers, alarms and scenes that my wife and I have spent days creating and tweaking is reason enough to avoid this version. Geofencing fails, grouping by room makes it harder to scene the whole house, getting pairs of lights to exactly match in color is a pain. So relieved I didn't delete the old app. Philips has a lot of work to do. Otherwise, if the old app should get removed from my iPhone, the lights go on eBay.

I love the new look, but that's it.  I have hue in only 1 room, my bedroom, which should be easy to set up and control.  Instead it is unnecessarily over complicated.  The widget to turn "off" the lights does not work.  "Widget cannot find room".  I have one room and all the scenes are set to it and all the others work except the off switch!!  I'm using the old app again.

Aside from this being much more difficult to use than Gen 1, it simply doesn't work properly. I can't resync and Siri commands, I tap the ! and it does nothing. Awful Siri combined with an awful app just makes me look stupid when I try and set a scene using my voice.

Tried to set this up. After my iPhone battery DIED waiting more than 4 hours to set up my first room I gave up. At 50+ s light bulb you'd expect the software to at least be able to set itself up, but you would be thinking wrong. Terrible apps. Terribly support. It's a great idea and I do like that my lights come on and off via my app schedule, but it is a right faff and absolutely not worth the money. I won't be buying another hue product and couldn't recommend the line to anyone in good conscience.

Why do you release an app that's *worse* than the old one? Where you have *removed* functions you have to go back to the old app to find?Why on God's green Earth can I no longer create a scene using all lamps? Only for a single room? What were you thinking?Why in heaven's name can't I create a scene from scratch, but *only* from a picture? Creating a scene from a picture should only be some additional "cool" function - fun for a while, slightly nerdy, but basically useless. It should *not* be, not only the main way to create scenes, but, even worse, the *only* way! That's only for playing around, for God's sake! What were you thinking?!Give us back a way to create exact scenes from scratch, precisely the way we want, using any lamps we want!
This new app is missing WAY too many features that were very useful in the old app. This is the second instance that hue has changed things for the worse. Getting tired of it.

The new Hue app simply makes you log in to your account over and over again, without giving you any of the functions so easy to use in the 1st generation app. I'm even a bigger fan of the 1st generation layout. If I were Hue, I'd scrap the new app and simply focus on improving what already works with the original Hue app.

No import feature. Widget can't have a simple pre made individual light control. Hard to navigate. Hard to make thing happen like turning a single light in a room off. It's a fail. Use the original app.
The new app is terrible. The developers should be ashamed of themselves for putting this junk out. Just stick with the first (and far superior) app.

I will continue to use the old app like many here. The UI looks like it was designed by a group of freshman design students who used Excel to build the app GUI. Main missing feature is the ability to group lights like symmetrical sconces as a single light. The rooms feature looks like an attempt to continue a group, but without the ability to gang a couple lights together without making those lights their own room is poor. If you have a dimmer for a single light in a room then do not upgrade to this version!You will lose the ability to control the single light and will instead control the entire room.This is terrible in situations like a bedside lamp dimmer which will now turn on all other lights in the room including your partner's bedside lamp. Besides the few good new functions mentioned in other reviews, I'll focus on what didn't work well for me:1.cannot edit custom scenes after added them2.becos of 1, deleting old custom scene to re-add the scene w/ the same scene name will cos Siri to nag u the same scene alrdy exist when u try to check the re-added scene in Siri, forcing u to rename the scene. Don't do that if u have OCD!To fix that, I had to wipe out all hue & Siri settings, uninstalled the app to reinstall to redo the setup. So make sure u set your rooms & lights right before adding the scene.3. Constant disconnection. If I didn't use the old app I would have gone crazy thinking about interference in my place is causing the constant dis/reconnecting to Hue hub. The old app didn't have the issue. Switching channel to 11 seems to disconnect less.Felt like testing n incomplete app. Happy to test to report issues though. Uninstalled to go back to old app for now.

As a supplier of premium smart home lighting - and yes hue is at the very top end price wise, you have a responsibility to make apps and control devices that actually work. Let me start off by saying that this app is much better than the previous is many ways. I don't like the import issues and losing some of the original settings, but it is what it is. The big issue to flag is the scene cycle addition on the recent update. I LOVE it, but the problem is, if you have a lot of dimmer switches, you will fill up the 100 rule limit quickly. You can no longer use 12 dimmers.....now it's down to 7 (7x13rules per dimmer is 91). The only other option is to disable the scenes and get the rules per dimmer down to 8, which eliminates a cool function. Developers need to send a firmware update for the bridge to extend the rules limit to at least 200.

Rubbish.  Really rubbish. It's as if they're now relying on 3rd party apps to make Hue useable. Come on Philips, spend some money on app development.....and Q&A !

This app is a backward step to hue 1. Can't even log into my hue, just has the icon rotating saying logging in. Used to be able to control rooms and individual lights now just scenes. Spent a lot of cash on lots of lights, strips and buttons all with the promise I can select the colours.  I cannot select colours anymore and have to use a random shuffle on a camera roll picture!What a bag of spanners! This app looks really nice, but I don't get it. None of my scenes have synchronised with my account and I find myself trying to find things.
