There was quite apparently no widespread user testing before this app was released. I highly recommend no one download the current iteration.

This update is by far the worst DOWN GRADE in any app that I have ever used for a critical function. Somehow Phillips let the engineer put out an an that only an engineer can't use or figure out. The fact that this crappy app took away scenes that I have created since Hue released on day one is beyond belief and common sense. I could tolerate the day one software release as being a working beta. This release which takes place after being in the market for a couple of years is worst than an ALPHA. A warning to all, please do not erase your prior Hue app if you want you expensive hue light to work as advertised. This ALPHA release is PURE CRAP! Enough SAID!!!!

The major issue with this new app is the increased complexity of managing timers/routines. The old app had timers, which could be used to turn on and off lights, with all available features including rooms/lights, colors and time of day. It was simple, easy to understand and quick to use.In the new app they have named routines (home and away, wake up, go to sleep and my routines). Each one is supposed to be purpose built with extra features but some basic features like light color/scene isn't available in the wake up routine. These new routine categories add unnecessary complexity to the app. The simpler way to get these features without adding such complexity is to have them all be general routines, and the home screen can then be a unified list of all routines rather than a category selection screen that adds a step. Move the "category" concept as a selectable variable within the routine, and then you can show only the features relevant to that routine (eg no color/scene selection on a lights off routine).This new app makes things unnecessarily complicated with deprecated features and a bad user experience.

It's ok, for many reasons I still prefer the original app. Thank you for having the sense to keep it available and working. I'll try this again in a few months and see how the dev has come, but start with importing scenes from the old app. I really shouldn't have to reprogram my house. Lame.

Unfortunately I'm at a point where I have to write a review for this app as well. I didn't realize that there were so many others who felt the same as myself about this app. I love the new look of this new app but one feature that has not been working well for me is the geofencing feature that allows to have the lights shutoff when you leave and turn back on when you return within range of wireless router. This feature on the first gen app work flawlessly. Today was the the last day I let this app let me down on this feature. I literally would be sitting in my parking lot, connected to my wifi, and still didn't see any lights come on for a quite a period of time. Then I walked into a dark apartment. Like I said though I do love the new look and layout to the app otherwise. I love the new "nightlight" options that really help me create a low light scene when I need it. Anyways I hope to see an update to this app that correct my issues and the others that other people have had as well. Until then I'm switching back to the first gen app.

Really? No import???   Should I just re-setup every light, every scene, every timer???  What a joke.  I can see if the products were low cost --- but $50 or more a bulb....  HELLO PHILIPS.   Get a clue, hire some competent developers.

It's a nice interface. Siri finally works with it and it's very quick when it works with wifi. However, please for the love of God, give us back the ability to individually select colors out of the pictures for the scenes. That's an essential and y'all removed it. I need it back.
I wasn't entirely pleased at the beginning, but it all makes perfect sense now. Thanks for a great update.
This version just does NOT work. Scenes are hard to arrange. Alarms/timers don't work well. It's not intuitive - I miss the old, EASY app so much! If you have it, stick with it!!

Eigentlich h_tte ich von Generation 1 zur Generation 2 einige Verbesserungen erwartet. Leider ist das nicht der Fall. Gute Funktionen der App Generation 1 wurden nicht in die neue App gerettet oder einfach vergessen?- Zufallsgenerator bei den Timern- Anzeige der Verfgbarkeit der Lampen wenn man ausser Haus ist- Timer zu setzten wurde komplizierter (und das will was heissen, es war vorher schon nicht sehr einfach - vielleicht liegt ja hier die Verbesserung)Wirklich die einzige Verbesserung ist die bersichtlichkeit - weniger Funktionen mehr bersicht folgt einer gewissen Logik!Ich werde noch so lange wie m_glich mit der Generation 1 weitermachen!

The only good thing about this new app is being able to easily control a room of lights. The new app makes it harder to set the exact colours that u want making it useless!!! Why did u ruin a good thing with making a shittier app?? Just add the room grouping to the old app and call it good. Seriously hate the new app and I hate that the old app always has a pop up telling u to switch to the new app. I'm no longer recommending this to anyone as I now feel like it's too much of a hassle to use making it a waste of money!!

I view my iPad screen locked in Landscape mode, which is my preference. 99% of the apps I use will rotate their screens and allow for Landscape use. Even Hue Gen 1 does that!! Won't use Gen 2 in a forced Portrait mode. By way of the other feedback here it doesn't look like I'm missing much anyway.

A new app that makes you start at square one is a bad idea.  Sure no big deal if you have 2 bulbs, b the for those that have bought in and did a whole house, I've got better things to do then spend the day re doing all the lights. The app isn't that much of an improvement to warrant such an important investment in time.  Try again you make a good product but your developers are hurting you.

...kein Support fr iPad oder Apple Watch. Ansonsten ist die App nicht schlecht gemacht. Die Einstellungen sind besser als bei der alten Version und es gibt endlich R_ume  denen man die Lampen zu ordern kann.Aufgrund des fehlenden Support fr iPad und Apple Watch kann ich leider nur einen Stern vergeben.SCHADE!

V_llig unbersichtlich und null intuitiv!Warum kann man beim einstellen einer Routine nicht die Farbe ausw_hlen die man m_chte? Zwei Lampen in einer Szene k_nnen nicht die gleiche Farbe haben. Warum nicht?!?!? Wie kann ich die Farbe in einer Szene zuordnen? Die alte app war schon schlimm aber die ist noch deutlich schlimmer...

Als begeisterter Nutzer der ersten Generation finde ich die 2. Generation nicht sonderlich ausgreift. Die Shuffle Funktion ist ganz nett. Aber wie lassen sich die einzelnen Lampen einer Szene konfigurieren? Alles erscheint mir recht umst_ndlich. Was ich auerdem vermisse ist die Zufallsfunktion bei den Routinen (Timer). Erstmal werde ich die gen 1 weiter nutzen. Schauen wir mal wann ein Update kommt....

Es gibt ein paar kleine, l_ngst berf_llige Erg_nzungen, ABERpl_tzlich erkl_rt einem die App, die verwendete Bridge (2.0!!!) sei nicht HomeKit f_hig. Also kein Siri, keine Steuerung ber das Internet. Ich wei nicht was die da rauchen, aber ich will es nicht

Nul nulErgonomie moyenne et perte de nombreuses fonctions comme les minuteurs d'extinction qu'on pouvait lancer quand on voulait. Perte de controle des lumires qui doivent etre rang_es dans des pices. Sc_narios qui ne jouent que dans une pice et pas sur toute la maison. Bref, inutilisable pour moi. Je reste sur l'ancienne appli.

Il passo in avanti  notevole. Preferisco questa app alla precedente ma devono risolvere dei limiti ampiamente enunciati in altre recensioni. Uno per tutti: non poter creare stanza contenente tutte le luci per avere scene che coprano l'intera casa. Cio,  fattibile ma perdi le singole stanze...cosa assurda! Speriamo aggiornino.

Op zich prima app. Scene maken is veel minder relaxed dan gen 1. Of shuffelen zonder eigen invloed op een foto. Of elke lamp apart instellen waarbij je niet kan zien welke kleuren de andere lampen hebben (alle lampen in 1 kleurenpalet verstelbaar zit niet in app).
Mooie interface maar hoe krijg je je oude scenes terug? En hoe maak je berhaupt scenes? Waar is de handleiding in deze app?
Heeeeeeelemaal geweldig, niets meer te wensen over, Ik kan er alles mee wat ik wil!

Eye candy meer niet. Werkt niet samen met andere Hue apps (Hue Sunset). Waarom maakt de app 4 schedules per routine aan in de bridge. App chrasht wanneer je routines wil veranderen.Bridge firmware en deze app werken niet lekker samen: sommige routines werken incompleet (1 kamer niet, rest wel of omgekeerd)Heel graag een update!

The 1st gen app is much better, the gen 2 app is missing a lot of the original features. 1 I feel needs to be added to this version is the random setting for lights to randomly come on either side of a specific time. Also being able to switch off a light from widgets. Was better on 1st gen hence why I haven't deleted the app. Philips have gone backwards on improving its app.
I didn't realise that when you update something it's for the worse . Phillips what have you done? I've deleted this and gone back to version 1. Sort it out
This gen 2 app is appalling, much prefer the gen 1 app that is at least designed for the iPad.
it works ok but had a few buggy experiences, also theres no watch support which is surprising as the old app had it and it was used as well, so give it a while before this app will get good reviews

The Philips Hue bulbs and family of lights are all excellent. But, this app makes the user experience unbearable. From never finding new lights, to being unable to control multiple bulbs at the same time, to glitches when trying to save light settings or syncing between devices, this app is even worse than the original (and the original was pretty terrible). All that is before even mentioning that now there isn't an iPad app. Philips is shooting themselves in the foot by selling an excellent product,mouth giving users a terrible app to control it.

You can't make scenes that encompass lights from more than one "room." In the old app I had scenes that were room dependent and scenes that weren't; here, you can only group lights in one rigid way. Plus, if you've made a bunch of scenes in your v1 app, you can't import them. The new app is sleek in appearance but I'm very glad I can still use v1 because this one is a huge downgrade and total disappointment

Where is the Apple Watch and iPad support? First generation had it, why can't the second? Of course there are many third party apps to fill this gap. But why should we resort to that when they are perfectly capable of having this support right out of the gate. Completely unacceptable from a massive company that has the resources to do so.

I had little to no problems with the Gen 1 app. This one has traded usefulness for simplicity and somehow failed completely at the latter. Setting a wake up alarm is a chore... Home and Away has stopped working... And creating automatic scheduled variance when lights turn on and off (so that it doesn't appear like lights are on a timer) seems to have disappeared. No longer is there control over scenes. Everything is a chore. I'll keep using Gen 1 until Philips realizes the people using smart lights actually want the corresponding app to be SMART!
I really like the changes in this new app. It's much simpler toUse and more intuitive. Luckily I didn't have a lot of custom scenes saved so worked great. Lights respond perfectly.

Tried the new app and gave it a fair shot. Conclusion: it's as bad as all the previous reviews said it was.I'd rather dismiss the "upgrade now" screen on the old app to keep my system the way it was than have to use the new app.To the Hue product managers and developers: bless your little hearts for trying, but some people in this world just aren't cut out to develop apps.To the Hue leadership: might want to rethink your product manager and developer hiring strategy.To those who, like me, wanted to see if the new app was as bad as people say it is: try it out and then come back and write a review.

Don't understand the point of this app. I can't use my scenes. Why would I want to simply use the crap stock scenes they supply. This version removes the ability to truly customize which is the whole point of having Hue lights.

The app has never worked 100% correctly. It did work for about 8 months with about 80% functionality. Siri never worked and it always said it could not find the bridge but worked anyway. After installing the update Hue can't find the bridge and I can't control the lights. I also can't use my Harmony remote (amazing product, works perfectly) to control the lights either. Now it says I need to be on my wifi network. Obviously, I am on my wifi network. Hue is an incredibly frustrating product.
I spent long hours creating scenes on the other hue app the new app didn't import anything!!! I'm so aggravated!  Setting up the widget is not user friendly. It is a disaster.
Subject says it all. This app is horrible.

You can't edit scenes once they are named (why?).Siri will turn off the lights but does not turn off individual lights.  I've done a massive amount of troubleshooting on the HomeKit Siri end but nothing has resolved it.  All I get is "Sorry, I didn't get that, could you restate?" Over and over again...Please fix this.
You can't edit scenes or group lights together to pick the same exact color. This is a huge step back.
The rooms and ability to dim are nice. But please bring back the many great functions of the previous generation app.

More like a quarter baked. Wait for 3.0 to upgrade from the first generation app.The interface is clunky and features like scenes and reasonable alarms and timers are missing.It's like a toddler ordered an engineer to redesign the app, and before finishing, moved on to the next toy.The Hue hardware family of appliances is great. When will the software catch up?

user_name: All Being Master of time space and dimension.
text: All my previous settings GONE! No logical way to even recreate them. Shame on you Phillips, might as well go back to regular bulbs if this is what I can expect.  Money back???
Even worse than the Gen 1 app

I'm so glad I kept the old app. Creating new scenes and managing each light color was so much easier before. I hope Philips won't block the access from the old App. The product team should really revisit what they have done and do more user research.
When "gen 1" worked fine, what is the point of creating a new app that does not, instead of continuing to develop the other one?
keine ipad unterstztung! SCHLECHT!

Die alte App war gew_hnungsbedrftig aber brauchbar. Die Neue ist so leider nicht brauchbar. Viel am Design der App gebastelte (nicht mein Geschmack) und dabei die Funktionalit_t vergessen. Was bringen R_ume wenn man dazu keine vernnftige Szenen erstellten kann? Und det Raum kann auch nicht als Szenen Ersatz verwendet werden, weil eine Lampe immer nur zu einem Raum geh_ren kann. Schritt zurck. Nur gut ersetzt die neue App die Alte nicht. So kann ich weiter die Alte brauchen.
For what I do with my lights, I prefer the new app over the old one. The old app focus was play with colour, this one is about daily living.

Sch_ne Optik und Umsetzung der Zimmerzuordnung. Ansonsten aber sehr schlecht gel_st hinsichtlich Einstellung der Szenen, der Routinen und der Farbwahl hinsichtlich des Handlings. Besonders _rgerlich: es gibt keine iPad Version.
Leider kann man keine -Sterne hier vergeben sonst h_tte ich fr die neue App direkt mal -100000000 Sterne gegeben!!Ich bin Stinksauer ber die neue App!! _____Bitte wieder die alte App frei geben!!

Chaque lumire peut appartenir qu'a une seule pice. Sur l'ancienne app il m'_tait possible de cr_er un sc_nario pour allumer 3 ampoules d'un coup (dont celle de ma cuisine ouverte sur salon) et un autre sc_nario uniquement sur l'ampoule de la cuisine. Ce qui me permettait d'allumer (pour cuisiner) ou d'_treindre (pour regarder la t_l_ le soir) SANS interagir sur les 2 autres ampoules, et je pouvais profiter quand bon me semble de mes 3 ampoules d'un coup. Par cons_quent tous les sc_narios patiemment cr__s sur l'ancienne app ont disparus... d_plorable !! Au premier coup d'il l'app m'a paru super, le rajout des pices est int_ressant, notamment pour cr_er des sc_narios pour chaque groupe (ou pice), mais le fait de pouvoir attribuer une ampoule qu' un seul groupe, rend l'app inutilisable pour ceux qui ont plein d'ampoules.Pour finir la fonction trs utile dans la partie widget qui permettait d'_teindre toutes les ampoules d'un sc_nario en appuyant 2 fois dessus  _galement disparue. L'ancienne app me paraissait avoir le meilleur rapport fonctionnalit_s / simplicit_ (ou complexit_), dommage. Je rajouterai des _toiles une fois ces problmes r_solus, pour l'instant je reste sur l'ancienne.

Dans un premier temps il faut toujours avouer que ces lumires sont justes g_niales!!Dans un second temps, mais comment ont-ils pu enlever le fait de contrler les mmes lumires dans des sc_nario diff_rents ?? Exemple : j'ai dans mon salon trois ampoules au plafond et 4 sur un lampadaire "styl_" d'ambiance, et bien je dois choisir entre tout mettre dans la mme pice (donc tout de la mme couleur et mme intensit_) ou cr_er deux pices (salon1 et salon2) que je dois g_rer ind_pendamment... Pas pratique du tout! Donc je reste sur la version 1 qui permet bcp plus de flexibilit_ (heureusement tjs disponible!)Je passe donc de 5*  3*J'utilise 20 ampoules pour info.Bye!!!
Waardeloze update. Bestaande scenes laden niet! (Na in loggen) App niet intuitief.
They need to work the kinks out of this before foisting it on us.  I want to be able to turn the lights on without reconnecting the app.
The Gen 2 app now refuses to even log onto my bridge. I've had to go back to the Gen 1 app to get control of my lights. Sort it out Philips!

The Gen 1 app worked fine but Gen 2 came along and I like new toys so happily gave it a go. Wish I hadn't bothered now and whomever designed this needs taking round the back of the Hue office and giving a good slap. Grouping lights by 'Room' is new and fair enough, I'll give it a try. But whereas Scenes in Gen 1 could control multiple lights in multiple rooms, with this I can't see any other way than one room at a time. It's a nightmare and frankly a massive step backwards in usability. I also have a Hue switch - before pressing one button could change any combination of my 18 lights anywhere in the house so with the four buttons that was loads of flexibility. But with this Gen 2 one, not possible. And to rub salt into the wound Philips have added a pop-up nag on the Gen 1 app that this new one is out. Yes it is, but it is rubbish and not a patch on the first one. Best advice, use the Gen 1 app and just swear to yourself every time that notification pops up. Dreadful app design. Avoid.

The new app has a revamped design which is much needed and appreciated. However the new app is missing the timer function from the gen1 app. Also it is more frequent to have connectivity issue with the hub, no matter at home or connect remotely.
Seriously.

I wish I did not uninstall the previous version.   The removal of scenes is unbelievably stupidRepeat for clarity. STUPIDHaving to spend hours redoing my lighting because of your decision to make a change WITHOUT taking into account you EXISTING Customers is just rude.How hard would it be to allow importing of previous scenes???If this is not resolved quickly I'm tossing this crap and buying from a mor stable and considerate supplier

So what gives with no iPad support in 2016?  I really love my Hue bulbs and I am decent with the old version of the App, but in the house tablet is way more convenient than the phone.  Why in the world would you not design this app out of the gate for parity device support to the Gen 1 app?

I'm very disappointed with the new app, especially the scenes functionality. I have created several custom scenes with the lights set exactly the way I want, and when I turn a scene on, the lights are not the colors that I set up. Plus, maybe I'm missing something, but I don't see an ability to edit the custom scenes I created. In addition, the home routine requires you to enter a scene. So I can have the lights set up exactly as I want, but when I leave and return they come back on with different settings (because the colors I set in the scene are not saving correctly). I can't believe Phillips would rollout an app with this many problems. Your QC department needs to be overhauled. I'm going back to the gen 1 app which works perfectly.
Lost the Apple Watch functionality!

Unglaublich, wie unausgegoren und unbersichtlich diese Nachfolge-App ist.Deshalb wurde sicher auch die alte App 'am Leben' gelassen, die mit ein bisschen Einarbeitung tadellos funktioniert (aber jetzt leider nicht mehr aktualisiert wird).
This app is slow, doesn't allow the selection of lights or the setting up of routines. Obviously not tested before release. Do not upgrade. Old app is much superior.

Design der neuen App gut! Alles andere ist aber ein Rckschritt! Fr den Preis von hue erwartet man hier mehr von Philips! Sehr entt_uschend!Szenen verschlechtert, allgemein Bedienung nicht intuitiv! Usabillity nicht gegeben! Alte Lampen lassen sich nur mit Mhe oder gar nicht mit der neuen Bridge ber die neue App koppeln.Philips da habt ihr einiges zu tun! Schnelles, vernnftiges Update sehr gewnscht!
Not user friendly. Stick to old app.
L'int_gration Works with Nest ne fonctionne pas correctement. Il vaudrait mieux r_cup_rer l'heure du r_veil natif iOS pour fixer les heures de routine "wake up".

This new Hue control app "looks" good, but just like a lot of the "fancy" looking websites and apps coded these days, the backend is full of bugs.  I downloaded it recently and I've had several issues.  The main issue is that it didn't seem to recognize an alarm I previously setup with the 1st Hue app.  It didn't even show up in the new app.  So now my lights go on and off per the previous alarm.  I had to go back into the 1st Hue App and erase the alarm.  Then I tried to setup a "routine" in this new app to replace the alarm and turn my lights on at 8:30PM and turn them back off at Midnight.  That wasn't working.  I finally figured out that somehow the app either initially created or set the 2nd routine to shut the lights off to "null" or "no" days of the week.  That isn't even a valid situation, why it saved it that way, I have no idea.   I mean, how much thought does it take to put something like "if ( daysoftheweek[] == null || daysoftheweek.size() < 1 ) then "don't save and warn user"???  Or something like that.I would code my own control app if I had time, I can't beleive how buggy this app is.

Beyond what others have said - limited functionality, losing all previous settings - my biggest frustrations is Siri integration: after taking ages to set it up (because of an existing bridge issue), it routinely just stops working - Siri no longer understands commands and I have to reset everything once more. Other homekit devices work fine... So this app or the Hue bridge is screwing things up.
They should pull this app it's unusable outside home and you have less control. I really regret deleting the old app that is a lot better than this one.

This new app appears great with a simple user interface. After setting up some rooms and the limits of the new app I've gone back to the previous version, which says a lot if you've settled for that experience. Very disappointing.
The widget doesn't work properly. It keeps saying the widget has no rooms, despite being set up to have rooms.

Terrible "update" to an app that used to work. Part of me wonders if this is Phillips way of forcing us all into buying the Hue switches since the app takes SO long to do a simple task such as turning off the bulbs. Additionally, it seems to always think I'm out of the home even when I've got a strong wifi connection within my home. I'm not purchasing anymore hue products if I don't see a fix to this problem soon.

I can not understand how you missed the mark so horribly with this app. You really did take one step forward and three back. The ability to organize by room is great. The inability to custom set light bulbs in a scene makes this app useless. The requirement to use a picture is horrible. Please stop trying to force scenes and let us create scenes based on whatever color per bulb we want across rooms. In my case, I just want a watch movie scene where I set my living room to blue on the back lights, off on front and dim my kitchen lights. It seems so easy and straight forward.

Nice attempt at adhering more towards HomeKit but you destroyed the widgets for me (and many other users) since you now limit the amount of rooms allowed in a widget. 4 rooms is just not enough, I want to scene my entire home so I need to be able to control all my rooms or lights. I have about 14 lights throughout 7 rooms. I don't care if it's less performant, I would rather that to no longer being fully functional since you decided more then four rooms was too slow. Or maybe add an advanced mode that lets users opt-in to controlling more then four rooms. And for other users fighting with HomeKit room name conflicts check out myHome+ as it allows you to manage room names.
I had to write my first review because this is unbelievably horrible.  How did anyone determine this was an acceptable product?  I can't even turn multiple lights on/off.

Sar esteticamente up to date ma funzionalit zero!!!  Non si pu aggiungere una luce in pi di una stanza. Ma se uno vive in un loft senza stanze ma zone. Come fa a creare ambientazioni veramente personalizzate? Molto meglio la 1. Gen. in pi succede che quando arriva una chiamata (stando a casa) si spegne una 'stanza'.  Pronto????  Ma ci siete o no. Creativit e funzionalit le avete persi per strada!!!!

This update is awful! Lots of functionality lost and buggy. Current frustration is that a morning routine that I programmed into my bedroom lamps is no longer visible in the app but is still active...meaning I have no way to turn it off. A step backwards.

First impression was good I set up my rooms and my lamps then I decide that I need to make custom modes for my lights I choose my photo - and the end - no options for lamps just shuffle I don't want to make it with luck I want to custom made it , also the brightness at 1% is to hi I will use the old one app :( or even better a third party :( bad support
Lenta, no conecta, no respeta las indicaciones que le das en la aplicacin. Definitivamente un fiasco! Me quedo con la aplicacin antigua mil veces

You can't share lamps between rooms and no grouping.Being able to change the color of all the lamps in a room at once is essential.Please give us a simple colorwheel instead of this fuzzy 2d chart.But it's an improvement of the first gen. app.
Deze app is geen enkele verbetering ten opzichte van de vorige app. Minder gebruiksvriendelijk, moeilijk scenes aan te maken, ...

Where are my scenes? How do I control all my lights at once? How do I get my widgets back? This is all nonintuitive in this app. Everything that worked in the old app is gone. I will be leaving the hue family. Thank you to this app for letting me realize I was stuck with ancient technology.
"Bring back my geofencing" - RuPaul

Overall I like the new app better.  Especially the ability to easily group lights into rooms and have room by room control.  A much needed upgrade.  I also really like the widget feature, and overall the UI is way improved.  I think the new scene builder is good.  I like the smart shuffle feature when using a photo to create a scene.  But not at the expense at the old pin drop interface that allowed you to set a light's color just by dropping its pin onto a photo.  Please bring the pin drop back.  Even worse however, is that there is no way to edit or update a scene once it's been created.  After making a change, you have to save it as a new scene, and delete the old one.  this is hugely problematic when adding additional lights or even when making minor adjustments.  Instead of one time update, once you've re-saved it, you have to go in and update all your widgets, routines, and switches with the newly saved scene.  This is really just awful.  The ability to edit a scene seems like app building 101 to me.  This has to be coming.  Right?  Please?  Still overall, I think it's headed in the right direction over the gen 1 app,

With the old app I would get a pop-up asking me to update every time I opened it, but every time I would try it would give me an update failed error. I was excited to see a new app because I thought it would fix this, but now I still can't update the app... And to make it worse the new app has no option to close the update screen. So I'm stuck with no functionality.

Bij het bewaren van de eerste keer opstarten vd app en kiezen voor woonkamer moet ik de app openhouden tijdens het 'bewaren' van het profiel. Na 4 minuten kansloos wachten afgesloten. Heb wel wat beters te doen.. Hoezo duurt het zo lang? Deed gen 1 app toch ook niet? Prutswerk Philips, huur eens een goeie appbouwer in!
Vind em fijn. HomeKit integratie is ook chill.Voor de boze mensen: de oude app is er ook nog gewoon.
Rooms zijn handig, maar scenes maken is een onduidelijk gebeuren waarbij bijna geen flexibiliteit mogelijk is... Geef mij de oude app maar.

Previous version allowed you to trigger a fade out starting immediately but for some reason you can only set up routines now ... which decides to turn your lights back on and then fade out at a designated time even after you've just turned them off. It's as if it was an app designed by a computer for a computer. As a result it doesn't offer much.

Well quite honestly it didn't, Elgato Eve fixed the problem I was having arranging my hue system within the rooms for Siri to understand where I am as Phillips took way to long keeping their app in line with the hardware progression. Secondly the hours I have spent perfecting and tweaking my scenes and they aren't even brought over to the new app... You can only seem to control one light at a time so using the new app leaves my rooms glowing slightly different shades... Thank goodness for open API otherwise hue would now be useless
Finally given up on the gen 2 app as I cannot login to my hue account, back to gen 1 and logged in no issues.
Absolutely love the new app. Amazing new UI and features. Love my HUE lights and this new version of the app compliments it massively.

The new app may look snazzy, but it is a lot less intuitive than the old. The difference between routines and wake up is unclear at best and even Google searches didnt provide a satisfactory explanation. The features which were so clear on the old app are now obscure. While Im sure that it can all be accessed when one knows how, I havent got a spare hour or two to try and figure it out. Id really just like the old app back if they cant produce a suitable new one.  Additionally, it seems to turn my routines off and/or delete them at will. Thats a lot of fun. Please note the sarcasm Philips.
Can't make scenes or save custom configurations. No more Apple Watch app either. What is the point of this newer app if it does so much less than the first one?

Perte des sc_narios qui permettaient de r_gler et de personnaliser au mieux son _clairageAucun int_rt s'utiliser cette application autant reprendre l'ancienne.Les nouveaux outils de param_trages ne permettent d'utiliser que 4 pices  la fois donc autant dire de Philips nous bride compltement dans l'utilisation de ses produits.

Definitely a step backwards. The Gen 2 app requires more steps/clicks to control your lights,  loses the ability to control lights individually withing a scene, and takes longer to find/setup switches and new lights. Not impressed.

I have literally never reviewed an app but after it taking MINUTES to turn off a light in my home for the umpteenth time I'm fed up.The concept they're going with is the right direction but the app is slow to respond: constantly reconnecting to my lights due to being out of the home connection (when sitting right next to my router), a problem the previous app never had. This causes a simple task such as turning lights on and off to take at least two minutes of waiting to connect and having to monitor to see if your change took effect. This issue persists when attempting to turn on a wake up with the added bonus of whatever selection you've made jumping to the bottom of the page, but I guess you know it worked when it does that? _I loved my hue system until this new app came out.
Pros: love the new interface and groupingsCons: no individual bulb control, no scenes, and no iPad support.AT LEAST ADD THE IPAD SUPPORT NEXT UPDATE!!!
Widgets used to not work. Now they do. Now don't mess up the app anymore, Philips.

Better then gen #1 app. My biggest wish: Either repeating scenes/alarms every x minutes. One set of lights in our house shall be always dimmed. Since Philips does not support custom default states the lights light up at 100%. So I have about 30 same alarms setting the lights every 30 mins to the desired dim level. 1 alarm repeated automatically every 30 mins (or even less) would help.Or just make the lights remember the last state when switched off/on with the wall switch.

1) custom widgets tell me "no associated room" 50% of the time2) WHY is it so hard to do simple things, like edit a theme and adjust its brightness. Why is theme management buried under Rooms->Room. It makes no sense. 3) please let us adjust the brightness of s theme so it sticks, i.e., brightness is low when clicking a widget3) photo based scenes is a nice gimmick, but don't make this the only way to make a scene..please. I want to make my own scene

Philips Hue team, does your UX designer even use the product? I think it's time to put your focus on APIs and incentivizing 3rd party development. Let someone else build the control app we're all looking for.

I've been trying this Version 2 of the Philips Hue app for several weeks now and it is simply awful. I've decided to sell by Hue bulbs on eBay and switch to something else because this app shows that Philips is totally lost in understanding their own product. This app is Philips' second attempt to integrate Hue into HomeKit. It fails. It loses all previously defined scenes from the first version of the app, because it can't import scenes -- either from Hue gen 1 or from HomeKit. Existing scenes are not modifiable, and you can't edit a scene once created.A problem that is definitely the app's fault is the Today screen widget. In the old app you could set existing scenes to be available in the widget. In the new version you have to individually create scenes just for the widget, even if they already exist. It's pointless extra work. These are just a few of the many frustrations. I am giving up on Hue.
Phillips took what was a functional app and destroyed it. No more grouping and the scene editing is ridiculously unintuitive. Way to go Phillips. I will be looking for a better app to use.
After finally setting up rooms and scenes and timers, a few weeks later I was greeted with the beautiful 'Setup' splash screen, yup, all gone.Thanks
The app is a great improvement but there needs to be a way to import my old scenes into the new app. Also I liked the old "color wheel" of the old app.

Je kan niet eens de helderheid van je scene's instellen dat moet je elke keer handmatig doen. Alles is raar geordend en moeilijk te vinden. Probeer iemand in dienst te nemen die enig verstand heeft van wat hij maakt?

I don't think I've ever used an app that's less intuitive. The last app wasn't perfect, but the concepts were there. Why not separate out the rooms, in the interface, then offer the various themes across rooms, in that same interface? It might also work to sell more bulbs, when people see that the majority of rooms aren't available to them.

I like the look of the new app, and I hope that over time the missing features that people have highlighted will be added in, however, under the old app my light routines (as they are now known) were 100% reliable whereas now some lights (if not entire rooms) don't turn off when they're supposed to. They all come on as expected but I've now got into the habit of manually turning them off at night otherwise I get up in the morning to find that the lights downstairs have been on all night _.

I don't know what the other reviewers are on about. This update is much cleaner and more logically set up than before. The lack of watch app is not a problem considering how bad the watch is at running third party apps.
Lost opportunity, prefer the old version
Jams se conecta a las luces, se queda en searching
Extremely buggy. This app changes the way it was previously organized making very confusing to manage lighting profiles. Can't log in with Google+ and can't set up things I had in the old App.
Since the last update conected lights are suddenly unavailablel and I am mysteriously logged out of my account.
Hue1 ist um Welten besser!!!
Durable !
Shitty app. Enuf said

Gut ist, dass man endlich R_ume definieren kann. Unbedingt wieder integriert werden sollte:1: Zufalls an/aus einzelner Lampen2: Warum kann man keine Szenen mehr mit fest zugewiesenen Farben erstellen? Das mach doch Hue aus!!!3: Warum kann man keine R_ume zu einer Szene mehr zusammenfassen? 4: Warum gibt die app kein feedback bei Verlassen des Hauses? 5: Warum sind die Routinen auf 4 R_ume beschr_nkt?All das war in der ersten App (nach und nach) schon umgesetzt. Wenn man jetzt eine neue durchsetzten will, sollten diese Funktionen wieder hergestellt werden und die Leute nicht als Betatester missbraucht werden! Bitte nicht nachlassen; Hue an sich ist Klasse!

Nee lekker dit. App slaat niks op en kan alles weer opnieuw instellen (al mijn oude settings zijn 'weg') is deze app wel getest? Dit breng je toch niet uit? Resultaat: allemaal slechte beoordelingen en gerriteerde klanten.

The new app is good. Many improvements over the gen1 app like rooms, more scenes available (love the night light!), routines and more options with locations.Remarks:The app is iPhone only. Come on Philips, where is the native iPad app?!?I don't miss the watch app, Siri works great from the watch and even native apps on the watch are too slow still. Would like the option to have glance on the watch with the same widgets.Must have: turn on lights/scenes based on sunrise or sunset.Want to have: control more than 3 rooms with a widget.
Dit betreft geen upgrade maar een downgrade. Alle settings uit gen1 zijn weg. Lampen zijn niet meer in een groep te koppelen.

Een enorme downgrade in heel veel opzichten! Buiten functies die missen versus de oude app is ook versie 1 kreupel geraakt!! Siri werkt niet meer op een aantal scenes en wanneer ik die wil heractiveren, zij er 'te veel lampen in de scene'. Het was een mooie en veelzijdige app (versie 1 dus) en TOTAAL verkracht door deze nieuwe app!! Zorg dat de oude backwards compatible wordt en de volledige functionaliteit terug krijgt! Echt waardeloos dat je na zoveel geld en moeite om alles precies te hebben zoals je wilt, verdeeld over meerdere apparaten alles weer opnieuw kan doen. Extra frustrerend is dan ook nog eens dat bepaalde functies gewoon verdwenen zijn.
Where is the option to edit the lights?

Absolute disgrace of an update. Our home is essentially a modern smart home. Everything is linked up with each other and all devices seem to work seamlessly with each other. Since upgrading to the new Generation 2 application, I had experienced a strange bug which turns on all the lights in the morning. Waking to a screaming daughter who is confused by the lights, I went through the settings to see if there were any new default routines settings such as home and away, wake up, go to sleep or any other routines, but all were blank. We did have the home and away setting turned on but disabled this hoping the problem would go away but the next night, she was awake from the lights again. We've since replaced the lights in her room with normal LED ones, and think we'll be replacing every bulb we have (which is a fair few across the house) with Lifx

How has this been allowed to be released? This is not just a case of changing from the 1st Gen App (which was far from perfect) to a "2nd Gen." Why a totally new app install was required anyway is beyond me. Given on the surface only a bodged UI and fewer Scenes exist, who knows who thought it necessary. Authentication for Friends with Hue simply doesn't work, my connection to Nest rendered useless. Very unintuitive user flow and menus.

It's not as horrendous as I'm reading in the reviews, but the app still needs work, it's pretty but not wholly intuitive. Changing the colour of my bulbs takes too many taps than it should. Maybe gen 3 will be the one that is what everyone wants.

App is under developed and should not have been released in current state. The idea of a 2.0 app is to improve on the first app - not make a worse one. I suggest you remove this app from the store, develop it further then re-release.

Are we supposed to keep both apps now?! I have to re download the old app just to name and find which light is l which. There needs to be instructions on how to set everything up. The app is functional but just no setup this makes no sense on why there can't be a simple app.
STILL no dusk timer activation and limited to four rooms on routines and scenes.  What an utter failure.  Philips needs to fire whoever is in charge of their application dev team.
This app is visually much better than Gen 1. That is the only good thing about it. Everything else falls short of the original. Get iConnectHue instead.

Nothing but trouble. Nothing ever works. The app is terrible.

Why would I want to use this new app when it won't import all the scenes and timers I've already spent hours making!! Fix this aspect and I may come back. Also you can't control each individual light color for scenes! You can just hit shuffle? What a joke! The fact that they say they won't support the old app anymore enrages me. Just improve on the old app! You know like most companies in the world! Your users have spent hours setting up each room the way they want and now you're essentially deleting this work they've put into your product to show off to other possible customers. Please listen to your users. The majority of them are all saying the same thing about your new app. You might want to listen to them.
The wedges do not work , the app it's not very responsive.
Can't group bulbs. Can't turn off scenes from widget.Very disappointed. Hoping the old app continues to work. This new version is terrible.

The timers and the individual light controls and the ability to make easy recipes for groups of lights was what made this system awesome. And then you hosed it! Thank goodness the old app still works for now. To the developers - perhaps you could recruit some actual users to test your next efforts?
Fix this mess.  If I could give it ZERO stars, I would.  Not user friendly and, for one, can't figure out how to change colors on lights anymore.
Room set up is nice, but can't create new scenes. This is a work in process. I will use old app as long as possible

... als viel Rezensionen vermuten lassen. Dass der Dimmer Switch sich endlich die letzte Einstellung merkt und sich mehrere Szenen nacheinander auf den Einschalter legen lassen, ist endlich die lang ersehnte L_sung fr einfache Stimmungslicht-Wechsel. Leider ein totaler Rckschritt. Keine iPad Untersttzung, keine WatchApp mehr. Warum k_nnen Szenen nur noch Lampen in einem Raum betreffen und nicht raumbergreifend?
Leider eine absolute Verschlimmbesserung zur Vorg_ngerversion. Gute Funktionen fehlen und das Design ist im Style von Apps der Anfangsphase. Hoffentlich kann man die alte App noch lange nutzen.
Room support and a much better way of organizing and creating scenes. Sorry to hear about the lack of iPad support though. I'm sure it's coming.

Diese App bietet MINIMALE Verbesserungen gegenber der vorherigen Version. Die M_glichkeit, R_ume zu definieren und der Go To Sleep Modus klingen interessant. Das erkauft man sich aber teuer. Einzige halbwegs weise Entscheidung von Philips ist es, uns die alte App gelassen zu haben. Hoffentlich werden die Features mit der Zeit Nachgereicht.

Een nieuwe app zonder enige meerwaarde. De eerste app blonk al niet uit, maar de nieuwe is wel heel slecht. Qua gebruiksvriendelijkheid, vormgeving en communicatie. Echt weer de 'vertrouwde' Philips visie, denken vanuit zichzelf en niet vanuit de gebruiker. Philips: THINK DIFFERENT!
In de oude app heb ik een mooie sequence van uitgekiende scenes gemaakt voor elke dag. Geen van mijn favoriete scenes en deze sequence is overgezet. Ik blijf de oude gebruiken...

Previous version was simple, user intuitive and working. This one is exactly the opposite on all 3.If you dont know how to improve something at least leave it as it stands...I guess the developers and managers leave on their own planet and just wanted to create something and justify their salary......it just could not have been worse, Philips you should be ashamed

Got a message on Hue app to download new version and take it from me, it's not worth the effort it takes to press download . Every time I open the app it can't find the bridge, the format is complicated and the default scenes are awkward to use. I have now deleted the new app and gone back to using the old one. COME ON PHILLIPS. You have had around 500 out of me for these bulbs, now give me something to operate them with that's worth my investment .
If you have the original Hue app, keep it. This new one forces you to redo/re-add EVERYTHING.If you have a choice, avoid this app.

Really?? Put out an updated app that totally wipes out all my lights' previous settings?? Do you realize what it takes to reset 50 bulbs throughout a house?? What bonehead thought this up?? For the price we pay for these bulbs, maybe I need to send Philips a bill for my time to re-program all my lights.I really hate you right now Philips. Next time... Do some actual user-testing before putting another app out.

I love the UI of the app but Scene Sharing is missing and the app has a lot of glitches. Widgets just have an error saying "No room selected, open app." Phillips you're on the right track but this feels still very much in beta.

Is Phillips a start up?! How can software this bad be developed and published at a serious and established company?Explain this Phillips.... how is it possible that you cannot control the specific color of a group of lights!?!? Through you app there is no way to set - for example - all your living room lights to...... pink! Or blue! Or green! Yes you can set the lights individually to whatever color you please but not a group of lights all at once!? And no, your abysmal repertoire of silly themes is not a replacement to a good old color wheel! Are you kidding? I mean how more basic can you get!? If it weren't for third party apps I would have taken the bulbs right back to the store. Nonsense.

The first version of the app was clunky and bad but the new one rebuilds it from the ground up to be every bit as clunky and bad. It is probably the single least intuitive app I use on a regular basis. For instance, I FINALLY kind of figure out how to build my own light recipes. Then I find out that they only apply to one room. As far as I can tell, there's no way to have them apply to my other rooms/lights.So I decided to look it up. There is ZERO documentation that I can find that explains how to use this piece of crap. I assume that's because Philips can't figure it out either.

This is a review for folks migrating from the old Hue app to the new app.  This review is not going to be helpful to new users. The old axiom is very true in this case; if it ain't broke, don't fix it!  The "update" migrates the functionality to HomeKit, but it loses so many of the things that you may have had on the old app.  I cannot find my old scenes.  Some lights are missing. Some new devices are also gone. It is almost impossible to navigate around the functions and it is extremely frustrating trying to make normal things like controlling individual lights a hassle!  I hope the update will resolve these problems.

Who is writing this app? It is terrible now.  It was easy to create scenes in the last version with the color pallet and you could group lights together. You could set on/off alarms.Know it is called routines.  (Most people are not going to understand it) All I want to do is set timers/alarms when my light turn on and have the ability to create scenes with colors and group my light together not pictures (that could be an option).   JUST make it simple.  Siri still does not work, that was the only reason I upgraded to the new bridge in January.   Hue lights are fantastic the App is Horrible.   Make it simple and easy to use.

This used to be a decent to good app. The app developers have destroyed it and made it functionally useless. It is a convoluted piece of garbage that has done nothing but complicate my life. Still using gen one.

I wrote a long, detailed review of this app but deleted it because it's not necessary to go into it all.  The fact is, this app removes all of the customizations I've made over YEARS with these lights.  It's not just a UI shift, it's the removal of literally all of the fun features I loved.  I can't imagine that HomeKit is so limiting, and frankly if it is Phillips should rethink their participation in it.  This 'upgrade' has actually made me angry.  It's really that bad.

I'm not sure of any app whose update has actually rendered its product unusable. It MUST be an intentionally defective app for business purposes; there is honestly no other reason they could have released this.
Why does the old app on my iPad keep telling me get the new app when the new app isn't even available for an iPad!?!?! FAIL

I wish I could give this crappy app 0 stars. Nothing on it works, and it just keeps getting worse. We have paid hundreds of dollars for these lights, and Philips puts out crap like this for us. Thanks a lot.

In the app itself, lights turn on, lights turn off. Good.Widgets? Don't work. Lights do not turn on, do not turn off. Bad.Bad, hue, bad. Widgets used to work in the old app. Now they don't. The end.

The new app has more functionality in terms of alarms and grouping things into rooms. But it's way less intuitive in how you control your lights. I can't just access the lights, I have to access rooms and within rooms I hear you can only access one light at a time. Controlling the lights is what I mainly use this app for - setting alarms is more rare. And I also only have three lights .. The previous version was way better for this.I can't help but get a feeling someone tried to save money or design by committee when it comes to this app ...

1) custom widgets tell me "no associated room" 50% of the time2) WHY is it so hard to do simple things, like edit a theme and adjust its brightness. Why is theme management buried under Rooms->Room. It makes no sense. 3) please let us adjust the brightness of s theme so it sticks, i.e., brightness is low when clicking a widget

The fact that I can only assign lights to one room, and only one style per room... The fact that I cannot import my old scenes...The fact that the other Hue app tells me to download this one now every time I open it...The fact that my old Hue app no longer dims my scenes after the last AND FINAL update...... MASSIVE FAILShame on you Philips, you got it wrong the first time and then you made it even worse.

You force an update on those who have the 2.0 Bridge only to take away features like Alarms and Scenes?  This app is not intuitive and you lose all the ease of customizing the way you want to run your own lights. Fire the ones responsible for creating this new app immediately.
This is worse than the previous app. I can't turn off my lights by just sliding it until the light is off. It does look nice in but it is not its saving grace.

1) no iPad support. 2) only does room-scenes, no multi-room scenes. 3) can't group lights to use same exact color. 4) scene switching is laggy, sometimes five seconds delayed. 5) doesn't import your scenes from previous app.

Your new app is horrible - no landscape mode and it takes forever to save a "room". I don't see how to import scenes from the previous app. Your bulbs have been $60 for years. Another company will win this space.

This app update doesn't address any improvement at all and I consider myself a power user. No way to sign in unless on home wifi. I store this app in my useless file and use the old app as long as it works.
You have to wonder whether the coders have got a Hue setup at home, or whether they just mess about with this stuff in the office. Version 1 wasn't great, but at least it works.
Apple Watch support is missing from the new gen 2 app. Please re-instate as soon as possible.
Store forbedringer fra forrige app, gleder meg til iPadversjonen kommer.N er mye mer integrert slik at du slipper  installere halvintegrerte tredjepartsapper for f.eks. oppvkningsfunksjon
Parece mais lento e, pra piorar,  est sem a verso para AppleWatch!
Leide nicht fr das iPad verfgbar. Hoffentlich wird das mit dem n_chsten Update nachgeliefert.
Leider kann ich aus der App keine erfolgreiche Anmeldung bei meethue herstellen. Schade! Das hat bei Gen1 besser funktioniert!
???? Was soll das?
C'est un vrai progrs. Mais il manque encore l'application pour Apple Watch, mais surtout pour iPad. Sinon beaucoup plus facile  utiliser. Et "flat design"
What a stupid app.
Where the heck is the Apple watch app!?!?! I like this new app. It's easy and simple, but i no longer have a watch app.

I didn't get very far with this "updated" version. I don't understand any of these apps that won't rotate into landscape mode. I use my iPad with a keyboard folio & I want them to rotate into that view. The previous version rotates so I will continue to use that one.

One iOS device with the widget "off" state works from a previously created room setup... Other devices have issues turning off the lights after this current update....  The   function for dimming has better aesthetics on this app... _
The overall look is much improved over three previous app, but many other functions like logging in, pairing with Nest, etc just fail in weird ways that make it feel like they never tested the app.

The previous app allowed you to create a single button in iOS' Notification Center that either turned the lights on or off. (Y'know, like a real light switch.)This app? You need to create two separate buttons. One to turn the light on. One to turn it off.How is the new app less convenient and less smart than the original? Unbelievable.It is pretty obvious that nobody at Philips actually uses their own products.

All right folks I have read a lot of negative reviews about this new Hue app 2.0.  I am still doing a lot of experimenting and may update this review but there are some very cool things about it! I have a heck of a lot of Hue lights and devices that ended up requiring two different bridges to keep things unclogged.First off I was very surprised that when Philips released this they did not release an iPad version. Really? I always use my iPad and I want the extra resolution which would allow for more information on the screen.  Hopefully that will be coming very soon!Second, no instructions or user guide for a very confusing new revamp of an application? Are you kidding me?OK rant off.  What I really like is the new functionality they have given the Hue touch switches.  Now I can activate up to five different scenes just by the touch of the same button on one switch!  This is very cool because now in my home theater I can virtually run through all my various scenes with just one switch.  Again I had to learn how this switch behavior works just by trial and error. So if I hit the switch once it activates scen one I can now dim seen one or a turn it off. If I want scene two I press the button twice and it activates scene two.  There is no timing in between when you have to press it once or twice. The only way it seems to reset is if you press the off switch on the device.  So this little hidden Jim is very useful to me and is not even brought up in the announcement. As far as I could tell. I may be wrong. Also it seems that the switching is quicker and more reliable.  That's about it for now.

When I noticed that I couldn't import the many scenes I had set up for the 20+ Hue lights in my home, I was getting suspicious. Surely Philips didn't remove the ability to create groups and customize colors by bulb in favor of a simplified 'room' feature for beginners? Alas, that's exactly what happened. For example, I had a light grouping for a display case that let me turn on and change settings for six light strips (that together lit the display) in the old app. Now I can no longer select that display unless I make it a room, and I can no longer match or tune the colors to my liking.I'm reverting to the legacy app. It lacks the more modern UI, but it provides the customization that got me to buy into Hue in the first place. I get what you were trying to do, app devs. But the dropped features make this app useless for your most avid users. The original app had major flaws -- but even though you fixed some of the most egregious UI issues, you lost some of the most powerful features that I use every day. Please update and restore! Also: psssst, iPads exist.
What was wrong with old app?I can see improvements to that app, an update but to completely redesign the app which forces me to redo everything is just plain Stupid.
Needs to allow us to import everything we had from the original app. Also doesn't allow enough personalization with new scenes. I'll use to old one for now.

Room setups are cool, but I could not find any panel/control that allowed you to control ALL lights in a single location. Gen 1 had this, why was it removed? I guess you could make a "room" with all lights, but you still have to drill down multiple times on each individual light. Going to continue using gen 1 app.

First, I'd like to start off by saying I love Hue lights. I've recommended them to friends and family, and even bought a set for my sister for Christmas. I don't love them blindly either, as I've tested/used other smart lighting systems over the years such as Lifx, WeMo, etc. Other bulbs I've used, however, exhibited strange flashing issues, tend to overheat or disconnected frequently. I haven't experienced that with Hue lights for the 4 years I've owned them. Now to the app... This app is poorly designed, missing numerous customer requested features, and the features that are included barely work if at all. If this was a first attempt, ok... But Philips, you should have a sleek, rock solid app by now. Your hardware as proven itself to me, but if the software interface "controlling" it doesn't work or is a pain to use, what's the point?! The previous version of the app wasn't pretty, but at least it functioned properly. Since I installed this app, I've experienced numerous disconnects, unresponsive bulbs, and an inability to establish a Home/Away connection. The settings that do seem to respond are so cumbersome that I've resorted to downloading a 3rd party app just so I can use my lights. I feel that Philips Bulb users have been patient up until this point, and we deserve better. This attempt leads me to believe that you hired some high school students to design/implement the app as a school project. Except that's insulting to high school students. Fix this app, and make it better.

The first app was decent - allowed you to make scenes across multiple rooms, utilizing all the potential of these amazing bulbs. It was a little cloogy, but eventually it was possible to get it set up as you wanted it.The 'new' version has some visual upgrades to the app, but severely limits what is possible with the lights. Scenes are now these ridiculous pre-set things with no individual color control, and there is a limit of 4 rooms for timers. It's completely crippling the potential for the lights. Find another controller - this one is laughable.

The new look takes some getting used to, but is really nice once you get the hang of it. Unfortunately There is no way to easily transfer the scenes from gen 1 to gen 2. Only by selecting the scene in gen 1 then switch to gen 2 and safe it again. Geofencing works very poor, the lights do turn off when I leave home but do not come on again when I return. The app does not give me any notifications of its actions so I have to open the app to check if the lights are actually been turned off. There is no support for the watch, although the old watch app was incredibly slow and for that reason I didn't use it I was hoping that gen 2 finally made it useful, not. So many missed chances in this new app. I probably keep using gen 1 for a while until gen 2 gets updated with the bug fixes and the gen 1 features.
Wat waardeloos! Eerst versie vele malen beter. Nu verbindingsproblemen en bugs. Bridge niet te vinden en ook geen Apple watch ondersteuning.
Na de laatste update van de Hue app is bediening via de Hue Tapp niet meer mogelijk! Heb contact gezocht met Philips Hue via een bericht op facebook, wacht nog op feedback.

I had some very simple scenes and geofencing customs on the Gen-1 App and I was very happy.This Gen-2 app is just terrible, function that existed in the Gen-1 simply isn't there anymore.  What's that all about ?  This app isn't an upgrade to the original app it's just different and inferior.  I for one won't be using this app until they get it sorted.  Minimally you have to be able to do with his app what could be done with the first one and that's currently not the case.If you don't want to be frustrated then avoid it for now.

This is a new front to the same old broken application, now with extra bugs! I have a very simple setup yet it's so difficult to manage with this app.Managing scenes is really unintuitive. The obvious place to add scenes (Scenes, tap +) only allows you to create by shuffling colours on a photo, which is never useful. It took some time to find how to set the lights for a scene myself. You also can't edit the settings for the built-in scenes (or if you can it's very well hidden).Setting up Siri control was a struggle. It wouldn't link up, I had to reset various settings & the bridge multiple times and made 2 calls to support which ended in nobody knowing what was wrong and recommending I have the bridge hardware replaced. Then it just started working the day after. When you inevitably need to reset everything for one reason or another, you have the pleasure of creating all your scenes & routines from scratch, because there's no way to save your preferences (imagine if there were an accompanying web service we logged in to where this could be stored?)Please put more effort into making sure things work smoothly than making it pretty!
BITTE DEN TIMER WIEDER HINZUFGEN _ DANKE
Hue Gen 2 ist eine Zumutung, als h_tte man das Ziel gehabt alles Gute der ersten Version zu verschlechtern

I had hoped that Philips would have built upon their first app to provide better functionality and an improved UI. Instead we got this 2nd gen disappointment. Not only did they scrap half of your default scenes (some of which were quite good), but they also won't let you port over any of my saved scenes. Stick with the old app, this new app is terrible.
old version is WAY better!dont waste your time downloading this app______________________________________

Das Speichern des ersten Zimmers mit meinen Lampen dauert nicht "etwas". Es dauert ewig und kommt nie zu Ende. Von daher leider total nutzlos. Gut, dass die alte App noch existiert und tadellos funktioniert.
Die Lampen lassen sich in den Szenen als Voreinstellung nicht einzeln einstellen.

I never write reviews, but this time I have to express how awful this app is. All I want to do is choose my own colors and have them turn on at one time and off at another. Not even that is possible with this terribly constructed app. Absolutely pitiful!

It's been very frustrating getting this new app set up. I had to recreate all of my scenes. I had to wait for an update to be able to sign into my account and use location based features. The old version had widgets that could turn off lights with a second tap but this one doesn't do that. Editing existing scenes seems to not be possible. Creating scenes is one of the least intuitive things I've done on my iPhone. They started from scratch and forgot to include the things that worked well with the original app.

After spending weeks learning Hue and creating my personal scenes, Philips decides to change the app and not at all appreciate or respect consumers who invested time tailoring to their preferences. Again large company development completely ignores consumer needs.

I agree with others who have shelled out hundreds on their Philips lighting system only to be completely disappointed by this horrible app. This is the BEST you can do? Philips, I can see your developers' effort and what you were attempting to do but this is a complete failure. Why in God's name would you release it before it was ready? I've had nothing but problems since trying (and finally succeeding) to set it up. I urge everyone to hold onto that old Hue app. At least it works as it's supposed to!!! This thing is a mess, works only part of the time, and was so not ready for release. Totally disgusted. I'm deleting it and sticking with the old app, supported or not. It may be lame, but at least it works. I'll wait to try this one again. Philips, please, for heaven's sake, wait till you get them right before releasing all the fixes for this mess.

Why on earth would you stop using your old app which was optimized for the iPad when the new one isn't??Mind = blownPlease fix this.  I hate having to "zoom in" on an app that was made for the iPhone.

If I could give this update zero stars, I would. What happened to the screen where I can control all of the lights at once? And you if you forget which light # is in which room, you are screwed. Once the "rooms" were set up, and I realized we mistakenly thought light #2 was in the bedroom, I couldn't figure out how to switch it to the living room. Shame on you Phillips. This upgrade is AWFUL.

If I could figure how to give this app 1/4 of 1 star I would. One star is giving it too much credit. Where did the Apple Watch widgets go?  WHY MAKE THAT GO AWAY?  I can't log in with the new app, wheel just spins and spins. This means I can't use my geofencing which is huge to me. This app is a definite downgrade from the old app. I know most people don't like change but I like to fiddle with apps and love when things are organized and intuitive and user friendly. This app is NONE of those. Who writes these for you Phillips?  Hopefully updates will roll out quickly to patch together this poorly produced product.

It took forever to figure out how to use the app. Focusing on rooms is extremely limiting for me and it gets confusing if you just want a button to control certain lights. Speaking of widgets....the widgets on the pull down screen periodically forget there's a room attached to them so to get it to work I have to reopen the app, hit edit, hit save and then the widget works. Not terribly efficient. All in all the app needs serious improvements.

What the hell did you do Hue? You took a mediocre app and made it completely useless.  And to boot you trashed all my old settings and scenes.  I can even figure out how to change the light colors to what I want.  Bravo on a poor UI and poor upgrade experience.  Your product and UX team should be fired.  They went for sexy features like geolocation but lost sight of keeping the main functions simple. If it was possible to give less that 1 star I would.

I work in UX. Where the f*** are the scenes? The provided ones are generic and lame. This app is a massive downgrade on features and control. A Clean UI redesign doesn't mean a good experience. What made the last app useful was the scenes. Terrible oversight.
No longer have individual dimming control. Only on/off. A problem.
This app is absolutely terrible. Why? Why did you break what already worked just fine? The list of limitations here is just staggering. I want the old app back.

The fact that Philips deployed this as a new app, next the the previous Hue app says it all. They add new functionality that was not available in the previous app, such as support for rooms, but at the same time, crippled key features such as the creation and use of scenes.In the 1st generation app, one used to be able to have full control over scenes. One could easily select which lights to include in a scene, and which color to assign to a light. This no longer seems possible in the new app. I can only create a scene for a room, and scene colors are entirely determined by the photo I select.Also, when coming home, the new app allows me to turn on the lights room by room. In the previous version I was able to select a scene which gave me perfect control over which lights could be turned on.I can only hope that this app is a wrok in progress, and the Philips will enventually transfer scene functionality from their old app to this app. Otherwise, this app is doomed.
Helaas wat een misser. Ik vind de App echt super onoverzichtelijk. Hoe moelijk kan het zijn om een goede App te maken??

Heel veel negatieve reviews. Ik vind dit persoonlijk een ENORME vooruitgang. De vorige app was qua User Interface gericht op hobbyisten. Deze app is toegankelijk voor iedereen in het huis. Eindelijk is het mogelijk geworden om met een simpele handeling de lampen in een kamer aan of uit te doen en te dimmen. En voor techneuten is er generation 1
Na installeren en kwartier proberen meteen weer terug naar generatie 1. Dan maar iedere keer de spam wegklikken. Duur systeem en dan zo'n waardeloze app. Ga u schamen Philips!

Voelt echt als een eerste beta poging, en ik vind dat voor een bedrijf dat lampen van 50 per stuk verkoop echt diep onder de maat. De app is nog behoorlijk buggy en crashed geregeld. Deze app zou alle 3rd party apps overbodig moeten maken, in plaats daarvan zijn er gewoon beter apps in de app store. Ook de HomeKit koppeling laat nog veel te wensen over.Aanvulling: diep diep teleurgesteld. Ook andere apps, zoals de ambilight + hue app werken na deze update niet meer. Ik ga weer downgraden, zowel in app als bridge.
Flot design, men man kan ikke flytte alle sine scener med over i denne app. Jeg gider ikke starte forfra. Det en ommer!
Unstable connection.
Muy mala
It doesn't work!It finds my bridge and asks me to push the button but it never connects.I am still using the previous app.
Amazing product.. One of the best purchases in my life.. Very fun app it makes capturing beautiful scenes that much more interesting
Some great new features. Unfortunately all the best features from gen 1 app are gone. Essential features are missing. I had to switch back to gen 1.

Was fr ein Rckschritt! Was ist mit den vorhandenen Profilen, muss ich dafr wirklich die alte App behalten!? Fr Neukunden mag es okay sein, aber Bestandskunden, die sich Ihr zuhause bereits eingerichtet haben wohl eher eine Klatsche!
hallo ihr Profis - es gibt auch iPads . . .
Der Hammer ist die alte App wird abgeschaltet

Schickes neues Design aber es fehlen ein paar Funktionen wie zB die Lichter besser anordnen. Man kann die aufweckzeit nur auf mindestens 10min stellen das mir zu lange ist. Zudem fehlt das Fading das das Licht ganz langsam an macht. Heute morgen bin ich dadurch fast aus dem Bett gefallen. Das gr_te Problem was ich habe ist das die Fernverwaltung fast nicht mehr geht ber Lte. Bekomm keine Verbindung mehr ber "mein hue" und Lichter reagieren dadurch nicht mehr. In der Gen 1 App l_uft noch alles gut ....

Ich frage mich immer wieder warum so eine Weltfirma geile Produkte hat aber bei Software immer wieder total versagt. Sorry aber bitte leistet euch endlich gute Programmierer!Man kann hier nicht einmal entspannt(!) die Helligkeit fr Routinen einstellen, die Voreinstellungen passen oft nicht auf die Wnsche und es ist fast nicht m_glich eigene nah pers_nlichen Wunsch anzulegen, da die Regler oft einfach zurck springen. Da ging die alte Version besser. Genauso mit den Geotacking.Bitte gebt euch doch mal ein wenig mehr Mhe und durchdenkt was ihr programmiert besser - das kann euch doch selbst nicht glcklich machen!?Teuer genug waren die Lampen ja, da kann man doch auch ordentliche Software voraussetzten. Danke an die Hardware-SpezisBitte geht an die Software-"Spezis"

The theme for this release must have been, "let's make it material design-ish and forgo a ton of features to get it out the door."This disgraceful 2nd generation of the app is complete junk! Among the features they tossed out was iPad support. It seems like the Hue software has consistently gone downhill as time as passed - time to seriously consider other non-Hue options in this space.Given the Hue price point (expensive compared to alternatives), you think the apps would not be complete garbage.
This app was obviously written by someone trying to make a design statement and not someone who uses Philips light bulbs. Would give zero stars if possible.
I really like the grouping based on rooms.  I also like the routines.  In addition it's easier to pick colors for a particular light bulb.  Overall a big step forward.

Looks great until you realize you can't use any of your scenes from Gen 1.  What could they possibly have been thinking??  We have many custom colors in our home and the new app makes it impossible to use them.  Rating will improve if they add that feature, otherwise I will not be using Gen 2.ALSO:  don't update your Hue Gen 1 app or you'll start getting reminders to switch to this new inferior version.  Seriously reconsidering the investment I've made in this technology.

I don't know if I want to throw my phone against the wall or just return this POS hue system I just bought. The new app is not user friendly, it's difficult to set-up, Siri commands do not work, and there's no support for AppleWatch. I've used the hue system on App gen 1 with a HomeKit enabled bridge for several months with no issues. Trying to set one up for my family's cottage is ridiculously frustrating with this app. What a regressive 'update.' I would give this app 0 stars if I could.

This version is less functional than the original version of Hue. What was Phillips thinking?Scenes have to be created for each room individually?? No individual control for a bulb without creating more "rooms"???Even the widget is worse. It used to be you could turn on or off a room with one item. Now you need a button to turn on a room and another to turn it off. Seriously??I used to be able to create a scene that with the tap of one widget icon/button turned off my Hue lights except one, and that one was turned to a nightlight mode for movie watching. Phillips app designers need to wake up and pay attention to detail.

Read the reviews before downloading this app. In the infinite wisdom of Philips Hue they updated their gen1 app to gen2. I tried gen2 lost some of the functionality I had before so I switched back. Gen2 is clumsy to use and difficult to use. Read the reviews before you proceed. Gen1 has apps for the iPad but gen2 does not. Philips has notified their customers gen1 app will no longer be supported I will not buy their products.

Today I called Phillips to get instructions on previous review. What a pain. I'm going to use the old app until it fails. You must transfer each scene one at a time. Phillips people may make good bulbs but they need to hire out app app development. Why is there no way to move my existing light recipes to your new app. I'll use the old one idiots. I'm not going to recreate everything. And those that say use the hue online. That just duplicated everything.
La grafica  carina ma in definitiva l'app risulta molto pi macchinosa e poco pratica pessima la gestione delle scene

Ho installate una ventina di lampade per certi aspetti la nuova versione risulta pi funzionale l'assurdit sta nel fatto che prima quando uscivo da casa c'era la possibilit di poter spegnere tutte le luci ora invece  limitata a solo 4 zone (io ho 10 zone)!!! La version 2 du logiciel a perdu les fonctions de gestion des couleurs si faciles  mettre en uvre. La gestion par pice n'apporte que peu de nouvelles possibilit_s. Retour  la version 1.

De 2 meest ergerlijke omissies:- Geen iPad ondersteuning- Widgets gaat alleen aan, en niet meer uit.Je voelt je door dit soort dingen als klant gewoon niet serieus genomen, en dat is best erg voor zo'n verder prima product.Positief punt:- De bediening is wel echt veel beter en logischer dan gen 1 app
Na de update geen verbinding meer. Krijg lampen niet meer toegevoegd. Lekker
Je kan niet eens de helderheid van je scene's instellen dat moet je elke keer handmatig doen
Nu voor de 10e keer probeert hij de bridge te updaten, steeds mislukt het. Net was ie bijna klaar en faalt hij alweer. Man ik wordt er gek van!
Phillips made a pleasant app very difficult. The old app was good, this version is really bad. Why make somethings that works painfully difficult?
Hue app generatie 2 is momenteel de beste die er is voor het bedienen van je verlichting in huis, het is een mooie en duidelijke app! bedankt Philips!
