What happened? Software generally gets better over time, but not this steaming pile of fail. It started pretty bad and just got worse with this update.

Worthless POSSpent thousands of dollars on their devices and the Idiots can't even make an app that works. Can't even add a single room."Max rooms" error yet not even a single room added"import from HomeKit" Doesn't workFIRE ALL YOUR PROGRAMMERS AND SEND THEM TO THE GALLOWS THEY ARE IDIOTS
Lost all settings and useful features from previous version. Is this app some kind of joke?!

Only plus is the ability to create rooms and assign lights.  The rest is worthless. You cannot control individual lights without setting them in rooms and all of my created scenes are nowhere to be found. Please update and add back scenes and the ability to control each light separately. I will continue to use old app until fixed.

I love the Philips hue lights, I have them all around my apartment. They're definitely the best option out there for app controlled, color changing led lights, but for a price of course. The apps on the other hand are awful. While I didn't mind the first app (even though it definitely had its faults), this new app is just frustrating and worse than the first. Simply changing a scene is much more complicated and annoying when compared to the first app. I'm just sticking with the original app until they make this one less crap.

I love that hue are taking another look at their app but the essence of simplicity disappears in their new Hue app. What made the original app so incredible was its simplicity of creating, customizing & quickly being able to choose the scene you wanted just by launching the app. Unfortunately this app has gone backwards losing the essence of simplicity & quick actions that made it so easy to use beforehand. Hope to see them innovate further & listen to the reviews.
Is this a serious attempt at producing a commercial app? Very glitchy and slow response. And why no iPad version. Very poor.
A confusing 'upgrade' which doesn't seem as good as the original. Scenes don't come across and are much harder to create and access (and not intuitive). No Apple Watch app.

Das Update l_st nicht das grosse Glcksgefhl in der Bedienung der Lampen aus. Das geht noch besser. Der Zugriff und die Steuerung einzelner Lampen ist viel zu kompliziert. Gruppen sind auch schlecht steuerbar wenn man 2 R_ume kreiert hat und die Lampen kombinieren m_chte je nach Situation, als Widget geht das, in der App nicht. Die App fr das iPad fehlt auch.

This "new improved" update is a waste of time. Visually it looks better and better functionality with rooms. Routines is nice too, but basic functionality is lacking. More taps to activate a scene, no Apple Watch support. More difficult to set up a custom scene. Will be staying with the old app until this gets baked a little longer.

Title says it all. The old app was good I had no issues with it. It worked really well. Updated to tgis app and wow it's horrible. It crashes all the time. All my old settings got deleted. It took me 2 hours to reset my house lights back to normal.
No Apple Watch app. Plus, making scene is so complicated. Cause you have to start from zero. Can't import scene from previous app.
Genel olarak ok ok iyi de_il _zellikle eve geli_ ve ayrl_ _zelli_i al_myor _nceki program da daha dzgn al_yordu eve geldi_imde _klar bir trl almyor her_eyi denedim
Gef_llt mir die App. Besonders die Trennung der R_ume. Dass man allerdings keinen Timer zum ausschalten manuell aktivieren kann, finde ich sehr schade. Deshalb nur 4 Sterne.

Keine Ahnung was sich Hue (Philips) bei der Weiterentwicklung seiner Apps denkt, aber fr mich als Kunde ist die neue Hue App (Gen. 2) ein echter Rckschritt. Keine Untersttzung fr iPad und Apple Watch, lediglich 4 Szenen, umst_ndliche Szenenbernahme von der alten in die neue App und die Kombi zwischen Hue App Gen. 1 und Hue App Gen. 2 bringt nur Probleme. Lampen lassen sich nicht ein- oder ausschalten. Erst nach ziehen des Netzsteckers an Basis/Lampe oder L_schung und Neueinrichtung der Lampe, kann diese wieder ein- oder ausgeschaltet werden. Ich habe den Kauf des Systems bisher echt bereut, daher mein Fazit __. Andere vergleichbare Systeme sind fr einen Bruchteil des Preises fr das Hue Systems zu kaufen und arbeiten dann auch noch zuverl_ssiger. Eigentlich ist die neue App ganz sch_n geworden.Aber die nicht manuell anpassbaren Szenen sind ein Rckschritt, der weh tut.Auerdem werden Lampen, die beim Szenenwechsel abgeschaltet werden, nicht mehr heruntergedimmt, sondern einfach ausgeschaltet. Auch das war vorher sehr viel sch_ner.Ich hoffe hier wird schnell nachgelegt, um eine wirklich tolle App zu haben. Dann gibts auch wieder 5 Sterne.

V_llig unverst_ndlich, dass das IPad nicht untersttzt wird. Zuhause lege ich mein IPhone zur Seite und benutze fast ausschlielich das IPad. Da ist die neue App wie Steinzeit und v_llig inakzeptabel!
Nirgendwo wird die app erkl_rt! Null intuitiv! Wie kann ich einer Szene eine  Lampe zuordnen? Schon die letzte app war kompliziert aber das ist wirklich der letzte Dreck!
Quelques sait programmer l'heure du r_veil ?Programmer un timer pour extinction  l'heure pr_d_finie ?

Pas simple au 1er abord, et finalement au 2me jour d'utilisation l'application parat plus simple. Aujourd'hui c'est un vrai bonheur. Les nouvelles habitudes paressent bien plus simples ludiques et logiques qu'avec l'ancien Hue. Les pr_ r_glages sont plus intuitifs plus beaux moins bord_liques bref sans comparaisons je pr_fre et de loin cette nouvelle mise  jour.  Les couleurs sont plus lumineuses. J'ai 11 _clairages en tout entre mon s_jour cuisine et chambre. Les routines sont trs simples d'utilisation et trs pratiques, on a plus rien  faire la domotique prend le relais, allume et rgle et _teint les lumires. Merci Hue d'illuminer nos vie___
Difficile  croire mais c'est encore pire que la premire version, il n'est mme plus possible de les configurer pour un allumage automatique  la tomb_ de la nuit!!!

De oude app was al een beetje knullig, maar deze nieuwe versie is totaal onbruikbaar. Snel een nieuwe UX Designer aannemen Philips!

Sorry hoor, maar deze app kan dus een stuk minder dan de vorige app. Geen scenario's meer, Maar 2 rooms tegelijk bedienen met afstandsbediening, maar 3 mogelijke sterktes bij creren rooms, verplicht alles in rooms opdelen. Jammer dat die app niet af aanvoelt, ik ga weer de vorige gebruiken.

Mis heel veel functies tov vorige app!!!  Ook de overgang naar deze app betekend veel (dubbel) werk. Moet alles weer opnieuw instellen, voor elke iphone apart. Deze app is echt een grote stap TERUG. Slechte zaak voor een bedrijf als Philips om zo'n slechte app aan te bieden voor zo'n mooi (en duur) product.
Wat een ontzettend slechte app. Ik heb hem meteen weer verwijderd. Ik gebruik de gen 1 app weer. Deze is veel gebruiksvriendelijker.
This new app is so frustrating, 90% of the time it never finds my hub. All of my scenes have gone. Siri no longer works even on the old app. Stay well clear.
Like the new look. Rooms are great and HomeKit integration much better. However the app refuses to login to MyHue. Old one works fine.

La verdad es que esta app es mucho ms elegante que la original. Las escenas tienen ms sentido y son ms funcionales. Est, por fin, a la altura de los dispositivos HUE y la marca Philips. Ahora slo falta que haya r_plica para Apple Watch.

So if you want to continue using the apple watch app, you have to use the older app.  Seems pretty ridiculous to me.  Deleted.On a more positive note, the UI of the new app is really nice.  I couldn't see any enormous difference aside from the app responding faster and looking much nicer.  I would love to use this app if it had an apple watch app.

2nd gen app is absolutely terrible. They took an already terrible app (1st gen) and made it even worse. I don't understand why it's so difficult to allow customization options in a convenient, intuitive app. There are paid 3rd party apps that work well, but come on, Philips...I shelled out hundreds of dollars for your hardware, a decent app shouldn't be too much to ask for!  Hire some competent developers and get the app updated. The bulbs are worthless without the app.
A real waste. Fewer scenes than the last version. Won't connect to Hue online. Stick with the old version. This one sucks.

This new version, which is supposed to replace the old one, required that I press the button on the bridge. That's fine. It asked me to name the room _ that's fine. It lost every one of my presets. That's not fine. So I have gone back to using the old app. Even the old one now is partly more responsive, and partly far less responsive. Hue, what got into you?

You cannot just go backwards! I love my Hue. I am ok with this update but it could have been better... But taking away the watch app is like going back two years in time! Please... Wearables are here to stay.

I've been using Hue for a while, and I'd never been too crazy about the app or the interface it provides for the lights. But this update addresses every issue I ever had with it, and controlling everything just is such a breeze now, with excellent precision too. Yeah, the previous light/switch settings don't carry over, but totally understandable as they just redesigned the entire system. Very happy with everything now.

For the price you pay for the bulbs you would think Phillips would have a nice app to go along with. But no. The UI is now clean but they removed features like: unable to change colors of multiple bulbs. Oh and the app has reset on me twice. Causing me to lose all the scenes and rooms I set up twice already.

Randomly lost all my settings. I recommend you delete this one and use the old gen 1 app that still works.Also, For the Today view widget, I don't want 2 buttons for each light. The old app lets you use one button for each light or scene (on/off). Using the old app for now.

This new update is horrible. I was able to do so much more with the old app. I can't set the Brightness with the new app or set the exact color I want. Even if I try to set a color it jumps to another. I have spent thousands of dollars getting my house fully automated with there lights and this is how we get treated? With a bull crap app that won't work. This is ridiculous.
Who's twisted twisted mind designed such an unusable app ? Who was silly enough to sign off on having this go public ? Such expensive hardware and so unusable software.
Why does gen 1 have a functioning Apple Watch app but not gen 2??????????? Hope HomeKit gets some needed help (it's own app) at WWDC and Philips can improve this app before iOS 10.
I still haven't figure it out how to change the colors or how to use the widgets. Bad.

The feature I use every single day of automatically turning my lights off when I leave in the morning is broken in the new app. I've tried various things to make it trigger automatically but it will not. Really disappointing
My previous scenes are not accessible, I can't set my automations to turn off, and the navigation is a step backwards. Very disappointed.

New version looks good but has half the functionality of the old version. Also, I experience alot more lost connections and the new timing and routines moods work 50% of the time having me have to open the app and turn lights on.Update. Just found out you can not connect remotely efficiently anymore. $100s spent on these bulbs and they have the worst app imaginable now. Absolutely unusable.

I can't seem to link my 1st Generation strips to this app. It's pretty simple with just the scenes no way to use different colors it seems. The Siri works ok but yea I need all my stuff linked together, I'll stick with the first app.

I don't know whether to blame this horrible app fully on Phillips or also on Apple, because HomeKit is such a half-baked poorly introduced mess. But Hue suffers because HomeKit is a disaster. This app is Phillips' second attempt to integrate Hue into HomeKit. It fails. It loses all previously defined scenes from the first version of the app, because it can't import scenes -- either from Hue gen 1 or from HomeKit. It also has mysterious error messages about naming lights won't work because of conflicting names. If you access your lights on an iPhone and then go to an iPad, it will insist on renaming then all because the first names were all taken by the iPhone. THEY ARE THE SAME LIGHTS AND DON'T NEED TO BE NAMED AGAIN. A problem that is definitely the app's fault is the Today screen widget. In the old app you could set existing scenes to be available in the widget. In the new version you have to individually create scenes just for the widget, even if they already exist. It's pointless extra work. These are just a few of the many frustrations.
It does some things well. I'll give it that. But I still haven't been able to find how to control just one light. Still need to go to the other app to do that.

What a missed opportunity.Positive:It looks better and creation of things on the surface seems easy.The brightness control on scenes is far superior in look.But design is its only redeeming featureNegatives:Rooms rather than groups is daft. There is no ability to have a light in more than one group.Scene selection looks slick but you can't control different light outputs and colours which causes a balance problem when you mix different bulbs or are trying to create a theme.Wake-up and routines look good on the surface but they go to a warm light which is not what you need to wake you up.Summary:In all, this new app is a really dumbed down sibling of gen1 and is more style than substance. Advice:Dump it and stick with gen1.

I was so looking forward to the gen2 app. Sadly it falls well short of the mark. I can't group my living room, dining room and kitchen room into "Downstairs" to control them all at once for example. It's also very confusing to figure out how to set up custom scenes per room (I'm still not sure how), you seem to be forced to use a shuffle feature which randomly assigns colours - really?? Philips please invest more time and effort into the software which controls your products, it makes such a big difference. The hardware is fantastic, but this app is disappointing to say the least.

This new version of the app feels as though it has been dumbed down. On installing it, I no longer have access to my many scenes... and can no longer make new ones!You can, of course "create" scenes. You are prompted to chose a photo from your collection, and after choosing, the app picks what colour the lights will be for you. Perfect -- because I clearly installed an expensive custom lighting system so that I could let a computer choose the colours for me.Moving the photo around results in different colours, but you cannot say, "I want this particular light to be green, and that one to be blue." This is a step backwards. The colour-picker images are gone, and tapping on a particular colour in the photo does nothing. Even if you uploaded a gamut rainbow, it would just choose the colours for you. By all means, make it simple for people but at least allow full control for those of us that want it!I had scenes that used a variety of almost-whites depending on the time of day, or matching up with other non-Hue bulbs. Such subtlety is now impossible.While being able to group lights into rooms is a much needed addition (finally!) I'm clearly not going to be using them, because the old app is far superior in colour selection. Without a colour-picking option, what is the point in owning Hue lights, at all?I would have given it one star, were it not for the fact that the new interface looks better and that being able to group lights into rooms is a major improvement. As long as you don't care about actually being able to have control over the colour of your lights.

Updated 24-May-16New version has added "Go to Sleep" routine. Set the time your lights will fade - but make sure you're tucked up in bed right on time or you lights will fade out too early or too late. This need to be a timer function, not an alarm function. Please add timers back in to the app. Initial reviewI like the new interface, but there are some key features that you've removed (for no obvious reason):- Timers - alarms remain, but timers have gone. That makes no sense. So I have to use the Gen 1 app for timers. The light fading out when going to sleep is just as good as it fading in when waking up, unless I go to sleep at exactly the same time every night, a "Routine" just won't work. - Linking lights - setting different lights to be the same colour is a very useful feature. Surely it's easy to implement and doesn't have to be a permanent link. Even a "copy settings" feature would work. Improvements:- UI in general- auto-generated icon for a scene actually looks like the colours in the scene, not just a generic colour palette or having to find a picture from somewhere (no more pages of scenes with the same icon)- rooms and switching whole rooms on and off quickly

The latest app eliminates scenes that I took a lot of time to create. Setting up anything is awkward. The lights are great but the app is horrible. I was already annoyed when they came out with a new bridge - rendering the first one obsolete, and now they have released an app that is worse than the one it replaced. Why not add improvements to the first app rather than issuing a new one with no instructions on how it effects the first one. VERY disappointed.

The old app was getting a bit long in the tooth and showing its age, but I'm honestly mystified as to how so many of the features of the old app (notably: iPad resolution support in my case) didn't make it into the "minimum viable product" for this app. Or how this app managed to see release in a state such as this. Or why room-based functionality wasn't just added to the other.

The original app didn't collect lights into rooms nor did it have the visual polish this version does. But, this version hides some of the features of how things operate under-the-hood and forces you to interact with your lights using only automation.  Sure automation's awesome but some of the fun of getting a product like this is still having more options to directly manipulate the lights on-demand!  With this app you can't get an overview of all of your lights at-a-glance like in the Gen 1 app, and you can't adjust brightness or colour in tandem. This app has a feel that there wasn't much user consultation during the design phase; like there was more direction over presentation compared to function. I believe if passionate users were consulted prior to development some of the missing tools would never have been cut. Now, if Philips put these fancy looks, new features and updated visual designs along side the functionality they already had with their original app, the built-in Hue app would be a winner for sure.

I am a long-term user of Philips Hue Lights and I seriously hope they have better plans for this NEW app. In its current state, it's confusing and has lost a tonne of functionality.- Unable to create LIGHT GROUPS. The only group option is "rooms" which means individual lights cannot be added to multiple rooms and therefore, it's not possible to create multi-room scenes.- Unable to control individual lights, or combinations of lights from NOTIFICATION WIDGET. Only allows you to select whole rooms or whole home.- Unable to create ROUTINES with individual lights, or combinations of lights. Only allows you to select whole rooms or whole home.- WAKEUP uses warm light instead of bright white light which is preferred for those of us  wanting a natural wake-up rhythm or those with Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD)- No longer able to customise and save changes to light recipe scenes (energise, read, concentrate, relax) or new dimmed, nightlight, bright scenes. - No ability to configure geofencing zone size.  Notification for leaving or entering geolocation zone has been removed as well.- No ability to randomise on and off alarm schedules.- No Apple Watch integration- Can't create light scene with standard colour pallet, forces you to use a photo. However when you use a photo, you're unable to place each bulb on the photo to select its colour.- Unable to automatically calculate light schedule for "sunrise" and "sunset"- Fade time is limited to 10, 15, 20, 30.  Longer or shorter durations are not available.Now I know that there are a lot of other applications out there that work with these lights, but Phillips need to demonstrate basic and advanced functionality to help grow the platform. The brilliance of these configurable lights is that they are highly customisable. I just hope this doesn't signal the demise of these products because there has been no indication from Philips whether missing (or new) features are going to be return to the app. I'm going to keep this review up-to-date with all the problems I find as I continue to use the app in the coming weeks.

Really wanted to like this and I see what they are doing. When it finally works it will be an improvement. For now however it's just a backwards step and very poor for such s premium product. Cannot login and cannot use Siri or Apple Watch any more. And not even an iPad version. Whoever pushed this out before it was ready for release should be fired immediately.

Latest update still does not address any of the problems that have been brought up with the new app. There is no import function so if you want to use only this app, get ready to manually recreate all your previous setting/scenes. The addition of rooms is an improvement (possibly the only one) but now everything only functions by room instead of allowing the option to use certain bulbs from different rooms (like turning off the lights in one room and simultaneously turning the lights on in another or turning on the lights in more than one location.)  The emphasis on photo-based scenes (mostly a novelty at best) still does not have the ability to choose specific bulb color and grouping is still not possible. Plus, in case you want to have multiple bulbs in one room with the same color, good luck getting all of them to match correctly.  Overall, Philips once again demonstrates a knack for excellent hardware and absolutely terrible (and clueless) software, even in their updates.

Ziemlich entt_uschend die 2. Gen. Hue App. Eigentlich nur die alte App in neuem Gewand mit weniger Funktionen (wo ist zB der manuelle Timer hingekommen?).Die App ist nicht wirklich intuitiver geworden, die Bedienung nicht einfacher. Es fehlen nach wie vor grundlegende Funktionen wie der klassische, simple Farbwechsler.Und: keine Apple Watch & iPad Untersttzung, das hatte sogar die alte App. Philips, ernsthaft?Fr das teure Hue System h_tte man sich wirklich mehr erwarten drfen. Wie schon einige vor mir, m_chte auch ich auf ein paar Funktionen hinweisen, welche nicht aus der alten App bernommen wurden. Ich habe auch bereits eine nachricht an Philips Light gesendet. Auf deren Facebook-Seite ist sie _ffentlich einsehbar.Die neue App gef_llt mir optisch gut. Dafr ein Lob! Doch warum wurden einige, wie ich finde, wichtige Funktionen der alten App verworfen. Drei Punkte dazu.- Warum gibt es die App nicht mehr fr das iPad? Gerade zu Hause wird dieses Device benutzt und wird gerne fr die Bedienung der Hue-Produkte verwendet...- Warum wurde die Funktion, zum Einstellen der Farbe fr meherer Lampen gleichzeitig, eingestellt. Was meine ich genau: in der alten App konnte man zu einer Szene Leuchten hinzufgen, diese dann verbinden und so hatte alle Leuchten die selbe Farbe und Helligkeit. Nun werde die Farben der Lecuhten bei Szenen automatisch erstellt und m_chte ich zwei Leuchten die selbe Farbe und Helligkeit zuweisen, geht das nur separat und umst_ndlich.- Der letze Punkt greift ein wenig in den Punkt zwei: Mir ist bewusst, dass es unter normalen Umst_nden logisch erscheint, dass eine Leuchte nur in einem Raum platziert werden kann. In der neuen App muss (kann) eine Leuchte einem Raum zugeordnet werde. Man kann dann ber den Schalter Wohnzimmer alle Leuchten im Wohnzimmer anschalten. Wenn ich nun aber eine Wohnkche habe (wie bei mir der Fall) konnte ich in der alten App einen Szenen erstellen, in welcher ich alles Leuchten aus Wohnzimmer und Kche zusammengefassen konnte. Somit alle Leuchten zentral steurbar. In der neuen App msst ich die Leuchten dem jeweiligen Raum zuordnen. Dass msste ich machen um nicht immer wenn ich im Wohnzimmer bin auch die Lichter in der Kche angehen. Leider ist es in er neuen App jedoch nur m_glich einen Lampe einem Raum zuzuordenen. Ich w_re dafr, dass man einen Leuchte mehrer R_umen zuordnen kann.

I try so hard to convince everyone that Philips have done a good job with Hue, but every opportunity I have to show someone how good it is, I'm perpetually let down.Firstly, the app looks great, and is functionally sound, but doesn't actually work. The 'Coming home' and 'Leaving home' don't work in Gen 2 of the app, unlike its ugly cousin, Gen 1.Secondly, as someone who's frequently away, what's the point in having a wake-up and sleep routine if you can't toggle it to only trigger if you're actually home. Given that the app is always aware of your location, this seems standard.

I have read some of the other reviews here- and I have to agree to disagree with them. I own near enough 150 various hue products/bulbs strips etc, and use 3 bridges at the same time - have ALL types of hue range products, using them for over 2 years;  So I know what I am talking about. This appis tonnes better than any other app out there - and I have tried nearly all of them! It's not simple for dummies - then dummies shouldn't be using these bulbs with app- stick to the switches they can come with.I can't thank Philips enough for update to gen 2; now it's the only app I use; bridge switching is easy; bulbs rooms; scenes and themes much easier to manage. On iPhone it's a pure delight to use- and creating you own scene is so cool! Not to mention very easyIn fact other than sounds and dynamic themes- Philips have thought about everything practical. Please include dynamic scenes in your next update!Remember the app facilitates the use of the bridge and bulbs; and other products- it's he primary software to run the hardware of hue products; there are heaps and heaps of various apps that do different things. So get those; find one for your need; as a primary app this has done an excellent job and is VERY simple to use- if you know how hue range work and how to utilise them to begin with. This app will be the killer of paid hue apps hence so much negativity I think. The only negative about hue range/ product is that they are expensive. But find product of similar quality, build and innovation then compare. There are so many car makers- but most will know an Audi, BMW and Mercs are what they are; and hue lights are just hue lights- and this app is fantastic- well done Philips! LONG awaited and it's been delivered! Thank you!!!

Seriously, why is there only an iPhone app and have to x2 to use on iPad like in the days when iPad first came out. Was just about to buy more Hue lamps but will save my money now if this is the direction Philips are going.

I am wishing that I had not updated to this version as it removes the Apple Watch companion app. Now I have to turn off the bedroom lights with my phone instead of simply telling my watch to do it. It may seem like a small complaint but this "update" is little more than taking away many existing features and leaving behind a dumbed down version.

I had the original app on both my iThings and used both. Now the updated app has been released there doesn't seem to be any iPad integration. The app itself is a lot better this time round with the room setup. It just needs an iPad app.
This app does not seem to work via 3G on my iPhone 6sPlus, but the original version 1 does work? Wi-Fi is fine, but no 3G support makes it worse than useless.

The new update restricts switches to only 2 rooms; useless if you only have a couple of devices in each room. We use our switch to turn all lights on and off. Reverting back to the old app until Philips fix it!

In many ways an improvement on the previous app. But Phillips have taken out the ability to pick colours from a picture for each light. This was one of the best reasons to have Hue in the first place!
The new app has less functionality than the old one! What a joke.
Nicely done, now it's aligned with HomeKit. Can't give it five stars because it's lost support for my iPad
This update deleted all my scenes and schedules!
In the last version, it seems we can line up different hue bulb with the same colour.  Why the new update delete that function ?
Really loved the new UI and overall the new app but I miss the screen where a have the plate of colors and I can set the color for all lights, now I have this screen but must do it one by one...
peggiorata tantissimo,  macchinosa, lenta e spesso non funziona. Inoltre non  pi compatibile con iPad. Vergognatevi.
Pi complessa dell'app 1 gen.  pi macchinoso selezionare i colori.
Dopo l ultimo aggiornamento dove mi hanno obbligato a cambiare app l applicazione nn si collega piu alla base... Aggiornate di nuovo al piu presto in attesa lascio una stella
Beatiful UI; please add geofencing zone settings.

Avete tolto il supporto ad iPad, mi aspetto almeno che col prossimo aggiornamento mettiate quantomeno il supporto alla risoluzione del display di iPad Pro.  decisamente un passo indietro vergognoso in tutti i sensi.
Lo dicho, una aplicacin llena de fallos. Al traste con todos los ambientes que ya tenia y adems el widget no funciona. Una pesima app.
I would appreciate a counter for the go to sleep routine (for the others too, actually), that allows to start it "now".I don't go to bed always at the same hour!

Vamos a peor en lugar de ir a mejor. Anuncian a bombo y platillo la nueva app con fantsticas mejoras, y cada da que la uso encuentro ms problemas absurdos e incomodidades de manejo. Es ms compleja de usar. Das mas vueltas para hacer cosas simples, las ambientaciones se crean solo para habitaciones independientes y no para todas, no puedes crear ambientaciones con los colores que quieras de una foto, no puedes elegir q bombilla tiene q color al crear ambientaciones, la intensidad no est en el mismo lugar q el color, hay que salir de uno para entrar al otro, sin rastro de las ambientaciones dinmicas...En definitiva una mier...a de actualizacin de app. No es que no ofrezca nada nuevo es que ofrece menos configurabilidad. Hay q seguir usando la app antigua junto con apps externas que si saben hacer las cosas bien.
Han arreglado cosas de la versin anterior y parece bastante gil. De momento a mi me va bien, pero faltan pulir cosas, como que funcione con el Apple Watch.

New app but big fail...way to difficult to create scenario, no way to modify the intensity of the lights for an existing scene. Be ready to spend few hours and loose hair to make it run.Keep it simple guys...
Die alte app ist einfacher. Vor allem dass man Fotovorlagen nicht mehr aus Cloud Alben nehmen kann, macht die App fast nutzlos!

Beim Alarm fehlt der Zufall Modus. Szenen mit eigenen Bilder gestalten ist eingeschr_nkt, Farben aus Fotos werden zuf_llig bernommen, keine Lampen Wahl m_glich und somit kein symmetrisches Licht. Design gelungen, der Rest ist v_lliger Bl_dsinn und schlichtweg unbrauchbar. Habe es jetzt mehrere Male mit der App versucht, kann mich nicht damit anfreunden. Da muss dringend nachgebessert werden. W_re ich Chef von Philips, h_tte ich die verantwortlichen fr diese App im hohen Bogen raus geschmissen.

Gen 1 hat viel Verbesserungspotential, so war meine erste Freude gross, dass es eine neue Version gibt.Gen 2: die App fordert auf, die verschiedenen Lichtquellen sofort in R_ume einzuteilen. Beim Ausw_hlen des 1. Raums gleich die Fehlermeldung: Max. Anzahl von Zimmern wurde erstellt. L_schen Sie ein Zimmer, um ein neues zu erstellen.Funktioniert gar nicht!

Das Update l_sst also zu wnschen brig. berhaupt ist die neue Version v_llig unbrauchbar. Die alte _ viel viel besser. Ich muss sagen, diese App bist du alte unbrauchbar. Die alte ist besser. Zudem kann ich nur eine empfehlen: iConnect Hue. Diese Kraft der zwar etwas, man bekommt da etwas fr das Geld. Ich benutze nur noch diese. Die andere kann man vielleicht noch als Hilfsapp gebrauchen und zwar die erste, also Generation I und nicht die neue.

Interface looks nice. But no iPad & AppleWatch support anymore? Philips seems to completely have missed this No more individual lamp assigning when in scenes. No lamps that map to the tap switch, only rooms or scenes.My Hue does not work at all, I can login but it obviously does not connect, so no remote control of lights when away, thats really bad. Thats not what I was expecting from an upgrade, looks more like beta. Philips is simply not there yet.

Agree with everyone else saying how terrible this new app is - I'm glad they didn't replace the old app with this, because the old one is far more functional.All this new app does is work better with rooms.Only thing I'll add is that the widget support on iOS is especially disappointing with the new app, as you can only activate a scene - touching it again no longer turns the scene's lights off as the old app does.Incredible that they'd put out a new app that does less, not more, than the previous version. Yay, it looks prettier! I couldn't care less if it doesn't work as well.

**Please don't decommission the old app any time soon**Update: May 231. This app is pretty, but functionally horrible. I'm downgrading to 1 star. And am considering buying Lumifi after I finish writing this.2. Basic functionality is missing:- can't set up lights the way we want them and save that configuration (or it's really not obvious how to do that). What's the point of having a product that offers all these colours / intensities if users can't save a configuration they've built?- can't choose colours from a scene image to use for individual lights- no album support for scenes based on camera roll. Forced to scroll through 100's of images(Scenes are currently unusable, and IMO you should remove them until this feature is minimally ready - make them "returning soon").The new app:Good:Better interface designBad:- Cannot control where individual lights pick up colours from a recipe image (shuffle isn't enough; some of your users bought into your system because they want the control)- Finding images in camera roll can be painful if you have a lot of images. Should allow users to select by album

Bis jetzt kann ich nicht viel gutes ber die App sagen. Die 1. Generation hatte sowohl Apple Watch Untersttzung, als auch die M_glichkeit die Szenen zu synchroneren und in einem Onlineportal zu bearbeiten. All das ist weggefallen. Sehr schlechtes Update!

Unbrauchbarer Schrott,Ich frage mich welcher Marketing Fuzzy diese neue Version kreiert hat. Eine Einschlaf-Routine anzubieten bei der man schon im Voraus genau die Uhrzeit wissen muss wenn man zu Bett gehen will und das auch noch auf den Tag bezogen. Absolut realit_tsfremd und unbrauchbar.

Ok, es sieht ganz nett aus. Aber ehrlich, warum verkompliziert man Dinge wenn sie vorher super waren. Die neue App ist unbersichtlich und null intuitiv bedienbar. Ich hoffe sehr, dass die alte App uns noch lange lange erhalten bleibt und Philips uns nicht zwingen wird (wenn wir es weiter benutzen wollen).

Ich finde die neue App vom Design her sehr gelungen. Kein Vergleich zur alten App, endlich wirkt die App auch dem Preis der Lampen entsprechend.  Jedoch ist das nur das Eine, funktionieren muss es ja auch. Warum gibt es noch keine Apple Watch App? Hier h_tte doch die alte einfach bernommen werden k_nnen, mit den neuen Bildern der Szenen.  Warum gibt es keine IPad App? Hier muss die Hue App V1 verwendet werden. Auerdem ist es echt schade, dass eine Lampe nur einmal angesprochen werden kann, sprich keine Raumbergreifenden Szenen (mit Mehrfachbelegungen) m_glich. Beim erstellen einer Szene per Foto ist nur die Zufallsfunktion m_glich, in der alten App konnte man jeder Lampe auf einen Farbbereich im Foto zuweisen - diese Funktion habe ich nicht gefunden. Szenen k_nnen aus der alten App bernommen werden, auch wenn nur einzeln was etwas umst_ndlich ist. Auerdem funktioniert bei mir die Ortungsfunktion nicht. Lampen werden weder an- noch ausgeschaltet. Man kann auch nicht mehr den Radius bestimmen. Einfache Features die jedoch essentiell sind und bei dem Lampenpreis nicht fehlen drfen. Zugriff von auerhalb per Mobilfunk funktioniert. Hier ist noch viel Luft nach oben, was sich auch in den Bewertungen anderer User zeigt. Bei dem Preis, was Philips fr das Hue System verlangt wird, MSSEN implementierte Funktionen einwandfrei funktionieren. Ich hoffe sehr, dass hier nachgebessert wird.Update 2.1: Die geofencing Funktion l_uft immer noch nicht. ( IPhone 6s, iOS 9.3.2: Bei der alten App L_uft es) Kleine Verbesserungen bringt das Update mit, essenzielles fehlt leider immer noch! Jetzt ist es aber endlich m_glich, mehrere Szenen ber den Dimmer Switch zu steuern. Bei anderen Apps ist aber weiterhin mehr Personalisierung m_glich, z.B fade-Zeiten und "Drcken+ Halten" . Es wird wohl immer so bleiben, dass man das gewisse Extra nur ber Drittanbieter Apps bekommt. Legt Philips die grundlegenden Funktionen nach, und bringt implementierte Funktionen zum laufen, gibt's von mir auch wieder 5/5 Sterne. Ohne funktionierendes Geofancing, fehlende Apple Watch + Ipad App etc. gibt es mit ach und Krach noch 3 Sterne.

Die letzte Hue App war super. Komplett intuitiv bedienbar und jetzt muss man sich super aufw_ndig alles zusammen suchen. Die haben wohl zu viel gewollt. Die Szenen von der Vorg_nger App kann man leider auch nicht bernehmen.

Die Gen 1 war vom Ansatz her v_llig unbrauchbar. Deswegen musste bei mir iConnectHue her. Aber die Gen 2 macht soviel richtig. Intuitiv, reduziert und dich alles drin. Die Zweitapp musste nur noch zum belegen der Switch her. Aber selbstverst_ndlich hat Philips nun in die native App gebracht. Bravo. H_tte Philips keine gescheite Software zugetraut.
Mittlerweile ist die App eigentlich ganz gut ... Sieht super und aufger_umt aus und ber inoffizielle Wege kann man auch mehrere LC2 remotes getrennt + Hue betreiben... :) soweit alles schicki :)
Nein wie schlecht... Ich bleibe bei der alten App ...
Die App ist einfach nur nervig! Keine iPad Untersttzung, die Dimmer kann man nur mit zwei R_umen belegen. Umst_ndliche Bedienung.

Das soll doch wohl ein Scherz sein?? Ich habe mir grad vor ne Woche die 2te Britge im Set gekauft und jetzt muss ich lesen um alles nutzen zu k_nnen erwerben Sie bitte die neue Britge??? WTF??? Sehr sehr schlecht!!!Wenn ich schon lese das ich mich registrieren MUSS um den Fernzugriff nutzen zu k_nnen dann bereue ich ja jetzt schon das ich mir das berteuerte Starter Set gekauft habe! ( ich habe etliche apps die ich von unterwegs Steuern kann OHNE Anmeldung! Und dann null Reaktion auf die negative Rezensionen???Die Weck- bzw. Alarmfunktion sollte mal berarbeitet werden und bersichtlicher gestaltet werden, ansonsten ist die sehr gut _Schade das es nicht durchgehend angezeigt wird das die Lampe leuchtet, da kann es mal passieren das man unterwegs ist und das Licht unn_tig an ist!German? Warum steht nichts auf deutsch da??Bin ja mal gespannt ob hinter dieser app ein funktionierender Support steckt und dieses behoben wird, danke. Bis auf paar Sachen bin ich n_mlich beraus zufrieden mit dem gesamten System.
Leider wurde die alte App abgekndigt, die nachfolge App bietet jedoch keinen iPad Support mehr. Sehr schade.

Fr den Anfang ist die App sicher ein guter Neustart. Es sollten nur Zeitnah die alten Funktionen (iPad & Applewatch Support) nachgeliefert werden. Die sch_nste App bringt leider nichts, wenn sie nicht die n_tigen Funktionen bietet.Leider keine Besserung im aktuellen Update.

Ich habe noch keine M_glichkeit gefunden eine Szene zu erstellen die Lampen in mehreren R_umen bercksichtigt. Des weiteren scheint es nicht m_glich einer bereits erstellten Szene neue Lampen hin zuzufgen oder zu l_schen. All das ist in der alten "Philips Hue gen 1" App m_glich.
They removed an essential functionality with this new version of the app. I can no longer manage timers

Die App selber kommt frisch daher, dass Update von heute 23.05. zeigt das Arbeit hineingesteckt wird. Jedoch macht die App es einem nicht einfach sie zu m_gen. Die Wege sind komplizierter geworden und gute Funktionen gel_scht. Der neue Button "schlafen gehen" unter meine Routinen ist nett, jedoch eine Zeit einzugeben + die eigentliche Fade Out Zeit ist ein Schritt zu viel. Bitte die Startzeit auf die jeweils aktuelle Ortszeit automatisch einstellen. So hat der Nutzer die M_glichkeit den Zeitpunkt einzustellen, muss dieses aber nicht.Was ist aus der sinnvollen Funktion An- und Ausschalten ber die Widgets in der Mitteilungszentrale geworden? Bitte unbedingt wieder implementieren!
the new app has obviously designed to attract tech people. the fun, the gamification and the easy of use is gone. i still use the old and now have a look into the osram solution. sorry #huefailed

La possibilit_ de cr_er un sc_nario regroupant plusieurs pices (id_al pour les maison s avec s_jour salon et cuisine le tout ouvert)La possibilit_ d'activer et d_sactiver un sc_nario dans le menu widget avec un seul bouton... ( un peu comme dans l'application de premire g_n_ration.Avec ces deux _l_ments, je donne 4 _toiles...

Tous les sc_narios sont pass_s  la trappe, et plus aucune possibilit_ de r_gler la couleur et l'intensit_ de chaque ampoule ! Donc pour cr_er un sc_nario, c'est d'aprs une photo (un peu au pif en plus) ou rien du tout, donc le meilleur moyen d'avoir quelque chose qui ne convient pas. Nul ! Je garde l'ancienne version sans h_siter, mme si l'UX de cette nouvelle version est beaucoup plus aboutie.

An improvement over the original app. Managing lights within rooms is much more efficient than having a bucket of bulbs. The color picker not being shared by a peppering of numbered icons also good. More options for the notifications widget also welcome. Even though it performed poorly... Hopefully the apple watch functionality will return and not take forever to load.
If you need to keep your Hub on previous version, this breaks that capability!!!
I've had my hue lights for almost a year now and I wasn't truly impressed with the Hue app. But this new app is awesome. I love the new scenes and the functionality of this app.

The new hue app is the worse. It's slow to connect, or reconnect when it's lost the connection. Confusing to use. Nothing takes the first time, you constantly have to go back and redo settings. Old app was so much better.
Generation 2 isn't nearly as intuitive as generation 1. There should be some sort of tutorial that walks you through how to use all the features. __
Not sure how they can release the app with widgets broken, but they keep doing it.

Instead of updating previous app they created new app, so all of my settings are gone! They could have linked all that to my account but that would have been too convenient.So far location isn't working so I have to manually turn the lights on and off. Way to fix what wasn't broken.
It never connects to my bridge. It has maybe a couple of times but that's it. Still using the original hue app.

Drastic loss of features compared to the gen 1 app, plus ongoing net connectivity problems makes you wonder what is going on at Philips.The original app was never perfect, but it did support lots of functionality, albeit in a sometimes hard-to-understand fashion.The new app is prettier, but the lost features are too numerous to list here.  One wonders if we will be seeing a class-action lawsuit or a going-out-of-business sale.It's pretty telling when a competing company's  app does a better job of managing your hardware than your own.

Just when the old app was getting stable , it got replaced by a new app with less functionality. Where is the scenes option ? I had my own collection of scenes and i used them only. This is not even allowed in the new app. Login to hue does not have scenes either. This philips lights are now as good as the 10$ ones from costco with fixed colors.

Please bring (back) these two things to make the app usable again: i) ability to select the same color for multiple lights at once, ii) ability to work with scenes alongside the rooms (for working with lights from across different rooms). And of course importing the scenes from the original app. Until then, this app is unusable..

Looks great until you realize you can't use any of your scenes from Gen 1.  Rating will improve if they add that feature, otherwise I will not be using Gen 2.  Seems like they rushed this out for some reason.

This app is somewhat better than the previous. However I still can not set Siri up to correctly run set rooms. I have renamed lights so there is no name conflict. I have deleted room names and started from scratch. Some lights work while others stay on or will not shut off. Philips needs to figure this out or stop claiming it works with Siri. If you want Siri to control your lights I recommend looking at other wifi options than Hue.
It's only an iPhone app, it does the scaling mode on an iPad.  The app should work natively on an iPad.

Wow just wow, who designed this, this makes me want to pull my eyes out. Who designed this, do they have more then 1 or 2 lights... This is completely useless if you have multiple Hue light bulbs. Assigning 3 rooms max for hue tap, whaaaaaat.

I'm not one of those 100-light guys. I have a small collection for my common rooms so I can do basic automation. THIS UPDATE BREAKS EVERYTHING. You can't do whole-home scenes anymore (just four rooms at a time, which overwrite your HomeKit rooms). It's impossible to do a multi-room scene. Creating a scene is far more difficult (did you look at ANY third-party apps?!). It's pretty. Changing the level of one bulb is nicer. The rest isn't there and makes a horrible experience. I gave up on Philips ever making a proper app, deleted all scenes from the bridge, and now have moved all settings to HomeKit and Wink/IFTTT.

This app is total garbage. It is not user friendly whatsoever. Philips is changing the whole ecosystem and system we have grown to love with this new app and it's just pitiful. Please Philips listen to your customers.
- No ability to create scenes- No way to modify existing scenes- No way to even choose a scene other than when creating a routine/timer!This app is truly useless. The 1st gen is far better!
The wake up function doesn't seem to work. This version does seem to make the lights respond more quickly, which is an improvement.

This update will not import all of your existing scenes that you have synced to their cloud service. This update removes the ability to group light bulbs. This update removes iPad support.All that this update adds is "rooms" which was a feature that already existed by creating a scene that only affected the bulbs of your choosing, the ones in your living room for example.To add insult to injury, the old app has updated to include a full-screen nag to install the new version every time you open it.Please fire your product managers, this is garbage.

New app doesn't carry over any settings or scenarios you may have set up in the previous version. What a PIA to have to redo everything and hope it works properly. Wake up alarm feature is missing. Terrible update.  Most annoying!

Like the new look, however not impressed that one cannot use previous scenes nor can one control lights remotely as you could in the older version.  Sure hope that more functionality is brought back to the new version of this app like in the previous version.

Absolute garbage! Wasted 40 minutes of my life I will never get back screwing with the setup, while missing the latest Game of Thrones and still have no clue how to dim lights or change bulb color. I am sticking with the first version.
It finds 2 hue bridges, yet there's only one. Then it won't connect when I press the button on the bridge. Useless.
You can no longer group lights together. Don't waste your time with this version and stick with generation 1.
No migration option from old app, only displays in portrait mode on iPad, non-intuitive.  Perhaps it will grow on me in time, but first impressions are not great.
It will take you a long time to recover my rating after the debacle of deleting all devices and starting from scratch when "Gen 2" was released.

This version taken away all the Scenes feature. Making Light cannot be in more than One "room". Made it easy for people who just want the light setup confined to each "room". Worse "upgrade" ever in software application history. I am going to use the old version until the end of time. Time to switch light system.

Can no longer easily color match lights. Why not?Can no longer group lights as scenes. Why not?You must use "Rooms." Once you put a light in a Room, you cannot use it in another "Room." If you like the flexibility to group your lights the way YOU want, this app will be worthless to you. I don't believe that anyone in charge of this software project has Hue lights in their home.

No ability to group multiple lights together without creating new scenes for every conceivable scenario, so say goodbye to matching lights unless you want everything to be set to "relax" all the time! I miss being able to control the color and intensity of multiple lights at once. It was one of my favorite features. I'd turn all the lights red from work to mess with my boyfriend. A hilarious joke, ruined forever.The UI is also really confusing and unintuitive, and there's no "help" button, because some dude in a board room thought it was intuitive enough without one I guess.It's visually appealing but actually terrible. Hopefully the overwhelmingly bad reception prompts Philips to make some changes.
Hue gen1 still suits me far better!
Waardeloos vergeleken bij de vorige App. Onlogisch en erg omslachtig om eigen scenes te maken en op te slaan. Terug naar de oude gegaan.

Vorige versie had een hogere functionaliteit. Nog niet perfect, maar beter dan deze! Helaas is er geen mogelijkheid meer om de lampen op een wIllekeurig tijdstip uit te laten gaan (binnen een bepaald tijdsbestek). Tevens in deze en voorgaande versie geen mogelijkheid om bij schemering de lampen aan te laten gaan.

I've been playing around with the new app a bit but for now it seems not possible to simply switch between self-created moods.With the previous app I could create different 'moods' using scenes (TV, cooking, etc...) where all lamps could be assigned specific settings like colour & light intensity. One click and all lamps turned into their own specific setting.With the new app, you can create scenes. However within a scene you cannot change lamp specific settings.You can change specific lamp variables however per room, but these settings cannot be saved.Does anyone know how to create and save 'moods' with specific lamp settings and switch easily between them?

Location awareness (geofencing) is totaal nutteloos geworden. Gen I werkte het wel.Nog steeds missen er veel functionaliteiten vergeleken met Gen I. Schandalig om zon incomplete app te lanceren met de oude weg te spammen.

Nieuwe app valt tegen!Ik moet nu vier verschillende Hue apps gebruiken om mijn doelen te bereiken.Zo is het nog steeds niet mogelijk om twee of meer lampen te koppelen om te gelijk te bedien. Bv boven onze eettafel en de gang en overloop.Ook kan je een lamp maar in een ruimte toevoegen. Dit is een heel groot nadeel! Ik heb veel overlappende groepen en scnes in de oude app.Zo hadden wij een alarm voor de kinderen. Lamp op de overloop rood, in bed blijven. Groen, je mag eruit. Ook dit is nu onmogelijk geworden!Helaas voldoet deze app niet aan wat je allemaal zou moeten kunnen doen met zo'n prachtig product.

Kwalijk! Ik kan mijn Philips Hue Lux lampen niet meer van wit tint veranderen. Ik vind het kwalijk dat Philips naar verloop van tijd functies verwijdert en een nieuwe lanp verkoopt die exact hetzelfde is (alleen 800 lumen) en dan de app aanpast zodat ik niet meer mijn lux lamp van wittint kan wijzigen vind het uitermate teleurstellend zeker voor lampen die 40 per stik hebben gekost!
Waarom is het moeilijk om zonsopkomst zonsondergang functionaliteit in te programmeren.De zon gaat immers niet elke dag om 17H onder.

It's an excellent app for the iPhone but it has left those of use depending on LAndscape (with keyboards) from using the app, IPadPro - and after upgrade from last-version; there is no longer an Apple Watch app; meaning; This is actually a downgrade, even though it works much nicer than the old app.I feel a bit miffed off that there is no Apple Watch support; it was key in automating my home. I needed it.
PLEASE add native iPad support!!

All say it best by just mentioning that I deleted this app and continued using the old.... The one you changes it's icon to Black and White. Just put it's colors back and you'll have happier users. Right?

The interface looks good.  That's where the positives stop.Siri no longer works for me.Setting a "scene" is very hard and you must use a photo which the app pulls colors from.  No more individual settings.  Just reinstalled the old app until this one is updated.

When I noticed that I couldn't import the many scenes I had set up for the 20+ Hue lights in my home, I was getting suspicious. Surely Philips didn't remove the ability to create groups and customize colors by bulb in favor of a simplified 'room' feature for beginners? Alas, that's exactly what happened. For example, I had a light grouping for a display case that let me turn on and change settings for six light strips (that together lit the display) in the old app. Now I can no longer select that display unless I make it a room, and I can no longer match or tune the colors to my liking. I'm reverting to the legacy app. It lacks the more modern UI, but it provides the customization that got me to buy into Hue in the first place. I get what you were trying to do, app revs. But the dropped features make this app useless for your most avid users. Please update and restore! Also: psssst, iPads exist.

I just got the starter kit and this app has made it a rough experience. Are you kidding me? Absolutely worthless app. It's worse than the previous. Can't schedule to turn off lights. Really? Don't upgrade! It's a joke. Unbelievable.

1. No more manual control of light color and brightness when creating scenes. Just a pre-determined setting with a shuffle button. I've pressed it HUNDREDS of times trying to get my room the way I want.2. Can't control multiple rooms with one Siri command anymore. For instance, a "bedtime" scene in which all lights in other rooms turn off and bedroom lamp turns on. Only work around is to make a widget. To integrate all HomeKit devices so that one Siri command changes lights in multiple rooms (like above), turns down AC (with Ecobee), and locks the doors (with Schlage) cannot be done. Only lights in one room can be changed.3. No iPad or Apple Watch support.4.  Added rooms but took away groupings of lights (as in for fixtures with multiple bulbs).5. Takes multiple taps to accomplish what used to take one.6. Stock scenes are far more limited and good luck getting them back if you delete any then change your mind later.

This is the worst update to an app that I have ever seen. It is far from intuitive plus if there is a way to bring back the scenes and switches that had been setup before, it is far from obvious.I HATE it. Truly horrible

When this app launches, I was expecting something at least as usable as the prior app. Obvious failings, lack of geofencing and an inability to share bulbs across recipes. You guys realize you sell a bulb, the GO, that untethers from its cord so that you can LITERALLY CARRY IT FROM ROOM TO ROOM!  And yet, with this new app, the bulb is only able to be accessed by recipe from the room in which it's assigned. If I want to turn the lights in the bedroom off and the ones in the living room on, it's now two separate actions as opposed to a single recipe that does both. So thank you for giving me the most advanced hardware for dynamically controlling the lighting in my home and hamstringing it with a subpar application. And another thing, REMOVE THE CONSTANT NOTIFICATION FROM THE PREVIOUS APP! Since I'll be relying on it until this app is sorted, I'd prefer not to have to close out of that EVERY TIME I ACCESS IT!UPDATE: Apparently, the app must be logged into myHue in order to activate geofencing, which seems impractical since it's a function that's built into the phone.
Timers where really useful!Please add them!

Regresses from the previous version in every possible way. Fewer features, requires way more taps to do basic things, extraordinarily confusing to use. Plus no native iPad app. Feels like it was released 6 months too soon.
It makes this app way more confusing and not worth even using. The first app allows easy visual and editing of color setup. My advise either kill this app or copy the old one.

I stuck with this for a while and tried to make the transition from Gen 1...and am going back. It doesn't appear that the developers understand the most frequently used actions actual Hue users, besides improving the basic function of turning a light on and off. Yes, that part is faster, but people don't buy Hue lights just to turn them on and off. Any other action requires at least one more tap or swipe versus the previous generation app. That is a basic fundamental flaw of user interface design. I can't believe a business unit that expects individuals to invest in hundreds of dollars of hardware consistently put such little attention into software design.Philips, do not *ever* pull Gen 1 app from the Apple iTunes Store! Here's hoping for Gen 3...

I can't believe Philips can't release the best app there is for my hue system. The old was was way better and now we are stuck with this? Give me a break. After spending $2,500 on lights I barely can control them now.
Please bring back the ability to randomly turn lights on or off within a given time frame. Adding synching with sunrise/sunset would be an added bonus.

May 22, 2016Had to drop the rating from 3 to 1. Siri was working fine yesterday after a lot of fiddiling with the app. Today, something happened to our uVerse router/modem. Had to reboot the router. Afterwards I went out for a walk and when I returned home, the lights were on (like they were supposed to be). However, I could not have Siri turn any of them off or all of them off. "Lights Off", "Turn Lights Off", "Front Door Off", "Turn Front Door Off". Nothing worked. Had to go into the app, reset Siri and then have Siri find the Hue Hub again. It seems there is a problem in the Hue as it should be able to find Siri even after being assigned a new DHCP IP address. I just went into the app and assigned a static IP to the Hue Hub, will see if this solves the problem with Siri. May 21, 2016Just loaded this after using the previous versions of Hue. Was using HESPERUS to contol my Phillips Hue lights with Siri. After setting up Siri in the Hue app, all I get is "sorry cannot find any devices this time". Did the resync and that did not help. Just figured it out. Had to go into Hue Bridges, select the i for information, Reset Siri voice control and then do Siri voice control setup again. This time it worked. Raised my rating from 1 to 3. iPhone 6S PlusiOS 9.3.2

Whoever was in charge to release this app to the App Store had to be a moron. You don't release an app without your major feature missing. Many of us have spent many hours configuring our Hue scenes. We can still access our scenes from the Meet Hue website. A simple API call would've been able to pull down all the scenes that of been configured in our accounts on the website it's called syncing. Hello??? Did you want to get horrible reviews in your app store for your app? Then you succeeded! While some of the features are great for someone who just bought a Phillips hue kit, your tried-and-true followers have been pushed aside in the name of progress. You had better put an app upgrade soon that immediately prompts you to sync your scenes from your account or else you might get a user revolt. You're not the only light bulb company in this world now and I certainly wouldn't think that your executive team would like to know that you're killing their competitive advantage. Fix it!!!

Functional it has been seriously compromised. The grouping of lights is a nice feature, but a consideration or expansion of the manner in which it was performed previously would have allowed for a much better user experience. In the manner provided now, customization of lights is a much less convenient and more complicated (in the number of steps required). The simplicity and was in which this occurred in the original app has been lost- it just worked. Now sadly it doesn't. I hope these reviews will allow those writing code to consider such. I like the routines option but it is a small blip in the good column when considering all else.
This is a downgrade. Terrible piece of work. If you want to try it do not delete your original app.

Degradation in every feature. Unable save the brightness of the scene, unable to set the color of each bulb in the scene (shuffle is to basic for 100% of users). Obviously, philips make the same mistake twice (first time with the 3rd party debacle they at least has fixed by listening to their customers). Hope they fix this mess by completely redesign this joke.

Worst Gen 2 app I have ever seen. Most all basic functions how I used my original hue app is gone. Being able to create scenes and groups is way way WAY more important then rooms. This new app takes all the customization out of it. I'm sticking with the original app until this garbage is thrown out and another try is made to improve the original and not dumb it down. Please don't make me regret the hundreds of dollars I've spent buying hue lights. You failed. Try again!!! And this time talk to people who actually use hue lights for custom lighting and not just for standard white light bulbs
Wonder if anyone at Phillips uses their products at all.

This "upgrade" is seriously bad. You can no longer pick which light gets which color. It's hard to switch between scenes, and the widgets are broken. Stick with the V1 app till they can fix this disaster. It offers way more functionality and actually does what you want your lights to do.

In January, I purchased Hue lights, downloaded the app, and had the system working in a very short time. I was so happy, I went out and bought more bulbs. Yesterday, I downloaded the Gen2 app, spent the evening frustrated, and woke up this morning to every light still on.  I never did find the random timer button. This system went from working fine to nonworking. Gen2 is not intuitive by any stretch of the imagination.  I'm going back to the Gen1 app. I will not spend anymore time trying to figure out your Gen2 spaghetti.

What a bait and switch!! The gen 1 app let me adjust the bulbs for individual control over color and intensity. Now all that control is gone and the lighting system has NO value to me anymore. Usually a new update means upgrade not downgrading. I only hope that someone wakes up and puts the additional control features back into version 2. I don't want a generic choice the whole reason for the purchase was for the control in creating scenes and light recipes. Now the bulbs just have a mind of their own and while you can still import a photo you no longer can customize the scene with individual bulb control! PLEASE BRING IT BACK, ADD IT IN, OR WHATEVER YOU NEED TO DO so the system meets my expectations OR offer me my money back!!

For some reason it wreaked havoc on my lighting because it didn't delete the old app and so there was conflict. I alternately had to delete this app and then scrub all the scenes in my old happy to recapture effective light control. For Philips: I think you need to design bridges that can link together to expand the overall effectiveness of a home system. Right now, the only way the lights will work is if they are in range of a bridge separated by walls, etc. If you can slave bridges to a master, fixed! Lastly, stick with the old app concept without a wholesale app change!

They have made this app so simple that it lacks many features of the original app. I make up lighting schemes based on not one room, but an areas within my home.  I like picking my color combination based on what I'm doing, not which room I'm in.  It seems to not have improved on home automation either with other devices (nest protect, nest cams, etc)
Lost my old scenes, can't get wakeup light clock in sync with actual time (meaning 8am wakeup light turns on at 6am), overall poorly designed user interface

After all, you will be disappointed if you find out that the software you downloaded for the previous generation Hue won't work due to compatibility issues. Also earlier versions of the Hue will have certain issues since the newer products will have better reliability and other important improvements made. However the choices of which products and softwares to use, the choices made depends on you.

Don't say you're stopping support for the old app that is working until you figure out the new app. The new app looks good, but a lot of functionality has been taken away. Basic use cases are not even addressed/considered in the new app. What if I don't want to turn all the lights on in one room?

This app makes me angry. I love my Hue, and have replace almost all the lights in my apartment with Hue bulbs. But this app ruins the experience and has me thinking I've wasted a lot of money. I can only imagine that the people who built it have never even seen Hue lights, let alone used them. The rooms feature has some potential, but right now it's useless. Especially since scenes can only control lights within a single room. My condo has an open floor plan, so all my carefully crafted scenes affect all the "rooms" I have. The only way to get the same behavior in the new app is to say my entire apartment is one single room. So rooms ... pointless. Speaking of scenes, Creating them in the new app is a nightmare. Totally gone is any way of grouping lights and setting them to the same color. Want the two bulbs in that one lamp to be the same color? Yeah, good luck with that. Photo scenes are just bonkers now because the only option is to let the app randomly assign colors to the lights in the room. This is a silly party trick, not a useful feature. My recommendation is to add scenes to the main nav (along with Rooms, Routines and More) and just replicate the same scene features and behaviors from the original app. Call it something new if you have to - I don't care. All I want is to create, activate and deactivate scenes for all my bulbs as easily as I could do it in the original app.

I hesitated downloading this new version for a while because of the negative reviews and concerns about undoing what I already had in place (I also use IF). This new version is just not intuitive, and that's saying something compared to the first one. But in retrospect the last version made decent sense, whereas this one is just a convoluted pain in the (can I mildly swear on here?).

I like the first version MUCH better than this latest version.  It is NOT intuitive to use, very difficult to use!  For instance, the first version has a simple button in the middle of the home screen to simply shut off all of the lights when you wish (very easy!).  With the new app, who the hecks knows how shut off the lights with one click?!?!?  Why is "wake up" a routine, yet when I create a routine, it goes under a different folder?  That means having to click on the screen again.  Most people set their lights to "timers", why call them "routine" in the new app??  NOT user friendly!  I will delete and use the first version.
I have been using the gen 1 app just fine for a year. Just uninstalled the gen 2 app as it won't connect to the bridge. The user interface is also clunky and not user friendly

Compared to the gen1 app this feels like a stripped out version that lacks a lot of the previous apps functionality.  I really miss the colour palette options. This app feels like a bit of a backwards step in my opinion.

Firstly, app looks great, it's a much more modern interface than the original app and I like that. I also like how you've allowed the creation of rooms so that scenes created for these rooms only affect the bulbs in it.HOWEVER,Why can we not custom map each bulb to a specific point on a photo anymore??? What's up with that? I have a converted garage that is now a room for films, TV and gaming and have set scenes for favourite sports teams etc. Where I have set each bulb individually to get the result I want. Don't take that away from me.Until this is sorted I will be sticking with the 1st gen app as it gives me much more control over the look of the room. As someone else has put it, this new app is the "for dummies" version for people that can't be arsed to go through the effort of setting the room up properly and are just happy with something ok.Not for me

Somehow Phillips have managed to create an app that is worse and better at the same time. The UX is just not intuitive and functionality is worse.Pros: interface is more modern and clean.. thats about itCons: functionality is greatly reduced, so much so I've gone back to "gen 1". Main gripe I have is the scenes can only be set for one room at a time. e.g. In "gen 1" had a "Movie" scene that would turn off all the lights in the house apart from one light in the living room that is set to very dim. Easy with the old app to do, just create a scene, choose your lights and levels and good to go. Even works with Siri. Not possible with "gen 2". Each scene can only be set per room, so forget trying to say to Siri "set movie" as she'll only activate the scene in one room and for all lights in that room. Useless. One advantage of upgrading to HomeKit is any third party app can control so don't need to wait for Philips to fix it, or can just go back to the old app for now.
where is The timer? suddenly its gone

A reforma foi bem vinda, o antigo App j est ultrapassado, apesar de muito eficiente. Tenho enfrentado vrios problemas de desconexo, App no responsivo. Enfim, primeira verso, tem muito potencial de melhora.

So much better than gen 1. Lights are quickly controllable with switches. Picking a colour now uses a hue wheel rather than that weird striped thing they had before. Lights can now be categorized by the room their in. A massive improvement in every way!
Die "alte App" gef_llt mir eindeutig besser. Es f_ngt schon damit an, dass es sie auch fr das iPad gibt...
Quel honte de ne pas faire une version iPad pour une application de domotique ! Ca r_fl_chit pas toujours trs juste chez Philips !

Effectivement bien plus agr_able niveau design, mais pour ce qui est des fonctionnalit_s ... Obligation de passer par les "sc_narios" plus de possibilit_ de choisir manuellement la couleur si on veut juste du bleu,du rouge, ... Pourquoi avoir retir_ cela ?De plus il n'y a plus la possibilit_ du gardiennage virtuel qui _teins la ampoules quand je pars de chez moi!Bel effort mais ... C'est une v1 quoi, qui n_cessite encore bien du travail
This is complete crap. Not ipad native, lacks features and is real garbage.

From how many features have been lost, I would have thought that this was their first app and not their second. Lost features include: Light Groups scheduling (not the same as rooms) Apple watch functionality (why?!)  Widget double-tap "off" Geofencing Zone level (s/m/l)I will give credit that the UI is much more beautiful, but it is also completely dysfunctional. Certain features are much harder to find than before (if they even exist anymore). No more can one create a scene with lights that they have designated as a separate room, even if the office is openly next to the living room. Though good luck even funding where the new home for the "scenes" tab is...Phillips had a real chance at creating a much better intuitive app with advanced features such like a water waves "moving scene" with a LED strip.

I don't know why there is so much negative feedback on this upgrade. I've been really happy with it and think they simplified it for the better. You can still do everything the old all can but I think the GUI is nicer. The color wheel also is much better than the old gradient box.

No longer can you activate an alarm or timer from the app, or at least it's not obvious. Looks like this app is dumbed down for the average consumer versus the original app which was fun for relatively early adopters. Also I still want to trigger a fade -> off trigger from my Tap switch and still cannot do that...

This update is horrible. It may be aesthetically pleasing but the Interface is ridiculous. Yes it has simplified certain actions but it also took away major functions (most importantly grouping lights). If you have multiple lights in your residence you literally have to go through ever light individually to change the color. That's just crazy.

home and away routines don't work when changing lication.  can't edit scenes once created.  can't edit a group of lights at once.   scene with only some lights enabled in a room crashes app when changing brightness.  deleting initial excessive scenes takes a long time and crashes touch controller - have to force quit app. This is disgraceful for a company as large as Philips to create an app without reliable testing.  It feels like they have a single junior coop student writing this app given a testing setup of one bulb in a closet down the hall.  Every person writing this app should be forced to have every bulb in their house/apartment changed with hue bulbs.

So first, if you like your scenes and individual light control, do  not download this app.This is the app they should have come out with two years ago. We've gone back to the basics. And while those basics work much better than the original app, this app does not have any of the advanced features people enjoy _ like scenes and individual light control.Not sure why, but this app has made the hue lights bulbs function like regular light bulbs. Hey Phillips, you idiots, I spent a small fortune on lightbulbs so I could control each one to the exact shade of red, or blue, or green, or whatever the hell else I wanted. If I wanted bulbs that turned on and off or showed up as some shade of white/yellow, I would've just bought regular bulbs and used the wall switch. You now have remarkably advanced light bulbs that your App dumbs down regular, 15-year-ago light bulbs. Also - why can't I assign bulbs to multiple rooms?! Like having a bulb in "downstairs" and also in "kitchen." Again, all you have done is make your "smart" bulbs dumb. If I wanted single-purpose, "not smart" bulbs, I would just by $2 bulbs.
I set all our lights on a timer every night and now I can't find that feature. It was my number one use of the light bulbs and now it's gone.
It does not work. At all. You should fire your design team, immediately. I had to download the Gen 1 again app and lo and behold... All my scenes are gone. F*ck off and die.
Terrible app. Please tell me this is not replacing the other app. HEY Phillips!!! TRY AGAIN!!!
Truly disappointed by the quality of this 'second generation' app. Deleting it and reverting back to the previous one until this one is improved. Come on guys! It's a flop, please fix it!
Gen 1 is so much better, lost a lot of cool features, confusing to use. __

This update is awful! Where are my scenes? Where is the ease of use? Seriously, this app has gone backwards big time! What's really annoying is that when you go back to original app, you have this pop up encouraging you to update. Don't!

I can't imagine what it must be like for the managers and executives who approved this app and then see their customers revolt en masse.The initial paradigm for hue was "come create light recipes and share them with other hue users."  In this new app the company has completely tossed that idea for really beautiful lipstick on an ugly pig of a user experience and control.  This new paradigm is, "you turn things on and off, we'll make that an unimaginative and challenging experience for you." They have taken away recipe creation, automated control of lift/color creation in the worse way possible, made the act of changing lights a multi-click requirement.  They have given no path the migrate all the scenes you've created, dumbed this app, limited to an iPhone interface ignoring iPads.  It is pretty and big, like much recent over-simplistic interface design (thank you google) and they have also given us minimal usability - at least compared to the previous Hue app.  However, at least you can turn light groups off and on room at a time. Just like old fashion light bulbs.  They have taken a fun and personal product and made it a just a product.  One that is not as easy to control or use.  Philips, please, fix this and quickly.
Please add iPad support!

I miss being able to individually set my lights and have bulbs set in different scenes, I like being able to leave a light on in the kitchen and bedroom at night. Try again developers...maybe combine the two apps into one.
wow this app is ridiculous, why fix something that's not broken, so confusing to use... deleted this and sticking with the old app.
Bello il design, limitata per molti altri aspetti, quello che ritengo pi grave  l'impossibilit di raggruppare le lampade per poter usare un colore comune. Continuo a usare l'app precedente.

Initially the app looked promising with the room set up but that is where it ends. Limitations with the Hue Switched in number of lights it can control, UI and UX is poor. Only of iPhone and not watch support. Looking forward to gen 1.5 which combines the good bits if both.

Philips, what have you done? Came to use it last night and messed about for over an hour and STILL cannot connect to my hub. This has screwed up the entire lighting system I once had. Total disgrace. I will be complaining to Philips in writing as this is really terrible service. Neither the 1st Gen or 2nd Gen apps no longer work. I honestly feel conned out of the money I spent on bulbs. Why is it not possible to adjust all the lights in one room to a custom color at the same time? I can only choose from a handful of crappy scenes. Please make it possible again to set all the lights i have in group A or B to the same CUSTOM color in one move instead of doing each one separately.
Tiene sus detalles, no es para iPad pero en general me gusta ms que la Gen 1

Betreibe ca 25 Lampen in einer Loftwohnung in einem Raum. Mit der neuen App muss ich zwingend mit R_umen arbeiten, dadurch absolut nicht mehr brauchbar fr mich. Zudem wird in der 1Gen eine penetrante Meldung bei jedem Start eingeblendet. Bin entt_uscht
