The Original is still so much better. Needs an iPad version, linking with the Hue Community so you can add your current themes and a simpler interface to navigate.
Nicht intuitiv und eine absolute Qual, da hilft auch nicht das verbesserte Design.

Wie schon von anderen erw_hnt, ist fr mich nicht nachvollziehbar, warum essentielle Funktionen in der neuen App fehlen (individuelle Zuordnung der Lampen in den einzelnen Szenen, Erstellen von einfarbigen Szenen). Sieht zwar schick aus aber wichtige Funktionen fehlen.Alte Szenen werden. Alte Szenen werden nicht bernommen nur umst_ndlich und dann ohne das Bild.Szenen schlechter zu erreichen. Generell zu umst_ndlicher.Zudem gibtt es keine IPad App. Bitte verbessern. solange lieber die alte App....

I like the new app, but in the old gen 1 app in the widgets (I have iPhone) you can only turn on the lights. You can't turn them off anymore.  What happened?  So many can use the widget to turn it on but have to use Siri or go to the app to turn my lights off.  :(
I can no longer set all lights to the same color easily! It's just a guessing game. Bummed out, that's a key feature you got rid of!

This may literally be the worst update I have ever received for an app. If I had not already invested so much money in the bulbs I would completely abandon the platform. It is non-intuitive and difficult to navigate. To any one considering buying these bulbs, I would reconsider if I were you.

I have a 1.0 bridge and it doesn't connect with it consistently.  Keeps saying out of home network or no connection.  Not sure how anyone is using this.  Gen 1 app keeps prompting me to upgrade, which is lovely.

Honestly, not sure why the bad ratings. The new app is great, intuitive, and quick to setup. Love the new features. Does it require more? Of course! But all apps do. No? This is a great update from Hue...
This version is even worse than before. They need to go back to the color sliders and or provide a way to input color recipes. (e.g. red 42, green 13, blue 2).
You used to be able to make a scene with multiple lights inside of it, now they are confined to rooms which is not good. So we need to be able to make a scene outside of rooms.

I rarely write reviews, but this deserves no stars.  Why would I use this if it won't sync all of my scenes and alarms from my account and gen 1? Why would I go through the hassle of setting all of my scenes up again. This app is worthless

Im happy with the added features, such as grouping lights into rooms, being able to fade the lights much more easily, and a sleeker look. But Im unhappy about the removed feature of being able to choose the colors I want in a scene rather than having to keep tapping Shuffle in order to eventually (if at all) find the color combination I want. Having to choose the perfect photo for desired colors is unrealistic. I had deleted the Hue Gen 1 app, but now Ive reinstalled it so I can use it in tandem with Gen 2, which is just a clunky way to operate. Please merge the functionality of both apps into one.
For the Today view widget, I don't want 2 buttons for each light. The old app lets you use one button for each light or scene (on/off). Using the old app for now.

Can't group lights like I could before and now I NEED both apps because you don't have support for Apple Watch on the new app. Why are you dropping features ? The only nice thing about this app is the look of the UI. Add back some features and you get my approval.
I hate the new app.

You have got to be kidding me! I lost every single light recipe I created in the old app. How in the hell do you update an app and allow it to destroy everything that the user created. They should have made it easy to transfer your light recipes to your new app.

I have the gen 1 and gen 2 apps running now and that's just dumb. Running both is the only way to get the best of both apps. I really like the rooms feature but hate that I can't adjust the home and away distance. Every time I walk the dogs, the lights go out on the family. So, now I run both and it works just fine.

Please return the double tap to turn the lights off. Out of all the functions I use with my hue  app, the widget was used BY FAR the most. I almost couldn't believe it was taken out. It is so integral into making the app useful.

Ho installate una ventina di lampade per certi aspetti la nuova versione risulta pi funzionale l'assurdit sta nel fatto che prima quando uscivo da casa c'era la possibilit di poter spegnere tutte le luci ora invece  limitata a solo 4 zone (io ho 10 zone)!!! Se avete le fantastiche luci Hue della Philips NON usate questa app ma Hue App di prima generazione. Quella con il logo senza colori.  l'unico modo al momento di usare al 100% le possibilit che le Hue offrono, tra cui prima su tutto la personalizzazione delle scene per lampada e colore, cosa che inesplicabilmente  stata eliminata da questa nuova versione insieme al supporto per l'apple watch. No Apple watch support?!Bad responsiveness of lightingNo geofencing?No iPad 2 compatibility?!?God guys, the old app was so much better, only the look and feel was crap. But now iTS the other way around.Looks good, works like crap!! Why?!

The UX is greatly improved in this app, but it still needs A LOT of work functionality wise.You cannot edit scenes, can't select which lights you want in a scene and you can't add a light to multiple rooms.I accidentally deleted some light recipes and now I can't get them back.I'd like to be able to write custom commands for Siri because she gets confused when I want to turn off a light (says she can't turn of a scene).I was hoping for some new function like ambient scenes (light cycling, stuff like that).You can't turn off a scene in the widget anymore (single action buttons). Which means now I need double the amount of buttons in my widget.And it'd be great that if the lights are already on a specific setting and someone comes home with their geo fence on that it doesn't overwrite the current setting. (Unless they're off).It seems that this app was prematurely released. Which is too bad. I like the hue labs, too, but none of those features have found their way into the app either, which is kind of a let down.EDIT: Just found out you cannot dismiss firmware updates in this app. Had to wait for it to update while my house was dark when I got home until the app had finished updating my bridge. Extremely inconvenient!!!!
Geen timer functie meer. Wordt zeer gemist.Uitvoering oogt grof, niet echt sophisticated. Best jammer dit. Ik blijf de eerste app gebruiken voorlopig.
Geen vooruitgang op de 1e app, graag een echte update

Voelt echt als een eerste beta poging, en ik vind dat voor een bedrijf dat lampen van 50 per stuk verkoop echt diep onder de maat. De app is nog behoorlijk buggy en crashed geregeld. Deze app zou alle 3rd party apps overbodig moeten maken, in plaats daarvan zijn er gewoon beter apps in de app store. Ook de HomeKit koppeling laat nog veel te wensen over.

Fancy looking, but just not as at all practical for setting up scenes if you have many bulbs. Very poor effort and frustrating to have to use this. Back to first app, this one is total crap. Can't even see a way to group bulbs anymore.

I was confused when I heard they were keeping their original app around and not just replacing it. Now I know. This version lacks features and is just a big step backwards. Looks good though. Deleted and sticking with original app.

The new widget doesn't even give you the option to tap your light on and then off, just on. The new app is confusing, took me a few minutes to even understand it. I've been a Hue user for a few years now and have several rooms lot and controlled with various Hue products.  Having just upgraded to the Hue 2 App there are some positives and some negatives.The Good:  - Grouping lights.  Finally set rooms together easily and they stay together.  Old app would always bump random lights out of groups causing frustration.  Now it is easily done.  Groups can also be individual named, allowing easier use of Siri voice commands - Dimming lights.  The use of an easy fader bar is much better than the previous app, making it quicker and easier to turn down a group of lights.- Use of Scenes.  Quick and easy to use scenes now.  However, I never use scenes.And now the bad:-Scenes have replaced colour option for lights.-Changing bulb colours.  The whole fun of hue is the colour options, but this app is a huge step backward.  You can only choose specific scenes and can't control the colour of a specific bulb.  The Ugly:  The truth is if you took this app, blended it with the previous app you'd have a pretty good app to control you Hue system.  Sadly you're stuck jumping between the apps to be able to use all the features.  At the end of the day there are better 3rd party apps to control and customize your Hues with. This app is a decent addition, but only does half of what it should.  Hopefully future updates will address this.Bottom Line: Skip this app and download one of the highly rated 3rd party hue apps. They give you greater control and customizability than both Hue and Hue 2 Apps put together.

I am a long-term user of Philips Hue Lights and I seriously hope they have better plans for this NEW app. In its current state, it's confusing and has lost a tonne of functionality.- Unable to create LIGHT GROUPS. The only group option is "rooms" which means individual lights cannot be added to multiple rooms and therefore, it's not possible to create multi-room scenes.- Unable to control individual lights, or combinations of lights from NOTIFICATION WIDGET. Only allows you to select whole rooms or whole home.- Unable to create ROUTINES with individual lights, or combinations of lights. Only allows you to select whole rooms or whole home.- WAKEUP uses warm light instead of bright white light which is preferred for those of us  wanting a natural wake-up rhythm or those with Seasonal Affective Disorder (SAD)- No longer able to customise and save changes to light recipe scenes (energise, read, concentrate, relax) or new dimmed, nightlight, bright scenes. - No ability to configure geofencing zone size.  Notification for leaving or entering geolocation zone has been removed as well.- No ability to randomise on and off alarm schedules.- Can't create light scene with standard colour pallet, forces you to use a photo. However when you use a photo, you're unable to place each bulb on the photo to select its colour.- Unable to automatically calculate light schedule for "sunrise" and "sunset"- Fade time is limited to 10, 15, 20, 30.  Longer or shorter durations are not available.Now I know that there are a lot of other applications out there that work with these lights, but Phillips need to demonstrate basic and advanced functionality to help grow the platform. The brilliance of these configurable lights is that they are highly customisable. I just hope this doesn't signal the demise of these products because there has been no indication from Philips whether missing (or new) features are going to be return to the app. I'm going to keep this review up-to-date with all the problems I find as I continue to use the app in the coming weeks.

There are a lot of things wrong with this new app. Apart from the fact it's been simplified to the point it almost makes the lights pointless, u have removed the best feature; dragging individual bulbs to specific colours! My sense of freedom and choice has gone, it's a nice touch it can be generalised, but I still want to be able to make bold choices!! I'm sticking with the old app until it becomes useless, then I'm getting rid of Hue. Pointless without choice!

I have read some of the other reviews here- and I have to agree to disagree with them. I own near enough 150 various hue products/bulbs strips etc, and use 3 bridges at the same time - have ALL types of hue range products, using them for over 2 years;  So I know what I am talking about. This appis tonnes better than any other app out there - and I have tried nearly all of them! It's not simple for dummies - then dummies shouldn't be using these bulbs with app- stick to the switches they can come with.I can't thank Philips enough for update to gen 2; now it's the only app I use; bridge switching is easy; bulbs rooms; scenes and themes much easier to manage. On iPhone it's a pure delight to use- and creating you own scene is so cool! Not to mention very easyIn fact other than sounds and dynamic themes- Philips have thought about everything practical. Please include dynamic scenes in your next update!Remember the app facilitates the use of the bridge and bulbs; and other products- it's he primary software to run the hardware of hue products; there are heaps and heaps of various apps that do different things. So get those; find one for your need; as a primary app this has done an excellent job and is VERY simple to use- if you know how hue range work and how to utilise them to begin with. This app will be the killer of paid hue apps hence so much negativity I think. The only negative about hue range/ product is that they are expensive. But find product of similar quality, build and innovation then compare. There are so many car makers- but most will know an Audi, BMW and Mercs are what they are; and hue lights are just hue lights- and this app is fantastic- well done Philips! LONG awaited and it's been delivered! Thank you!!!

First, I'd like to point out that most of the 1-star reviews I've read here are from people who clearly have difficulty accepting change. Yes, Groups have been renamed to Rooms and Alarms are now Routines. But they are functionally equivalent. Secondly, the app addresses some pain points from the previous version. The new color pickers are much easier to use and allow you to get the full range of color out of your bulbs. In the previous app, it was very difficult to drag the selector to the edges of the palette. Also, I love that there are now on/off switches next to every light and Room. My most common tasks is to simply shut a light off. Now I can do that quickly. The new slider controls are also much easier to use. If you're happy with the previous app, then you probably don't need to upgrade. But if you're frustrated by some of the UI details in the old app, I think you'll find this a solid improvement.
Usually a generation 2 is new and improved from generation 1. This is a dumbed down version of generation 1. Fail.

Let's talk about the good first. This app looks nice. The style is certainly a step up from version 1. The app is quick and responsive. Setting up rooms is nice and intuitive. The Siri integration takes some work, but seems to work very well after you tinker with it.Tip: Name your rooms how you would describe them in natural language. Example: "The Living Room Lights", instead of "Living Room". Let's talk about the bad. The migration from v1 is terrible. No scenes are seemingly compatible with this version from v1. Some of the feature are buried. Tip: You CAN build scenes with custom colors. Took me a while to find it. Select a room, then tap the light bulb icon and you can play with the color from there. After you do each bulb in the room, you can build a scene from it. Sadly, the option for color from photo is gone using this method. Some stuff just doesn't work. I found no way to edit scenes after they were done. There doesn't seem to be anyway to group multiple rooms together for one scene which is the most glaring issue with the app. I thought I could create a "1st floor room" as a work around for this. DO NOT TRY THIS. Apparently you can only have one bulb assigned to one room at a time. Ugh....Hue, give us our scenes for multi-rooms and I'll be much happier.

As others have already said. This app is one step forward and two steps back.1. Scenes have been dumbed down to the point that they are utterly useless. It's almost laughable. There is no way to actually customize or edit any scene short from hitting a randomize button. I was hoping that Philips would actually try and fix the scene editing interface rathen than just decapitating it.2. While room grouping is a welcome change, there is still no concept of grouping lights together as one logical unit (zone?). So if you have any rooms with multiple light fixtures that have multiple lights, good luck to you. You can turn a room on and off, but if you want a scene where some light fixtures are on and some are off or at different levels of itensity with different color, no go.3. Also, there is no way to create a scene that sets lights for multiple rooms. So if you have a relatively open floor plan and you want to configure your lights to dim down an adjacent room to watch a movie in the living area, no go.4. It is unclear if the Home & Away feature actually works with multiple users.This app might work well for customers that have bought a starter kit to play with the lights but it doesn't serve anyone that actually made a considerable investment in installing hue lights in an entire house.

So the first gen Hue app suddenly alerts me that it will no longer be supported, and that it wanted to download the new app. Great. Except, not so much. It replaced the first gen iPad app with a second gen iPhone app - there's no longer an iPad app. The iPhone app can only be viewed in portrait mode - it won't rotate into landscape. On top of that, it's hell to figure out how to merely adjust *one bulb* (after grouping into rooms - which I hate - you tap on the room, then tap on a bulb name, then go through two more steps to adjust brightness and color, as opposed to the one step in the old app). All around, this app has the feeling that it was designed by engineers who never used the bulbs or the old app in a real world setting - like their own homes. This is a poorly designed app, with too many steps, too difficult to figure out, and too limited in its power. And, really, no iPad version??

I don't know whether to blame this horrible app fully on Phillips or also on Apple, because HomeKit is such a half-baked poorly introduced mess. But Hue suffers because HomeKit is a disaster. This app is Phillips' second attempt to integrate Hue into HomeKit. It fails. It loses all previously defined scenes from the first version of the app, because it can't import scenes -- either from Hue gen 1 or from HomeKit. It also has mysterious error messages about naming lights won't work because of conflicting names. If you access your lights on an iPhone and then go to an iPad, it will insist on renaming then all because the first names were all taken by the iPhone. THEY ARE THE SAME LIGHTS AND DON'T NEED TO BE NAMED AGAIN. These are just a few of he frustrations.

Use the 'Gen 1' version of this app, because this version removes cool functionality for the sake of just trying to look cool. But it's not cool. The developers must not realize what makes a smart lightbulb different from a standard bulb. Rooms? As in a light switch for each room of your home? Setting all of your scenes up again, manually? But your scenes can only work within one room? Why don't I just go back to standard bulbs, use my standard wall switches, and call it a day?This backwards move in functionality is purely stupid and either shows they don't use the product or that the app was rushed out unfinished. Use Gen 1 or find a better app to control your lights. And maybe think of going with a different brand, you might be happier.

Mis de optie willekeurig aan schakelen! Kan deze ge-update worden? Dat maakt Hue juist zo fijn tegen anti inbraak
Snap deze update niet. Waarom moet ik een foto kiezen om een scne aan te maken? En inderdaad geen Apple watch ondersteuning. Nee nog niet, ik blijf voorlopig bij versie 1

Wat een teleurstelling. Ik ga deze app niet gebruiken. Heb je net mooie scenes ingesteld, kun je overnieuw beginnen maar hoe dat moet? Geen idee. Ik blijf de oude app wel gebruiken. Ik was al geen Philips fan en heb dit merk jarenlang geboycot in huis maar voor de Hue lampen maakte ik een uitzondering. Dom, dom, dom. Honderden euro's kwijt en een absoluut waardeloze app. Marktplaats maar??
Valt me zwaar tegen Philips, totaal gebruikersonvriendelijk, geofencing werkt niet, app ziet niet of lamp met de handschakelaar aan is gezet, etc etc...snel weer naar 1e versie!

App ziet er goed uit. Echter voelt zeer beperkt in de mogelijkheden. Gemiste kans om geen zonsopkomst en zonsondergang trigger toe te voegen!! Ik wil graag 30 minuten voor ondergang dat m'n lampen aan gaan. De trigger zon-onder zit notabene al in de app... Hopelijk snel een update!

Ik mis de mogelijkheid voor het hele huis scenes te maken!Intervallen van 5 minuten ben ook ik niet blij meeDaarnaast zou het ook mogelijk moeten zijn lichtgroepen te maken die lampen onafhankelijk van kamers linken, zoals in de eerdere versie van de app wel konIk blijf voorlopig de oude app gebruiken, of elgato eve
Im Vergleich zur alten App nicht zu gebrauchen. Definitiv ein Schritt zurck.

The new look is nice, and at least they have stopped breaking the app with every update for a while now so that was great.  Now to remove all the ability for individual light control and add no new features at all is pretty asinine. Were you going for the minimalist feel...??  I would say Philips should put out for some talented app designers there are tons that would love to work for such a large global company.  These lights should have tons of features and tie ins. Get with the times ... A fresh crowd sourced project has more talent and ideas, move on.

All of my scenes were broken when this version was installed. After 6 hours of work I've managed to get rooms turning on together but don't have any Siri support or handoff to HomeKit. A little basic QA would have been appreciated, Philips.
Glad the first generation app is still around; can't get past the room setup. It tells me I have too many rooms created... But I haven't created any!

The limit of one Hue account per bridge is pretty restrictive. I can't seem to figure out a way to make lights in a room the same colour.Overall, this app is lacking. There are much better products out there like iConnectHue that give much better control over your lights. If you want HomeKit support, go with iDevices or Eve.

Like the new widget control, room set up and routines. Missing sharing settings between devices, picture icons for widgets and staying logged in. Would like to see functionality from the first app in the second app rather than a complete rewrite. Transferring the settings from first version would also be nice.

Excellent looking redesign. Refreshed UI and larger tap targets make it easier to interact with. The introduction of the grouping of lights into "rooms" is a welcome addition. However, it's a dumpster fire when it comes to navigating the interface, creating new scenes and is generally confusing enough to discourage new and existing users. Oh and they ditched some features such as Apple Watch support and

Die Homekit Integration ist einerseits gelungen, indem R_ume etc. der Homekit Konfiguration jetzt verfgbar sind. Auch die neue Umsetzung der UI und der Erstellung von Szenen ist ganz ok. Was die neue App unbrauchbar macht sind 3 Dinge:1) Bei der Definition von Szenen kann die Helligkeit einzelner Lampen nicht definiert werden - zumindest habe ich dazu keine Option gefunden.2) Die Farbauswahl fr Szenen war in der bisherigen App besser gel_st - wobei die neue Version auch einen guten, wenn auch nicht gerade intuitiven Ansatz verfolgt3) Dritter Punkt und K.O. Kriterium: Es gibt in der neuen App keine Notification mehr wenn was die location Based Routinen angeht. Sprich: Haus verlassen oder ankommen wird nicht mehr im Homescreen angezeigt. Insofern wei man nicht ob die Lampen wirklich ausgegangen sind. Generell laufen die Routinen bei mir nicht verl_sslich. Mag sein, dass das nicht generell so ist.
Mit meinem Ipad2 geht gar nicht.Widget geht nicht.Dimmen geht nicht.Alte Szenen sind weg.Aber sieht toll aus.
... warum muss man eigentlich alles "verschlimmbessern"?
Absolute Verschlimmbesserung, macht ein tolles Produkt kaputt. Schade.
die Ambilight Funktion.Derzeit braucht man dazu eine 2. App und die kommen sich auch mal in die Quere was die Priorit_ten betrifft.Sonst w_re es perfekt.

Frher konnte ich in meiner Stehlampe, die drei Leuchtmittel beinhaltet, alle drei gleich farbig stellen. Jetzt nicht mehr. Auerdem finde ich keine M_glichkeit, selbst Farben festzulegen. Bitte nochmal nachdenken, oder warten bis ein anderer Hersteller zeigt wir es geht, und nachmachen.
Why do you release an app with less functionality than the old one?*no ipad support*no apple watch support/Sad customer

I had to check if I had signed up as a beta tester or something. How can this app have passed testing and quality assurance? No way to change all lights at once. What happen to all my scenes? Setting up widgets is absolutely terrible and the kicker is, they are not synced to any other devices. And no iPad support? Glad the Gen1 app still works.

Purtroppo sono rimasto deluso. Bello il design ma le funzionalit sono diventate pessime. I widget creati mi dicono che non hanno stanze assegnate (quando non  cos) di conseguenza non funzionano.Da aggiornare!
La preferisco rispetto a quella vecchia...  solo questione di abitudine. Il supporto a Siri non funziona benissimo. Migliorabile.

Questa volta DEVO.Avete aggiornato l'app e resettato tutte le impostazioni.Ho dovuto riconfigurare tutte le luci! Poi, per quale motivo sono obbligato a dividere le stanze ed all'interno settare ogni luce?Non era meglio prima quando avevo l'elenco tutto a portata di mano? Non  possibile che per regolare la luce del comodino debba fare 4 passaggi!Tanto  bello il sistema tanto  mal fatta l'app!!!

Avete migliorato la grafica, avete migliorato l'accesso alle funzioni ma avete commesso l'errore pi grande, le stesse lampade possono essere configurate solo per una scena e non per pi scene. Se potessi metterei ZERO

Geen ondersteuning van de bestaande scenes! Hoe is dat mogelijk :-( De room-functie is veelbelovend als je de app voor het eerst gebruikt, maar daarna heb je meer nadelen dan voordelen. Voorbeeld: Ik gebruik meerdere scenes in de slaapkamer: Enkel de nachtlampjes (Hue Beyond) met warme kleuren vs. alle lampen. Met deze app zou je hiervoor meerdere kamers moeten definiren voor dezelfde kamer. Idem dito voor de woonkamer: warm licht vs. intiem licht. Bovendien kan je elke lamp maar in __n kamer gebruiken, dus niet delen in verschillende "kamers". Ik gebruik verder ook Hue Taps overal in het huis. Met deze versie wordt dat helemaal een ramp. Je kan bijna niets meer doen met die schakelaars. Dank je wel Philips! Wat een achteruitgang :(
Weniger Funktionen als die erste gen., alte Szenen nicht mehr verfgbar, einfach dumm so raus zu bringen was soll der Mist
Die alte Version war besser. Sie bietet keine Apple Watch Funktion. Und ist auch sehr unbersichtlich aufgebaut. Auch bittet sie fast keine Szenen zur Auswahl sowie die alte Version.

I understand that making app is not easy, however original hue app was simple, easy to use and it was obvious what is turn on or off and where. Honestly if I could I would use the first app rather then this but not possible anymore.
No iPad version so looks rubbish on my iPad. Looks pretty but time consuming and fiddly to set up. Will use version 1 until Philips see the light! Avoid until then...
I don't normally write reviews but wow, this "update" is 'kin terrible! Unintuitive, jumbled and a complete mess! Where was the user testing done? Do not download, use a decent 3rd party app instead.

So far, this app has actually worked in controlling the Phillips hue. The alarm feature works. You can set colours. Both UX and UI need addressing - the experience is poor and the UI is not intuitive. Three stars just for the fact it works, as previous app didn't!
It has a better design, but I is not as friendly as the 1st gen app. The deal breaker for me is the option to click twice on the widget to turn off the light.
You cant set the induvidual lights for each room.

Ligger vken n fordi alarmen p lyset gikk av p feil tid. Klarte ikke sl av med ny app (ikke kontakt). Mtte bruke den gamle. Den nye appen er alt annet enn intuitiv. Den virker heller ikke. Teste neste gang fr den slippes?

Beyond horrible. Too bad there isn't a Zero Stars rating. We have 50+ Hue bulbs and not being able to group bulbs in the same lamp/area to color match all the other bulbs makes this app genuinely useless. Trying to match the color of each bulb to its neighboring bulbs individually is nearly impossible and just doesn't cut it, Philips. Back to the drawing board.

Just awful. This is 10 steps back from what we had. This is not an improvement in any way. Im staying with the old app, especially since I can find no way to bring in my scenes from the original or the web site. Keep working Philips. this isn't ready for Prime Time, not by a long shot

The ability to separate groups of bulbs into rooms is great but I'd really like the functionality of designating individual bulb's colors and brightness when creating scenes back. In this version it seems like you pick a picture and keep rolling the dice until you're maybe happy with it. I only have one room with Hue bulbs for now so I'll keep using the old app until I see this one get updated

After an hour and a half, I have come to agree with the previous low star reviewers.  It is a dumbed down version that is far less intuitive and user friendly that the original app.  Additionally, it is far less useful.  It might be useful for someone wanting a techie light switch for white lights--maybe using the app as a dimmer.  For those of us creating scenes with purpose and nuance, you've made it relatively useless.   Please invest the time and development dollars in maintaining the original.

This is a solid update. The ability to delete lights from your bridge and easily add them again is a welcome change. I don't understand all of the fuss about groups. You can define rooms, or parts of rooms, or virtual rooms that effectively give you all of the grouping capabilities you need. The UI is a little confusing, but still an improvement. Nice app. I was pleasantly surprised after reading all of the vitriol.

The gui looks nicer, but where is everything? Why can't I just make scenes without selecting a room first?I like the wake-up feature, but now you can't seem to set what scene it turns on to! Also where are the timers? I can't get rid of the old app because this doesn't have simple timers.

Don't understand the point of this app. I can't use my scenes. Why would I want to simply use the crap stock scenes they supply. This version removes the ability to truly customize which is the whole point of having Hue lights.
We use the hue lights as a timer to go to sleep. As far as I can tell, that functionality is completely gone. Ridiculous. This is the PRIMARY reason we got the lights in the first place. Fix it.

The interface is a bit confusing sometimes, but it works. Others have pointed out its limitations with things like groups of lights and subsets of lights. I don't have a complex config yet so I haven't felt stung yet. But the app does work for what it's doing right now.  Siri works great. And the widget is really convenient too. I assume the app will be constantly developed? (Hint hint).

You can't pic the colors in a picture that you select and the app is doing it at random. HomeKit can't get names right constantly telling me to rename everything even after HomeKit and Siri were reset. Yet Home a 3rd party app has no problem. You can't bring over your existing scenes and dimmer switches will not link back to the hub. Your app should have all of not more of the features that a 3rd party has if you are going to make me buy another hub for HomeKit and charge me $60 to $80 a lamp where is the money going? Not the app that's for sure because anyone can use it for a matter of minutes and say this app was not finished. Sorry but us customers have been making issues know for a long time now. If a kid learning code can fix a app faster then Philips, a company with real time and money, then it's time to shut down.

It appears that Philips dropped Apple Watch support in the "improved" Hue2! As mentioned in other reviews, Philips needs to have some actual users in the loop when it creates software design! Don't the engineers personally use Hue and quickly realize what is an improvement and constructively builds on existing legacy systems? I'll continue to use Hue1 with Apple Watch support as long as I can and hope that someone at Hue wakes up to this major failure!

Very tedious to program, especially Widgets. Really, I have to program every single one? At least give us a choice to pull from scenes. Also lame that scenes from previous app didn't translate over. It also takes forever to navigate, like getting to scenes. Please redesign.
Can't create scenes or retrieve your old ones. Incredibly hard to find anything to be honest. They made turning on lights and changing their colors difficult.

I'm lowering my review to one star because the scenes randomly assign colors instead of giving me control over the color of each bulb, as did the previous software version. Amazing: Philips produces these wonderful bulbs, and then produces an inscrutible app, that gives you so little control over the lights! What a tremendous lost potential.My original review follows.This looks like it will be an elegant and powerful app. It's already working a little for me. But the GUI is totally new, unlike any other app, and not in an intuitive way at all. There's virtually no help within the app, and online discussions are just beginning to address the issues. I have to say, upgrading this is one of the most unpleasant app learning experiences I've ever had, and I've had plenty. It's just so new and counterintuitive. If you get this app, or especially if you're updating from the previous version, expect setup to involve a lot of stumbling around, and trying to figure out how to do what you always used to be able to do before the update.
Overall I like the new app and it's functionality, but the WAKE UP feature does not work with the fade on function. I need this in the mornings! Please fix!

This is the most confusing app I have ever encountered if I would of started with this instead of Hue1 I would of sent everything back How can you take some thing that works so well and totally screw it up

The new app is confusing and lacks features from the first gen app.  I get things need to move forward but giving up groups and the complexity around the new scenes is a killer. Will use the old app as long as I can.  Rooms is a nice addition but doesn't always reflect how people light their house.  Seems a little to much adherence to HomeKit rather then how so many Hue users actually use the product.  Fail

After using the original app for years, I was excited for the next generation of the app. I did not have to go far to see that this "update" was not fully thought out and published prematurely: it is not a universal app (i.e. small interface for iPad or poor resolution if you select the "x2" button to fill the screen), you cannot transfer scenes from the old app (you are led to believe you can, but it is not a TRUE transfer, it's more of a "partial kind of but not really transfer" that does not bring over the picture associated with a scene; and if you invested a lot of time on the original app that's very frustrating), no landscape mode for iPad (again, not a universal app). Since Philips stopped support and updates of the original app, I certainly hope this new app has a big next update that incorporates some of the above listed (and what I believe to be) core functionality that should have been included in the original issuance of the new app in my opinion.

The gen 1 had issues. This gen 2 app took those issues and just added some nice graphics on top.How can I create scenes that include ALL of my lights? There only scene options I can find in the new app are room based.Say I want to watch a movie. I can only create a scene for my living room. So the lights in the rest of the house will stay on unless I manually turn every room off.Horrible.

Where is the control for individual lights and color selection. Where are the amazing original scenes I made?? I was an idiot. I deleted the other hue app, when I downloaded this one, before I realized it was basically missing everything that was great. Do you like a lot of the features of this app

Hue totally misses what Apple seems to understand. They created what appears to be a simple, intuitive interface that is anything but that. I certainly understand the concept behind the new design but a "Help" link or a video on their website would have made a huge difference. I am having issues with the lights behaving from rules created from the old Hue app, which I've deleted. I am going to delete the new app, download the older version of the Hue app, reset my router and start over. One feature that I miss is that I cannot find anywhere in the new app for a "timer". Previously I could set a timer in my bedroom to go off at 20 minutes but I no longer can. I go to bed at different times, so I can't simply set one off time. Hue, LISTEN TO YOUR CUSTOMERS!  There needs to be more information on your website. Your Support section woefully lacks.

Here we go again Phillips!  You had an app that worked and turned it over to the interns again.  Warning!!  No customization of colors.  That's gone.  You can create a timer to turn on the lights, but they forgot how to turn off the lights.  If that feature exists....I can't find it.  Thanks for breaking the app again!

If you are new to hue, make sure you download the version 1 app.   This one is not as good.  Lights are grouped into rooms.   That might work for some people but what about open areas?   I have an open floor plan and I might want to control a certain set of lights in several rooms.  That cannot be done with this app.  There are no groups anymore.  It would be better is you could have the same light be part of several rooms.  I like the group idea better.  In the old app, a light could be in many groups.     I also liked that I could bring up the lights section and just control any light in the house at will.  When you create a new app, it should not take away features but improve and add them.  By the way, the old app has an iPad version.  This one is iPhone only!

At first I thought the new UI was a bit more intuitive than the old one. Unfortunately I couldn't figure out how to set up the wake up alarm to start with one color and then fade to a different color. This is important to me so it mimics early morning and isn't too jarring. It took me a couple days to figure out how to do it in the old app. In the new app I never did figure it out. Not sure it's possible since I can't seem to choose different colors for the same light at different times of the day.I just deleted the app and went back to the old one.
I love this app. It's very organized and the lighting selection are more exciting and beautiful.

The new app forces you to work off pre-programmed images. I need a color wheel not a palm tree. Who in the world wants their lights to look like a palm tree???Using a photograph of a tropical sunset or mountain top was broken UI when this product launched, and its still broken UI 4 years later. Removing the color wheel / color picker functionality and forcing you to pick colors from a photo is the incorrect answer here.
Worse than Gen 1 app. Needs group function
Groups. Bring them back. Not sure how this was overlooked. But that was essential to the first gen app.

There are a bunch of features that were reduced and dumbed down on Gen 2. *Dimming function is now reduced from 60 mins to 30. So if you create two timers to fade into each other, it happens too quickly. It should have been extended as it works great for moving from diner time to sleep time. * There is still a over use of the silly photo thing. There are only so many colors these lights can produce and the Home app seems to have better control of that.  A simple color palette would have worked fine. * Gen 1 could easily do rooms separately as well and it was easiest to just create a page for each room, add the 4 recipes and a couple of customs then you were done. * Finally They need a beta program for everyone to test out before release. It would save so the so much time, money and complaints.

don't be surprised when you cannot use Siri to control your lights anymore. the upgrade completely wrecks your phone's previous settings. enjoy completely setting everything up again and then not having the functionalities of the previous version. garbage app, poor programming.

Take the abilities of the Gen 1 app with the style of Gen 2 and you got yourself a cool new app. Take basic functions that have existed from the very beginning and take them away, you get this app. Scenes which are so important in the Gen 1 app are buried in this app. NOT BEING ABLE TO MIGRATE SCENES FROM ONE APP TO ANOTHER MAKES THIS APP USELESS. I can see them on your website, how can I not see existing scenes on your new app. Rooms while a good idea is so less important then being able to group lights (aka scenes) Back to the drawing board Phillips.

Didn't even open this app after reading the reviews. It sounds to me that this app is only going to mess up everything I've set up already. I'm really disappointed in Philips hue for not making better apps. You would think that they would have the best apps of there products but they seem to be mediocre at best. I really hope Philips reads these reviews. I love there product but like I said there apps need work.
This app needs an update. I have multiple lights in one fixture and need group adjustments back.Also, please make moving to this new app easier with an import function.

After 30 minutes of poking around just to get experience I was able to get with the previous app I really do not feel like providing constructive feedback. I concur what others brought up. Also, it's still surprisingly inconvenient UX. Is there any scenario this was optimized for?

No customization! That's the first thing missing. Then there's the requirement to set lights by room...what if I want one light in a room sometimes and three other times? Sorry...I'm keeping and using the old app until you fix this one. Boo, Hue!

this app throws away the ability to control lights in groups or independently in favor of control of "rooms". The UI is slower and more confusing than gen 1, and removes some of the greatest features. I was really looking forward to the routines, but there is very little change between those and the timers in the original app.

I'm sticking with the original app until this new app allows importing all the scenes that I've set up with the original app. Whoever allowed this app to be releases without this feature should be fired.
Where is the watch support? Is the problem this it isn't native? Make it native so it's faster. Come on now.

For the cost of these lights and a brand name like Phillips, you would think they would make an app that actually works!! Phillips should be ashamed of themselves for putting their name on a piece of junk app like this!!

Ah, a much needed refresh! Finally! The ability to quickly turn rooms on and off. I can move between rooms with a breeze.I feel like everything is much more natural on initial setup. Great UI, great icons.However, there are some caveats. I can no longer choose which lights get which color on the scenes. This leads me to tapping Shuffle a dozen or so times and finally settling. It's important to have this control of your lights are arranged a certain way.The old scenes from Gen 1 also don't seem to sync over. This is a disappointment.Also, I can't seem to disable a Coming Home scene - I untapped the room but I can't untap home.Geofencing ability is minimal. I like Apple's way to set the range. I couldn't find a way to change the location after it chose it, or its borders.Overall, a solid more intuitive design, but it needs to bring back advanced functionality for my full stars to return.

This app can do most of what the first app could do. But it's missing one feature: scenes that include multiple rooms. You can mostly get there. Widgets allow you to set a scene across multiple rooms. But the problem is widgets don't sync with Siri. There is no way to have Siri control two rooms at once, that I can find. (i.e. Dining and living, which in my house are actually practically the same room, but I still want to be able to control them separately)Another solution would be to allow bulbs to belong to multiple rooms. That way I could create the normal dining and living rooms, but also create a "front" room or "main" room which includes the bulbs from both.In any case, this lack of functionality is a huge regression from v1 of the app. Hopefully it gets fixed.

Philips, you did a complete redesign of an app that just needed improvement. I HATE the new app!! There are some good features, like room grouping. However I had scenes that were for multiple rooms & now scenes are within a group. I don't plan on using this app, I'll stick with the old one.

This isn't much of an improvement over the gen1 app. It's shiny, but it's a pain to migrate to. The addition of support for rooms is handy, until you want to configure a custom scene using more than one room. It would have been nice if they had provided the ability to transfer/sync the scenes and alarms (now called "routines"). But there is no such option. You have to reconfigure all of it.There's no Apple Watch support, and the notification center widgets are less intuitive. You can't double tap a widget to turn a scene off. Instead, you have to make a widget just for turning whole rooms of lights off.
This app is awful. The interface is inscrutable, and trying to do anything is frustrating. They need to spend more time on usability and less on trying to be cool. Zero stars.

So much functionality is gone. It's much more cumbersome to use. The user interface is not so great in this version. Restoring the widget functionality of turning scenes on and off with the same push of a button would be a great start.

Overall the new app looks better, and some new things added. The most evident thing is the removal of the color mixer for lights, removal of "Scenes" and no forward over of Scenes or colors from there previous app. Also the menus are confusing and need more thought out toward them.The app is a step in the right[ish] direction, but it needs to carry over the futures from the previous generation one application. Please update, Phillips!
1. You cannot change to the color you want. 2. You cannot change ask at onceHopefully it's fixed, or I'm sticking with gen 1

Phillips really messed up with this update, the interface is terrible, easy scene creation and single light modification within a scene is impossible:  bad choice Phillips... Many users are very disappointed here

This app is awful. No alarms, no scenes, no grouping, no control of all lights at once. Version 1 was terrible but this is even worse. Philips needs to hire some of its home grown Dutch programmers with autonomy to create a functioning GUI without scrapping useful features to account for stupid users.
Don't. Srsly DONT. Not intuitive, mega-lame UX, totally notttt user centric. Over it.......______

Once again, a company writes a new app without porting over all previous functionality!!!Some of us spent a LOT of time building up and tuning our Scenes.And what? Now we are just suppose to start all over from scratch?1.) Not as pretty2.) Not feature replaceable from old version 3.) No new functionality seems to be added.4.) No reason given to upgrade other than threat that old version is no longer supported.Kinda of customer service disaster.I am sure it will turn into something good eventually but that is not what it is now.

You like being confused; Like complicated apps, that require hours of climbing the learning curve; Like not having Siri work, or recognize what you say (Siri can only control one room and one scene at a time); Like having random lights be ignored; Do not want to control individual lights; Like having an app that has severe limits (you can only turn on/off a maximum of 4 "rooms" when you set a wake up, auto off or auto on setting - so you are screwed if you have Hue in more than that); Feel you wasted your time setting up scenes (news flash, your old scenes are gone and you cannot create new ones);This is one of the worst apps I have. I will stick with gen1, at least it workedBest advice for Phillips: Terminate the idiots that thought this was a "good" idea, and the next developer needs to live in a house that has more than 3 bulbs in one room.

I switched to the new app and while do it I wondered to myself why not just a major update?I'm thinking they beta tested it with the programmers because only someone who wrote the app would think it is intuitive.There is no clear way to set up colors within scenes and scenes them selves are not self explanatory

I love this app! I think its a major improvement from the previous one. Its now extremely easy to lighten/dim individual or group lights, or turn them on or off. I really can't understand why people aren't giving this more praise, they nailed it!!
This update is the worst. Prone to crashing and much worse than the original.

They've removed the best functionality of the app. Made it more complicated to adjust scenes or create new ones. The UI is confusing with many sections that seem to do the same thing but don't actually affect your setup. You can no longer tap a widget twice to turn that scene off completely. If only they could mix the better look of this app but the functionality of gen 1 everything would be fine (judging from the other reviews everyone agrees). I just hope they act fast. Or I'll be using a 3rd party app and not recommending these anymore.

For those of us who have more than a few of these bulbs, the ability to group bulbs at the same exact color is critical. This new version takes that capability away!  What were you thinking? You removed the most useful feature.

This ap is terrible! I hate it that I have to actually choose a star. There's no more grouping lights or manually selecting colors. You can't choose specific areas of an image for a light. The only option now is a random shuffle that you do not have control of. This is a mistake Philips! BIG MISTAKE!

I do not like this app.  Good:Room groupings are easy and intuitive.Bad:No individual light control.No color palette to pick colors from.  Just scenes to choose from. No way to import my scenes that I created in myhue.The alarm feature that allowed randomized light timing is gone and replaced with a lame and less customizable feature.Overall:Literally the worst update I've ever seen in an app.
All of the bad reviews I've read so far are 100% true! This thing is a total train wreck! Would anybody please recommend some third-party applications that are better now?

Some things work better then gen 1.  Philips you are making a smart home app.  Most developers are adding rotation to their apps...you take it away. The new app fails in several ways. The biggest failing is the inability to assign bulbs to more than one "room". The quotes are important, since you might want to define a room as the whole house, or several physical rooms. Since a bulb can only be in one "room" in the app, you're out of luck if you want scenes that apply to a single room *and* scenes that are for larger areas in the house (like, say, a scene for a living room night light and a scene for watching TV that affects lights in the living room and nearby dining room). Technically you could define a single room for all the bulbs and then create a ton of scenes, but it's awkward and you'll still run into a problem if you want to turn on lights in two separate physical rooms independently.The other issue is that there's no good way to import scenes and settings from the old app. You have to activate a scene in the old app, then use the add scene button. You need to do this for each scene, and again you're out of luck if you want to copy a scene spanning rooms.I also noticed the app had a hard time connecting to certain lights. They'd become unresponsive for a while, sometimes requiring restarting the app.All in all, this app is an attempt to streamline the interface, but in doing so makes the app less usable. Hopefully this gets addressed in future updates.For now I'd recommend staying on the gen 1 app until lights are allowed to span rooms and the connectivity to the lights gets a little more stable.

Where's the anti burglary setting? ieIn version 1 app we could set a + - time to the timer light coming on. This made it look like someone was home rather than the lights being on a set timer. This was a huge selling point for me. Infact the only reason I bought the lights as I live alone so need to make it appear I am home. Would like some randomness please. Example. I set front room to come on 8pm everyday. I want it to not come on 8pm but around that time varied each day. Same with other rooms I set. I set this according to sunset but an auto set to come on round sunset would be a good option so I don't have to change the timer when the clocks go forward or back. As most people switch lights on around sunset why isn't it a standard feature? Why no "going away/holiday button?"Also leaving location, I would like some added function. Not to just switch lights off when I leave. That's OK in daytime. But to switch certain lights off and others on when I leave at night. I want to be hands off. I leave my front room light switches to a set scene. My hallway goes into a timer which goes off after 3 minutes. My kitchen goes off. That sort of thing. Thanks.

The Gen1 app was good, not perfect but easily usable and functional.This version the interface has been totally redesigned but it appears they didn't talk to many users. Nice having the option to group by rooms, but confusing if you have scenes across rooms.The method of setting lighting settings is a bit confusing and overly large sliders.And would be easier to be able to select an album for photos rather then the entire camera roll!More work needed!! For the moment I'll stick with Gen1.

Surely if you create a new app, it needs to be better than the previous?Enable export of old scenes  from old app would be a good startScene manipulation has gone completely!? Why? I want to be able to control my lights, as that is their primary function.Looks nice but functionality is poor!

Just installed yesterday - been playing with it on & off for a while trying to get the setup as per Gen 1 app. Gen 2 wasn't as intuitive as Gen 1 but once you get familiar it's not bad. You CAN choose a colour from the pallet for individual lights / rooms - the light just has to be switched on to do so! <<< Not very Intuitive which is why some reviewers have said its not possible! Not being able to group lights/bulbs as you could on Gen 1 is a real oversight and needs sorting out! In Gen 1, it was possible to turn a widget on AND off with a tap of the same widget icon, no longer the case in Gen 2!!! Another major flaw.In Gen 1 we had a 'turn all lights off' widget - How to set up a widget to turn ALL lights off in Gen 2 given you can only add a maximum of 4 rooms per widget!!!! Another major flaw. Creating a widget which uses the 'last on state' of a light means that the widget has a boring blank icon, unlike if one were to use a scene. How ugly when you swipe down and see such boring hue widgets in front of friends & family!How were your beta testers picked!!?

This update to the app should not have been released as an update to the existing app. It should have been called "Hue for dummies". I only have six lights so far : they do not now all fit on the screen, so I have to scroll : not useful when you're in the dark and need to turn a light on. No access to existing scenes: really ?  The developers appear to have "simplified" much of the scene functionality out of the app, and say there will be no more updates to the old. ALL of my scenes are multi-room, so my use of scenes apart from "All Off" has been removed at a stroke. If you are having trouble with Siri / HomeKit integration and have to reset the hub ( if it hasn't happened to you yet it probably will ) then you will have to choose which app to set up, or even do both. And the website integration : more and more instances of apps on different devices. The developers have made a criminal mistake in removing functionality that existed before. Someone has decided "a scene is within a room" to simplify data handling. There are many users far more heavily invested in these products than I am: I can imagine they are more upset than me. Good luck on this one Philips.

Philips Hue Generation 1 app is a pre-HomeKit-era app that has no concept of rooms. Instead, multiple lights could be bundled together into scenes. Multiple lights could be controlled (brightness, color hues, and on/off status) as a scene. Scenes could be shared via the meethue.comportal among several devices logged in to the same meethue.com portal.   Philips retrofitted Hue Generation 1 app with HomeKit compatibility in 2015 (when it introduced the square version of the Hue Bridge). The only two features of Hue Generation 1 app that were compatible with HomeKit were the names of the Hue lights added in the Hue app and the scenes created in the Hue App. Both the names of lights and the scenes could be exported to HimeKit, but that integration was not dynamic, and the synchronization between the Hue app and HomeKit occurred only at the time of export (via the "Siri voice control" feature of the Hue app). Philips Hue Generation 2 app was redesigned based on the Smart Home concepts based around rooms. In Hue Generation 2 app, lights are first assigned to rooms. Once the room is created and lights are added, a scene can be created for the room. In fact, scenes can only be created for rooms - no longer for discrete lights. Because of that, scenes created in Hue Generation 1 app cannot be shared with Hue Generation 2 app. The real inconvenience of this is that the Hue Switch configured in Hue Generation 1 app has the scenes (assigned to its buttons) that cannot be seen in Hue Generation 2 app. Many users here complain that they can no longer control a subset of lights as one scene unless they place these lights in the same Hue Generation 2 app room. This can be easily achieved, however, via true HomeKit apps, such as Home. The Home app (which is the most comprehensive HomeKit app (which looks like an app that Apple should have released for HomeKit, but never did), allows one to configure scenes that can be created based on Descartes lights rather than on HimeKit rooms. Therefore, along with the Hue App Generation 2 app scenes (based solely on rooms) and exported to HomeKit, one can create additional HimeKit scenes that span the HomeKit rooms. The downside is that HimeKit scenes do not sync back to Hue Generation 2 app. My conclusion is that if you are interested in integrating Hue lights into HomeKit (along with other HomeKit compatible accessories from other manufacturers, use Hue Generation 2 app). If, however, you are not interested in Apple HomeKit integration, and especially, if you want to control discrete lights located in different rooms as one action, use Hue Generation 1 app.

Absolutely no significant functional improvement, in fact a regression with several features. Looks better, I suppose, but I'd rather not have to learn a completely new UI and lose functionality. I find it hard to believe that Philips has listened to customers' feedback about gen 1

1. No more manual control of light color and brightness when creating scenes. Just a pre-determined setting with a shuffle button. I've pressed it HUNDREDS of times trying to get my room the way I want.2. No iPad or Apple Watch support.3. Added rooms but took away groupings of lights.4. Can't control multiple rooms with one command anymore. For instance, a "goodnight" scene in which all lights in other rooms turn off and bedroom lamp turns on. Only work around is to make a widget.5. Takes multiple taps to accomplish what used to take one.6. Stock scenes are far more limited and good luck getting them back if you delete any then change your mind later.

I was really excited for an entirely new app to control my lights, but what I got was what seems like an attempt to over-simplify for the masses, which I think failed at that attempt. But there are some positives: the dimmer slider stops at 1% so there's no flicking a light on and off repeatedly before getting it to stop on just dim the lights can be separated into rooms choosing a color for a light is a cleaner interface But the negatives: the scene sharing didn't import any of the scenes from the old app I've been working off of and have customized to my home creating new scenes seem to be limited to one room at a time, so if you want to dim the lights everywhere but one room, you have to choose multiple scenes to do it if you do manage to set up a macro control, you're limited to only up to four rooms the widget appears to be limited to the one room controls, so if I hit my "movie time" scene, it now only effects one room (and just the lights in there), instead of turning off the other unneeded rooms, dimming other areas, and setting the lighting near the tv; it used to be one button, now it's 4 or 5The new UI is TOTALLY different from the previous app, which may just take some getting used to, but I'm just not convinced it's a better option just yet. It's definitely prettier, but it just seems like we were given looks over fuller customization.

Handing all control of your lights over to an app only makes sense if that app works perfectly, all the time. This app does not. The old one didn't either, but it worked enough that it didn't make me want to give it a one-star review.

The new version is very pretty and easy to use, but I wish it had the color page in which you pick the color for your light, now you can only add color through photos and I wish I could just pick a color. A shame this long awaited update is in a way a step backward in time to change moles UI's and bad workflows that add custom mole city were simplicity worked just fine in the first gen. App. I stopped using it because it keeps deleting rooms, lights and there is no easy access to basic stuff like turning all lights off or easily controlling each light. The UI is dreadful, scenes have been removed, and it's generally a clunky app.Can't believe this is the best Philips could come up with.After using for five minutes, went back to the older, better app.

I don't think I have ever gone out of my way to write a review on App Store, but this deplorable excuse for an app has made me put this here. Having invested over five hundred pounds in the hue range of lights and bulbs, this app feels like an insult. Connecting to Siri and the location tools took a few days as there is no troubleshooting available through the app, and even the website is severely lacking in help. The new app removes a lot of the functionality of the original, although does look slightly prettier. If function is low on your list of priorities then switch to this app. I would recommend looking for other options for home lighting automation unless Phillips actually put some of our money to fine tuning their products to make them viable for stress free home use. There are third party apps out there that do it better, and Phillips should be ashamed of that.
Scenes aren't syncing, no Apple Watch support and Siri not working. On a positive note, I can still turn on and off my lights and use geo-fencing. On the whole, a lot worse then the Gen 1 app.

Somehow Philips have managed to take a terrible app and remake it into something worse. This new one is completely unaware of saved scenes, it has no iPad support, no Apple TV support, and the UI is a baffling, illogical mess. This is real amateur hour stuff.

First things first, nice looking app - custom controls I'm not a fan of, apples normal toggles that come with SDK are nicer than these, they are just too big and don't stand out from the rest of the UI enough - personal opinion of course. Remembering the last state of a bulb is also a nice addition especially if you want an RGB bulb to remember a particular white point. Rooms is a great addition too...... But I'm afraid that's where the good ends. Not being able to select the colours I want in a room is... Well daft. I can't actually remember in the UI how to get to this feature - just been searching and frankly have no idea, but going on my memory when I did stumble across it, you are forced to use a photo, you can't place a bulb on the photo to select the colour you want... But what's more annoying is I can't get to the standard colour sheet (as in not using a photo at all) where I can select my own colours, group bulbs into a single colour and add others around it. This was one the best features in the old app and now it's gone... really?!?!?I'm afraid the UX has suffered some what in this update, there are bugs too. I'm afraid until the basic features are back I'm going to continue to use Gen1, as right now Gen2 just doesn't do the basic things a user needs, and the basic user experience is just too confusing.

I can consider myself a tech savvy and this app is not easy to understand, at least from the ones moving from the previous app.It gets very vey confusing when trying to play with in visual lights.I prefer greatly scenes over rooms (or at least the option to choose between modes) Good looking and modern interface in favour of design over functionality.

It may strike as less intuitive, concepts have evolve. Scenes aren't the top hierarchy, superseded by rooms now. A video manual is very needed. Once the new utilization is understood, everything makes sense and blows the gen 1 app away.Limiting rooms to four and forcing unmarked rooms to off by default with the widget may not be the best option.

My opinions are the same as everyone else , I still wonder if they actually field test , maybe its time to change developers , too many poorly implemented software apps , why release a incomplete app????

Overall a really good improvement.Note: I would like to see a new Apple Watch app aswell

Leider muss ich mich vielen meiner Vorrednern anschlieen: die neue App kommt in einem schickeren Gewand als ihr Vorg_nger daher, bt diesen Pluspunkt bei der Funktionalit_t aber gleich wieder ein.Ich bewohne eine loftartige Wohnung. Kommt man bei mir zur Haustre rein, steht man quasi schon mitten drin - ich habe keinen Flur. Durch S_ulen (mal breit, mal schmal) und Schr_gen sind die einzelnen Bereiche Wohnzimmer, Kche, Essbereich und Bro voneinander getrennt - aber nicht durch W_nde (geschweige denn Tren). Ich habe also fr jeden dieser Bereiche einen Raum in der App angelegt (wenn ich im Essbereich bin, muss nicht das Licht im Bro brennen usw.).Nachdem alle R_ume angelegt waren, wollte ich einen Raum namens "Loft" anlegen, in den ALLE Bereiche meiner Wohnung enthalten sind - geht nicht. Weil eine Doppelbelegung von Lampen nicht vorgesehen ist. Und das finde ich echt schwach, zumal der Trend doch unumstritten zu zumindest offenen Koch- und Wohnbereichen geht. Da hatte ich eine Szene fr Kche, eine fr Kche+Wohnraum, eine fr Kche+Essbereich, eine fr Wohnraum+Essbereich, usw..Ihr habt in meinen Augen den Aspekt, dass ein Raum mehrere Bereiche haben kann, v_llig bersehen. Und dann wird die Bedienung echt anstrengend..Das Festlegen der Farben finde ich auch mhsam (zwei Lampen im gleichen Farbton? Comment peut on faire aussi peu intuitif ???Vous aurez besoin des 2 applis gen 1 et 2:- la notion de scenario parametrable (ou vous choissisez independemment chaque lampe et sa couleur/intensite) n'existe plus, les scenarios sont li_s au une des pieces cr__es auparavant). Exemple scenario veille pour la nuit ou vous avez 5 lampes dans 5 pieces differentes a parametrer est impossible a faire.- enfin on peut via le compte cr__ sur le site Hue synchroniser tous les iphones, ce qui etait impossible avec Gen 1.- Avec gen 2 vous controlez les lampes a distance (depuis sa voiture par exemple) via le compte Hue cr_e aussi avant en ligne.- la naviguation est peu intuitive, vive la gen 1.

Cette version est en effet bien mieux conu que la premire et permet de profiter des nombreuses possibilit_s de ce systme d'_clairage connect_. Il y a cependant une fonction qui a disparue de manire assez incompr_hensible : la fiction al_atoire des alarmes n'existe plus dans les routines qui les remplacent... A much better step towards organizing and HomeKit integration, but a major gripe is there is no apparent way to select multiple bulbs, in the same room or otherwise, and change their colors simultaneously so that they are all the exact same color.  Sure, some people might like to be hip and use one of the scenes that makes all the bulbs different colors that look 'really hip' together or whatever, however, some of us like to have uniformity in our colors and the loss of that feature over the older version really makes this a pain in the arse to to use when we want to change the color on the fly and their is no scene set for it.  Also, as was previously mentioned, there needs to be an option to add a light to multiple 'rooms'.  There could be situations where a bulb that is positioned in certain areas of the house could overlap multiple rooms.  In other words it could be a desire of someone to have a particular light turned on when either of two rooms were turned on.  As it is currently, a bulb may only be assigned a single 'room' designation.  Also desired would be a 'room' that contains all the bulbs on your bridge.  This is another feature that is sorely miss over the old version.  Having the ability to see all of your bulbs in one place and adjust the brightness and colors on a color scheme just seems like common sense.  I can't believe things like this we overlooked when they were included in previous versions.  Hopefully these issues will be addressed and the system will continue to be improved upon with future versions.

I like the room separation, but my location service never works despite that all settings are correct on the phone. Probably going to switch back to classic until I see 3+ stars. Also not as easy to do scenes and I lost all of mine from the previous app when I switched.
Phone app is okay, but iPad app is needed

Geo fencing no longer works in the new version of this app. As well, the ability to fine tune the geo fencing radius is also missing. As well, it would be nice to be able to control all the lights in a room to make them one color at the same time.

Thank you for the redesign but we lost light recipes and the ability to control the colors of individual lights with photo colors. I am assuming the first gen app will be phased out so this is a needed addition to gen2.  I like the ability to section by rooms natively - though this could be accomplished with recipes by singling out individual lights. Again, if one is to recreate a recipe to a scene, there is no color wheel or the ability to select individual lights and depict what color you want them to be. On a positive side, Siri and HomeKit integration is working great, and widgets would be improved if we could create customs scenes with lightbulb/strip color picker like in gen 1.

If I could give this zero stars (I REALLY hate it) I would. After downloading and test driving Im thoroughly convinced that whoever designed this new app does not own or actually use Hue lighting (I have over 40 of them throughout my home). So Ill say it loud and clear and Im talking to you Philips...GROUPS ARE EVERYTHING!!! If I cant GROUP individual lights together and then incorporate them into scenes the app is completely useless to me and everyone else with more than a couple of bulbs (I could care less about rooms" if I cant create GROUPS within them). I cannot believe that such a basic and obvious function has been removed...its ludicrous. Being able to choose the exact color of both individual and GROUPS of lights within a scene is what makes (made) the Hue ecosystem great. Its how you layer both the color and intensity of individual and GROUPS of lights. My advice to anyone reading this who is thinking about investing in Hue lighting is dontuntil this extremely basic functionality has been restored to this flagship app. As for you Philips, listen to your customers! As I write this there are more 1 star ratings than all others combined. Fix it now!!! GROUPS and being able to choose exact colors in scenes are basic functionsso get on with it...apologize, admit you were wrong and give them back because (now you know) this app isnt cutting it and its major.

I need more granular control of specific bulbs within my room, and there is no (apparent?) way to achieve this functionality in the new app. I had hoped that the concept of "rooms" would be some sort of container for scenes, but instead a "room" is a blunt-force object that assumes I use all the lights in a room the same way.Wish list: the ability to group bulbs (e.g., all the cans in my kitchen, both of the lamps on my nightstand...); more complex routines (e.g., start all the lights as dim orange, gradually increase in brightness while also shifting to blue light); tappable widgets that toggle between on and off.

Without the ability to set lights to specific colors and save them into full-house scenes, there's no way I'm going to try to control my 30 bulbs with this new app. And the Tap can't turn off all the lights (or turn them all on?) no thanks. This is a major step backwards - I'm not upgrading until these problems are fixed.
Severly lacking compared to v1 and other third party apps.
Unintuitive and pretty useless. Sticking with the old app until Philips gets a clue and fixes this one.

App is prima maar ik wil graag zelf bepalen welke lamp welke kleur is zoals in gen1. Ook wil ik op mijn tap scene de brightness in kunnen stellen. Anders heb ik helemaal niks aan de tap omdat ik alsnog de brightness aan moet passen in de app. Erg jammer weer dit.
Better than the first version at least, rooms should have been included with gen1, but no iPad support is a massive oversight.

Alarms and timer functionality removed. Siri can only switch all the lights on or off. Can't be controlled per room. Looks prettier than the old version of the app but less functionality. That's why 1 star.
The only problem seems to be you can't create scenes that apply to more than one room. I've discovered that setting up 'widgets' does effectively - but you can't call them up with Siri.

This versions is the worse everNothing works properly, makes the phone hot,  unresponsive and drains the batteryI have to uninstall it to use my phone againFancy design but no functionality to itBack to the drawing board guys

Rooms are a great improvement and work well within the app, but minimal design has been put into setting up and the look of widgets.Also, it won't connect via the cloud for me - tells me my bridge is connected to a different account and no instructions to fix, yet I've only ever had one account and the Gen1 app works fine. Very confused.

I've used Hue from the beginning. When I found out that a new app was out, I downloaded it immediately. The new app is simplistic and sleek. It lets you control your scenes and dim better and it also is just overall better laid out. HOWEVER, what happened to the Apple Watch app? The old version of the app had it and the new one doesn't? Along with an iPad app? That just doesn't make sense to me.

This version is working fine and I'm happy with a lot of the changes. My big gripe though is that I can no longer adjust the color of individual lights in a scene. The entire reason we bought into this system was for that type of specific control. Using my own photography to create scenes has been the best part of owning the Hue system. Please please please bring that feature back.
Much improvement over last version. And you can keep both. ;-) thanks for the progress Philips

Why is 10 minutes the shortest interval to fade lights on in the morning? What's so tough about letting us set an arbitrary value? I prefer a 3-minute fade in the morning, not 10. It's like negotiating with my Mom as a kid again.

Everything seems to work, except they took out one feature which I quite like... To slowly switch scene over a period of time. Also missed the function on the widget to toggle off, rather than another off button.
