Ich frage mich, warum ein Unternehmen wie Philips keine anst_ndige Software fr ihre Hardware hinbekommt? Entwickelt das nur eine Person? Testet das nur eine Person?Gibt es nur eine Testumgebung?Genau so fhlt sich die App an. Fr mich unbrauchbar.

Designers must not have Hue bulbs in their homes. The rooms feature is a nice idea, until it breaks your ability to simultaneously turn on bulbs in one room and shut them off in another. It also gimps the functionality of the Hue Tap. There's no way to change the color of multiple bulbs at once, which is a puzzling omission. Using a photo to create scenes is now completely ruined by not being able to actually choose what colors in your photo you'd like to use. And to top it off, the app regularly crashes. On the plus side, the color picker is easier to use and the interface is fairly slick. For now, I'll use this for the Wake Up feature and for everything else use Huemote and Scintillator.Update: The Wake Up feature has been turning on the wrong bulbs, despite having selected specific ones for the wake up routine. This app is 100% garbage.

I wanted more from this version after trying it for a day I'm going back to the previous version.  It just works better!  And has things you've taken away (like turning off all lights simply at once).

It is oddly harder to set a scene now.  It is terribly difficult to get all the lights to end up the same color.  It makes improvements to HomeKit related functionality but loses it's core ability to easily make colored light scenes.  It's like a pile of icing with no cake. It also oddly doesn't import the scenes from the old app.  Also, the widgets are terribly narrow. You can't widget old scenes you've already made.  It has to be their preset widgets...  Super strange...
This new app does not allow you to set all lights in a group to the same color. Setting lights to blue no longer works. Who the heck did the UX and debugging? A monkey?!

I like the new interface, but there are some key features that you've removed (for no obvious reason):- Timers - alarms remain, but timers have gone. That makes no sense. So I have to use the Gen 1 app for timers. The light fading out when going to sleep is just as good as it fading in when waking up, unless I go to sleep at exactly the same time every night, a "Routine" just won't work. - Linking lights - setting different lights to be the same colour is a very useful feature. Surely it's easy to implement and doesn't have to be a permanent link. Even a "copy settings" feature would work. Improvements:- UI in general- auto-generated icon for a scene actually looks like the colours in the scene, not just a generic colour palette or having to find a picture from somewhere (no more pages of scenes with the same icon)- rooms and switching whole rooms on and off quickly

All nice to add new functionality, but why take away other good functionality?Why can't I create scenes where I can select the color of each bulb to my own choice?Why do I have to use a picture and hope the tool gives me acceptable bulb colors?I'll go back to Gen 1 until I'm able to match my bulbs colors to my desired setup
Die Bedienung ist eine Katastrophe. Man weiss nie wo man hin klicken muss. Schade dass man keine 0 Sterne geben kann

I tend to control my lights at home from my iPad. This feels like a regression purely for that fact.

The interface was drastically improved with this update. However, the functionality of the app took a huge hit. Given my hue setup (4 bulbs in 2 rooms with a gen-1 bridge)1) the app often reports the status of lights incorrectly. 2) the app often fails to turn lights on / off. 3) the app no longer turns lights on / off remotely. 4) the app no longer works as an alarm. Und selbst wenn das geht war es fr mich nicht herauszufinden, wie. Die App ist zwar grunds_tzlich ein Schritt in die richtige Richtung aber leider blieb die Benutzerfreundlichkeit auf der Strecke. Finally Siri works for me, hence the 3 stars, but I want to be able to set one scene for my whole apartment. I do like the design of the app, once you find your way around, navigation to scenes is only by room, this I do not like. It will take a bit of getting used to.

I was excited to see that you can now control the lights with groups. After using the app that was about the only thing I liked. You can no longer change the colour of all lights in a room at the same time. The colours can be slightly off and very annoying. Setting and creating scenes are also only in a per room basis.I used to be able to dim all the house lights when putting the kids to sleep. It's now a lot of voice commands or a lot of menu navigation to achieve the same result. I would have liked to of had lights assigned to multiple groups. I would then be able to accomplish the above with a single command. Too much time as spent making the app look pretty and not enough time making sure the end user had the best experience possible.

UI is tighter, but HomeKit/Siri integration is completely broken. The Siri setup doesn't even recognize that the app is already paired with my bridge. I've reset the app, removed/reinstalled the app, and even completely reset my Hue bridge. Just got an Echo, so it won't matter soon, anyway.

...so unterirdisch die Software. Man k_nnte meinen Philips geht davon aus, der gemeine Hue-Kunde ist ein supermodischer Dau, der die Birnen nur wegen des tollen Marketings kauft. So durchdesignt und dabei funktionsschwach kommt jedenfalls die neue Hue-App daher - noch un-technischer als die alte Version.Lampengruppierung, Szenen ber Raumgrenzen hinweg? Fehlanzeige! Das konnte ja sogar noch die alte App...Liebe Philips-Verantwortliche: wer 60 Euro pro LED Birne ausgibt, der wei in der Regel warum er das tut - und dieser Kunde will keinen quietschbunten Designunfall als App, sondern etwas Funktionalit_t! Am besten mal bei den Alternativ-Apps spicken. Die zeigen wies geht.
Kann mich anderen nur anschlieen. Wenn gewohnte Hauptfunktionen wie zB das Zusammenlegen mehrerer Lampen nicht mehr geht, ist das ein deutlicher Schritt zurck. Bitte nachliefern.

The Hue App has always seemed a bit of an afterthought - Gen 1 looked terrible with those garish colours and was never the easiest to use (try picking out one light from a group of 4 in the tiny colour picker window). Plus centring the whole experience round moods beach or aqua or whatever was something I just never used.Hue Gen 2 is a step in the right direction. It looks a lot nicer, picking colours is easier, and the concept of grouping lights into rooms makes a lot more sense, but overall its let down by some limitations and bugs- You can only have a routine (times fade on / off etc) for up to 4 rooms. Have 5 rooms? Youre out of luck. One misses out. (Its to keep a fast response apparently. But Id much rather have slower lights and more rooms.)- Worse if you have a Hue Tap, you can only control 3 rooms with each button. I want to turn all my rooms on to custom scenes with a button push. I cant do that anymore with Gen2.  Best Im given is a whole home preset - which can only have Bright Dim and a few other settings that arent appropriate.- Can I make scenes for the home preset to get around this? I asked Philips? Sure they said - just add all you lights to a room called home and set them how you want. They didnt tell me Id have to delete all my other rooms to do this, which defeats the point (You can only place a bulb in one room at a time)- If you delete a scene thats in use in a routine the app crashes. Thought that would be a basic bug to test for.- Sometimes you get duplicate scenes appearing for no reason. I had 5 Evening On scenes at one point. Had to delete 4, then watch the app crash as they were no longer in my routines, then add them back in  to all my routines...- The old app timers etc arent wiped by the new app. I had them both conflicting (I only noticed after Id uninstalled the old app of course) Re Installed it again to deactivate the timers and its super confused by the new apps timers. - Basically I need to keep the old app around to program my Tap to get around the rooms limit. But Gen 1 and Gen 2 dont play nice.Generally its sort of an improvement, but its also a disappointment on how many holes and bugs there are. Youd think a big company like Philips would have this thing down by now After all the lights themselves are pretty solid pieces of engineering.

Despite improving the look, integrating with Siri, and adding additional features, they somehow made the app worse and barely usable. Want to set a scene?  Me too, but I can't figure out how to, despite them existing!  That's just one of many very frustrating things about trying to use this app now.

Actuala varianta a aplicatiei isi bate joc de toti clientii Philips hue. Nu putem adauga bridge-ul, conexiunea fiind total instabila si aleatorie. Daca ai norocul ca la 1 din 40 de incercari sa reusesti sa treci de setup.. nu mai poti adauga luminile si deviceurile (switchurile de exemplu). Am luminile hue de ceva timp si am prins si momente bune in care aplicatia veche functiona normal.. dar gen 2 e o aplicatie complet ratata. Nu inteleg de ce un producator ca Philips, care cere bani multi pe luminile Hue, tine mortis ca sa se faca complet de ras cu asemenea aplicatii, platind niste programatori de doi lei... Sper ca situatia sa se schimbe cat de repede.. Nu va transformati clientii in testeri ca dati faliment.

(background: Im a nerd and I use dozens of Hue lights throughout my home as well as a ton of third party devices and apps to control them)This rewritten app causes me to emit a sigh of finally! for fixing a lot of pain points the old app had, especially for people who have a large number of bulbs throughout their home.There is finally support for multiple bridges, meaning I can finally set up my old first gen bridge at work! (havent tested this, but will report back if its problematic)There is finally the ability to group lights together by room (or really anything you want). A nice touch is that I can have lights that are members of more than one room, which is perfect because it lets me have a dining/living combined room as well as individual rooms for those, which works nicely since my dining and living rooms are right next to one another. I still have access to scenes which is nice, but they are no longer the top-level way of controlling things; they are where they belong, nested within the rooms construct.One very important aspect of rooms support that makes me super happy: I went to set up the app on a second phone I have, and all the rooms are there waiting for me. The gen 1 apps syncing of scenes was a total nightmare and Im glad to see that they finally addressed it; previously I was afraid to touch my scenes on my secondary devices.Often I still find myself wanting to control an individual light, and thats still buried, but I can always put individual lights in their own rooms if I want. Im surprised you cant 3D touch the home screen icon and have quick access to actions; that seems like low hanging fruit. Itd be even nicer if the whole app had 3D touch support for making certain actions faster for power users.The execution of the app is still a bit 1.0; it feels a bit finicky at times, and it misses certain things, like not even being able to tell me what my Hue Tap buttons do because I configured them in the old app. Theres no iPad support, which is a shame but I hope its coming later. I still primarily interact with my devices by secondary means and not directly by the app (my Flic buttons and Tap switches are great, and Im thinking about acquiring an Echo at some point; Siri is awful), but im excited to see that I can have quicker, fine-grained access to control my lights from my phone again. I think this is a super promising rewrite and the things it got right are so welcome to me that Im only knocking off a single star for the things it got wrong.

I love the new feel and responsiveness of Hue Gen 2. It's a start in the right direction. However, I am shocked at the fact we no longer can control individual lights inside Scenes. What could possibly be the purpose of removing this feature, Phillips? It basically tells the consumer that you're not allowed to choose what you want to do. That is 100% opposite of what Phillips is trying to achieve with this technology.  I'll be sticking with Gen 1 until I can control my own lights inside Scenes.

Ich finde die neue App vom Design her sehr gelungen. Kein Vergleich zur alten App, endlich wirkt die App auch dem Preis der Lampen entsprechend.  Jedoch ist das nur das Eine, funktionieren muss es ja auch. Warum gibt es noch keine Apple Watch App? Hier h_tte doch die alte einfach bernommen werden k_nnen, mit den neuen Bildern der Szenen.  Warum gibt es keine IPad App? Hier muss die Hue App V1 verwendet werden. Auerdem ist es echt schade, dass eine Lampe nur einmal angesprochen werden kann, sprich keine Raumbergreifenden Szenen (mit Mehrfachbelegungen) m_glich. Beim erstellen einer Szene per Foto ist nur die Zufallsfunktion m_glich, in der alten App konnte man jeder Lampe auf einen Farbbereich im Foto zuweisen - diese Funktion habe ich nicht gefunden. Szenen k_nnen aus der alten App bernommen werden, auch wenn nur einzeln was etwas umst_ndlich ist. Auerdem funktioniert bei mir die Ortungsfunktion nicht. Lampen werden weder an- noch ausgeschaltet. Man kann auch nicht mehr den Radius bestimmen. Einfache Features die jedoch essentiell sind und bei dem Lampenpreis nicht fehlen drfen. Zugriff von auerhalb per Mobilfunk funktioniert. Hier ist noch viel Luft nach oben, was sich auch in den Bewertungen anderer User zeigt. Bei dem Preis, was Philips fr das Hue System verlangt wird, MSSEN implementierte Funktionen einwandfrei funktionieren. Ich hoffe sehr, dass hier nachgebessert wird.

Die App geht in die richtige Richtung, war aber auch berf_llig. Die fehlende Optimierung frs iPad ist aber traurig, zumal man zu Hause eher das iPad als das iPhone nutzt. Hier ist Nachbesserung notwendig.

Die neue Generation der App sieht zwar auf den ersten Blick besser aus, ist aber funktional gesehen Mist.Intuitive Bedienung ist hier nicht vorgesehen. Alles ist auf Szenen ausgelegt, aber gerade die fehlen in den Einstellungen.Man muss sie suchen und kann sie auch nicht mehr ver_ndern. H_chstens umbenennen und l_schen geht noch. Einzelne Lampen entfernen oder hinzufgen geht nur, indem man neue Szenen abspeichert und die "zu _ndernde" Szene l_scht.Einem Schalter kann man nur eine Szene zuordnen nicht aber nur eine Lampe. Das ist mehr als umst_ndlich.Liebe Entwickler, bitte benutzt diese App mal selbst im Alltag, nur eine Woche oder auch nur einen Tag lang. Ihr werdet berrascht sein, was man bei so einem Test alles lernen kann.Mein Dimming Switch dimmt  nicht nur die Lampen, die in der Szene des Einschalters enthalten sind. Stattdessen schaltet er alle Lampen des Zimmers.Und was Widgets sind, solltet ihr auch nochmal lernen. Was ich in der App einstelle, sind keine einzelnen Widgets sondern Teile des EINEN Widgets, dass die App hat.Ich hab es mir berlegt, statt 2 Sternen, gebe ich doch lieber nur einen. Nur gut, dass man fr die App nichts bezahlen muss. Der rger w_re ungleich gr_er.

I'm not sure what they're trying to accomplish by limiting usage. This update actively harms the hue lighting system.

I see what you were trying to do. You wanted a sleeker interface. You totally missed the mark. I actually found the old app much easier to use. I do like the addition of rooms. But, I had that through a third party app. The rooms were really easy to setup. It was the only thing easy to setup. None of my scenes carried over. That should be automatic.

This version is just awful.  Design is bad(really bad)...  Control even worse....not to mention bad screen animation to bad screen animation.... Not possible anymore to turn the lights in my hallway off while turning the light in my bedroom on. This version does not allow me to quit using the first generation app. I truly wonder if Philips has looked at what their audience is using their lamps for.

Muy bonito diseo pero est muy poco amigable y faltan funciones que s trae la generacin 1.Seguir_ usando la otra aplicacin.
I want more control over individual lights. And routines that turn off lights are not working.

i've been using a wemo wall outlet up to this point and decided to plunge into the world of philips hue with the gen 2 bridge and 2 white light starter kit. first, it's way more complicated just to even rename the lights. second, even though the bridge is connected and i can control my lights at this very moment through the app, when i try to set up the connection to siri, the app says it can't find the bridge? huh? third, how many companies does it take to automatically turn on the porch light at dusk and off at dawn? apparently, the answer is three or more. involving philips is obvious, but i have to also involve ifttt and the weather channel as well. wemo does the same with just the one wemo app. and to top it all off, i created an account on the site so that i could at least use it away from home without having to use siri, and the app says there's no connection.this thing needs a lot of work.
Better IU than 1st gen, but; why quit a Apple Watch app?? It's annoying, I'm very disappointed

Recent Hue user here coming from Wink. I'm so happy to see rooms and this is a much slicker interface. That said, two features I would really appreciate: - The ability to do master groups (rooms). My living room and dining room have a lot of overlap. Sometimes I control the separately, sometimes together so having a third "room" that encompasses both rooms would be majorly helpful. - Conditional routines: options like "only dim", "only if lights are already on", "only brighten", or "only if lights are already off". For me, my schedule is not quite as predictable as your app is. If I set a morning routine to ease the lights on and I'm already wide awake and have my house on full brightness I don't want the lights to fade into my morning scene. Same goes for night, if I've already fallen asleep before my night routine happens I really don't want the light to come on and wake me up.
2e generatie dus.. En dan maar 4 kamers in kunnen stellen?!?!? WHY?

De app ziet er leuk uit maar de functionaliteit is bedroevend. Scene's gelden voor alle lampen in kamer, niet meer per lamp bij te stellen. Geen scne meer in te stellen met minder lampen waardoor ook schakelaar niet meer zo ingesteld kan worden dat met 1 lamp nachtstand wordt ingesteld. Lampen kunnen maar aan 1 kamer worden toegevoegd dus daarmee kan ook geen workaround gemaakt worden. Ik had voor de langverwachte app toch meer verwacht.

Interface veel beter maar daar is dan ook alles mee gezegd. Zeer buggy, __n van mijn lampen negeert steevast de scenekleur. Werkt nog waardelozer dan de gen1 app. Weer een typisch ontwerp van Philips. Ik ga weer terug naar de oude app...
Drlig opdatering. Hvordan kan man bruge den som t_nd/sluk ur. Og hvor er randomfunktionen blevet af.

Absolut dilettantische Weiterentwicklung. Umst_ndlich. Schlechter als 50% der Drittentwickler-Apps. Beispiele: - Eine Lampe darf nur einem Raum zugewiesen werden. - Einzel ansteuern geht quasi gar nicht mehr- Lampen vergessen ihre Helligkeitseinstellung- usw. Peinlich. Mal wieder.

Auf iPad3 wird nur skalierte iPhone App gezeigt. Null Punkte Philips. Die alte App konnte iPad Aufl_sungen.

Man kann keine Lampen farblich zusammenfassen - was soll das denn bitte sein? Ich will nicht das mein Zimmer kunterbunt beleuchtet ist sondern das bestimmte Lampen in bestimmten Farben zusammen passen. Ich hab den Spa mittlerweile wieder gel_scht, selten so eine beschissene neue Version einer App gesehen. Null intuitiv und absolut unbersichtlich. Die App hat sich entschieden, meine Bridge (neueste Version) nicht mehr zu finden und bleibt auch beharrlich dabei. Nutze jetzt die Elgato Eve App, da l_uft alles. Super Leistung, Philips! Not.
I just hope version 1 will always be available, cause version 2 I don't like at all! Nothing about it .... Sorry guys - nice try but ___________
Ansprechendes UI. Strzt aber andauernd ab. Vor allem aber an immer wieder der selben stelle. Schlechte Apptester. Wenig intuitiv! Zu verschachtelt! Bitte nachbessern!

...aber Schw_chen im Detail.Die App ist ein Schritt in die richtige Richtung. Einige Funktionen fehlen allerdings.So ist es leider nicht m_glich Lampen mehreren R_umen zuzuordnen oder Szenen raumbergreifend zu erstellen. Bei vorhandenen Lichtrezepten kann die Helligkeit nicht gespeichert werden, was dazu fhrt, dass ich sie immer nach der Auswahl nachjustieren muss. Dies ist besonders _rgerlich, da ich einen Schalter verwende und dann trotzdem noch das Handy herausholen muss.Werden Szenen neu erstellt, kann nicht mit einem Lichtrezept oder einer Farbauswahl gestartet werden. Das Verwenden von Bildern zur Szenenerstellung halte ich nicht fr optimal, zumal auch hier eine gezielte Farbauswahl auch nicht m_glich ist.Generell wrde ich mir wnschen, dass bei den Schaltern eine Taste mit mehreren Funktionen belegt werden kann (z.B. das an und ausschalten der Lampen je nach vorhergehendem Zustand)Schade finde ich insgesamt, dass es wohl selbst den Entwicklern klar zu sein scheint, dass die App alles andere als perfekt ist, sonst h_tten sie wohl nicht die alte App weiter im Programm. Es scheint leider mittlerweile g_ngige Praxis die K_ufer teurer Produkte zu Betatestern zu missbrauchen.
Hat ber Nacht ALLES verloren, Lampen, Zimmer, Szenen, Routinen, alles Weg und nicht einstellbar.Macht die Lampen unbrauchbar!Bri Amazon auch von 5* auf 1* korrigiert!Zum Glck gibts noch Gen1

The app feels moder now. It's up to date. First gen seems ancient now. It's such a delight not having to use it anymore. Except I have to. The new app is missing some key features. Which forces me to go back.The ability to create a scene without the need of a photograph is something I really miss. At first, choosing colours to my lamps using a photo sound cool. But as it turns out it's more of a hassle than useful. To be honest, it's annoying. I wish scene creation was the same as it was in the old app.Also, I still miss the ability to turn on lights when the sun goes down. I was looking forwrd to delete the old app. But I can't really do it without delete some feauters. Perhaps next time. Until then, this update is a bit of a bummer.

I love the deeper HomeKit integration in this version, works way better with Siri now, and the user interface has come on leaps and bounds. For someone who tends to just use a few scenes and has a flat without many rooms the change to scenes isn't bothering me, but I can see how it would others. Lots of work still to be done here but a step in the right direction for sure. Keep it up!

Unfortunately they seem to of recreated a poorer version of the old app with much less functionality. Groups/Rooms just don't work as well as Scenes use to. I want the scene to come on at 25% well to bad that function was removed and its coming on at a blinding 100% whether you like it or not. I think they've miss read what their users loved about the app.

They've added one feature, improved the interface, took several features away, and added nothing that we have so desperately needed for a long time.  Feature request, after feature request has been ignored from all of Philips customer.  I find it quite rude that they haven't taken the time to understand our needs of what is probably the most expensive retrofit lighting out there.Start listening to your customers!  Cause I'm starting to look elsewhere
Much better than the first gen!

This app is sooooo much better than the old one and all the people complaining just don't know how to use it yet. But yes, you can change the color of each individual bulb. Apart from the occasional crash it's amazing! Hue have finally nailed the design and functionality. ____

It is oddly harder to set a scene now.  It is terribly difficult to get all the lights to end up the same color.  It makes improvements to HomeKit related functionality but loses it's core ability to easily make colored light scenes.  It's like a pile of icing with no cake. It also oddly doesn't import the scenes from the old app.  Also, the widgets are terribly narrow. You can't widget old scenes you've already made.  It has to be their preset widgets...  Super strange...

There are parts of this app that make sense but parts that took a huge leap back. For instance, I used to use Siri to say 'Movie' and it would change all my living room lights a certain color, keep my porch light on and turn off all other lights in the house. Perfect! Now, I try and create a movie scene from a photo and I can no longer control the color and intensity of the lights in my living room independently of each other. It's some weird shuffle mode and I can't even edit the default intensity. All the colors are different! Also, Siri works per room now so when I say 'Movie' it only affects my living room lights and forgets to turn off my bedroom and kitchen lights and turn on my front porch. So annoying. Just go back Philips!

Het is weer eens vorm boven functie bij Philips. Het is tijd om eens iemand anders aan het roer te zetten, iemand die het wel snapt. Erg jammer, de lampen zijn echt wel ok, maar het gebruik model laat zeer te wensen over. Heb mijn hele woonkamer vol () met Hue maar zal het nog niemand aanraden.

Ik mis nog vele functies zoals het aanpassen van scnes. Ik kan ze nu alleen hernoemen of wissen. Ook bij de routines gaan de lampen alleen aan op een bepaald tijdstip, en niet bijv. bij zonsondergang. Routines moeten ook eventueel een eindtijd hebben voor als je op vakantie bent. Verder is het design wel top! Hopelijk komt er snel een update!

Helaas lijkt het alsof deze versie totaal nog niet af is. Een stap terug t.o.v. de vorige app. Helaas kunnen de scenes ook niet worden meegenomen en is er geen ipad versie te vinden. Voorlopig toch de oude app nog maar gebruiken tot deze 2e gen app wel af is _
Keine Apple Watch und iPad Untersttzung

So I finally took the plunge with getting myself some hue lights. Got this new app to go with it. First impressions are that its really good although very basic. Hopefully there are more updates to come! Could really do with adding when you want your lights to turn off on the routines as well as turning on. A sleep timer would be ideal too. The wake up feature of fading the lights up is really cool. I actually get up in a better mood now! Keep the updates coming please.

I must admit that the new app looks a lot better visually but it has a much more complicated feel. I don't like it how you can't set multiple scenes for single bulbs. I used to have 3 scenes for 2 bulbs:Downstairs bright - reading or eating. Downstairs low - watching tv or relaxingDownstairs off - only downstairs wentI've now lost this ability so went back to the old app.

Whilst there has been an obvious investment to improve the design - the user experience is still poor. Basic functions require too much thought and fiddling. Please think about how your customers use these lights.
Simply, why bother making a new app that offers fewer features than the previous version. Where is my Apple Watch app?

This app looks really nice, but I don't get it. None of my scenes have synchronised with my account and I find myself trying to find things. I thought it might be just a new layout and I would get used to it, but I have picked this up a number of times, but I give up every time.I could be showing my ignorance but I couldn't even find how to set a scene to wake up to. Routines, wake up, room (no scenes).After investment in a number of lights, this is a worrying move "forward???".

Mir ist die Logik der neuen Szenen r_tselhaft.Ich hatte bisher Szenen, bei denen ich in einem Raum nur eine von mehreren Lampen aktiviert habe.Das ist in der neuen App nicht m_glich.Man kann mit einer Szene nur den kompletten Raum steuern jedoch keine einzelnen Lampen.So ist die App fr mich unbrauchbar.
Ich habe die 2. Generation eine Woche getestet. Nichts, aber auch gar nichts funktioniert!
Weiterhin keine iPad-Untersttzung, App nicht besonders intuitiv.

This app seems to assume that you have Hue color bulbs. I don't, I have only white ones. I want to set be able to set scenes that can be used with the today widget and Siri so that I can easely fade the lights to eg. 20 % in the evening, but that is not possible. Instead the app makes me choose a picture from which it determines the percentage of the fade. I understand that this picture thing makes sense if you have color bulbs but it makes no sence for white ones. Hope this will be improved in a future release.
Wanneer je huis niet volledig "hue" is werkt de gen 1 app makkelijker, simpeler en sneller, geen Watch app... Voor mij persoonlijk een tegenvaller

So I can create widget to turn on certain rooms on together but cannot control individual lights? It's all or nothing? I can no longer select my own color in a scene or lights I want On/Off in a scene. Gen1 offers individual light control so that's it for me for now.
This app is much better than the other one in my opinion

Happy they made some serious changes how ever one major thing they forgot was my apple watch. The old version at least let me use my watch to control my lights, which is something I though they would be on top of as it is a smart system..

The software has a good user interface and can easily be handled. And yes: it looks nice and is definitely better then the 1st generation as it adds the functionality of controlling more than one room. You will only be happy with the 1st gen if you control one room only!But: I have rarely seen a professional software with so many bugs. Some examples: When defining a rule to switch on nightlight in the children's room, one bulb in the living room goes into nightlife mode and the lamp in the children's room switches off. After changing a scene you sometimes have that scene twice (but neither the 1st not the 2nd are working). Removing these scenes unfortunately affects some of your rules.  So you have to redefine them.Pairing the bridge with the Philips cloud does not work here which could be a firewall or NAT issue. But to be honest: good software should be able to handle such problems...It's really frustrating to manage around all these bugs. I wonder if Philips ever tested the software as the first bugs arised after only 20 mins working with the software. Today's professional software development should lead to better software.

The UX is greatly improved in this app, but it still needs A LOT of work functionality wise.You cannot edit scenes, can't select which lights you want in a scene and you can't add a light to multiple rooms.I accidentally deleted some light recipes and now I can't get them back.I'd like to be able to write custom commands for Siri because she gets confused when I want to turn off a light (says she can't turn of a scene).I was hoping for some new function like ambient scenes (light cycling, stuff like that).You can't turn off a scene in the widget anymore (single action buttons). Which means now I need double the amount of buttons in my widget.And it'd be great that if the lights are already on a specific setting and someone comes home with their geo fence on that it doesn't overwrite the current setting. (Unless they're off).It seems that this app was prematurely released. Which is too bad. I like the hue labs, too, but none of those features have found their way into the app either, which is kind of a let down.

Helaas een misser. Alle prettige functionaliteiten zoals duidelijke wekkers zitten niet meer (duidelijk) in de nieuwe app. Daarnaast ben je al je scenes van de "oude" app kwijt en moet je alles opnieuw instellen. De werking met kamers is grappig maar niet functioneel als je weinig lampen hebt. Geen Apple Watch, Siri en iPad ondersteuning. Beter was de oude app met alle functionaliteiten verbeteren. Deze app laat ik liggen, een verslechtering tov de eerste generatie.

Deze app voegt weinig toe t.o.v de oude app. De app bepaalt zelf welke lamp in een scne welke kleur krijgt. De mogelijkheid om een lamp zelf op een kleur te plaatsten ontbreekt. Verder werkt de app niet intutief zoals de oude app waardoor het erg ingewikkeld aanvoelt. Oude scenes werken ook niet met de nieuwe app. Lampen indelen in kamers is handig maar daar waren al andere apps voor. Ik blijf bij de oude versie.

Slechte update.... Enige nieuwe noemenswaardige tov oude app is dat je kamers kunt aanmaken. Hoe maak ik nieuwe scnes aan door lampen naar kleuren te schuiven? Hoe kan ik lampen binnen een scne apart dimmen? Zonder de basis functionaliteiten is de app maar 1 ster waard. Trs belle application mais - R_glages  domicile et dehors ne fonctionne pas- Pas d'animations - problmes avec commandes Siri Merci de corriger au plus vite

I like the new look. Feels more modern. I miss being able to assign a color from a picture manually and having more control. You have to shuffle colors randomly now... Not a fan of that change! Geofencing is hit and miss. Sometimes my lights turn on when I arrive home, sometimes not... I miss having a range to choose from with the geofencing. And now you can't be notified when your lights turn on. Overall I'm kinda disappointed with the new App. Cool looking but it's pretty much it! It's like Phillips didn't think enough about keeping what was good in the other App...

L'id_e d'organiser des pices est bonne. Mais l'obligation de mettre une transition pour se r_veiller est une arnaque, les jours ou je dois me lever  4h, j'ai pas le temps pour ces conneries mme pendant 10 minutes

Clairement mieux que la version 1 au niveau de l'interface et de la facilit_ d'utilisation. App da eliminare ( o da non scaricare!) non serve a nulla. Ho 13 lampade HUE ma non  utile a gestirle in modo intelligente (come del resto hanno gi notato gli altri) Molto meglio la generazione 1. Mai lasciare la strada vecchia per la nuova...
Per questa caxxta, di app.Inutile e dire poco.... Continuo ad utilizzare la vecchia app.

Die neue App sieht zwar besser aus, aber hat weniger komfort und mehr Bugs. Warum testet Philips das nicht ausreichend, bevor es ver_ffentlicht wird? Ebenfalls st_rt mich dass die Sanft wecken Funktion mit den empfohlenen Lampen nicht funktioniert. Eigentlich alles Mist und unintuitiv.
Use common sense, add iPad and Apple Watch. Get with it!
Dramatic improvement over the previous generation of the app.

What's the point of having great lightbulbs when the software is so ineffective. I thought the old version of this software was bad enough, but this is even worse. There are so many features missing, it's impossible to use as it is. How can a company like Phillips get this so wrong?

When you tapped scene in older version it came on, tap it again lights go off. It doesn't work in new gen, I have to make seperate extra widget for that. Why?!Also siri only turned lights on, not off.

Been using hue since it was available and this app has ruined the functionality. Added rooms? Ok good. The rest is awful. We cannot use photos to specify colours for each light anymore. No Apple watch. Lost all my scenes. What was the point?
iPhone only app? Why not support iPad?

Vamos a peor en lugar de ir a mejor. Anuncian a bombo y platillo la nueva app con fantsticas mejoras, y cada da que la uso encuentro ms problemas absurdos e incomodidades de manejo. Es ms compleja de usar. Das mas vueltas para hacer cosas simples, las ambientaciones se crean solo para habitaciones independientes y no para todas, no puedes crear ambientaciones con los colores que quieras de una foto, no puedes elegir q bombilla tiene q color al crear ambientaciones, la intensidad no est en el mismo lugar q el color, hay que salir de uno para entrar al otro, sin rastro de las smbientaciones dinmicas...En definitiva una mier...a de actualizacin de app. No es que no ofrezca nada nuevo es que ofrece menos configurabilidad. Hay q seguir usando la app antigua junto con apps externas que si saben hacer las cosas bien.
I miss timers, as for example in "go off 30 min from now".
Apple watch siempre, y si puede ser todo en una app por favor!!..2 apps? Para? Todas las funciones en una no?
Strzt h_ufig ab, ist unbersichtlich, endlos verschachtelt und berdesigned. Das machen einige Fremdanbieter besser.

Das gro angekndigte Software-Update bricht mit den altbekannten Strukturen  prinzipiell keine schlechte Idee, hatte die alte App doch ihre Grenzen. Leider entpuppt sich die neue Version doch als "alte" im neuen Gewand: der Funktionsumfang wurde m.E. verschlimmbessert (obwohl so viel Potential besteht!) und alles was nach moderner UX schreit in die App gestopft. Leider ohne stringentes Konzept.Mal eben bei zwei Lampen die Farbe gleichzeitig _ndern? Ich hab's nicht geschafft.Mal eben die Widgets _ndern? Ein Spieroutenlauf.Ein Widget erstellen, dass alle Lampen im Haus ausschaltet... Fehlermeldung.Szenen ber mehrere R_ume hinweg steuern? Nicht m_glich.Ich werde bei der alten App bleiben. Die sieht nicht sch_n aus, aber die hat alle Funktionen die man braucht. Zwar auch nicht immer am rechten Fleck, aber immerhin funktioniert's.Liebes Philips Hue-Team, euer System hat so viel Potential. Entwickelt eure Software doch bitte mit denen die sich damit auskennen: eure Nutzer!
Raum erstellt, Farbe l_sst sich nicht mehr _ndern. Nicht empfehlenswert

Selten habe ich eine so unfertige App gesehen! Diese Version der App ist weder auf iPad und iPhone, noch auf der Apple Watch kompatibel und diverse grundlegende Funktionen fehlen komplett! Ich hasse es ber eine App herzuziehen, aber diese App hatte wirklich nicht ver_ffentlicht werden drfen! Man kann nur jedem raten, dass er auf der ersten Version bleibt.

Kann wie viele vor mir nur best_tigen dass das handling eher bescheiden ist. Nach 10 Minuten findet man sich zwar gut zurecht. Aber es fehlt an vielem. Pro: - neues Design - neue Widget Implementierung und Funktionsumfang Contra: - importieren von Szenen nicht erfolgt bzw keine Option zu finden- Steuerung auerhalb des WLAN sehr viel Tr_ger bis hin zu gar keiner Reaktion - Raum bergreifend kein Zugriff auf Lampen  ( auer im Widget )- in der Szene nicht die M_glichkeit die einzelne Lampe zu definieren oder in Gruppen zu fassen
I'm using the new app and see that it doesn't work on 4G. And I would like it to be iPad compatible as the 1gen app is.  Please fix both problems.

I'll be sticking with the original app. This new version needs a lot of work to be anything close to the original. This app is ok if all you want to do is separate rooms but lights cannot be used in multiple setups. This app also looses connection to the bridge quite often and has randomly shut my lights off. That's a deal breaker and a step backward for Philips. I'm just happy that they didn't do this to the original.No Apple Watch support either. Just leave the original alone please.

As a new hue consumer I love the new app except for the fact I cannot select my own color from a picture. The new app has a more attractive UI overall. Can't wait for more features and Apple watch app.

I have two rooms currently and being able to select them separately is great. I now however have no Apple Watch support. I have the hue lights in the bedroom, but I leave my phone out of the room. In the past I would use the watch to turn off the lights, now I can't. Simple issue probably will be fixed in the next version. I do have an issue with the lights no longer being the same color... Some of the old functionalities need to be revisited. We need an update ASAP

The new app is a major step backwards from gen 1. While you have rooms (great idea), you no longer have scenes. Routines only control four rooms, but what if you have four lamps (products) you want to control independently? What if you only want 2 of 4 lights on in a room? In an attempt to simplify, Philips has removed a lot of what was cool with the product. Im looking for alternative apps (while I continue to use the original app) to control my Hue lights. Talk to users of your product; users who have 20 or more Hue lights and see how they use them. This app will only be useable for people with 10 or less (6 or less) lights at best.

This app isn't perfect yet, but it is much easier to use and more accessible for those new to Hue when compared to its predecessor. I very much like all of the changes and I can tell people are leaving bad reviews based on expecting perfection. This app is brand new and Philips has a good record of keeping apps updated when enough people ask for a change. It's a step in the right direction. I think my review should be 4/5 stars but I am giving it the full 5 to boost its overall score. People are expecting too much. Philips encourages users to find a 3rd party app they love for controlling their lights on a day to day basis. Their main app is meant mainly for getting everything set up and providing basic functionality for beginner users. It excels in those areas. If you don't like this app for day to day control, find/buy one of the many amazing 3rd party apps here in the App Store. You can also use the plethora of HomeKit apps as a controller if you are set up for that. Keep up the good work Philips.

This long delayed update to the original hue app is an improvement with important caveats. The good: I've noticed a significant speed increase in the responsiveness of the lights when on wifi. It's almost instantaneous now, though I suspect your mileage will vary based on your wifi signal strength. You can finally group your lights into HomeKit/Siri friendly rooms. The bad: Yes, the new app design is not the most intuitive. A brief in-app tutorial would have helped many. Power users will want to continue controlling their lights via other, superior HomeKit apps or desktop scripts. Siri still gets my light commands right only half the time.  The ugly: widgets are now limited to controlling four rooms. Switches are limited to three rooms. Both changes cite "to ensure a fast response" which on one hand I appreciate, but I would like the option to settle for a slower response in exchange for controlling more rooms. I can no longer use my hue tap to turn off all my lights on my way out the door! The hue tap, unlike Siri or even the app is 99% reliable in giving successful commands. The biggest improvement (fast response) is thus also the biggest drawback: the inability of widgets and switches to control ALL my lights simultaneously. Let some of use sacrifice speed in exchange for the freedom to use all the software and hardware accessories as we were once able. I'm not going to put a hue tap in every room.

Location based triggering of my lights, based on home/away, does not work at all!I leave home, lights still on. Then I turn them off via the app and when I get back, lights still off. This is EXTREMELY ANNOYING!
Hue 2 is less functional than Hue 1. That's just the truth. What was Phillips thinking?

Others have said it better than me but I'll rehash the biggest issues.  Selecting colors is terrible.  Same with brightness level.  The app also isn't fitting on an iPhone 6S screen. Why?  Please work quickly to improve the app.

As a lighting designer, I will be the first to admit that gen 1 needed some minor tweaks. But this new app takes a confusing app and makes it even less intuitive. Furthermore I really liked the hue community and the ability to upload and download scenes. I have over 75 scenes that I use regularly. Sure I can copy them into the new app. But there is no organization. Furthermore, I found the color/photo map in the old app very useful and intuitive. Just drag the light to the color/area you want set the intensity and done. The new app only lets you select from the color or white palettes on an individual basis, no more grouping of lights, and you can't pick a specific spot on a photo replicate. Instead the program chooses for you. I really hope support will continue for gen 1 or that the two will be integrated. Sorry. I want to like. But can't.

It could use dynamic effects, such as candlelight and importing old scenes from the old account - but the new UI is much more intuitive and user friendly. Annoyed that you can't select an exact point of color on the photo? Grow up.

Seriously, it's an embarrassment at how bad this app is for such a genius product. Sell it to Apple and let the world rejoice. Or hire some amazing developers and stop this madness. It's just silly. Thank goodness for my dear Amazon Echo/Alexa.

Been playing with this x hours and Im getting frustrated. BTW Where are the scenes?I was hoping for Hue to fix the previous app which is not great but we all have learn to live with. Lights are great but the apps mmmm!
I miss the old app that worked great with my iPhone AND iPad. App doesn't allow all lights in the room to be set at the exact same color and brightness. The old app had it all. Had I known...

Verwende wieder Gen1

First, let me say I love the bulbs themselves and have implemented nearly house-wide over the last couple years.  This is a review of the new app only.The gen1 app was absolutely abysmal, which is sad for such a great product.  Reliance on 3rd party apps is risky, and almost stopped my continued implementation of the bulbs.  This 2nd gen app is better, but I'm really frustrated that Philips didn't make the effort to learn from mistakes and understand what people need in an app.  I've spent a fortune on this system and I don't think it's too much to expect a decent app without having to spend more money on other unreliable apps.The Good (and there is good):-HomeKit integration - thank you!  This alone encouraged me to expand my system despite the app-Rooms!!!  Finally I can now group bulbs together and control them with Siri.-Home/Away and routines are a great step in the right direction-Overall the updated interface is more intuitive and looks goodThe Bad-What happened to the blinking light when assigning names to newly installed bulbs?  When installing multiples, it's impossible to determine which is which easily and requires testing and extra time to get it right.  Please put this back!-Poor database management.  If I delete a name because I didn't get it right the first time or I have to reinstall the app or the bulb itself, I can never use the same names again.  At this rate, my hall lights will have to be labeled as "Hall4768" which I'll never remember when using Siri.  See I'd already tried hallway and corridor with every iteration in between before the lights finally worked right - by then appropriate names were gone.  Seriously?  When I delete a bulb or room, it should delete it from the database and allow names to be re-used.-Bulb connectivity is lost WAY MORE, which means I have to install and reinstall more (see previous points for impact)-Siri voice control sync issues.  Wha???  Trying to resolve the sync issue means visiting every room and light setup to determine the problem.  I have several sync issues a day and this is out of control-Scenes.  While I do like the new look of scenes, why didn't all those scenes I painstakingly created port over?  And why must scenes ALSO not allow names to be used again?  For that matter, why not allow one scene that can be Siri controlled for any room? This needs better room integration-Why can you not assign a scene for wake up or timed events?  That's key for max usability-Why no blink function with routines?  Need another option besides fadeI hope future releases will address these issues, but frankly I'm not holding my breath since it took forever to get rooms, which is such a basic function.Still, I do love the bulbs and Siri control.  And, I am thankful for HomeKit integration.  I'm also in love with the dimmer switches/remotes and the Hue Go.  Add a motion sensor to the switch and it would be perfect!

I updated to the this new app from the old a and lost all my scene setups. I cannot control scene creation like i did in the previous app. Only shuffle colors. Very dissapointed. I am switching back to the old app

Several HUGE issues with this. 1) You CANNOT have lights be part of more than one "room". So if I want to have a scene that controls multiple rooms simultaneously, well, you can't unless you set up your entire house as a single room (which will delete any other rooms you have set up. INCOMPREHENSIBLY STUPID.2) No way to manually set the color of groups of lights simultaneously (you just have to eyeball it if you want to create a scene where all the bulbs in a room are the same orange). Feature regression, we used to be able to do this. 3) It takes me way more clicks/scrolls to get to where I'm turning a scene on than it used to. The rooms/scenes division makes me have to keep navigating back and forth between pages, and this weird bubble interface only shows 4 choices at a time on a big iPhone 6 screen. Much less efficient.What is so bad about scrollable lists? Why does everyone feel the need to invent some kind of worse interface idea than the obvious?
You can't remote access anymore, group lights to the same color and the dimming feature is visually nice, but annoying to use on a frequent basis. Thank you for letting us use gen 1 still.

I really like the new interface and controls; however, there are some bugs in the app. I cannot add more than four rooms because it says I have no lights in the 5th room and wants to delete all of the scenes I have set up. The wake up routine did not run at the assigned time and only turned on two of three bulbs assigned to room in the routine. The fade feature did not work in the routine. Having to go into the rooms to adjust individual lights is an extra step. It would be nice to have an all lights tab on the home screen.

Una app appena realizzata per utilizzare al meglio le luci senza supporto all'apple watch ! Assurdo.

New scenes and colour options are slightly lacking yet more than enough for serious lighting routines. The implementation of "rooms" that are stored in bridge memory is excellent, leaps and bounds ahead of the "scene sharing" in the old version. The 'no frills' minimalistic approach to the UI is much appreciated and is slightly more tasteful in my humble opinion. One problem I have encountered is the constant disconnecting from the bridge only if I sign into my hue account, but since there's no real incentive to do that now, it's not a deal breaker. The reason why it isn't 5 star is because nothing really 'wowed' me. More of the same (which isn't a bad thing). Keep it up devs :)
The old app is much better - this app is way too convoluted and not intuitive at all.

So, I'm giving this review two stars because I can't give 2 1/2. I'm going to jump straight in so the developers can address the issues quickly and easily:WHAT'S RIGHT:- A sleek, more modern design that was sorely needed.- The app is quick.- You have on/off switches for lights right on the homepage. - That's it.WHAT'S WRONG:- WHY ARE YOU STILL FORCING THESE "PICTURE" SCENES? No one wants them! Let us just create our own scenes, not using photos! It doesn't even make sense to use photos! No one else is seeing the photos, so all they see is the lights change to random colours. I'm sure most people also only have one light in a room, so WHY would I want to use a photo?! - Where has the iPad and Apple Watch support gone? I have both an iPad Pro and Apple Watch, why remove loved functionality? - When creating a widget I have 3 options to pick from, none of which I can find a way to customise?!?! This is the MOST annoying thing for me. And again it involves the stupid use of photo scenes! If there is a way to customise these, make it easier to find, or better yet, put a "Make your own scene" button right there! So we can tap that, go through the nice menus of choosing the "rooms", and then let US configure the colour, brightness. I don't want your tropical pictures or savanna or whatever other stupid photos you choose. I want my own colours. I want my own scenes. I think that sums it up. There's so much done right with this, I think the reason I'm annoyed is because there are also so many obvious oversights! Please fix these. And please make things easy to use. If your mum can't use it, then don't release it. Deal? Deal.

The overall UI is nice and flaschy but more or less useless without proper scene editing. You can choose an picture for scene creating like in the gen. 1 app but without any controll over the light bulbs indivitually. You can move the picture and the bulbs change there color randomly !!! Also the funktion to sync and import scenes from myhue.com is missing !

Das neue UI sieht schick aus und wirkt ein bisschen flotter. Damit h_rt sich's dann aber schon auf mit den Vorteilen zur alten App. Die Bedienung ist weniger intuitiv, die Umsetzung hat einige offensichtliche Schlampigkeits-Fehler und anstatt mehr Funktionen (z.b. die lange gewnschte Umsetzung von Hue-Labs Funktionen) gibt's weniger (Lampen mssen nun gruppiert werden und sind nicht mehr einzeln ansteuer/programmierbar - eine gruppenfunktion an sich w_re ja eh fein, aber bitte zu gunsten und nicht auf kosten der bedienbarkeit, die watch-app fehlt, ipad app ebenfalls, ...). Deswegen wollte wohl auch die alte Version noch im App Store belassen. deswegen gebe ich auch zwei Sterne statt nur einem - ich nehme an, die fehlenden Funktionen werden noch nachgereicht. Warum man hier aber zur eigenen Schande eine gerade mal das alpha-stadium berwundene App ver_ffentlicht hat, erschliet sich mir nicht unbedingt. Vielleicht wurde einer willkrlichen Deadline des Marketing Department entsprochen - wobei deren nicht-einhalten die meisten End-User sowieso nicht mitbekommen h_tten. Im Gegensatz zu einer halb-fertigen App.
Only one device can be paired.  Once that device is paired, you're stuck.  Not even resetting factory settings can fix it.

Much improved. New features and sync now works like a modern iOS app. The routines could use sunrise and sunset setting for shifting times. Needs a new Apple Watch app too. But this works well and is much nicer looking

So far Philips hue is the best smart light system compared to others out there. Update is good but I look forward to more features. My only wish is for Philips to create dynamic scenes. For example I love the preloaded dynamic scenes for the Philips go lamp and wish these were available for my other bulbs.

So for me a lot of the older interface worked fine. And if I wanted to I could easily pick and choose lights and put them all into the same color so that they would match. With this version of Philips hue you can't. I'm also a user who has a large amount of hue bulbs that are spread across my house many of them are in fixtures with multiple sockets like chandeliers. It's was a common thing for me to change the color all at once and now I can't do that and it drives me up the wall because the colors don't match. The regression of scene creation has got to be fixed. There is no way that I want to use a picture and not beanie to see on the picture where I'm getting the color from. That's the point of me using my own photos. So that I can chose the exact color from that photo that I wanted. Also the loss of scenes from my old app to the new one was kind of a killer. When you have to rebuild all of the scenes you've had before into the new app I can be time consuming. So for me a customer who has multiple hue bulbs and strips around there house this app is horrible when it comes to user interface.
I need gen 2 for the "improvements" and I need gen 1 for the watchOS version...
Dear Philips,  Focus your talent on making cool products but outsource your app development.
Geofencing is no longer working with this new app because as soon as I leave the app it turns off. There is no iPad or watch app :( Anyone else having issues keeping geofencing enabled?

Vielleicht sollte man das n_chste mal erst mal berlegen welche Funktionen man bieten will und erst dann das GUI angehen und. Nicht umgekehrt. Was alles fehlt, verglichen mit der "alten" jetzt SW-Version ist ja schon erw_hnt worden in diversen anderen Rezessionen. Hbsch alleine hilft nicht, wenn das wenige was noch einzustellen geht in v_llig verschachtelten Mens versteckt ist. Universal-App w_re auch nett gewesen. Einen Punkt gibt es dafr, dass ich es mit der neuen App zumindest schafte Siri auf zwei Ger_ten zum laufen zu bringen.Mein Tipp: weiter die alte App benutzen in Kombination OnSwitch.
Leider wurden die die eingerichteten Zimmer und alle Szenen einfach beim erneuten starten der App gel_scht.

I have never thought the Gen 1 app was great, but the Gen 2 app is even worse. In the Gen 1 app I could adjust scenes at the individual light level, which was useful, in particular with light strips. Now scenes have been completely ruined and can only be adjusted on a room by room basis.

Dit is echt de enige functie die ik gebruik, de app open ik zelf nooit. Faal.. Hoop dat dit er snel terug in komt. Tot die tijd blijf ik dus gewoon de oude gebruiken..

De app ziet er beter uit dan gen 1, helaas ontbreekt bij het maken van scenes de mogelijkheid om per lamp zelf een kleur te kiezen. Dit heeft gen 1 wel. De gen 2 app zou beter zijn als hij de zelfde functies heeft als gen 1.
Ziet er mooi uit maar mist een hoop essentile functies. Zoals alle lampen 1 kleur geven in een scne.

Lamps can only be put in 1 room. I want a scene that activates more rooms (inside and outside or living room and hallway for instance) next to rhat I can't edit a scen, all lamps are auto configured, even brightness is set to a default level so  selecting a scene is more touches on the phone and after selecting I still need to adjust brightness to my liking. Also no active scens are possible, other apps can make livings scenes, much more dynamic. And my negativity list goes on and on..app really sucks!

1. iPad-Support2. Apple Watch Support3. Bringt bitte die Timer zurck! Diese waren perfekt zum einschlafen etc...4. Macht die Widgets wieder so einfach wie bei Gen1! Es ist viel zu kompliziert...Aber ein grosses Lob, was das Design betrifft. Finde ich Hammer so!

Einfach nur schlecht. Fhlt sich wie eine Beta an uns es fehlen etliche Funktionen aus der vorigen App. Danke Philips, nun kann ich ein eh schon teures Produkt nicht mal mehr mit seinem vollen Funktionsumfang nutzen.

Fail Philips, fail! Deleting essential features like scenes, no ipad/iwatch support but making the app look more pretty is not a step in the right direction, please please finally hire someone that is capable of programming a proper app!

Die neue Oberfl_che gef_llt, aber ich finde es eine Frechheit, dass man alles neu einrichten muss! Das Konzept von R_umen ist bescheuert. Wie kann ich meine Leselampe auf dem Soga heller machen ohne, dass das ganze Wohnzimmer hell wird?! Gar nicht! Dafr muss man dann zwei seperate R_ume erstellen. Die alte App war viel flexibler!
The new layout and changes are awesome.  Lots of change that makes things easier for me too. BUT i have an iPhone 6 and it has crashed 3 times already today while using it

No matter how many times I try, I can't log into My Hue on this app. It always leads me to a broken page that says Forbidden. As such, I can't even utilize any scenes. This app needs major work. Horrible first experience.
Incredible to not have basics feat as turning on lights at sun down or to turn off lights at a specific time in the routine settings! It's basics thing in most of third party app for hue lights.

Ever since upgrading to this app my lights turn on and off at random times. There is no logic behind it. No ability to control individual light colours. Why are my lights turning on in the middle of the night? Why are my lights turning off at random times? Even different lights in the same room are turning off/on without any instruction!

Actually, I've warmed to this a lot.The lack of Watch and iPad support in an upgrade from such a big company is inexcusable but I do see what they were going for with the way the lights are controlled now. Get the iPad and native support for the watch sorted (though I can't be clear enough when I say that Philips are a huge company so it should have been done from the outset for a premium product like Hue) and this would be pretty good.

I don't usually write reviews but for this one I felt compelled to.I was very much looking forwards to the release of this much anticipated second generation app. However, it's left me feeling more than underwhelmed, so much they could have done that they simply haven't, it's no wonder they promote third party apps. Anyway it's close to being a total disaster buts it's not and there are some cool features, like the wake-up function. There is potential but I'm already looking forward to another update and even to an extent looking back at the previous app. It's an awesome product is Phillips Hue and it deserves an equally awesome app. Sadly this is not it.
In Gen 1 the geofencing is set so that when I'm on the driveway I see my house light up. Now I have to go in the house, and run the app before lights will turn on.

The light picker from Gen1 was one of the nicest things about the app. Ability to group lights, ability to adjust EVERY light in your home, and ability to dim without having to change screens. Please bring this back. Also, please include the scenes from Gen1 app, I really like them. New scene picker looks nice, but is hard to use. Is there any way to set a scene for your whole home now?

The new version of the app has a much cleaner interface and has a ton of added functionality such as support for rooms, wake-up timers, routines, and expanded functionality for geo-location.However, there is a rather annoying and somewhat severe bug with this app's integration with Siri. Any scene that uses white light instead of colors doesn't seem to transfer color information to Siri properly. For example: if I tell Siri to set my bedroom to the "bright" scene, it does change my lights, but instead of the warm white that it's supposed to be, it defaults to a pure white light. This happens with every scene that uses white light, even though switching it in the actual app works properly.

Loving the new room support (which also configures groups on the hub). Took me a while to figure out how to create scenes (you have to tap on a room, then set each light the way you like, then click + to make it a scene), so minus one star for not being intuitive in that respect. Would also be nice to be able to easily set multiple lights in a room to the same color easily.

As some of the other reviews has said, this Gen 2 effort is more complicated, not in the since that you cant figure it out, but you shouldnt have to figure it out since Gen 1 was pretty intuitive. I have had to reset several times because the lights wont stay connected; test my network is working fine. Siri is not working any longer with this app, however, I have some GE lights and Siri is working fine with my iDevices. I have a call into Phillips to find out whats going on especially since I have the latest Apple TV and iOS updates. Like I said, Gen 1 worked like a charm, but Gen 2 Im having lots of problems where it works sometime and sometimes it doesnt; all manually. Im hoping my call into Phillips will fix the glitch and I can start enjoying the technology the way it is intended. Ill re-review the app once I have a conversation with Phillip; but for now, lots of work to do what I was already doing at a 5 star rating with Gen 1.

1. No notifications when leaving or returning home to verify lights are off2. No iPad app3. All lights/room lights/ individual lights are a little strangely laid out. The app looks great, but some of its new UX implementation is a bit difficult.

The gen 1 app wasn't very full featured and left a lot of possibilities on the table for other app makers.  The biggest problem was the user facing features were never updated. Now we have gen 2, it really has fewer features, but possibly a better base. So lets see if they can pull off adding new features to this one. 2 stars until you start delivering. Hopefully this product is not indicative of the level of team used to produce this at Philips.

Pros (maybe): Added rooms.Cons: made scenes and widgets basically unusable: lost control what light takes which color from photo, hues in photos change on loading, widgets no longer allow to turn affected lights back off. No room crossing scenes (eg living and dining room). I have scenes in the old app that turn lights off in other rooms when I set them, eg lights in my bedroom when I turn on living room lights. No real improvement anywhere else.

I love that they finally got option to separate by rooms so I can control with Siri HomeKit,it was a little tricky to setup because I had it setup with the 1st gen but,It works great,and the widget option to set different light mood brightness on ur rooms is awsome so easy manage once u get use to it..well made Phillips..keep up with the updates

Philips grabbed the home lighting market by storm with their introduction of "hue lights". Then with the integration with IFTTT, there were possibilities that were never available to before. I was excited to hear of the 2nd gen hue app with new possibilities. Those new possibilities are "HEADACHES".Headaches:1.) Scenes are not or cannot be imported from the hue 1st gen account. We now have to REBUILD ALL 1st gen scenes from scratch. Deal breaker for me. 2.) No iPad support, REALLY? My iPad Mini is my home control device; not my iPhone in the bedroom charging. Support for both is a MUST.3.) Reduction in functionality. Pros:1.) Nice UI for light color and intensity. Staying with hue 1st gen for now.

You don't have the "alarms & timers the first app had so you can't set the lights to go on or off when you're not home at a specific time, only when you leave or arrive. Combine the features of both apps into one and you'll have a hit. You had more control with the original app. I had to delete this app so I can get the first one back. I need my lights to go on when I'm not home at a specific time.

Yes, the new UI is vastly improved and feels more like a fancy HomeKit app, but man did Hue kill the feature set. Be warned, if you liked doing more than turning you bulbs on and off or using a dimmer switch you will be upset with the new app vs the old, but hey, it now looks pretty.

Great improvement over Gen 1. Incorporates features from many other apps now to give support for scenes and rooms with much needed speed and visual improvements. No Apple Watch app yet which is what I want and need for this to get 5 star. Otherwise Gen 2 is a must.

This new app provides a decent but clunky facelift, but takes away functionality that made the old app barely competitive with the multitude of 3rd party hue apps. Now scenes can only apply to rooms, not the whole home altogether. There's still no interface to the online MyHue community of submitted scenes. And there's no fine-tuning advanced controls that make this worthy of a version 2 badge. In summary, it's version 1 with less features and a facelift.
Killed all my lights initially. After a day they all came back and now (for my use case) it's much improved vs v1.

This new version looks a bit nicer and has room support, but overall is still terrible just like the old app.Why is Philips still pushing this stupid picture scene thing. They don't even give you the option of just choosing a colour and a brightness for your lights/scenes. You have to pick a picture.
App looks much better than previous version but why not support Apple Watch? This is two steps back.

UI is much improved. However very little in terms of new functionality. Pros: new sleeker ui room set upSet up of switches easierCons:Removes ability to randomise light turn on in routines. Lights now turn on exactly at time set in routines without any option to randomise. (Critical to randomise for house security)Light schedule still does not automatically adjust routine with changes in sunset time. This means user must change the routine by 12-20 mins each week both in spring and autumn.New app not compatible with Apple Watch or iPad All of the cons above mean I will still need to use old app or alternative hue app to ensure routines work correctly and to use on watch/iPad.
Aber ich pers_nlich sehe kein Vorteil in gen2!Das Geofecing funktioniert genau so wenig wie in gen1!N_mlich gar nicht!!!!!!!Trotz Freigabe meiner WLAN Verbindungen!Schade!!!!!!GruGisbert

so nicht meine Damen und Herrn von Philips. Ich habe der App echt eine Chance gegeben. Nachdem ich mich 3 Stunden ge_rgert habe ist die App vorerst wieder von meinem iPhone geflogen. Das einzigste was nette ist das Design. die Bedienung ist unm_glich. Den einzelnen Lampen eine Farbe  zuzuweisen ist ein Unding. Man kann zum Beispiel eine erstellte Szenen  nachtr_glich nicht mehr _ndern. Zumindest habe ich die Funktion nicht gefunden. Ich werde es in einem halben Jahr noch mal probieren.
Leider funktioniert der Aufwachen Modus nicht. Wenn aktiviert, dann gehen keine Lampen an. Schade.

ein, zwei kleinigkeiten noch _ndern... ansonsten sehr klasse... was mir z.b. fehlt (vielleicht hab ich es bisher auch nur bersehen): die m_glichkeit, die einzelnen lampen auf den fotos zu verschieben, um die farben einer jeden lampe in einer szene zu definieren... das hat mir super gefallen. bitte wieder einbauen... ;-) ansonsten: top. gutes design, intuitiv... fein.

was hilft das, wenn der Funktionsumfang dafr schlechter geworden ist? Auerdem ist die langersehnte Funktion x Min. vor/nach Sonnenauf-/Sonnenuntergang ein und auszuschalten immer noch nicht implementiert worden.Die Funktion per Zufall ein- bzw. auszuschalten ist futsch, raumbergreifende Szenen einstellen ebenfalls...
...jetzt habe ich 20 Minuten versucht Szenen zu erstellen und in das Widget einzubinden - ich habe erst mal schlecht gelaunt aufgegeben.Das ist alles, aber nicht intuitiv bedienbar.

I really miss the ability to make widget actions that changes ONLY intensity, not color.I really dislike that the widget actions can only select between 'scenes', why is it not possible to directly choose a color?I really miss the ability to change color for all bulbs assigned to a specific room at the same time.I really dislike having to configure the same widget actions on all my different devices, why can these not be shared between devices like the room definition etc?I really miss proper ipad support.Sometimes the 'routines', does not work, especially the location based routines seems to be shaky.Weary seldom the app seems to loose contact with the bridge and nothing responds.

Scener kan en skrida _ver flera rum vilket g_r att man t.ex. ej kan t_nda alla lampor i huset via en scen. 2. Fininst_llning av egna scener saknas. Funktionen _r nu helt styrd av att man ska v_lja en bild som f_rg/styrka s_tts genom. Vgar s_ga att alla vill kunna st_lla in scener helt manuellt och inte via en bild? Helt sjukt designbeslut3. Avete tolto il supporto ad iPad, mi aspetto almeno che col prossimo aggiornamento mettiate quantomeno il supporto alla risoluzione del display di iPad Pro.  decisamente un passo indietro vergognoso in tutti i sensi.

Ottima la revisione del design e la semplificazione di molte impostazioni ma le possibilit di impostare il colore delle luci in base allo spettro dei colori e di raggruppare le luci a prescindere dalle stanze di cui fanno parte dove sono finite? Il raggruppamento per stanze  una grande idea ma vincolare tutto solo a quello mi sembra un po' esagerato.

3 cose che spero sistemiate.1. Una volta creata una scena non ho trovato il modo di modificarla se non rifacendola da capo. Mossa furba ...2. Non si possono fare scene tra pi stanze... Seconda mossa furba ...3. Quando attivo le luci tramite Siri ho notato che le scene sono diverse da quelle create ovvero se imposta una scena con luce calda quando la attivo con Siri questa di accende bianca (con tonalit diversa).Considerando i soldi che vi ho dato per tutta questa roba, speravo veramente in qualcosa di meglio.

Endlich geht die Steuerung ber Siri. Vielleicht aber auch nur, weil ich die alte Hue App auf dem iPad gel_scht habe. App strzt beim dimmen einer Szene ab. Usability ist insgesamt schlechter als bei der alten Hue App.

Gut: Endlich keine Fehlangaben durch nicht erkannte Gesten mehr, endlich eine Gliederung der Lampen in R_ume. Nicht gut: Zimmerbergreifende Szenen nicht m_glich. Es w_re doch so einfach virtuelle Zimmer zu erstellen und dort Lampen hinzuzufgen zu k_nnen die bereits in anderen Zimmern aktiv sind.Lichtaktionen bei Ankunft und Verlassen des Wohnbereichs w_ren sicher eine sch_ne Sache, aber dann doch bitte fr alle (smartphonebewehrten) Personen im Haushalt. Solange die Familie pl_tzlich im Dunkeln sitzt weil Papa kurz zum Kiosk muss ist das natrlich eine peinliche Nummer. Merkste selber ne, Philips!?
Da habt ihr euch echt Mhe gegeben _ wenn jetzt noch das iPad untersttzt wird und die beiden Apps zusammen gelegt werden , kann man kaum noch was verbessern

Der Sinn von Hue ist die freie Gestaltungsm_glichkeit der Beleuchtung meines Zuhauses. Mit dieser neuen App ist dies nicht m_glich - im Gegenteil es wird in festen Raumschemen gedacht. Dann kann ich mein Licht gleich am Schalter an der Wand ein- und ausschalten und bin induvidueller als mit dieser App.Ganz grosser Mist!
Wenn ich die Szenen mit Siri exportiere, stimmen sowohl die Entspannen-Szene als auch die Nachtlicht-Szene nicht. ber die App aufgerufen haben die Szenen eine andere Farbe als ber Siri.

Having rooms is the best part of the update, everything else is still hard, complicated and unintuitive. Why would you remove the ability to sync bulbs to the same color. Where in the old app you could swipe down and combine which lights into the desired color. That's gone. Isn't that one of the main purposes of these lights? Great lights, poor app.

Didn't think it was possible, but new app is even worse than the old app. Widgets are a mess, geofencing doesn't work, scenes are far more difficult to create, frequent crashes. Feel pretty dumb for having sunk hundreds of dollars into a system that they haven't been able to get right in three years. What a scam. This was the last straw for me, will start switching to a new system.
I simply don't like it!! No Apple Watch support, where are all my themes? UI is very complicated!!! Please improve

I had high hopes for this app but after using it I will definitely keep using the first generation app. Scenes do not migrate to the new app which is very frustrating. Also the room control seems great until you realize that each bulb can only be in one room at a time which is really annoying when you have certain scenes that you want controlling more than one room. The app has some good ideas but they need to be merged with the old app.

The only reason I can't rate this app over 1 star is because instead of improving what you already had, you attempted to create something new and more limited than its predecessor. While the "Rooms" function is a good addition, you took out the ability to select the color for a group of lights. Now, knowing your customers may try and match colors for separate lights, why would this be considered an improvement? Other than that and Siri functionality for the home kits, there is no difference. Wouldn't it have been better and more efficient to build off the older app and add these features?

I would not be as negative as some of the reviewers. This app is a very significant improvement over the previous one. I can't wait to see how it continues improving once they correct the few things that are missing over the gen 1 app.
Trataron de hacer algo bueno con ella... Fallaron, se volvi compleja, llena de fallos, deja mucho que desear.
No question the old version of the Hue app needed some work. But really, no iPad version with Hue 2?  What is this, 2010?

No idea why they didn't just update the original app. This gen 2 brings a redesign and allows you to add rooms, but you don't have the same ability to colour-pick scenes, it doesn't bring your old scenes across from the first app, and it's missing features - why don't we have IFTTT integration within the app yet?This app's basically the same as first gen app, but looks different. Plus I've got to keep the 1st gen app on my phone anyway because this version doesn't support Apple Watch!

Sicuramente un notevole passo avanti rispetto alla versione precedente, per l'interfaccia  ancora poco convincente e poi si  perso il supporto a _Watch e l'ottimizzazione per l'iPad. Migliorata invece l'integrazione con HomeKit.
