Please bring the alarm and timer feature over from the first one. It is nice being able to set an alarm and then have it turn on or off the lights at a random point.  I'm not sure why there isn't a feature to create an alarm that turns on your lights +/- 30 minutes of that alarm.Not having this feature really negates its functionality as a security tool to turn your lights on and off while you are away.

Pros:   Group lights into rooms.   On/off switch for rooms.      App looks nice?Cons:   Scenes: what happened?    Inability to change    individual lights.   Creating/managing scenes is a pain and feels less customizable. Owned more than 10 lights since fall '14. The hue apps, and 3rd party apps are still a huge let down. Home kit and Siri are a small step in the right direction...although who wants to carry an iPhone/iPad around to talk to Siri (in a quiet enough environment to be understood) I don't want to have to buy another product such as Amazon echo but maybe The Hue tap should include the "listening" port for "voice control" and at a lower price to make up for the lack of app support and practical use. It's not like we are able to easily create the endless color combinations as advertised. The lights do not produce a lot of the colors. Add voice support to a Hue Tap, with Dimmer, and charge us $30 at most. Or include them in a newer bundle starter kits for new customers. Right now, users change the expensive lights because of the Name brand, install the app, get a small Wow effect, then get frustrated. Roughly $1k invested

Yea it might be a visual improvement but the functionality has taken a step back....this app is confusing to use and make it difficult to manually change the color of your lamps (let along change two lights to the same color). Please update this app!!!!!

Seriously, how it this app better??? Awful. And the HomeKit Siri integration started bad and only got worse. Siri apologizes when she works. And then confirms when nothing has happened. For the price we paid for these lights you'd think they could pay a good company to design a good app. Not a great app. Just something that's passable and functions. This is just terrible.

My biggest complaint is you can't choose the individual color of your he bulbs now! Hue now picks the colors for u! Why Phillips why? I think the company seriously needs to consider hiring better program designers.

Been playing with this x hours and Im getting frustrated. BTW Where are the scenes?I was hoping for Hue to fix the previous app which is not great but we all have learn to live with. Just for the lights not the apps.
I don't like how you have to recreate all of what I had set up in the first gen app. Also it is not obvious at all on how I recreate scenes in this new app. Back to the  old app for me
Great new app! This is what it should have been from the start. Setup was a breeze and super intuitive control of all the lights in my rooms. Excited for future updates!

The new app is certainly more complicated than the old app, but for good reason, as it finally offers the ability to separate lights by rooms (a feature that I unfortunately do not yet need). The features I use the most are still here: the widget, Siri (of course), and arriving/leaving home. Unfortunately the widget regresses in features: there is no more "second tap on a widget turns your lights off", so I have to take up valuable widget space with a dedicated Off button again, which is totally lame.Otherwise I am perfectly happy with the new app, works just fine for my purposes. I'll admit that it confused me at first, HUE would benefit quite a bit from including a video tutorial or something. I am not sure why more apps don't include introductory tutorials or videos to show you the basics of app usage first. Most users are not as smart or as patient as I am. I could imagine an average Joe or Joey getting really frustrated trying to adapt to the new app.Edit: some reviews here are perplexing. One user says "I need bulbs that can be in multiple rooms". Huh? That's a physical impossibility, why in the world would the app need to account for something impossible! Anyway...

Overall, the new Gen 2 is a good application, much better than 1 when it comes to UI and organization of rooms. But it is missing core functionality. For example, setting a scene for the whole home instead of setting per room and then having to call them from every room. I know this can be done via routine. But I can't call a routine via Siri. Another thing is allowing 2 lights to have same CUSTOM color. Seems impossible via choosing from the color palate.

While it looks pretty, functionally it's a step back.  It drops some features from Gen 1 and buries the rest in obscure places. You can no longer use photos for scenes or assign colors to individual lights (unless I missed that setting).  Sticking with Gen 1 and Lightbow.
I can't get Siri to even recognize my Bridge. It just sits and says looking for Bridge. I can't get it to connect with my Neat thermostat either.

I like the new design and feel but it needs a few things..... To make it great !!! I am not a person to write reviews like EVER ..... This one I felt that you need feedback because it's my favorite accessory to the iPhone. I have 25 of your lightbulbs and both hubs. Here is a list of improvements 1. Each room should have an easier way to access different scenes 2. Watch widget needs to be implemented 3. When creating a room - other rooms should not forget the lightbulbs .... That is so weird !!! 4. More selection of pictures to choose from - sometimes pictures from camera role are not the best 5. The color green is practically non existent - it turns the old lightbulbs and new to white !! Still love your product but not there in this new app !

...if you interpret "update" to mean "iterating on previous functionality." I am giving this two stars rather than one because I feel Philips' heart was in the right place - although I have no idea where their brains were. Cross-device support: removed. Apple Watch app: removed. Ability to set a scene with the specific lights I choose (without having to create a whole other grouping): removed. Ability to selectively choose the color based on a picture: removed. I like the idea of rooms, but the loss of functionality and the maddeningly unintuitive UI have driven me to uninstall it and move back to the gen 1 app.

Wat wordt er bedoeld met routines? Ik vind dit een verwarrende naam. Ik vond het verschil tussen timers en wekkers duidelijker. Ook mis ik heel erg de Apple Watch en iPad app. Ik had ook gehoopt op ondersteuning voor meer huizen in __n app. Voeg dit toe alsjeblieft!

Grafisch een verbetering maar qua functionaliteit een achteruitgang.  Ik mis de timer die je direct kunt inschakelen. Gebruikte dit om tussen scenes te wisselen met een zelf ingestelde tijdsduur. Kan nu alleen maar op een specifieke dag of tijd ingesteld worden. Jammer. Ik blijf bij de gen-1 versie.

Nieuwe app is een flinke update waar de hele interface is veranderd. Daardoor kost het even tijd voordat je alles weer hebt gevonden maar na een korte gewenningsperiode is de app intutiever en sneller dan de eerste versie. Erg fijn!
#NAME?

Ik blijf voorlopig de oude versie nog gebruiken. Scenes zijn niet meer vanuit de app te bedienen en ik kan geen eigen scenes maken en die dus ook niet gebruiken in de widgets. Slechte poging om iets beters te maken.

The app is a leap forward. I really like it. What I love to see improved is- Also use areas from HomeKit where your able to combine rooms together- have a all lights function-ability to program buttons more freely ( holding a button to cycle cenes, ability to add scenes to + and -)
This doesn't feel like the much anticipated upgrade... Big let down <and deleted...>
Please please please update that terrible icon.
I don't see any improvement in this app over the old one, if anything some features from the old app are missing.

Some initial hitches (needing to reset the HomeKit config) Missing watch support and a few improvements could be made elsewhere but still a vast improvement over the "junk folder" hidden first app. Keep the updates coming!

I was so looking forward to the gen2 app, I had highly hoped Philips would have accepted me into their beta testing to provide early feedback but they didn't. As of this update I can no longer set up my scenes the way I used to, especially with Siri - it just doesn't work. Scenes don't seem to save correctly, if I set up a "relax" scene with lights dimmed to 25% percent and then activate it with Siri the lights come on at 100%. Baffling. Further more you cannot set up mixed scenes, a feature which would have been a vast improvement. It's also very confusing to figure out how to set up custom scenes per room (I'm still not sure how). Philips you are making a LOT of money with these lights, please invest more of it into the software which controls them!
I've got loads of scenes saved in the old app and uploaded to the myhue website. Where are they? I've (finally) found how to select scenes but they're not there!!
What a let down. Siri and HomeKit has now stopped working, my Zigbee extensions keep disappearing from my light list and my Hue Tap can only control 3 rooms? Waste of time.

This app is a fantastic update to the horrible gen 1 Hue app.  It gets rid of the gimmick and cuts straight to feature set.  Features may be buried in menus and not outright noticeable for casual users.  A giant step in the right direction.

They removed a bunch of features and broke existing ones. You can't import old scenes, and you can't group bulbs together to set to the same color. If you liked the old icon grid layout and had multiple pages of scenes, stay away!
We need to be able to import old scenes and timers!  Is this a joke???
The old app had more control. Can't create a routine to turn on lights at sunset. Can't create a scene unless it is a picture?

This new iteration is a major leap forward for Hue. Finally they get integration with HomeKit the right way. The lights react now faster. The HomeKit room rationale is so much enjoyable and easy to pull off. Some crashes happen sometimes; that's why it is not a five-star one yet.

The concept of rooms and lights within them makes much more sense for how I use my lights. The HomeKit and Siri integration is also more natural because of this. Liking the new widget and ability to tweak the look.I think a few improvements could be made.Speed everything up.The layout of the "settings" and "more" menus isn't very intuitive, not sure these need to be two things.It might be nice to have a separate screen that lists all lights.The plus button isn't very iOS design like (with the exception of the notes app).Bring the iPad version back, and add a sync option so the config is the same across both devices.The app icon is ugly, I know it's made by "Philips" I bought the lights, it's tacky for a high-end product

Leuke nieuwe UI, vorige app was het instellen van kleuren met veel lampen lastig, klikt makkelijk op een ander. Ik mis multi-user optie. Dat als ik wegga de lampen uitgaan, mits er geen andere users in huis zijn bv.

De app is zeker een verbetering tov de vorige. Siri werkt een stuk beter. Alle scenes uit de vorige versie moet je helaas wel handmatig overzetten, maar dat kost je slechts een uurtje.  Een hele verbetering is dat je nu verschillende kamers in je huis kunt instellen. Ik ben er nog niet achter hoe je 'timers' kunt instellen, maar dat zal ergens wel mogelijk zijn. Helaas is er geen iPad app. Hopelijk komt dat in een volgende versie. Ook werkt de ondersteuning via de website niet meer met de 2e gen bridge. Je bent dus volledig afhankelijk van configuratie op je iPhone.
Wat een instellingen moet je doen. Overal weggestopt. Onnodig ingewikkeld. Ik houd het bij de 'oude' App waar Timers gewoon Timers heten en niet Routines.

Echt heel slecht. Je moet een ster geven anders kregen ze helemaal niets. Ben gek op mijn Philips lichten, maar hoe hebben ze zo'n app kunnen schrijven. Ik heb behoorlijk wat tijd besteed aan mijn eigen scenes en nu ? Weer op nieuw beginnen ? Want in de nieuwe app zijn ze niet terug te vinden.En waar is ook de iPad versie ? De app is een beetje te snel op de markt gebracht wat mij betreft. Ga je huiswerk opnieuw maken Philips.
Appen er betydeligt flottere at se p, men flere  features er fjernet. Forstr ikke hvordan Philips kan bruge 2 r p at udvikle noget der er mindre brugbart end deres frste udspil _
Meget bedre end den gamle app. Ops_tningen er langt mere logisk og grupperinger i v_relser fungerer godt - og de enkelte lys kan stadig nemt kontrolleres. Flot og gennemarbejdet app.
Leider so nicht zu gebrauchen! Weder ipad tauglich noch hat diese APP die M_glichkeiten der vorherigen Version. Frage an Philips - k_nnt ihr es nicht Besser?
Philips hue in two words: Great hardware, Disgusting software. Fix these broken apps and you'll get a 5 star from me.
Szenen mit Familienmitgliedern teilen geht immer noch nicht. Selbst erstellte Szenen k_nnen nicht mehr ge_ndert werden.

Die neue App sieht zwar schicker aus, aber Aussehen ist nicht alles. W_hrend die Gen 1 App sehr intuitiv war, komme ich hier mit den Szenen, Routinen und Einbindung der Lampen nicht gut klar.Ich hoffe, dass es demn_chst auch eine eigene iPad-Version gibt und das die Funktion der "circa"-Zeiten (Beginn, Ende einer Routine zu einer ungef_hren Zeit) auch wieder eingebunden wird, diese Funktion ist sehr ntzlich und es ist schade, dass die aktuell in Gen 2 nicht verfgbar ist.

Nach riesigen Ankndigungen kam schnell die Ernchterung. Die neue App ist echt schlecht umgesetzt. Alles funktioniert genauso schlecht wie bei der alten. Gerade die Siri Sprachsteuerung die auf der Herstellerseite so hoch gelobt wird funktioniert nicht! Und dies schon seit Wochen. Beim telefonischen Support hat man alles versucht, leider sind die Mitarbeiter hier genauso unf_hig und k_nnen nicht weiterhelfen. Es wurde immer auf die neue App verwiesen dessen Erscheinungsdatum unbekannt war. Jetzt ist sie da und keine Besserung vorhanden. Werde das komplette Hue-System also reklamieren! Hat mir mittlerweile echt genug Frust gebracht.

..ausser einer neuen Oberfl_che. Die alte App hatte einen guten Funktionsumfang, nun wurden viele Begriffe ver_ndert, Abh_ngigkeiten und Zuordnungen ber den Haufen geworfen und vor allem werden die meisten Daten beim Import aus der Bridge irgendwie fehlinterpretiert und verstmmelt.Alarme und Timer - Fehlanzeige, ich vermute das sind jetzt Routinen. Import - geht nicht, keine Option.Was fehlt denn da in der Entwicklung, Anwenderbezug oder Kenntnis der Aufgabenstellung und Ziele der App? Philips prahlt doch gerne mit dem Anwenderbezug, hier wurde noch nicht mal geschaut, was man denn bisher so gemacht hat. Oder das ist alles nur ein weiterer Betatest beim Kunden.

was hilft das, wenn der Funktionsumfang dafr schlechter geworden ist? Auerdem ist die langersehnte Funktion x Min. vor/nach Sonnenauf-/Sonnenuntergang ein und auszuschalten immer noch nicht implementiert worden.Die Funktion per Zufall ein- bzw. auszuschalten ist futsch.
Nach dem es einen Tag lang funktioniert hat, verbindet sich die App nicht mehr mit der Bridge 1. Gen.Die alte App dagegen funktioniert weiterhin.

Das Design ist gut gelungen und auch die Bedienung funktioniert teilweise besser (z.B. bei der Steuerung der Helligkeit), aber die App hat so schwerwiegende Einschr_nkungen, dass sie leider so (noch) nicht zu gebrauchen ist.  - Einzelne Lampen lassen sich in einer bestehenden Szene nicht bearbeiten und dann speichern. Man muss immer gleich eine neue Szene anlegen. Nennt man diese wie die alte, gibt es HomeKit / Siri Konflikte.  - Lampen lassen sich nicht zu Gruppen zusammenfassen bei der Einstellung. - Nicht auf iPad angepasst. - Keine Synchronisation mit hue online / mit bestehenden Szenen! Empfohlen wird ein umst_ndlicher / indirekter Import ber die alte App, bei dem u.a.  die Fotos der Szene verloren gehen.- Szenen sind nun auf einzelne R_ume beschr_nkt. bergreifende Szenen, z.B. bei offenen R_umen, sind nicht m_glich. - Eigene Szenen mit eigenem Foto, in denen man fr jede Lampe die Farbe bestimmt, sind nicht mehr m_glich zu erstellen. Nimmt man ein Foto zur Erstellung einer Szene, kann man nur nach dem Zufallsprinzip die Lampen danach einstellen. - Einstellungen sind allgemein weniger intuitiv.- Kein wirklicher Mehrwert: die App kann nichts, was nicht schon die alte konnte. Beispielsweise gibt es noch immer keine dynamischen Szenen. Gefhlt kann die App einfach nur weniger - netter verpackt.Schade! Hue Lampen sind groartig - die App noch nicht!
Sur iPad, la taille d'affichage est celle de l'iPhone. Pourtant, elle est donn_e compatible.
I'm sure it'll change with updates but right now you're better off with their gen 1 app.

Missing much from the former version. Like watch-support, iPad-support and the possibility to fine-tune scenes. Also, missing a way to set a scene for the whole home. Not importing scenes from the bridge. Needs much work.
Looks great on iPhone but why no native support iPad?

Too many bugs. Sometimes crashes randomly. * No 'fade in X minutes' (only alarm, no timer)* Can't sort (order) bulbs* No option to change colour on multiple bulbs simultaneously...and much more. Sorry Philips, this app is not ready for release.

Devo a mio malgrado rivedere al ribasso la precedente recensione. Troppe lacune in questa app. Si salva il design molto bello e le funzioni principali. Il resto  un dramma: ogni punto luce pu far parte di un solo gruppo (stanza) quindi non vi _ possibilit di creare scene che agiscano su pi stanze (ad esempio prima era possibile creare una scena TV che accendeva uno o 2 punti luce in sala e contemporaneamente spegneva tutte le altre stanze). Anche le attivit sono limitate: si pu interagire con solo 4 stanze. Al momento per me non  un problema, ma pensiamo a chi ha investito in tutta la casa...Creare una scena da una foto non permette di personalizzare le luci. Creare una scena da una personalizzazione di luci non permette di assegnare un'immagine alla scena. Verificare se le lampade sono offline  macchinoso. Non notifica quando entra in funzione l'azione in geofence. Manca versione iPad e watch.

1st gen app was rubbish. This one still utter junk. The only thing I will use this for is the ability to create rooms so I can turn off a room with HomeKit (Siri) for everything else I once again turn back to iConnectHue which is amazing. Philips should perhaps just buy out this developer and make his app the official one.

Round of applause to the UI designer, it looks nicer, UX needs some firing though. At least generation one let you set custom scenes, it's only redeeming feature and you've removed it from the "improved" product. I won't use both apps, so I'll continue with 3rd party. Terrible update, did you ask customers how they used your apps????

I like the app, but it only allows you to group lights by one room. I actually want to create groups, which may mean changing all the lighting on one floor, or the whole house. Not sure how this has been missed off.
So now you have to recreate EVERY scene and schedule?  What a beautiful useless disaster!  Why in the world didn't this information transfer with my account?

I actually like the update, it is much improved over the first version.  I just want one feature added.  In the routines, you have a when should it start, what should happen etc please add a when should it end.   in each routine I would like to set the on and off time from within the same routine. Perhaps in 2.01 please :)   thanks
I like the improvement with rooms
The older version is much better.  Especially with scenes.  The new version looks nice but it is pretty useless.
Yikes. Missing lots of features from the old app, and some misguided organization. Worst of all, loses all settings from before. Terrible.

How badly they messed this up; let me count (some of) the ways...1.) Seriously, no native iPad support? What? It's 2016, are you joking? This is an expensive product.2.) Why the heck did you make us sign into our account to share scenes on gen 1, but now I can't even import those scenes to gen 2? Terrible.3.) How could you make the widget this much worse? The icons take up too much space, and you can't even tap it again to turn the scene off! WHAT?! So now I need a second widget button for EVERY scene in order to turn off a scene or room? Just an awful step back in ease of use.4.) Where are the custom picture scenes? Either it's gone (boo) or I can't find it, which is even worse.5.) Why have the useless "more" tab at the main screen if you're still going to use a stupid hamburger menu (with a settings icon) to access important settings???6.) Siri voice control is still very hit or miss. "Sorry I couldn't find any lights" or similar is a frequent failure, and yet the action still works sometimes despite Siri saying it failed. That's the main reason I bought a new Bridge and it's the least reliable aspect. Huge disappointment.7.) Routines seem cool, but what if I take a day off and want to not have the lights wake me up? There should be a snooze or day off button that skips the next wake up. Reconfiguring routines for one day, then having to remember to change it back is too many steps. Solve this with Calendar integration perhaps?I honestly could go on and on, I'm incredibly disappointed in this new app. Hire a proper development team and/or give the existing one the freedom and resources needed to do their job properly. Someone who can lead with a vision of intuitive usability needs to tear this app to the ground and start over. Again.Every Hue owner I know says the same thing- the product is amazing but the app is just terrible.  Most 3rd party apps are so much more functional and intuitive than the official app, which is just sad.This update makes baby steps to improving some things, while taking giant leaps back on others. I'll stick to the gen 1 app until this is more useable.

I'm not understanding the direction they are going at all.  What is the point of 2 apps that don't work the same? Why wouldn't you take the features from gen 1 and port them over to the design of gen 2?  No grouping, way less control by having it choose the colors from a photo without your opinion, huge bubbles force you to scroll constantly to find scenes.  Astonishingly bad.  Speaking in total honesty, if this was the default app (doing away with gen 1), I would sell my lights.  Doesn't having all your scenes, settings, and features in one place make sense?  I sure hope so, Philips.

This new app looks much better than 1.0, but it has a baffling lack of core functionality.1) You can't adjust the color of multiple lights at the same time. So if you have 3 or 4 in a room, you have to adjust them one at a time and just get as close to the same color a you can.2) It isn't universal like 1.0. If you use it on an iPad it's just a blown up iPhone app, which looks bad and is hard to use due to the goofy iPhone keyboard.3) All of my scenes from 1.0 are gone.File this one under "Did anyone who worked on this actually use it in their homes?" and go back to 1.0, which had UI problems but at least gives you sensible controls and runs on the iPad.
I do like the room separation, but you need to bring back Scenes as a section. The way it is now is useless.

1. Can't check for external alarms (by other apps) or disable them. 2. Scenes only have shuffle, no individual light control over the photo. 3. Editing a scene crops my photo again and again, shrinking it a bit each time. 4. Sunrise alarm is just one color. Come on Philips!! You invented the sunrise alarm, why can't you just create a simple red-orange-yellow pattern instead of just dimming.and where did the fade timer go for the opposite direction?This seems like a junior iOS dev did that, with the worst QA ever.

This is an improvement. Simpler, cleaner interface that enables me to do the things I do most (turn on/off and adjust brightness) faster! People don't like change and are angry about this new app taking away some niche features, but this is the right move for Hue to appeal to a larger market.

*UPDATE**Figured out how to properly create your own scenes. If you tap into say your Living Room, you will see the list of your lights. Tap each light icon to choose its color, and then at the bottom you will see a "+" symbol. Tap that, and you can save your creation. Do not create a scene with a photo on the Scenes page, it's useless!*This is a poor update to the previous app. While visually it is nicer to look at, it loses a lot of functionality.The idea of Rooms is nice, but you could create the same thing in the gen 1 app by making scenes, and with proper naming Siri could control them.I also don't understand why you can't change the color of a Room all at once without using a Scene. You have to go into each light individually to change color. Good luck matching them all.  What is the point of Rooms again?The scene creator is a mess. You have no control over what color individual lights will be, it is completely random.It now takes multiple taps to get to the change scene page, when before it took one.Routines (timers) STILL do not have an off time, so the user has to create two separate Routines instead of making one and setting it to turn off in 3 hours.I could go on. They focused on graphics instead of improving functionality. You are actually getting less with this new app, and things they should have added are not here.

I love the Philips Hue system and have had everything setup very well in my Gen 1 app however I tried this Gen 2 app and while I like the introduction of rooms I should be able to assign lights to multiple rooms for easier use. For example I would like a separate room for just my breakfast bar and living room but would like a "family room" that turns both on. Easily accomplished in gen 1 but when adding the lights to a new room they get removed from the other rooms.

I really do like the new app. It feels much more intuitive and my lights seem to be more responsive. Routines are much better than the timers before but the way things are grouped by room makes it inconvenient if you only want one light to come on when you wake up. You have to put the light you want in a room by itself.The way it's divided by rooms is decent for general control but it means that if you have lights you only use as accents sometimes and not just as every day lighting (for example, I have a couple main lights for my living room but also a tv accent lamp and a custom fixture I made) then when you set them to come on when you arrive home it turns on ALL the lights and not just the main ones I use. This is fixed by, again, putting the main lights in their own room, which is fine, but inconvenient. The biggest downside is the scenes feature but I never used it much anyways. I do hate that I can't choose lights and colors individually for alarms though. You're stuck with presets/scenes which are pointless if you are only using one light for your wake up alarm. I did switch over to the new app from the old one though so all in all this new version is an improvement but there are still some kinks for me, personally.
I like the changes a lot. Easier to change the color, nice addition of rooms and the option to set timers isn't hidden anymore.
Seriously. Stick with the first one.
The new app has no easy way to import all your scenes from the Gen 1 Hue app. Not well thought out.

Yea. That wasn't a well thought out change. When I wake up, I don't expect my wife's bedside light to turn on in the same bedroom. Wake up scenes should have independent light controls. Additionally, zones need to be added. What if I want all my outside lights on or upstairs vs downstairs lights. Incorporate your app with other vendors. I also have Lutron Caseta, and SIRI conflicts with naming conventions are a pain.

I think this was an attempt to better integrate with HomeKit's concept of rooms.  But it isn't worth giving up so many other features like picking the color of each bulb in a scene (it's random now).  I also would like to sometimes control more than one room at a time, such as a "nightlight" scene that sets some bulbs in each room to dim red.  No go now.  The support for switches seems to have regressed too.  On top of all that, my Siri voice control isn't working at all.  It doesn't seem actually understand any of the room names.  It seems like old names from the gen 1 app are interfering.  The gen 1 and gen 2 apps need to be merged.  And if that doesn't work well with HomeKit rooms vs Gen 1 scenes then Philips please explain the limitations and let your customers complain to Apple.  I need scenes that span multiple rooms.  I need bulbs that can be in multiple rooms.  I want the old bulb scene selection with groups back. For dimming, making me trace a big circle is RIDICULOUS. It's difficult to stay in the "lines" and why can't I just touch where I want the level to be? Why do I actually have to "drag" the position?   Dimming shouldn't be a test of my hand-eye coordination.Hire some UX designed that care about more than making things pretty.  Maybe have them live in a house with many hue lights.  Heck, have one of them come live at my place for a night.  I started this review with 2 stars but enraged myself so dropping it down to 1.

I have over 50 Hue bulbs/light strips etc in my home. I was an early adopter. Although it's unfortunate this new app can't magically interpret and port over my old scenes( which would have been illogical to program anyway )... even with as many bulbs as I have I was able to get up and running quickly.The concept of assigning bulbs to Rooms is much more logical and there are plenty of ways to assign automatic scheduling through the rooms as well as other triggers. This update make the product work like a brand new system! Keep up the innovation. Thanks for a solid product.

The new app looks better, but I haven't been able to use it once I leave the house. I downloaded it, signed in and once I leave the house the app states it can't find my bridge. Also stinks that you can't import all of the other settings from generation 1. Definitely needs an update ASAP!

Unbearable issue still exists:-"Siri name already exists"...please fix this...resets to Siri Voice Control and also the hub itself do not clear out this problem! -please allow a bulb to belong to more than 1 room simultaneously, or, restore the Hue Tap being able to control more than 4 rooms/scenes
This is an unintuitive app.
I like the new stuff, but scenes are totally bad. Let me select my own colors, like before.

It's a nice update, but it is still unfortunately focused on creating lighting scenes from images.What I've always wanted is simple controls: make the light this color at this time, fade to this color a bit later, then fade to this color.In gen 1 there was a color palette image that let me do this, albeit in a convoluted way, now it is more complex.The bulbs are capable of a zillion colours, I wish the software would allow us to simply pick one.
I love it!!! The rooms feature is great.

Updating my review because after some use I've noticed this app lacks a lot of functionality that the previous had such as timers. I like having the Hue go fade out before going to sleep for a few minutes and I see no way of doing this unless I use a schedule and that's useless in this case. I'll stick with v.1 for now.
The old app is one of two I actually use on my Apple Watch. Please bring that functionality to the new app!
Taken all day but still siri voice control does not work... Several resets later... Nada.

So... I really love the visual update of this app. It's beautiful. I love the way that everything looks. However, the updates that this app really needed...didn't make it. Which is honestly really sad. Siri should have been updated to support more than one user. My husband and I both use the app for our lights, but only he can use Siri to turn lights on and off. I feel like I'm missing out on a lot of the experience of "smart lights."

I agree with the majority of the one star reviews, the way scenes now work is seriously screwed up. Please allow us to customize scenes and integrate them with multiple rooms. My main problem with this is that I have white and color bulbs in the same room, and I usually set the white bulbs much lower than the color ones, the new automatic scenes set the white bulbs uncomfortably high and there isn't an easy way to customize this permanently.I'd also like scenes that set multiple rooms to have similar settings instead of having to do each one manually.The new user interface is greatly improved but I hate that I can't easily group bulbs by a similar color anymore. This was a major let down and I'm sticking with the gen one app until this app gets a major overhaul, way to completely ignore the beta testers concerns.

I got used to the quirky first version. Then Philips Hue brings a 'new' / updated version out?!1. It ONLY find the existing lights & switches2. You need to setup Rooms / v.1 Scenes from scratch 3. The it screws up royally 2 'Rooms', same lights is a big no-no!Setup is as confusing as an IBM OS2 setup, hidden everywhere...Let me stop here...!!!
The basic organization of Gen 2 app is good, but the fact that there is no Apple Watch support is a big step backwards. Cmon, Philips. You can do better.
Rooms are a nice addition but Scenes took a step back. It's sad I have to use 3rd party apps to create/maintain/control my lights.
The app has a pre-configured fading in Routine for Waking Up. However, there is no way to set up a routine to fade out at night time. Apparently Philips really wants you to be awake.
Some good improvements and many bad. What happened to the Apple Watch app? How do I sync colors on multiple lights?

The UI is anything but intuitive.  The controls have all been moved and reshuffled, and theres no hint or help to figure out how to restore what I had in the Gen1 app.  Utter Failure.  If you have a chance to stay with the old app, dont upgrade.
1. Does not scale to iPad.2. Scenes does not sync.3. Lost Apple Watch feature.
Great job, much better and faster then the gen1 app.I would really like to see a native AppleTV app though.  Hope that is on your radar :)
Looks nicer, yet lost some basic functionality from original app. Try again Philips developers.
Fix custom scenes!! Apple Watch app! And 3D Touch. But mostly scenes some lights on some off

This app is smooth, stable, and pretty nice looking. And finally I dont have to slide my finger all the way down to turn off a light! I hated the previous scene system and find this much more intuitive. Thanks Philips!
Gosto muito dos produtos da linha Hue, mas quando vocs da Philips vo deixar o app em portugus do Brasil?
Philips, just buy iConnectHue and make it your default app! This is missing so much functionality that your lights are capable of!

Scene based system is much more flexible than room based. Can only assign a light to one room. Makes it hard to easily switch the feel of an entire house. When logging in the app constantly switches from 'connected' to 'out of home connection' even though I'm on my home wifi. Logging out of My Hue fixes this.Recommend using Gen 1 app for now.

I can see why the other reviewers are upset. The functions are still there, but the way you get around the app is very different, so it's not obvious. The old app still works if you'd prefer to use it. I think the new app will be much simpler and more powerful when it's setup and people are used to using it.A good upgrade.

Nothing more frustrating than an amazing piece of technology backed up by a less than impressive app. Sure it's better than the old app however we've lost the Apple Watch and iPad support? How bizarre!

Vanwaar de grootse aankondiging?Al het goede uit vorige app is eruit. Alles veel te omslachtig, het snel selecteren van scenes is eruit. Lampen diverse ruimtes kunnen niet in 1 scne terecht komen, wat handig is voor knoppen of gps functie (die is nu voor max 2 ruimtes, wat te weinig is)En totaal niets nieuws te vinden, na al die tijd en aankondigingen.
Geen Apple Watch ondersteuning? Oh come on!!!
Prima App. Veel handiger en intuitiever in het gebruik dan de oude versie. Enige kleine minpuntje is dat je niet alle oude scenes via my hue kan overzetten.

Stuk duidelijker dan de vorige app. Je weet gelijk wat je kan doen.Wanneer je huis verlaten aanzet, laat je de ander ook met deze app op telefoon in het donker achter.Helaas is random aan en uitzetten in tijdsbestek verdwenen. Dit was ideaal als timer als je niet thuis was.

Wat een waardeloze nieuwe versie.. Vele malen minder gebruiksvriendelijk dan versie 1, scenes zijn niet over te zetten, intervallen van 5 ipv 1 minuut, geen trigger zons op- en ondergang.. Je zou van een bedrijf als Philips toch vele malen meer verwachten. Ze zijn gelukkig beter in het maken van elektronica dan in het ontwikkelen van apps. Ik ga snel terug naar versie 1.
Geen 5 sterren omdat ik nog steeds de zon opkomst en zon's ondergang trigger mis. Tevens is het m.i. onmogelijk om exacte kleurpunten van lamp naar lamp te kopiren.

Great design, app super fast, and easy rooms controls. But... you totally killed the widgets by not letting us define precisely each light, instead we have the choice between 5 light levels for 4 different rooms.That was the only great stuff of gen 1 (hopefully we can still use it) fine controls over widgets (=scenes). Sorry, I stick on gen 1!Also what's the point of the feature home away and stuff, or the routines? That's good if you live alone, not if you have a partner. The app should be aware of others people wish, there should exits a real family management in this app!
-Geen Apple Watch support-Lampen maar aan 1 groep toe te wijzen. Ik wil mijn TAPs optimaal benutten door 1 uit-knop voor alles. Kan nu niet.

I don't understand the motive for Google design elements. Interferes in a bad way with how I'm used to operate my phone.Had to search for how to transfer my scenes, which are essential to me (much more than rooms). I'll stick with the old version.
Hi, nice app but I miss synchronize feature, please add it very soon!!!

Scenes that use the preset colour recipes (Relax, Concentrate, etc.) show up differently when enabled using the app vs when enabled though HomeKit (Siri).Also, the migration from the previous version could be better. I had to remove my existing scenes from HomeKit using the Elgato Eve app before I could configure them using the new Hue app, because the new app can't migrate them and the old app won't remove them.
Surely a huge step forward! This is a much stronger foundation to create a much more intuitive interaction with lights. Looking forward to everything which will come in the future!
Overall the Gen 2 is nice. But no native iPad/Watch support yet. Also unable to edit existing scenes besides their names. 3 stars for now...

Kamer indeling is Fijn, helaas crashte de App nog regelmatig. Kun je vanuit de widget niet de scne uitzetten net als in de gen 1 app waardoor je alles moet uitzetten en de specifieke ruimte weer moet aanzetten.Siri support nog steeds maar 12 lampen.Met een nieuw design alleen red je het niet.
Finally a well designed app from Philips for HUE!
Leuke app makkelijk in gebruik, ook oude scenes makkelijk over te zetten. Alleen mis ik nog de Apple Watch en iPad ondersteuning.

It has a better design, but there are important functions missing. Example creating Ambience with the exact color you want and dim, or dim white. In the Notification Center the option to press twice to turn it Off.

Id_en med rum osv er rigtig god, men der mangler mulighed for at lave scener eller tilfje de samme enheder til flere rum. Enhederne reagere meget langsommere end fr, hvilket ikke er forsteligt nr det burde blive bedre i en ny udgave. Den funktion der er v_rst, er begr_nsningen omkring antallet af enheder der kan tilfjes til en switch, en widget osv (henholdsvis 3 og 4). Fiks disse begr_nsninger og appet er fuldendt!

Virker fint, og dejlig opdatering, til dem der skriver den mange noget fra den frste udgave, prve lige at leg lidt med anden udgave, og i vil opdage at det er jeg den er gal med. Time funktion, er da noget nemmer at bruge.
Man kan ikke slukke lyset via widget, som man kunne p gen 1. Man kan ikke lave widget der kun er halv lysstyrke, nr man t_nder lyset via widget. Det er store mangler..
Gen 1 version har LANGT flere features end denne gen 2. ______

Unfortunately this update fails to deliver the much needed full integration with HomeKit (zones, units), but is a step forward. What is most disappointing is the conflict in how Philips and HomeKit works with the concept of scenes. While it makes sense to be able to easily set scenes in a specific room, the lack of ability to set a scene controlling lights (and other devices) across the entire home limits greatly the the functionality. I hope Philips will add this as extended scene setting in a future update. Please note that this is possible in the previous generation 1 app.
Mangler scener som p den gamle hvor man kunne dele dem. Fr 5 stjerner nr det lavet.
The new design is very ugly, and makes it impossible to see my lights on a single screen
Super appUn peu difficile au d_part pour changer les sc_narios par contre une fois qu'on a trouv_ c'est top!
Unbrauchbare app!An den Benutzerbedrfnissen vorbei entwickelte app.
Abstrze, kein iPad Support, aktuelle Lampeneinstelllung wird nicht immer bernommen usw. Was ist bloss mit Philips los?K_nnt ihr das nicht besser???
Die App mag ja schicker (dafr noch berladener) aussehen als zuvor - aber dass es weder iPad noch _ Watch Support gibt, ist ein riesiger Schritt zurck.
not bad but not finished yet..... a lot of missing features.

I liked the look of the new UI. But it isn't as intuitive to use. Missing scene sharing, scene adding from the website...doesn't import my old scenes from the old app. Setting your lights up via a picture is missing the individual light control...only random exists. No shake to randomize lights. I hope you can scroll down to access the light mosaic like the old app. I know this went through a beta test, but these things should have been picked up. I'll be using the old app until this one is updated. What's the point of a new app and beta test when you reduce functionality??
Switching to the built in recipes such as dim or energize don't work.

I like it, but a couple things I find frustrating. For starters I can only group 4 rooms together per widget. I'd like an "all off" widget like the old app. Also I'd like to be able to adjust the colour of all lights in one room as a group not individually. Setting up scenes for coloured bulbs is weird too, no control of what light will be what colour. Just a random button.

Sucks that people are rating this based on there not being an ipad or watch variant... Rate THIS app as is... And its amazing.  Its everything the first app should have been.Its room focused instead of light focused.  Meaning you group lights and scenes into rooms to then easily manipulate.  Previously you just had a big list of lights and had to awkwardly manage groupings through scenes.Great job guys
Even after I signed in. Don't want to create schedules and scenes again!
Like the new UI but add back iPad and Watch support please.

Me gusta mucho como pinta pero hay cosas que no me gustan y con las que dado un paso atrs.1. No tiene app para iPad o para Apple Watch.2. No puedes controlar a la vez la luz y el color de todas las luces de una habitacin (tienes que hacerlo una a una).3. No se puede todava compartir a trav_s de MyHue las ambientaciones creadas.4. Las ambientaciones son distintas para cada habitacin, lo que hace que Siri se vuelva loco si quieres usar ambientaciones iguales para distintas habitaciones. Und man kann leider auch keine R_ume mit doppelten Lampen aus anderen R_umen erstellen, dann werden die Lampen in einem anderen Raum entfernt! ENDLICH mit Support zum Rcksetzen der Siri-Sprachsteuerung! __Auch sonst eine gelungene Weiterentwicklung. OK, etwas gew_hnungsbedrftig aber sehr schick.Nur: es sieht aus als wurden die Ausschalttimer vergessen! _ rgerlich!

Nachdem ich die neue Version mit Vorfreude installiert habe, musste ich leider feststellen, dass 1. die Benutzeroberfl_che nicht besonders intuitiv ist. Zum Beispiel bin ich nur durch Zufall darauf gekommen, wie man zu den "Scenes" gelangt. 2. die App-Version nicht besonders robust ist. So strzt sie beispielsweise beim editieren von Scenes ab, oder das einloggen auf den myhue Account klappt nicht immer. 3. ersetzt es leider nicht wie erhofft die separate App "Hue Sunset" da sich keine Aktion an die Sonnenaufgangs- bzw -untergangszeit binden l_sst. 4. immer noch nicht bei Philips bemerkt worden ist, dass es manche Haushalte mit mehr als einer Person gibt in Bezug auf geofencing und die "Coming home" / "Leaving home" Funktion. App schlussendlich gel_scht und wieder zur 1. With the new Hue app Philips breaks with everything which made Hue great:The new rooms concept forces you to group your lamps into rooms, a lamp cannot be added into several rooms and a scene can only be added to a room. Say goodbye to scenes which change lamps in multiple rooms!Say goodbye to scenes which only control 2 out of 3 lamps of a room.Say goodbye to manually select a color for each lamp from a picture. Now it tries to guess the colors and you have to press a button over and over again until it matches what you want to see.

Cette nouvelle application est trs sympa niveau design, de nouveaux _l_ments pour g_rer des groupes de lumire sont apparus (enfin!) mais l'application n'est pour autant pas fini! Alors d_j, merci  vous, elle a l'air carr_ment d_mente, le seul point n_gatif que j'ai  dire, je m'attendais  une nouvelle icne plus "minimaliste" ou alors justement  ce que la nouvelle icne de l'ancienne app (gen1) soit celle de la gen 2, je la trouve bien plus jolie et se fond mieux dans les d_cors, je baisse la note parce que l'app contient quelques bugs, mais je commence  m'y habituer ! :)
I only get the 1x/2x option when using this app on the iPad.

Neat and intuitive design. Everything is better than the old app, except that you have forgotten to add the toogle feature in the widget. Right now we can only turn our lights on, or use a separate off widget button.
Avete tolto il supporto ad iPad, mi aspetto almeno che col prossimo aggiornamento mettiate quantomeno il supporto alla risoluzione del display di iPad Pro.

Il design della app _ molto bella per philips non dovrebbe rilasciare una app con meno funzioni di quella precedente... Manca la integrazione Apple watch e iPad, non sono riuscito a modificare il colore delle luci con 2 lampade (stesso colore-gruppo) e molto importante le scene non devono per forza partire da una foto!!!!
What about Apple Watch support, movie sync as advertised, scenes transfer from first generation app?Prettier then the first gen but not complete.

Ziemlich entt_uschend die 2.0er Hue App. Eigentlich nur die alte App in neuem Gewand mit weniger Funktionen (wo ist zB der manuelle Timer hingekommen?).Die App ist nicht wirklich intuitiver geworden, die Bedienung nicht einfacher. Es fehlen nach wie vor grundlegende Funktionen wie der klassische, simple Farbwechsler.Und: keine Apple Watch & iPad Untersttzung, das hatte sogar die alte App. Philips, ernsthaft?Fr das teure Hue System h_tte man sich wirklich mehr erwarten drfen. Eine Entt_uschung.
Siri control is better now for rooms too, just taking a little while to get used too

Yay you can create rooms. And then you realise EVERYTHING else is gone. You can't create multi room scenes, or scenes for all lights, Apple Watch support now gone, iPad version gone. I used to be able to set scenes to affect all lights at different times of the day with alarms. But now as multi-room/all room scenes are gone I can't. And still terrible UX. After 3 years and lots of money from their customers you would think Philips would release an app that respects their customers. Sadly not...
All the useful stuff like timer, custom scenes, and a quick way to switch between scenes has all been removed. Were Philips smoking something when they created this app?

Switched straight back to Gen 1. Why did you remove the ability to make custom scenes or sync existing scenes?Why does the widget only let me turn ON lights? Why can I not programme a dimmer to control particular lights now? Why do I have to control an entire room?! I didn't before. Where is the Apple Watch app? Bring that back!Come on guys. You had some great features on the Gen 1 app but you have decided they weren't worth keeping for some reason! One positive though. The interface is nicer.

This is described as 'much anticipated' by Philips and given the negative reviews for its predecessor I imagine it was. This leads me to wonder why Philips haven't made more of a effort to redeem themselves with this one.Yes, it's a bit prettier and does rooms (something that 3rd party apps have been doing for years) but Watch, iPad and Living Colors support have all gone!I honestly don't know what Philips were thinking, other than how they could release an 'update' with as little effort as they thought they could get away with.

There are some good new features but to make things work correct especially Siri you need to start again and reset the hub. Siri still doesn't work right and now my complex scenes that controlled the whole house are unachievable with this app. Plus all the work you do has to be on the small screen as they haven't released iPad version. Shouldn't have updated as everything was working so well. If you don't want to spend loads of time starting again then don't bother because you will end up with less flexibility than the old app but with a nicer looking interface!
This seems like a huge step backwards.

So 4 lights limit for quick response yet there are third party apps that allow scenes of more. But if I got this right because of widgets limited also to 4 lights you can no longer have a widget to turn off all the lights meaning I have to keep the first app installed to do this ?! Completely random. Sticking to iconnecthue for now.

This app cannot connect to my (gen 2 HomeKit) bridge unless I'm on my home wifi. When away from the wifi network it shows a connecting banner and then 'no bridge connection'. This is a fundamental feature that now doesn't work for me. Gen 1 app always works (and still does) when away from home.

The only thing better about this new app is the design. Usability and features is a massive step backwards. The rooms feature is nice but the key feature (colours) is all hidden away and difficult to use. Keeping the old app until this one is updated.
No iPad support, badly thought out and poorly implemented.Version 1 lives on.

I do like the new concepts that this new iteration of the app introduces, but it does seem 'featureless' compared to the first app. And the app seems to crash for me at times when changing the brightness of a scene by circling the circle. It seems like the app has been released before it's ready. A little disappointing.

This app is functionality limited compared to the previous app. A disastrous launch for "Gen 2". I cannot foresee myself nor anyone in my family going to the trouble of dealing with the many limitations in this version.

Surprisingly bad update from Philips on their Hue lights software, a successor they were supposedly working on for quite a while now. There is no import function so if you want to use only this app, get ready to manually recreate all your previous setting/scenes. The addition of rooms is an improvement but now everything only functions by room instead of allowing the option to use certain bulbs from different rooms (like turning off the lights in one room and simultaneously turning them on in another or turning on the lights in more than one location.) Plus the emphasis on photo-based colors (mostly a novelty at best) is still there. And in case you want to have multiple bulbs in one room with the same color, good luck getting all of them to match correctly, the method for choosing color is even worse. But at least it's easier now to gauge their intensity. Overall, Philips once again demonstrates a knack for excellent hardware and absolutely terrible (and clueless) software.

So all my old scenes are gone. Fine. Annoying and unnecessary but fine. Scene sharing is apparently gone so now everyone in the house needs to reconfigure from scratch great. No more Apple Watch app, huh. Not like the old one worked well or anything anyway. Why are we hemorrhaging all the features that make automation and syncing easy? Thats the whole reason I bought this product and now I have to reinvest a whole bunch of time setting it up from scratch in preparation for the next breaking update. Meh.
What the heck, why doesn't this version support iPad, but your "legacy" version does?

The interface has been improved. However, removing features is ridiculous. Timers have shifted to routines (which is fine), but fading time maxes out at 30min. It used to be 60min in "timers". You can no longer select individual colors in a picture to create a scene.Missing features are: I cannot group rooms into zones. Similarly, I cannot create a scene with lights that are in different rooms.
Better than the previous app but it still needs better scheduling settings like sunrise or sunset events. Also, where is the native iPad app?
No iPad or Apple Watch up, which the previous version had. Very, very disappointing that the app took a large step backwards.

This new app strips all the features away from the old app. How can you make an app and not let the user choose what lights show what colors manually? Isn't that the whole point? This app is complete garbage.
Hue took a simple Gen 1 app that needed more functionality and gave us Gen 2...goodbye simplicity, questionable functionality, and loads of needless complexity.
No iPad support, which is very, very, very disappointing.  To make it even worse, the previous app did have it so this is a major drop in functionality.
The new Hue app has a greatly improved user interface. It groups lights into rooms, which reduces the need for numerous scenes. If you have Hue, you need this upgrade.
Finally the Hue app considered user experience. After setting the bridge up its just a breeze to control all the lights.

I just downloaded the app, and it is designed for the iPhone.  Not a universal app.  Need to zoom to 2x and only works in portrait on the iPad.  Already that loses two stars.  I will play around with it and see if it will lose any more.
You can't edit scenes or group lights together to pick the same exact color. Don't see the advantage aside from pretty interface.
This is what the first app should have been. Much more intuitive and functional.

The interface is vastly improved. I also like the ability to name rooms. I hope for the restoration of the iPad version of the app, as well as Apple Watch. Which are gone. Otherwise, this is a big inproveme.
Love the new app. Much easier to use and manage different rooms. Excited to see what future updates will hold!

"Scenes" replaced with "Rooms" and once you assign a light to a "Room" you can't assign it to another. I'm just getting started, so maybe I'm missing something, but first impression... this is NOT replacement for Gen 1.

OK, allow me to start with the update looks fantastic! That was a very welcome upgrade. Now for the not so good. Light recipes, where did they go? Looked high and low and I can't find them. The lack of being able to individually pic a lightbulb and select the color I want when making a new picture recipe 100% killed this version for me. It makes NO sense not to have this function. I'll sit back and wait for that feature to be added back in.
I don't like how you can't set scenes to be a certain brightness by default. The app decides unless you override. Also Siri no longer changes light colors when you ask

If the Gen 1 Hue app was clunky and confusing, this one is so simple that it's unusable. Where are my Gen 1 scenes? Why can't I select my own colors for the Gen 2 scenes? Why do I have to put a single bulb into a room just to be able to use half the functions? Where is the iPad scaling? There are good bits here, much of the UI is easier to use and understand.

It's great they are trying to improve and the interface itself is better. However, a couple of big fails here I am sure they anticipated people complaining about. #1: room based control. So now a scene can only control lights assigned to a specific room. See point #2. #2: No easy way to port over my gen 1 scenes. Even if I did as they recommend, use gen 1 to activate scene and they save current set up in gen 2, most of my scenes won't fully work because of point #1. My living room is connected to my dining room, hallway and loft. #3: Selecting lights based off a picture and being able to move the points around and group them is gone. That was the best feature gen 1 had. It was the one cool that I showed everyone as a brand enthusiast. It was so intuitive, easy and fast. Now, it's random and clunky to adjust if you want to change individual lights after starting with a picture. It doesn't even make sense in gen 2. Yes, I can still use gen 1, as long as it's there and supported. But we always want to use the shiny new thing.The best thing about gen 2 is multiple bridge support.
Much needed update I like all the improvements EXCEPT the app for Apple Watch was dropped in this update...big loss for me. Other than that I would have given it 5 stars if it was included.

What a mess, everything from assigning lights to rooms, to creating scenes is a nightmare.First off, you need to assign bulbs to rooms, and only one room per bulb. This leads to having to hit multiple buttons to adjust more than room. Annoying, but even worst, choosing a scene randomly assigns bulbs a color from that photo, there is no way to adjust lights individually in a scene.Not sure what they were thinking with this app, stick to the gen 1 version or a third party app.

While I appreciate that you are attempting to create a better experience compared to the train wreck of a gen1 app; dropping device support out of the gate doesn't inspire much confidence. Please add support for iPad (including the iPad Pro) and iOS 9 multitasking.

There is no button dedicated to scenes. That is one of the primary things I go to in my app. In order to get to a scene I have to click on rooms, then click again into a specific room, and then click again into the scenes that are set up only for that room.It seems scenes cannot incorporate lights from other rooms? This is ridiculous. Editing scenes is a nightmare. I can find no way to add or manipulate lights in a scene. Nor can I change the picture associated with a scene. This app is buggy and badly designed. So I decided to delete a scene I had created, and trying to do so fails.  At least Phillips Hue has been consistent in delivering ridiculously ill-conceived lighting solutions.
This update is excellent over the old app. However where is the Apple Watch app? Please include it soon.

I love the new design of the app and some of the new features like setting up rooms and easier to use location routines but when this app was released they left out the ability to group your lights together to match a single color when creating a scene. Now when I create a scene my lights don't match the exact same color. Also, I hate sliders. Yeah, they're visually appealing but I prefer accuracy over aesthetics. Either the beta-testers didn't give them good feedback or Phillips dropped the ball here...
This is a good start, but we need the Apple Watch app back as well as actual iPad support (as in the gen 1 app). Third parties will fill the void if Philips can't or won't, however.

This app needs some modifications to make it perfect. With that said, there's a lot of good going on here, and I'm really pleased that we're getting a major update to the app. First, the Siri controls feel unnatural, and have to be said out very specifically. I want to be able to just tell Siri "turn off my bedroom lights" and that's it; done. The new scene arrangement is interesting, but I can't seem to manually assign colors to lights when I import a photo. Maybe I've just not figured it out, but it doesn't appear to be there. I don't like that I can't edit the relax and bright scenes, or create new ones. I have the old app programmed to go from full bright light to full orange light every even after sundown. There's a lot of good here though. The added room separation is great. It's much nicer to look at now. Overall, pretty happy with the direction this app is going.

This new app is so much better compared to the previous version (gen 1). I love the fact that we now have rooms - a desperately needed feature that was available in other third party apps. Siri now correctly works for HomeKit functionality. Overall a fantastic update and cannot wait to see additional features added.
This app is significantly better than before. Love how you can now set up lights based on rooms and how there is a master control switch at the top. Definitely makes it easier to use!

I was excited to see that after years of development Philips finally added the support for multiple bridges. Alas short lived happiness as you can't access rooms on different bridges without switching bridges. Seriously Philips... Get a clue!!!

In the previous version of hue you could open a picture, and from that picture assign color values to your hue lights. In this reinterpretation of the scene feature you select an image as before, but the app then randomly assigns colors from the image to your lights. Want two lights to share the same color? Sorry, not going to happen. Apparently there is no migration of your scenes through the website either. Youre starting from scratch with this version, configuring all your lights. Its a re-imagination of hue, and if youre a new customer, Im sure its just fine. But some consideration of existing users and their habits would have been nice.
Loving the new version. Huge improvement! Please add All Off as a 3D Touch option.
No 3D Touch!???No Apple Watch App?!
The Apple Watch App is gone. I was hoping for an improved one with complications... Also the only way to have one tap scenes for all rooms is to use widgets.

I like the addition of rooms but rooms control all lights not segments.  Need to figure that out, and how your rooms store on the hub, no need to reconfigure per device.  I still need to play with scenes and settings and how they relate to rooms.  The place to find where you login to your hue account is hidden, look under more not the settings.Loading this onto your iPad is a zoomed in phone format.  Not really designed for the larger iPad screen area which I feel is a flaw and draw back since Gen 1 was indeed designed for the two.Overall there's improvements and its t the spot where it would compete back with competitor apps and layouts. Just hoping for a few more refinements on this Gen 2 to help the stragglers and things Iike the iPad since there much more scrolling due to the zoom in and you can see it a across the room as opposed to smaller items and fitting more on the screen (meaning iPhone size switches on the larger screen, not 10x zoom)
The old version has iPad and Apple Watch support. This has neither. Thanks for the down grade!
Serious feature cut - new scenes is a joke.

Although the app looks better, it has lost some of the best features in the old application. First of all, where is an IPAD APP?  The application no longer has the ability to change functions of scenes. Where in the old app you could choose individual lights change the colour & brightness this feature has been stripped in the new app. One of the best features about the old app was in the widgets, turning a scene on and a OFF function was shown, making functionality easier without opening the app every time you want to make a change to the lights. The app is now slow and has crashed several times. The "room" function limits the ability to individualise lights and scenes. I am extremely disappointed with this update to the app, what was a really good opportunity to reformat the existing app and add extra functionality the system is now slowed & functions reduced. I have a few suggestions, apart from bringing back personalisation of scenes, to have the ability to create a floorpan of your house where you can map lights and make changes. Would not recommend the update... Time to step it up Philips.

I just love the new design of the Hue app. It's beautiful. But on the opposite, it has lost functions from the previous app. - transitions can only be done with 5 minutes or higher, in the old app you could use 1 minute- the new 'rooms' function is nice, but I can't create a scene with mutiple rooms included, or I have to make the app 'think' some bulbs are in some certain rooms. There just must be an option for multiple room scenes!- when creating a scene with a picture, you can only shuffle colors, but I can't tap the picture to choose the picture's color for a certain bulb anymore. The shuffle is nice, but the old option must return!

Helaas ontbreekt in deze 2e generatie Hue app de mogelijkheid om bijvoorbeeld 1 lamp in te stellen als een anti inbraak tijdschakelaar die willekeurig aan en uit gaat. Zo lang op zitten wachten en helaas zwaar teleurstellend.

I really like the new look and feel of the app. However, for me, it does not seem to be as user friendly as I hoped it would be. I cannot really find any new functions, and I actually have the feeling that the new app has less functions. It feels very complicated, and I am not able to make scenes using individual lights in multiple rooms. That's an option we really need in the new app, as this was already possible in the old one!I might get used to it, but overall I'm a little disappointed and I will continue using huemote as that app has still a lot more functions and works a lot easier than the hue gen 2 app. I'm sorry Philips but the new app is apart from the new looks a bit of a letdown.
Lampen sorteren op kamers is prettig, uitgelijk van de app ook. Alleen scenes creeren is nogal slecht, kan niet zoals in gen1 de lampen slepen naar kleuren/groeperen.
Upgrade is zeker aanwezig. Nog even wennen aan de interface maar dat gaat vast lukken!
Je kun je scenes weer opnieuw instellen!! Geen Apple Watch ondersteuning!!
Eindelijk!! Top
Nice app, but where is the watch app?
The new design works like a charm. The only thing I'm missing is support for the Apple Watch
Wat een fijne update als je generatie 2 hue bridge hebt. eindelijk heeft Philips het begrepen! Ik heb alle andere apps voor de hue van mijn iPhone gehaald en gebruik alleen deze nog. Happy!

Mooie interface maar hoe krijg je je oude scenes terug? En hoe maak je berhaupt scenes? Waar is de handleiding in deze app?

Nou nou hier wordt ik niet wild van.Eerste app is beter met scenes met verschillende dim variaties tussen verschillende lampen. Niet 1 dim variatie voor de hele kamer.En nog steeds geen mogelijkheid om te triggeren op zonsopgang en ondergang.Terug verwijderd helaas.

Geen ondersteuning iPad en apple watch, app crasht regelmatig, oude scenes worden niet geimporteerd en het maken van een nieuwe scene is erg omslachtig.......voor zulke dure lampen mag je toch wat beters verwachten. En dan zo'n app met zoveel bombarie aankondigen!
Op het eerste gezicht een leuke app. Maar ik mis Apple Watch ondersteuning.

A cosmetic makeover with minimal functional enhancement is not necessarily an overall improvement. OK, a huge improvement is the introduction of rooms, seriously better indeed than just lamps.But that's about it for significant improvements. - there's only an iPhone version, how about my iPad? - there are still no triggers for sunrise or sunset available.-  transitions inside timer settings now come in 5 min intervals instead of 1 min earlier.-  no improvement on options for tab, for example starting a timed scene when pushing a button or using a tab-button to toggle between scenes.All in all disappointing, very disappointing.
Tig tal keren tikken voor je een scene kunt activeren, lampen kunnen maar aan 1 kamer toegevoegd worden, oude scenes zij niet over te zetten. Mis een 'alle lampen' functie en kamer.

Ved frste jekast er brugergr_nse fladen flottere, men jeg synes endnu (har i skrivende stund hentet den for en time siden) synes jeg, at den virker lidt besv_rlig at f til at virke som jeg gr ud fra at det er meningen.

Den nye Hue app understtter homekit rooms og det gr brugen meget lettere og mere fleksibel og overskuelig. God og gennemarbejdet. Det er let at overfre scener fra Hue Gen 1. Mangler meget iPad understttelse og styring af geofencing omrdets strrelse.

Love the new changes.So much more usable.Can't wait to see new features that take advantage of the new "3D Touch" features of the iPhone 6S.Small bug? on scenes. I like the visual design for the new app, but making scenes is confusing and unintuitive, especially if you're used to the original app.I'm glad there's finally support for rooms, but for the life of me I can't figure out how make scenes support multiple rooms.Honestly, the original app was much better/easier when it comes to scenes and colour selection.There really ought to be an option to import scenes from the previous app.
iPad version please! iPhone version looks and works relatively great.Even a Mac widget would be awesome, but I can't see that happening. __

Much quicker to switch scenes etc on old version. I will continue to use old version. Very confusing and requires much more tapping to actually do what you want. Before I hit scenes and tap a scene and done, now must pick a room, turn on, hit scenes, then scroll for scenes.

Loving the new functionality in this app. Room control and organization was something that was missing from the original application.Now I'm sure this will be addressed in a later update, but to ship this version without watchOS support is a little weird considering the Gen. 1 app had this as a feature. An und fr sich endlich die lang ersehnte Auffrischung der App. Nchtern betrachtet wird hier nur zu Apps aufgeschlossen die es schon l_nger fr HomeKit Steuerung gibt. Innovationen wie Dynamische Lichteffekt (gut umgesetzt), Uhrzeit angepasste Szenarien und endlich mal das automatische einschalten der Lichter x Minuten vor Sonnenuntergang fehlen leider wieder.....Einzelne Farbeinstellungen treffen mit dem alten RGB matsch Rechteck auch nicht unbedingt meinen Geschmack. ber Design kann man streiten, schlecht ist es nicht.Trotzdem hat die App M_ngel weswegen ich wohl erstmal bei der alten bleibe:Es gibt keine iPad Version, die Home & Away Routine hat bisher nicht funktioniert, Benachrichtigungen gibt es nicht. Der Ansatz der Hue App der 2. Generation ist sehr gut. Ich finde es klasse Zimmer anlegen zu k_nnen.Dadurch ist die Bediengung ber Siri deutlich verbessert. Das Design ist deutlich moderne und intuitiver (wobei hier sicherlich auch noch  etwas zu tun w_re). Leider vermisse ich ein paar Dinge (nicht nach Wichtigkeit geordnet):1. Geofencing fr mehrere User. Was ntzt mir die Funktion, wenn ich das Haus verlasse und meine Frau im dunkeln sitzt? Oder ich nach Hause komme und eine zuvor, von meiner Frau, eingestellte Szene sich pl_tzlich _ndert? Eine L_sung hierfr h_tte ich auch nicht parat, aber ich wrde sie sehr begren. 2. Dynamische Szenen. Ich finde die Funktion innerhalb der Hue Labs sehr gut und sch_n. Bitte bringen Sie sie in die App. 3. Eine zus_tzliche Sektion, in der man "Zeitschaltuhren" einstellen kann. - das funktioniert auch unter "Routinen", aber dadurch w_re die App aufger_umter. Nicht, dass dies automatisch anhand des Bildes geschieht. Ich wei besser, wo meine Lampen stehen.5. Einzelne Lampen ansteuern. Fr meine Nachttischlampe msste ich einen extra Raum anfertigen, damit nur diese Lampe aktiviert wird, wenn ich z.B. lesen m_chte. So ist mein Schlafzimmer hell erleuchtet. Hier reicht mir eine Lampe und nicht alle Hue Birnen im Zimmer. Ein extra Raum "Nachttisch Lampe" sehe ich als Notl_sung an. 6. Meine Hue Go mag ich ebenfalls keinen Raum zuweisen. Deswegen heien sie ja Go. Man tr_gt sie in verschiedene R_ume. In manchen Dingen die war die alte App sicherlich durchdachter und individueller einstellbar. Generation deutliche Vorteile und ist individueller die einstellbar.

This app is really bad. They've left out basic functionality such as a colour palette for the lights. There's no scene import from previous Hue app. It looks like change for the sake of change. This new version of the app does have a number of new features. However, setting scenes is not one of them. How on earth you achieve this is a complete mystery to me. It has got to be one of the least intuitive features I've ever seen in an app.

Just the update hue needed. Solved all of the issues I had with the old app.

You can now create rooms. But you can't create scenes that apply to more than one room. And good luck finding how to create custom scenes. So, if you want to create a scene that lowers the kitchen lights and brightens the dining room, you can't. You'd need two scenes, one for each room. Two voice commands. And then another to turn off any other rooms where you didn't want to the lights on. Gen 1, you could just edit all the lights to your liking independent of room, save as a scene and that was it. And Gen 1 was aggressively badly designed and confusing, but round of applause to the designer, this one looks slightly nicer, but is equally confusing and poorly designed. So consistency. Bravo.

Its a cleaner version than the original app, and the ability to group lights into rooms is very nice - but it doesnt appear possible to select a single colour for all lights in a given room. Opportunity missed?

Looks to have potential but seems to have missing features. I can't find a way to set a timer that will fade the lights off after a period - great for when I fall asleep while reading in bed. Also doesn't seem to sync everything between iPad and iPhone and between family members in the way it used to. Good be good with a few additions.

They consistently managed 1 star reviews for the original app that never worked from day 1.  The interface is a personal one and it does seem better than the original mess which was an eyesore.  Considering they have worked for ages on this I'm amazed it's only scaled to iPhone.  On the iPad it's zoomed. Remember 2010 when the iPad first came out?  Pressing the 2x button to get it full screen with blurred writing? Welcome back to 2010.  Perhaps Philips are waiting for iPad to go mainstream?  Anyway, this app seems to stumble with Siri also.  So, to recap.  It's a new app that looks 6 years old and doesn't work.
